Commentary: Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX, Rashid finishes with a long hop. To be fair, it's not abysmally short, but Watson is so good on the back foot. Rocks back quickly and hammers the pull over long-on
Cutting to Binny, SIX, slower ball again but this time Binny hacks it over deep mid-wicket. It was slightly closer to off-stump and was given a fair tonk
Bhuvneshwar to Tymal Mills, SIX, full and wide, Mills has a proper dash at it and he's flayed it away over the point boundary. Magnificent hit. Bhuvneshwar won't enjoy that
Cutting to Aniket Choudhary, SIX, first ball Choudhary faces in the IPL, he smashes it over long leg. A short ball from Cutting, Choudhary swings into an instinctive pull and gets enough on it

Nehra to Gayle, SIX, that ball hung in the night sky for eternity. Never looked like coming down. For what it's worth Gayle gets the maximum result. Length delivery right in the swinging zone and Gayle did not hold back, went full-monty and heaved it over deep mid-wicket. Six number one for Gayle in IPL 10

Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, Gayle is in the mood. Mind you, he's not been in the best of forms, but IPL is his cup of tea. Bhuvneshwar dishes a full length delivery and hopes to get away with it, Gayle doesn't allow him to, carves it over long-on for his second maximum

Deepak Hooda to Gayle, SIX, a gift from Hooda and Gayle thumps it over the rope. A full toss outside off, Gayle takes a step out and slots it straight back over the bowler's head. Went miles back into the crowd

Cutting to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, that looked like a half-hearted shot from Jadhav and it has travelled the distance. Picked the back of a length delivery and pulled it to the vacant deep mid-wicket region, just cleared the rope

Aniket Choudhary to Warner, SIX, .. and Warner makes the most of the free-hit. Another pretty poor ball from Choudhary, short and just outside off, Warner rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the stands for the first six of IPL 10

Aniket Choudhary to Yuvraj, SIX, whoa. This is getting back in the 2007 zone. Choudhary without a clue as to where to bowl goes full and wide. The mind-reader gets the front leg out and unleashes a full bat swing showing the maker's name in tonking it right on the extra cover ropes
Aravind to Yuvraj, SIX, into the first tier. And a standing admire from Yuvraj. Aravind serves a pie with the short sitter and heaved away. So very typical. Equally friendly bowling here as well

Aravind to Henriques, SIX, now Henriques joins the act. Wants to ive his partner a run for his money. A run for some crowd catchers. Keeps banging it in short with the pitch sucking away all the momentum. Another mow across to give the crowd some work. Brings up his fifty. In some style

Aniket Choudhary to Deepak Hooda, SIX, the march to the double ton gets another gear. And some help from Chahal in tipping it over the fence. Hooda opens up and uses his entire height to good effect in his tall pull. Mid-wicket takes another one in its kitty

Tymal Mills to Yuvraj, SIX, the murder continues. Mass murder. Another spirit buries itself inside this pitch. Overcompensates going short, going quick but the response is quicker. Is brutal too. Back to his high backlifted pulls. Gravity too cannot pull it down

Watson to Cutting, SIX, the yorkers too cannot stop the bleeding. Cutting rocks way inside, crouches, gets underneath the supposed yorker and carries on from the finals a year ago in tonking the drive

Watson to Cutting, SIX, a dramatic photo finish. Watson tries another short one but this time Cutting ain't surprised. Stands up, uses his entire height to good effect and smokes it away. Admiring it as he does so. As flat as the bat motion could get

Head to Henriques, SIX, massive, Henriques shimmies down the track, makes room as he did so and goes high and over long-on, went a long way into the stands. Watches in admiration as the ball kept going and going

Stokes to Nitish Rana, SIX, Stokes would be proud of that shot. Banged in halfway down and the line was around off, Rana is quick to transfer his weight onto the back foot and nails the pull over deep square leg. Third six that Stokes has conceded

Tahir to Pollard, SIX, Tahir shouted "catch it" and there was no way anyone could have caught that. The South African goes a tad fuller in his length and that enables Pollard to get underneath it, slams it flat and over long-off for a maximum

Stokes to Southee, SIX, Southee nails this. He should have tried this shot on the previous ball. Once again gets his front leg out of the way to give him a free swing, Stokes makes his job easier by bowling a length delivery, tonked straight back over Stokes for a maximum

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, consecutive sixes for MI. Dinda missed his yorker by a few inches and is launched into the crowd. Low full toss outside off, Pandya keeps a firm base and carves it over point. Went a long way back into the stands

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Dinda attains normal services. Three sixes in a row. Pandya getting into the thick of things. Length delivery and Pandya dismisses it over long-off. Just stood there and dispatched it with disdain

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, make it four in a row. Dinda and death overs are not the best of mates. He goes full and misses the yorker by a couple of inches, Pandya had enough to get under that and smack it over long-on

Dinda to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Smith has a worried look as Pandya sends another one crashing over the rope. Switched to back of a length and the result remained the same, Pandya went back and nailed it over wide long-on. Pinged the ad hoarding on the full
Stokes to Buttler, SIX, for the first time this over, he pitches it up and Buttler goes bam! Gets underneath it and launches it for a maximum over long-on

Stokes to Buttler, SIX, Stokes turns back and smiles. That's all he could do. Ridiculous T20 batting on display. Buttler shuffles and scoops a pacy length ball over the keeper's head, lands just over the advertising triangles. Back to back sixes for Buttler
Chahar to Buttler, SIX, that's gone flying into the stands. Greyhounds out of his crease, picks the bones out of it, a Tennis-esque flat-batted smite over wide long-off
Zampa to Nitish Rana, SIX, half-tracker and gone! Lovely swivel-pull from Nitish Rana, lands Zampa over the mid-wicket fence, brute power!

Pollard to Smith, SIX, it's not working. Smith is just too good for Pollard. His slower balls do work sometimes but this is just different class. Smith picks it up, waits on it and swipes it over deep mid-wicket
Pollard to Smith, SIX, going, going, gone... Is there anything he can't do? It's a slower ball from Pollard, Smith swipes across the line and muscles it over wide long-on

Pollard to Smith, SIX, he's done it. A couple of sixes to finish the game off just when it was getting away from them. What a player! A full ball on leg stump, Smith whips it away with unbelievable timing over the deep mid-wicket boundary. Pune clinch the game with a ball to spare

Southee to Rahane, SIX, Rahane is looking in good touch, this was banged in short and on the stumps, Rahane swivels across, doesn't bother to keep it down. He didn't look in complete control - but has enough to send it sailing over the head of the man at long leg

McClenaghan to Rahane, SIX, that's easy pickings for Rahane, width on offer from McClenaghan. He stays in his crease, uses his hands to good effect, makes the most of McClenaghan's pace and helps it high and over third man for a maximum

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, SIX, stunning bit of timing from Rahane and he gets just enough to beat Pollard's leap at long-on. At first instance, it looked like a simple dolly to long-on, the ball kept going and going. Pollard arched back one-handed, got a finger-tip, but the ball was always beating him

Chawla to Karthik, SIX, ends the over with a maximum. A much needed one for GL. Bit of air on this and a fuller length meant Karthik was able to get underneath that, he heaves it high and over the cow corner fence

Woakes to Karthik, SIX, Karthik picked the bones out of that. Length delivery right in the slot and it was a clean swing of the bat from Karthik, lofted it with a straight bat and cleared long-on with ease
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, massive, tossed up nicely by Chawla, fell right into McCullum's hitting zone, he gets forward and clubs it high and over mid-wicket, went a long way over the ropes

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, SIX, McCullum is in some form alright, comes down the track, doesn't get too close to the ball, allows him a free swing and he deposits it high and into the sightscreen. Another expensive over for the Knight Riders

Y Pathan to Finch, SIX, Finch gets going with a massive hit, Yusuf tosses one on the stumps, Finch gets a big stride forward, lifts it with the spin and sends it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Y Pathan to Finch, SIX, back-to-back sixes from Finch, flighted delivery on the stumps, Finch gets forward and thumps it high and way over the fence at deep mid-wicket
D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's the Chris Lynn we saw in BBL. Full-blooded swing, clears his front leg, picks the length early and goes bang over mid-wicket
Shivil to Chris Lynn, SIX, way too many half-trackers from Shivil today. Just can't get away with it at this level. Lynn rocks back and blooters it over long-on

D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, SIX, that about sums their night up. McCullum makes a blunder in the deep and palms the ball over the ropes. A miscue from Lynn off a full toss, should have been taken at long-off
D Kulkarni to Chris Lynn, SIX, flat, strong, six! Kulkarni misses his mark, bowls it in the slot and is walloped over long-on. Lynn can do no wrong
Gony to Chris Lynn, SIX, boy, has he nailed it! You bet. 95-metre smite. Gony serves length and gets smoked for a maximum over long-off

Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, SIX, if that ball had voice, it would have pleaded: "Chris please take me for a journey". Lynn heard that and obliged, rubbish length ball outside off and the next thing Smith sees is the ball flying over deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, SIX, in his zone and Lynn doesn't have any second thoughts. Marmalizes it with utter disdain, Roy came in the way to interrupt, he was never going to catch that. Never
Dwayne Smith to Chris Lynn, SIX, the onslaught continues... Full ball, don't even look back Mr Smith, the ball has gone to Brisbane. Period
Rahul Chahar to Axar, SIX, goes for the big whammy and succeeds. That was short and has been flat batted over long-on for a huge maximum. Pressure on the youngster
Rahul Chahar to Maxwell, SIX, MAAMMAAAMIAAAHH! The Big Show has arrived. The showman lays the bat on that and crunches that over the man at long-on. That scaled many a light years before coming down

R Bhatia to Miller, SIX, slower ball, doesn't matter. That was a dead meat of a delivery and the batsman has picked the bones out of that. It's that time of the season folks - In the arc, it's out of the park. If it's in the V, it's into the trees. Remember the carnage from 2013 against RCB?

Stokes to Maxwell, SIX, backs away by clearing his legs and then sees the ball like a football to have a clear swing at it. The ball soars over the long-off region for a maximum. Maxwell is taking it away

Tahir to Maxwell, SIX, 50 for the combo! That was a short ball, never got enough wood on it but enough on it to send it packing just over the man at mid-wicket. There were shouts of catch it but that region was unmanned
Tahir to Maxwell, SIX, the most powerful delivery boy is here. He has sent it packing over the cow corner region. Brutal sinews into that pull and the ball flies away into oblivion

Dinda to Miller, SIX, has that gone all the way? An overpitched delivery and the batsman checked his drive with power on his bottom hand to hit it flat and just past the diving Christian at long-on. The ball landed on the cushion and the third umpire signalled it as a half-a-dozen
Dinda to Vohra, SIX, that has been slapped! Short of a length delivery, Vohra dances down and wallops it over the bowler's head. Muscled it. Way past the boundary rope
Christian to Amla, SIX, Amla is turning it on here now! He walks down and lifts this shortish ball over mid-off. The ball has enough wings to go into the stands
Swapnil Singh to Stokes, SIX, good end to the over. A massive end actually. In the arc of the southpaw and the batsman comes up with an explosive response to tonk the ball over the cow corner region
Axar to Stokes, SIX, and now he lets the off-side take the brunt. Patel in his response fires one out flat and wide. The mind-reader that Stokes is, sinks and tonks it through the line

T Natarajan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, the wide yorkers. Prove to be the undoing of Natarajan here. Makes Tiwary reach out making him stretch every cell of his body in getting there. Boy o boy he does. And how. Slices it imparting all the momentum in lofting it over backward point. These tiny boundaries I tell you
Stoinis to Stokes, SIX, he's smoking them in. With a gallop down, gets the ball sitting up in his arc and keeps swinging his bat. We are firmly into the baseball zone. Over cow corner

Mohit Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, in the arc, and out of the park. You cannot expect the bowler getting away bowling length at this stage. And Tiwary keeps up with the tradition of dishing out the punishments. Sits up and swings it through the line in tonking it over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Christian, SIX, a switch to over the wicket makes no difference. Pounds it short, pounds it wide and Christian unleashes the mighty forehand smash. The concrete on the stands taking a real beating here
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, SIX, OLLLLAALLLAAAA! That was some response from Rahane to a short ball. He loved the aroma on the perfume ball and accepted it with glee. That drop might well be costly

Watson to Pant, SIX, that's a really good short ball from Watson. Pant is unable to control the pull as he tries to fetch it over his head and nearly holes out. But these are short boundaries. The ball lobs up to the left of Binny at deep square leg, who runs backwards and leaps across but can only palm it over the ropes

I Abdulla to Pant, SIX, now he gets closer to off, Pant goes down on one knee and wallops it over wide long-on. This is superb batting from the 19-year old. He's putting Abdulla under tremendous pressure

Tymal Mills to Pant, SIX, Rishabh Pant, you beauty! This is some stunning cricket we're witnessing here. He takes on the short ball, and pulls it away over the fine leg boundary. It was a thick top-edge there actually but with Mills's pace, it travelled

Chahal to Billings, SIX, oh my days! This is thrilling cricket. Billings goes down low and wallops the reverse-sweep for six. He's known for this. It was right in the slot too after Chahal flighted it up

I Abdulla to Pant, SIX, holy smokes, the nerves these guys have got! First ball, Pant sashays down the track and wallops the ball over deep mid-wicket. He was playing with the turn, so not a bad option. But to do that first ball is something else. This is a roller-coster, this match

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, massive, Kedar breaks the shackles, this was well tossed up on off, right into the swinging zone of Kedar, he gets forward and sends it high and into the second tier - over long-on

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, 24 from the over. RCB needed something and Mishra has gifted them a perfect launching pad. Kedar is in some form alright. This was tossed up slower and wider outside off, Kedar bends down his knees and clubs it high and over long-on, went a long way over the ropes
Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, freaky, this is sensational from Kedar, length delivery on off, he makes room by backing away and goes inside out over cover, went all the way over the ropes

Brathwaite to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, cracking shot, he's in some devastating form at the moment - Kedar. Length delivery from Brathwaite, that's a cardinal sin for any bowler. Kedar gets his left leg out of the way and drills it back over the bowler's head, went high and into the top tier of the Chinnaswamy

Zaheer to Vishnu Vinod, SIX, he's done it several times for Kerala - he's showing why RCB picked him up as KL's replacement. Runs down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it over long-on for a maximum
Chris Morris to Negi, SIX, Negi connects one finally! This was the slower full-toss from Morris, Negi backed away, got underneath the delivery and sends it soaring over long-off for a maximum

Mishra to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, beautifully played, what made the shot even more special was that he didn't get to the pitch of the ball. It only allowed him to free his arms and lift it inside out over cover, went sailing all the way

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, SIX, Smith is finding his bearings now. Nehra errs in length and dishes out a full ball right in the hitting zone, Smith frees his arms and launches it straight down the ground, pings the sightscreen on the full
Cutting to Basil Thampi, SIX, this will do. Sinks low, gets under this slower ball and tonks it over the long-on fence for a maximum

Nehra to Dwayne Smith, SIX, Smith is finding his bearings now. Nehra errs in length and dishes out a full ball right in the hitting zone, Smith frees his arms and launches it straight down the ground, pings the sightscreen on the full
Cutting to Basil Thampi, SIX, this will do. Sinks low, gets under this slower ball and tonks it over the long-on fence for a maximum

McClenaghan to M Pandey, SIX, this was coming. With McClenaghan keeping it short and wide and Pandey's orthodox cuts failing, he decides to arch back with a toe-rise and ramps his bat upwards in teasing the man at third man over the ropes

Bumrah to M Pandey, SIX, oh boy. Smoked one down. For a change he stays put in his crease without moving around and bends low in plundering what should have been a yorker. A vicious bat swing in tonking it into the black screen

Malinga to M Pandey, SIX, a sink, a swing and a crowd deposit. Picks out the predictable off-spinner and waits for the ball to get into his arc. Unleashes a full bat swing and goes through with it in holding the pose as he drills one several rows into the cow corner stands

McClenaghan to M Pandey, SIX, the sitting up length. Right where he wanted to and with all the pace on it as well for it to be dealt with severity. A full-blooded pull and just the sound ensures the maximum

McClenaghan to M Pandey, SIX, misses the mark yet again. A yorker attempted only to be missed by a cool few centimeters. Ample time for Pandey to settle himself under it as he hammers it over long-on. Just cannot keep it down
Malinga to Chris Lynn, SIX, there he goes! Loads up big, gets under this short ball and dismisses it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Into the top-tier

Kuldeep Yadav to Nitish Rana, SIX, oh what a shot! 23 off the last two overs now. A good little burst from these two. Kuldeep still flights the ball up, the line is outside off and Rana goes through the line to cream it beautifully over extra-cover. What timing on that. Way into the stands

Rajpoot to Pollard, SIX, all the way. If you're going short to Pollard, it better be nice and high. This one sits up around his chest and he dismisses it from his presence over the mid-wicket boundary

Boult to Nitish Rana, SIX, 10 off 2 balls. This game isn't over yet. Not while Rana is there. Boult is struggling to execute the yorker. He delivered a low full toss last ball, now a proper full toss at the stumps. Rana picks it away effortless over long leg

Boult to Hardik Pandya, SIX, length from Boult and it disappears way back over mid-wicket. The MI dugout is on its feet. What a blow from Pandya. But this is ordinary death bowling. Seam-up and good length, right there in the slot
Rajpoot to Nitish Rana, SIX, lapped over the keeper for six! Thrilling stuff. Rana has stooped across and picked this full toss from middle-stump. It came right off the middle
Rajpoot to Hardik Pandya, SIX, low full toss again and Hardik flogs it over square leg. He is 18 off 5. What a blinder!

Woakes to Buttler, SIX, Buttler clearly has the wood on his England team mates. Stokes in the first game and now Woakes. A little shuffle and a crouch down to scoop this length delivery over short fine. The connection was such that it travelled the distance

Narine to Buttler, SIX, Buttler surely picked that from Narine. It was the off-spinner and he played it with the turn, plants his foot across and whips it over the cow corner fence for a maximum. This was more timing than power from the Englishman

Kuldeep Yadav to Parthiv Patel, SIX, finally Parthiv connects with one and sends it into the crowd. Floated up just outside off, Parthiv sinks to one knee and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket. GG certainly didn't like it
Chahal to Amla, SIX, that has gone flying into the third tier. Just slid on with the arm, Amla picked the bones out of it, thumping it high and handsome into the long-on stands

Stanlake to Maxwell, SIX, this could be over pretty soon. Maxwell is surely relishing captaincy, Australia are you watching? Clears his front leg and smites the heck off a short delivery, backs away and makes a clean connection, goes seething over a helpless third man

Stanlake to Maxwell, SIX, brute! That's massacred! Maxi is in some form. Watches the ball like a hoop, once he picked the length (short) it was all about connection; that was marmalized, flat and flying over backward point

Chahal to Maxwell, SIX, #KXIP make a mockery of RCB's 148, ABD's 46-ball 89, win by 8 wickets with 33 balls to spare. Maxi is blasting it all around the park, puts the finishing touches with a brutalizing maximum over long-off. Got underneath a flat delivery and killed it...Watto smiles as he shakes hands with his dear friend. Lo! That's all he can do at the moment

Stanlake to Vohra, SIX, you will see those often especially when Stanlake is bowling at such pace. Vohra is not afraid, goes for a pull off the front foot, gets a fat top-edge that flies over the third man fence. Blades these days! I tell you..

Tymal Mills to Amla, SIX, in the airrrr and dropped. Mills is furious. Stanlake is the culprit. Don't even look at the bowler. A short ball down leg, Amla swivels across and pulls, hits it straight to fine leg. Stanlake prances to his right, goes reverse-cupped but makes a royal mess of it. The ball bursts through his fingers and what's worse is, it carries over the fence

I Abdulla to Axar, SIX, this one goes horribly wrong for Abdulla. Tries the chinaman, but drops it on a shortish length, Patel spots it. He pivots back and muscles the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands
Chahal to Amla, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Pitched up just outside off, Amla was waiting for it, plonks his front foot forward and lifts it over long-off
Tymal Mills to Maxwell, SIX, wow! What a strike. Full and outside off, Maxwell engineers room and slices it with an open bat over extra cover. Such is the power that it carries all the way

Aaron to de Villiers, SIX, MAAMMAAMIAAAHHH! That has sailed over the long-off region. Out of nowhere, Mr. 360 decides to pepper the area down the ground and he got the length to smack it down the ground. Length to ABD is blasphemous

Stoinis to de Villiers, SIX, good length is synonymous to death in the death overs. Length ball and the batsman hacked the pull shot away to send it packing into the cow corner region. That was out of the top draw from the comeback man!

Stoinis to de Villiers, SIX, Mr. 360 is back with a bang! Short delivery, it was a dead meat of a delivery for the batsman who was on the back foot, he picked the bones out of that. Pivots on the back foot and then hammers the pull on the on-side for a maximum and with that his fifty.

Mohit Sharma to Binny, SIX, length ball and it disappears. That has been hoicked away into the on-side and that has landed many-a-miles into the deep mid region. He picked it up like he was picking roses in a garden

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, cheers says ABD as he accepts the freebie from the bowler. That was a friendly full toss on the sticks and the batsman went across the line to smack the blow flat between long-on and mid-wicket for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, PHHUUUUUU!! 97 metres hit after he sank down on his knee to clobber the ball away towards the deep mid-wicket region. That was a low full toss and the batsman got under it to send it into oblivion

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, full toss, you don't want to know what happened to the bowler. That again forced the batsman to crouch low and trample the ball away into the on-side. That ball almost scaled the moon before it came down

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, his body lost balance. He was done in by the length, which was full, done in by the lack of pace but he reached out for it. He still managed to drag the ball away over long-off and a six it is

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, on the sticks, he goes down onto his knees and then the biggest of the night is unleashed as the ball scales some other orbit and disappears out of the stadium. Sensational hitting from ABD and RCB have something to fight with

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, oh my! That's a de Villiers special. How did he manage to time it so well? Looked like he was initially cramped for room, just moved his legs to the leg-side for a wee bit, somehow managed to get under that ball and loft it inside-out over wide long-off. Right then, he's moved on to 10 off 5. Good start you would say

T Natarajan to Mandeep, SIX, now then, now then! That's hit the roof of the stadium over the square leg stand. What a shot! How effortless was that? This short ball didn't rise much, Mandeep stood tall, swivelled and muscled the pull shot all the way

R Bhatia to Pant, SIX, hits it and poses for the photographs does Pant. That's Instagrammable. Full delivery with no pace behind it. He clubbers it over the bowler's head and the ball sails over the sightscreen. First maximum of the day

R Bhatia to Pant, SIX, second six of the over and Pant is turning the heat on here. Very similar to the first six. Full and slow from Bhatia. Once again, Pant thumps it down the ground and the ball lands wide of the sightscreen

Zampa to Samson, SIX, that's a pressure-releaser! Brings up the 50-run stand in style! Zampa overpitches and Samson takes full toll of it. Leans forward and sends it sailing over long-off for a gigantic six
Tahir to Samson, SIX, that's a monster! Fired in on the legs of Samson and Samson deposits it into the mid-wicket stands with a heave. That cleared the boundary rope by a long way
Dinda to Samson, SIX, welcome to your new spell says Samson! Length ball wide of off allowing Samson to free his arms. He is balanced in the crease and elevates it straight over long-off for a six

Dinda to Samson, SIX, that's a stunning shot! Samson moved leg-side and Dinda follows him with a bumper. Samson has no problems whatsoever as he hooks it over square leg. No fielder there and Samson collects another maximum
Zampa to Samson, SIX, what a stunning way to get to your maiden T20 century! Zampa bowls it quick, full and on the stumps, Samson moves slightly to his right and lofts it down the ground. MUSCLED

Zampa to Chris Morris, SIX, that's a gigantic hit. For a moment, I thought it might go on and land onto the Pune-Mumbai Expressway. Fullish length, Morris moves to his right and wallops it over long-on. That went miles in the air and cleared the fence by a long way as well. High and handsome
Stokes to Chris Morris, SIX, wow! Bowls length and gets punished. On the pads and just a flick of the wrists. The ball has more than enough wings to clear the square leg fence

Stokes to Chris Morris, SIX, fittingly Morris finishes the innings with a six. What a cameo this was from him. Stokes bowls it short and Morris easily muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket. The man in the deep is just a spectator. Well that has been the story for the last few overs
Corey Anderson to R Bhatia, SIX, take that! Says Bhatia. Gets under this short ball and smokes it over deep mid-wicket. Crunching sound of the willow

Nadeem to Dhoni, SIX, lovely shot, Pune need more of those, Dhoni skips down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum. Chants of MS, MS from the crowd.. Can he make a big score here?

Pat Cummins to Chahar, SIX, mistimed but six, Chahar just got enough to clear the leaping Billings at wide mid-wicket, got underneath the length delivery, gets plenty of height and just about enough distance

Pat Cummins to Chahar, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Chahar, Cummins shortened his length outside off, Chahar backs away, makes room and slaps it over cover. The timing is good and the ball sails over the ropes for another maximum

Deepak Hooda to Nitish Rana, SIX, BOY O BOY! Clatters the ball out of the park after dropping down on one knee. The moment it hit the bat, it was heading one way - into the oblivion! That was again flattish and the batsman wasted no time in sending it away aerially

Mustafizur to Pollard, SIX, wow! Just a flick of the wrists from Pollard and away she goes. That's scintillating timing. It was a fullish off-cutter on middle stump and Pollard whipped it comfortably over deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, SIX, oh that's a full bunger on leg stump, the dew causing the ball to slip out of Rashid's hand. So difficult. Krunal Pandya swings it away over square leg
Nehra to Krunal Pandya, SIX, just clears long-on! He didn't get all of it, having to fetch it from outside off, but there was enough power in those shoulders
Cutting to Krunal Pandya, SIX, he's mowed that over deep mid-wicket. Back of a length, maybe a cutter, and it sits up to be whacked. Flat six

Mustafizur to Nitish Rana, SIX, banged in short, the batsman plays an awkward shot to pull the ball away fine on the on-side for a maximum. He had eyes away from the ball and then the evasive action with the bat coming down on it made good enough contact

Harbhajan to Warner, SIX, bring it on! Make a GIF of that shot. Warner swapped his hands and belted it with switch hit over third man, that's some hitting I tellya. Got behind it and gave it a full whack, bam!

McClenaghan to Dhawan, SIX, cracking shot, length delivery on the stumps, right in the hitting arc for Dhawan, he gets forward and thumps it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the stands for a maximum

Hardik Pandya to Warner, SIX, beautifully played, banged in short and angling across the left-hander, Warner backs away,uses the pace of Hardik and helps it on its way, no one in the deep and the ball sails over the ropes

Stoinis to M Pandey, SIX, KKR complete a stunning 8-wicket win. Their eighth win on the trot against KXIP. Pandey brings up the winning runs in style, picks the slower delivery and swipes it flat over long-on. The fielder there was a mere spectator

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, SIX, lovely, Narine was sent in to do some pinch-hitting and he's doing exactly that. Length delivery outside off, Narine gets forward, drives it through the line and sends it high and over the fence at long-off
Aaron to Narine, SIX, lovely shot, Narine is hurting KXIP here, length delivery on the stumps, he presses forward and thumps it over mid-on, has enough power to pop over the fence on the full

Aaron to Narine, SIX, back-to-back sixes, this is Narine's highest ever T20 score. Aaron isn't learning here, another length delivery on the stumps, Narine backs away and lifts it high and over long-on, went a long way over the ropes at long-on

Mohit Sharma to Uthappa, SIX, stylishly done, just a pick-up swivel from Uthappa and he sends it into the stands at wide long-on. Was quick to read the length, stayed on the front-foot and launched it into the stands

U Yadav to Vohra, SIX, that's been dispatched with disdain. Blistering pull shot. Short of length, around chest high, Vohra is still on the front foot but he transfers his weight quickly and smashes it in front of square. Hits the boundary cushions on the full

de Grandhomme to Miller, no ball, SIX, thumpy thump! What a sin. de Grandhomme has overstepped again and one more free-hit for Miller. Hurls one full outside off, Miller plants his front foot across and smashes it flat and hard over extra cover. Such is the power that it carries all the way
Chawla to Saha, SIX, Saha gets into the act. He's had enough. Uses his feet, reaches near the pitch and tonks it over long-off. An 84-meter strike
Chawla to Saha, SIX, fabulous shot. He has picked this googly alright, shimmies out, meets the pitch and lofts it inside-out over extra cover. Sweet timing and it sails over the rope
U Yadav to Miller, SIX, that's gone a long way into the stands! Miller sets up a solid base on the leg-stump, lets his hands take over and smokes it miles into the deep square leg stands

Chawla to Maxwell, SIX, he's in some form in this tournament. A flighted leg-break from Chawla, it's right in the slot. Maxwell is close enough to the pitch, knows that Chawla doesn't turn it a great deal and just swings through the line over long-on
Chahal to Krunal Pandya, SIX, in the slot and Pandya connects one. Scooches low and smacks one over long-off

Negi to Pollard, SIX, backs away and clears the man at deep extra cover. He went inside out and got enough meat on it to send it packing over the cover fielder's head. Any doubts on Pollard's powerful delivering skills were quelled down. He didn't time it at all. The batter got it off the outer part of the bat and still enough sinew in it to send it over the ropes

Negi to Pollard, SIX, flat hit! That was a flatter delivery and the batsman spanks it down the ground and over the bowler's head to give himself a wonderful fifty! This has been a top-class knock from the Trinidadian
Negi to Pollard, SIX, go fetch that! That has gone out of this orbit. That was flat again from Negi and the batsman shot a firecracker into the night sky to the delight of the MI fans
Chahal to Pollard, SIX, succeeds this time! He reaches out for the dragged slog and then biffs the ball down the ground to send it rocketing 20 rows into the stands

Tymal Mills to Hardik Pandya, SIX, slower delivery, Hardik Pandya picks that up and dismantles the ball over the cow corner region for a maximum. That is it. MI have got themselves out of jail here after self-imprisoning themselves with a dreadful start. They were 7 for 4 but Pollard-Pandya have done it for them. 3rd win for MI!

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, greets him to the crease with a maximum. Tosses it up, a floppy-hat Pollard plants his front foot forward and launches it over long-off. A blow so meaty that it deserved some extra cheese and french fries to add to it

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, that's a six and a half! That ball is gone into the sea of reds in the cow corner region. That was a slower delivery and de Villiers spotted it like dead meat after giving the charge and picked the bones out of that

Bumrah to Kohli, SIX, full toss and the ball has been banged down the ground! Over the man at long-off and fifty for the skipper in his comeback game! He can do no wrong in this league. That was effortlessly done

Southee to Kohli, SIX, first maximum for Kohli. Finds his bearing right this time. Sees a full ball on off, just stands motionless, in fact took a step forward and thumps it over long-on. Doesn't bother to look at the ball at all. He knows it went a long way

Harbhajan to Gayle, SIX, Gayle flies out of the blocks! He runs out of patience and shows Michael Jackson footwork. Reaches the pitch this time and lifts it high up in the air. Didn't get it off the middle but enough to clear the man at long-on

Ankit Sharma to Dwayne Smith, SIX, he's got proper hold of that. Good lord. That's gone way back. Not much different than the first delivery as Smith lunges at a length ball but this time he muscles it right off the middle. Welcome back as an opener
Lockie Ferguson to Brendon McCullum, SIX, bangs it in short but it's a leg-cutter and it just sits up. McCullum makes room and spanks a flat-batted shot over extra-cover. Woof!
Rahul Chahar to Raina, SIX, this is Raina at his best. He does this so often against spinners. Dances down, gets to the pitch of the delivery and takes Rahul Chahar for a journey over cow corner
Lockie Ferguson to Finch, SIX, that's a Finch special. He loves pace, doesn't he? Stamps a 145ks delivery with a 80-metre maximum over square leg. Pure power!
Lockie Ferguson to Finch, SIX, that's it. Gujarat Lions win their first game of the season. Finch goes deep inside the crease, expects pace and envelops it over long-on
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, SIX, a little shimmy down the track, reaches out to the pitch of the ball and wallops it over long-on. Tahir under pressure, probably for the first time in this IPL
Tahir to Brendon McCullum, SIX, skips out of his crease and smokes a dart high into the night sky, straight back over the bowler's head

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, goes down on one knee and tonks the ball straight back down the ground. Finishes a good over for GL. 14 off it. Jadeja fires it full again, maybe aiming for the blockhole, but misses it by a fair distance and Tiwary is all over him
P Kumar to Ankit Sharma, SIX, length and into the batsman, right in Ankit's arc to heave it over cow corner. It might have been a slower ball but Ankit picked it all right

Shadab Jakati to Smith, SIX, glorious. Uses his feet and gets right to the pitch of the flighted delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, lofts it handsomely over the long-on fence for the first six of the game
P Kumar to Tripathi, SIX, well, Tripathi showing why he's been sent out to open. One, two and bang. Advances to the length delivery and swings through the line. Hit flat and over deep mid-wicket

P Kumar to Tripathi, SIX, the result though does not change. Good length ball around off, Tripathi lofts through the line, nice free flowing of the bat and off it went over the long-off fence. Back-to-back sixes for Tripathi

Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, just a pick up shot and cleared the rope by quite some distance. Bit of air on this delivery, Stokes uses his long reach to get under that and sends it sailing over deep mid-wicket. Jaddu under the pump

Henriques to Uthappa, SIX, a nice way to nail your form back. And he exhibits it with some toying around. Just crouches, takes on the line off a length sliding in and swats it flat batted. Such is the timing that it flies all the way too

Bipul Sharma to M Pandey, SIX, the feet are on the skipping mode. Sharma does the cardinal sin of darting it in Pandey's arc and the shimmy down with the full bat swing unleashed tonks it high and mighty

Cutting to M Pandey, SIX, a yorker missed by the slightest of margins. And Pandey punishes it to the fullest. Gets moving inwards, gets right under what ended up as a half volley and smashes it down the ground

Bhuvneshwar to Y Pathan, SIX, spoiling his figures. A perfect sitting up length delivery right in the slot and Pathan is in his beast mode unleashing the entire bat curve bringing it down off a massive backlift and spanks it high and mighty
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, gets underneath this one and lauches it over long-on, picked the length early and was helped with some width on offer
Henriques to Uthappa, SIX, stand and deliver! Uses those Popeye-esque arms to smash a pull off the front foot, sheer power! It has gone flying into the mid-wicket stands
Bipul Sharma to Uthappa, SIX, sits back and smites a half-tracker over wide long-on, he is making the most of his luck today
Kuldeep Yadav to Deepak Hooda, SIX, advances, gets right to the pitch of the delivery and hacks him over wide long-on. Nailed!

U Yadav to Yuvraj, SIX, I hate to do commentary on balls like these. Coz, all you want to do is stand, admire and applaud the class of Yuvi. Wowza! Holds the pose for the cameras as he powers a mere extension of the arms on this 141ks pace cranker

Woakes to Yuvraj, SIX. That's dismissive. Precise, mathematic middle of the bat. No feet, allows his wrists to take over. The gift of timing. Flat-footed, takes on the short and wide ball, thumps it flat over extra cover. Fetch that!
Woakes to Cutting, SIX, that's in his half and Cutting has clubbed that straight back over the bowler. Clears his front leg, gets underneath and goes bam!
Woakes to Bipul Sharma, SIX, quick-feeted this time, does just enough to pick the length and marmalize it over KKR's dugout at the long-off area

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, that's how you cash in. Something for Billings to learn. 95kph slower delivery and Morris picked the bones out of that one, delayed his shot and that allowed it him to send it sailing over long-on. That gets the crowd going as well

Axar to Corey Anderson, SIX, Axar became predictable there. He was targeting Anderson's pads, missed his length and the Kiwi got underneath that, swung it over the long leg fence and the short Kotla boundaries took care of the rest

Axar to Corey Anderson, SIX, it was a gamble and it didn't pay off. Darted in on a shortish length, Anderson sets himself up with the front leg cleared, muscles it towards long-on. Maxwell leaps as high as possible, but couldn't even get a finger on it

Sandeep Sharma to Corey Anderson, SIX, Anderson ends the innings in style. Slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely for Anderson, who waits for it and pulls it to deep square leg. The ball teased the fielder, but he could only palm it over the rope
Mohit Sharma to Samson, SIX, caps off the over with a stinker. Short ball sat up nicely for Samson, he gets on top of it and nails the pull over wide long-on. Just about clears the fence

Mishra to Axar, SIX, gosh, that's big from Patel. Way back into the stands. Mishra turns one into him this time, Patel goes down quickly and picks the bones out of the slog-sweep. Elevation as well as the distance

Corey Anderson to Axar, SIX, drills this straight back down the ground. Anderson misses out on the blockhole by a few inches and is hammered by Patel. He's playing a good little knock here. But this chase is beyond his powers
Zaheer to Axar, SIX, another slower ball perhaps? Patel picks it up and nails it over long-on. He's been hitting them really well today
Bumrah to Brendon McCullum, SIX, a gift which McCullum accepts with pleasure. Full toss just below the waist, McCullum maintains a low base and helps it along the way, over long leg for a maximum

Hardik Pandya to Karthik, SIX, 200th six this edition. And we are just into the 11th day. Improvisation at its best. Karthik moves across his stumps and gets underneath the back of a length delivery, uses the pace of Hardik and scoops it over the fine leg fence

McClenaghan to Karthik, SIX, he is a small man but when he hits them, he certainly packs a punch. Short of length delivery angled across off, Karthik goes deep inside the crease and pulls it over deep mid-wicket. Flat and all the way. 50-run stand and 150 up for GL

Malinga to Roy, SIX, why was Roy held back? Can someone tell me? Such power and timing he possesses. This was more power and the ball cleared Pollard with ease. Malinga misses the yorker length and Roy gets under that, though a miscue the ball still goes over long-on with ease. A rare off-day for Malinga, finishes with: 4-0-51-1

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, SIX, wow! He made that look easy. McCullum waltzes down and Malinga shortens his length. But there was enough width outside off for McCullum his free his arms. He expertly elevates over the point region and it has enough wings to go all the way

Malinga to Brendon McCullum, SIX, shot! It's the slower ball from Malinga and McCullum picks the bones out of it. Waits for it to come to him and muscles it over mid-wicket. Second maximum of the over
Munaf Patel to Pollard, SIX, 120kph slower short of length delivery, sat up nicely for Pollard, who pulls it off the front foot, struck it flat and over the wide long-on fence

Dwayne Smith to Pollard, SIX, just a lift and off it goes over the long-on fence. For the first time in the over Smith pitches it up, Pollard nonchalantly puts it over long-on. Just an extension of the arm and the ball flew away

Jadeja to Rohit, SIX, lovely shot! This is Rohit Sharma we all know. Flighted on off, he makes a bit of room to go inside out and connects handsomely, the ball crosses the boundary cushion by a metre or so

Andrew Tye to Pollard, SIX, just over a leaping McCullum at long-off. Short of length delivery outside off, Pollard flat-bats it straight back over Tye, McCullum standing at straightish long-off, jumps up and couldn't even get a finger

Basil Thampi to Buttler, SIX, wow! That's a Buttler special. Easily done. Short of a good length delivery on off, Buttler moves across, still has the eyes on the ball and scoops it over the keeper's head. Improvisation at its best

Basil Thampi to Nitish Rana, SIX, shot! That's Raina-esque. Slower ball outside off. Overpitched as well, Rana crouches low and creams the lofted cover drive over extra cover. It came right off the sweet portion of the bat and the ball goes the distance
Andrew Tye to Nitish Rana, SIX, one of the best shots of the day! Short ball at a decent pace, Rana has no trouble in pulling it over square leg for a maximum. He absolutely middled it
Jadeja to Buttler, SIX, wow! 15 runs off the over and MI are surely ahead at this stage. Right in the slot for Buttler to swing his bat. He prods forward and thumps it over long-on for a huge six

Unadkat to Kohli, SIX, my word, how well has he timed that! Unadkat appeared to have deceived Kohli with a cutter and Kohli had to really reach out for it. But his wristwork is a work of genius. He somehow manages to whip the ball away over the deep square leg boundary. Fantastic shot

Christian to Binny, SIX, Binny nails this one into the crowd. The slower ball from Christian drifted into his hips, sat up to be put away, and Binny flogged it a long way over long leg. Don't think we're getting the ball back. Someone's taking it home. Ball change required

SN Thakur to Negi, SIX, well, well .. don't go anywhere. This partnership has raced away to 22 off 9. Thakur deviates from the slower ball strategy, bowls it full and wide of off and Negi spanks him over mid-off. That's gone all the way. Flat six

Unadkat to de Villiers, SIX, he's hit that straight into the stage where a display car is kept. He sat on that slower ball. It was a touch on the shorter side, AB is quick to rock back before mowing it over wide long-on

Tahir to de Villiers, SIX, Tahir flights it up and AB immediately clatters him over long-off. Just got the length wrong there. It was a bit too full outside off. Still, it's a superb shot as AB had to reach out

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, whoa. The beast mode is out. And the ball has been tonked into one of the metros going around. Dhoni is back to his earlier avatar of galloping down to spinners and just swings the bat keeping it as straight as possible. Laced over long-on. Has to be the biggest of this season

Watson to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, even better. The gorgeousness of the shots increases in an arithmatic progression. Much straighter this from Watson but once again off a generous half volley length. A seam up and dispatched into the sight screen with a full flowing drive

Milne to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, up and dispatched. Gives his side something to bowl at on this graveyard. Milne after bowling an eviable yorker misses the next. A cool few inches short and enough time for Tiwary to get under it in whipping it over the top. Behind square and into the stands

Aravind to Tripathi, SIX, nothing streaky this time. Aravind looks for another one to fox the batsman getting too predictable in the process. A mighty swing taking the ball into the clouds before getting it to settle over long-on. Jee, this target setting is getting scary
Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, SIX, wow! Floated up outside off, Pant had the width to free his arms and he made no mistake, lofts it high and over the long-off fence. Almost nailed the electronic scoreboard
U Yadav to Pant, SIX, the yorker gone wrong. Low full toss just outside off, Pant brings that strong bottom hand into play, gets underneath it and sends it sailing over the long-on fence. What a hit!
U Yadav to Pant, SIX, 16 off three balls. That is what he can do. Length delivery on the pads, Pant crouches low and plays the pick-up shot to perfection, sent it packing over backward square leg

U Yadav to Pant, SIX, wasn't Umesh the best pacer for India in the Test season? He's been taken to the cleaners by the youngster. Third six in the over and already 22 off the over. KKR will be hurting by this onslaught. Fuller and around off, Pant clears his front leg and dispatched it over wide long-on

Mathews to M Pandey, SIX, that's a pressure-releaser. Jogs down the track and uses his wrists to good effect. Flicks it handsomely over square leg. there were two men in the deep. All they could do was watch it sail over the rope

Zaheer to Y Pathan, SIX, can't get away with this full toss! Pathan brings up his fifty in style. He clears his front leg and swings his bat hard. Finds the gap between long-on and deep mid-wicket and has enough power to go all the way as well

Mishra to M Pandey, SIX, wow! Six and KKR need just 2 now. It was darted outside off. Pandey does a Dhoni! He moves slightly across and thumps it over long-on. Cummins was coming forward and I reckon he misjudged it there. Had he held his ground, he might have had a better chance

Shami to Y Pathan, SIX, how on earth did it go over the ropes? Shami looks flabbergasted. Almost did in with this off-pace delivery, Pathan was months early into the shot, ends up mistiming it but such is his power that it went all the way for a maximum over deep mid-wicket. Pathan ended up hitting that with the use of one hand as the bottom hand came off
Mishra to M Pandey, SIX, fabulous shot. Uses his feet, reaches the pitch and tonks one over long-on. Went sailing into the stands

Barinder to Mohit Sharma, SIX, Mohit Sharma, what a strike! Never mind my comment that they have no real firepower to come. This has been caned over point. Full and wide from Sran, Mohit clatters it away
Barinder to Vohra, SIX, two sixes in three balls. The required rate is back under 12. Handsome strike from Vohra, crunching the full ball over long-on to bring up his half-century
Rashid Khan to Vohra, SIX, short again, this time it's all the way. It might have been a googly, but it's way too short. Vohra nails the pull over long leg

Rashid Khan to Vohra, SIX, what a stunning hit over long-on. Vohra is playing an absolute blinder here to spring the game back to life. A flighted leg-break on off, Vohra doesn't bother using his feet. Just a stride forward to smash it through the line

S Kaul to Vohra, SIX, he's not mis-hit one delivery, not that I can remember. What we're watching is something very special. A length ball wide of off, this is actually a pretty decent delivery. But Vohra's arc has widened so humongously tonight that he's able to fetch it over long-on. Just over the fielder
Nabi to Eoin Morgan, SIX, bowls it short first ball and Morgan is quick to pump him over long-on. Swiftly jumps onto the back foot and thumps a flat pull over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Vohra, SIX, oh my goodness, the sound that made! Wow. Rashid flights the leg-break up around off, Vohra quickly goes down on the back knee and belts a slog-sweep into the second tier over mid-wicket

Axar to Naman Ojha, SIX, whoa. Take that. A gallop down the track, inherits the ball right in the slot and just swings the bat all along. A massive swing and lofts it over deep mid-wicket. Several rows inside

Sandeep Sharma to Warner, SIX, bursts through the hands. Oh Morgan. Such has been the standard set these days that you expect these to be picked out. A low full toss here and Warner reaches out on a knee, almost rolls over in the process too. But imparts the final few breaths of energy in him to loft it over long-off, where Morgan gets his hands up but in the quest of keeping himself inside the rope lets the ball sneak through

Sandeep Sharma to Rashid Khan, SIX, that's how it is done. A banged in sitter and Rashid just stands tall and slogs. Connects right with the middle of his sweet spot and in the only ball he faces gets the ball into the crowds. Over long-on. 159 is what the Sunrisers manage

Cariappa to Warner, SIX, the usual suspect. To deal with the mystery spin. Warner pre-plans his switch. Gets quickly the other way and fetches this off the middle stick to slog-sweep it away over point

Milne to Brendon McCullum, SIX, Milne is letting it through like a sieve here. Very full ball. Too full, Milne. And McCullum makes room and hedgehops him flat over his head. 39 off Milne's 3 overs so far

Watson to Brendon McCullum, SIX, here's it, again. A big front foot stride that somehow opens the leg-side for this man. Hacks the ball across and popped it away over square leg. Scratch that. Not popped, but bruted

Aravind to Ishan Kishan, SIX, uh oh. I will. I have. Kishan gets a six here. Wanted to do this since the first ball of this over but gets the desired length and pace on this ball. Outside off, just short enough and he's slogged this over deep mid-wicket
Head to Ishan Kishan, SIX, I-am-from-McCullum's-team slog sweep. Sits low, gets under this hospitably full ball and punishes it. Admonishes it
Aravind to Ishan Kishan, SIX, eish! This guy! It's a full toss alright but look at that bat swing. Brutal. Swings this full toss over deep mid-wicket. Way over. 32 off 8 needed..

Aravind to Ishan Kishan, SIX, 26 needed off the last over now. I'm not calling this, yet. Another slower delivery on the shorter side, Kishan ducks but only to get under it and hoicks it up and over backward square leg
Aravind to Raina, SIX, hoisted. And with sheer timing. A slider this from Aravind onto the pads further amplified by a shuffling across Raina, who picks and posts it over the long leg ropes

Aravind to Raina, SIX, just when we assumed the earlier flick was good, this one gets even better. Plonks his front leg forward to a pitched up delivery right in the slot and keeps the bat face full in lofting it with all the elegance. Down the ground

Chahal to Brendon McCullum, SIX, the slog mode is on. Oh it better be. Is quickly on a knee with the bat turning into a slogging monster as he swings across the line and goes high and mighty into the cow corner stands
Negi to Brendon McCullum, SIX, moves well across the stumps. And is down on a knee. To execute some more of his slogs. An angry sweep in the air and a dispatch into the stands behind square

Chahal to Finch, SIX, brings the hoick out. The defence was meant only for the first delivery. Spots the googly and decides to let the mid-wicket ropes take the brunt of the hammer once again. Tantalizingly over the fingers of a leaping man right at the fence

Watson to Brendon McCullum, SIX, oh the bats. And the muscles. Helped by Watson's want to bowl length and he just gives himself some room in swinging his bat as he lofts it high and mighty down the ground

Milne to Brendon McCullum, SIX, nothing mistimed about this one. Hands with a speed greater than 3 x 10^8 as he unleashes a ferocious cut to a short one in slapping it over extra cover. All the way as well

Negi to Brendon McCullum, SIX, 10 years down. And McCullum puts up another show. Against the very same opponents. A real drag down and pulls out the agricultural heave in pocketing a half-century with a max over his favoured square leg
Dwayne Smith to Gayle, SIX, he eats, sleeps and churns out sixes like a mill. Right in the slot for Gayle, he won't spare those. Just muscles it flat-batted over long-on
Dwayne Smith to Gayle, SIX, what a strike. Full and in the slot for Gayle, he flexes his muscles and smokes it a long way into the long-on stands
Shivil to Kohli, SIX, there he goes. High percentage shot. Picked the gap and used his wrists to good effect. Generated enough power to send it over the long-on fence
Shivil to Head, SIX, Koushik is being taken to the dry cleaners today. Head joins into the act. Gets underneath this one and dumps it over cow corner
Andrew Tye to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, the pocket-rocket launches his missile. Saw what was coming maybe, picks the knuckle ball by advancing down the track and deposits over long-on
Jadeja to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, oh dear! Jadeja fails to get his landing right and bowls it in the arc for Jadhav. Gets dumped over long-on, effortless from Jadhav

Basil Thampi to Gayle, SIX, first six of the evening. Gayle is underway. A high full toss served to him and Gayle just about manages to put it away. He lofts it over mid-off. Didn't get it off the middle, but doesn't matter as it had enough wings to hit the boundary rope on the full

Shivil to Gayle, SIX, there you go! Overpitched and Gayle latches onto it. Presses forward and dispatches it over long-off for a huge six. Just an extension of his off-drive. Brings up the 50-run stand as well
Jadeja to Gayle, SIX, oh hello! The best of the lot. Gets down on one knee and slog sweeps this firing in fullish ball into the deep mid-wicket stands

Jadeja to Gayle, SIX, Jadeja gets his man. But, this wicket should belong to McCullum. Hang on! It was a low full toss outside off. Gayle stays in his crease and doesn't get hold of his lofted drive over extra cover. B-Mac at long-off runs to his right and takes a flying one-handed catch. The Lions are confident. The umpires want to go upstairs. Soft signal is Out. Oh wait, did his floppy hat make contact with the rope? Oh, yeah. What a shame! Baz's brim of the hat saves Chris Gayle. The southpaw has a big smile on his face as he comes back. He gets six runs as well. Even, Kohli came and shook hands with the SUPERMAN to applaud his effort. Credit to McCullum for he immediately gestured that his hat may have touched the hoarding. Felt the touching motion

Shivil to Gayle, SIX, stand and deliver. That's a 104 meter six! Gets to his fifty in a grand style. Right in the slot for Gayle to swing his bat. Sees the width outside off, comes forward and blasts it over long-on. The ball is out of the stadium. New balls please. He takes some piece of the sand from the turf and pours it on his bat
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, advances, right to the pitch of the ball and he smokes it for a maximum over long-off

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, down the pitch again, just a clean swing of the willow. Might have read the wrong 'un early, and then used all his might to get the distance, into the stands over mid-wicket
S Kaul to Mathews, SIX, can't get away this time. Another full toss in the swinging zone, Mathews clears his front leg and smites it over wide long-on
S Kaul to Samson, SIX, lofts him into the stands. What a way to get off the mark. Right in the slot from Kaul, and Samson goes through with an uninhibited swing over long-on

Siraj to Samson, SIX, another nonchalant strike over long-on! He makes it look ridiculously easy. The key is that Samson's head is so still while hitting through the line. Once the ball is full, he simply gets a small stride in, keeps his balance, and plays an extension of the on-drive

Henriques to Nair, SIX, brilliant shot on the move. He's walking down the pitch, Henriques does him in length with an off-cutter but Nair is still able to loft him through the line over mid-off. He not only clears the infield, but the timing ensures that he clears the boundary too

Pat Cummins to Williamson, SIX, fine shot! Short delivery around off, Williamson was on the front foot, but quickly transfered his weight back and pulled it behind square. There was a fielder in the deep, but placed it well wide of him

Mishra to Williamson, SIX, even the tallest man in the team can't get a finger on that. Tossed up around off, Williamson makes room and drags the loft towards long-on. Morris was a few yards inside the rope and the ball sailed over his leap. If he had been on the edge, who knows

Mishra to Williamson, SIX, how is he not playing every game? He's turning it on here for SRH. Just a bit of air from Mishra, Williamson kneels down and nails the slog sweep to perfection, flat and over cow corner. BTW, it is his fifth six of the evening

Mathews to Dhawan, SIX, geez! That ball hardly left the surface. A flat six from Dhawan. Mathews missed the yorker by a good couple of inches, Dhawan got underneath it and heaved it over deep mid-wicket. Mathews leaking plenty

Zaheer to Deepak Hooda, SIX, crack! That was the sound when ball made contact with the bat. A gift from Zaheer and Hooda takes full toll, full toss on the pads, Hooda swings hard and dispatches it over deep square leg
Mathews to Williamson, SIX, length ball at 123kph. Williamson trusts the bounce, gets into a good position and dispatches it over mid-wicket. Off the sweet spot of the bat

Mathews to Williamson, SIX, even better! Williamson is looking in fine touch here. Shimmies down the ground and lofts it over long-off. Exquisite timing. He didn't try to hit the ball hard. Relied on timing

Krunal Pandya to Amla, SIX, why is Pollard not at long-on? The only man who could have had a chance, but this would have cleared him as well. Currently, it is Nitish Rana who is patrolling the fence. Flatter delivery on the leg stump, Amla lofts over the top and clears the long-on boundary

McClenaghan to Maxwell, SIX, Maxi has arrived. "The juices are flowing for Glenn Maxwell," Mike Hussey on air is all excited. Gets underneath a full delivery and sends it soaring into the stands over long-on
McClenaghan to Maxwell, SIX, D-I-S-M-I-S-S-I-V-E! No change of length, in the slot and Maxwell whangs it like a fire-cracker over long-off
McClenaghan to Maxwell, SIX, full toss again, you gotta be kidding me. Maxwell uses every ounce of his muscular stamina to whip-loft it into mars. Bam!

Malinga to Amla, SIX, that has gone out of the stadium. Things that T20 cricket do, Hashim Amla can hit the long ball. What's more amazing is the power he generated behind the shot, Amla picks the change of pace and spank-banged it over the top-tier over long-off with a bat velocity of 135KPH
Malinga to Amla, SIX, 72 metres maximum square on the off-side. Well, well! Amla is nailing it. He is treating Malinga like a club bowler, hammers him with a throw of the kitch sink on the off-side
Malinga to Amla, SIX, short ball, Amla clatters the pull off the top-edge, over the keeper's head but who cares? It's a six
Malinga to Amla, SIX. First T20 hundred for Hashim Amla. What.A.Player. He posts a leg-side rubbish into the fine leg stands with a clean wallop. Sigh!

Malinga to Amla, SIX, wowww! It's always interesting to see Amla play aggressive cricket. This was an authoritative hit. Malinga seemed surprise by that approach. He bowled a normal back of a length delivery, but Amla had made up his mind to go big, went back in the crease and launched it over long-on for the first maximum of the day

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, easy as! That's just a flick off the wrists and the ball has flown away over mid-wicket. A little shimmy down the pitch from Buttler to get close to the ball, picks it away with sumptuous timing. He's been lukewarm so far in the IPL. Can tonight be the night?
Ishant to Nitish Rana, SIX, we're into the mode of having fun now. A wide yorker gone wrong. Shortened by a few inches and Rana just leans low, crouches and whacks it down the ground

Swapnil Singh to Nitish Rana, SIX, right in the slot. Talk of the pressure of a chase. Mumbai do not seem to understand though. Sinks, buries and slogs it into the night sky. Rows into the cow corner stands

Swapnil Singh to Nitish Rana, SIX, the misery is piled on. This time with the length getting even more horrific. In the form of a rank drag down. A rock back, a swivel and a dispatch off a flat batted mow into the mid-wicket stands

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, whoa. Brute. Angry. These bottom hands. These big bats. All in one. Clears his front leg getting it out of the way does Buttler, gets under the friendly length delivery and just jabs it over long-off. The flattest you'd have seen

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, a miscue? Does it matter? It continues to fly. More of the sitters from Sandeep enabling Buttler to get on top of the bounce and he just clobbers it over cow corner. The required run-rate is a mockery now

Ishant to Nitish Rana, SIX, 180-degrees on the other side from the one he'd intended to go over. But the maximums only keep coming. Gets the ball to climb up awkwardly does Ishant getting it up on the ribs and Rana just swings his bat looking to go over cow corner again with the familiar hits. Gets the familiar result though with the top-edge flying over the cordon. And his third half-century of this season too
Ishant to Hardik Pandya, SIX, another bat. Another rocket launcher. The angry flat bat face is up and so is the usage in whacking it. Boom. Back into the third stand. Over mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's that. A real mockery this. A target of almost 200 and Mumbai do it with time to spare to go after another. Mohit meanwhile bends his back in banging it half way down the track and Rana just swivels as he hooks it into the second floor. Over long leg

Sandeep Sharma to Buttler, SIX, oh my! KXIP won't be liking this. They don't want to run into Buttler on the wrong night. And so far, the signs are ominous. Buttler exposes his stumps again, backs away, and smokes a low full toss over extra-cover. Flat six
Ishant to Parthiv Patel, SIX, good length ball on leg stump, Parthiv whips it gloriously into the fine leg stands. What a pick up! The runs are flowing for Mumbai

Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, SIX, backs away, Stoinis bangs it in, and Parthiv spanks him off the front foot well in front of square. That's gone all the way. It's just flying off their bats. Amazing timing

Stoinis to Nitish Rana, SIX, any confirmation needed about what form Rana has been in? Have a look at this. He's pulled that into the stands, making it look so easy. Short of length over leg-stump, that's usually a very awkward line. But Rana's so quick to get outside the line of it and then helps it on its way over fine leg

Axar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Axar fires this well outside off and would have hoped that he's got this out of Rana's reach. But Rana is still able to fetch the slog-sweep comfortably over wide long-on. Amazing shot

Axar to Buttler, SIX, that's almost a seam-up delivery from Axar, but he's landed it way too short and Buttler parks him into the crowd. He uses the depth of the crease well and pulls it over mid-wicket

Narine to Finch, SIX, wow! The intention is clear from both batsmen. Slightly overpitched, Finch gets low and smacks the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket. There was a man in the deep, but he couldn't do anything
U Yadav to Raina, SIX, picks the slower ball and deposits into the crowd. An off-cutter from Yadav, Raina backs away and nails the slog sweep from a length. Sailing over mid-wicket

Narine to Jadeja, SIX, top-edged .. and taken by Surya at long-on. But he's stepped on the boundary cushion. Straightaway signals a six, making it easy for the umpire. A desperate move from Jadeja after three dot balls, he nearly falters but somehow the top-edge flies right at the edge of the boundary, where Surya does really well having stationed himself just inside the ropes. But his weight is leaning back as he stretches overhead and the momentum takes him over

Coulter-Nile to Raina, SIX, slower ball this time, and all the way. He's tearing into Coulter-Nile here. Picks up the change of pace right off the hand and whips the ball off middle and leg into the deep mid-wicket stands

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, SIX, quickly onto his back knee to smoke a slog-sweep over mid-wicket. He sees the ball drifting into leg, it's in the slot and Raina gets under it beautifully. Just 8 needed now
Shakib to Finch, SIX, second six for Finch and GL are off to a flier. Waits for this slingy ball to come to him and dispatches it into the long-on stands. 15 runs off the over

Coulter-Nile to Brendon McCullum, SIX, 50 up for GL in 23 balls! Head-high bouncer, McCullum isn't perplexed by that. He is on the front foot to pummel the pull well in front of square on the leg-side. The deep mid-wicket fielder is just a spectator

Woakes to Raina, SIX, just grazes Pathan's fingertips at fine leg. Hooks a short ball and wasn't quite in control of it, it loops up and goes flat to the right of fine leg who sprints with his right hand stretched to the maximum. Just can't get there

D Kulkarni to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is the best front foot puller. Picks the back of a length delivery early, just plonks his foot forward and short-arm jabs the pull over cow corner. Flat and all the way

Basil Thampi to Uthappa, SIX, 10 off the first two balls. The back of the hand slower one does not come out right for Thampi, ends up as a nice juicy full toss for Uthappa, who heaves it into the crowd at deep mid-wicket

Basil Thampi to Narine, SIX, gee, this is the shot of the match so far. Could well be the shot of the day. Highest score for Narine in T20s. Thampi bowls a length delivery on the leg stump, Narine goes leg-side and lofts the drive easily over mid-off and holds the pose for the cameras

Jadeja to Gambhir, SIX, that's easy pickings for Gambhir. Full and outside off stump, the ball is turning back in, so the mid-wicket area is a favourite zone for a left-hander, Gambhir swings with the spin and sends this all the way - the first six for him this season

S Kaul to Dhoni, SIX, that's as flat a six as they come. Never got over 10 feet above the ground. Lots of power in the bottom hand as Dhoni swipes an overpitched delivery over wide long-on. Not easy to get under those

Siraj to Dhoni, SIX, he's muscled that over the long-on boundary. Nothing but brute power. It's a decent ball from Siraj: a leg-cutter wide of off. But Dhoni swings his hips, pumps his arms and flat-bats it away

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, SIX, hit hard, hit flat, six! Dhoni, you have been missed. That's sensational ball-striking. It's very full from Bhuvneshwar, most players won't be able to get under it but Dhoni's wrists and the power he generates are something else. A Dhoni special
Siraj to Tripathi, SIX, cracking shot, banged in short and on the stumps, Tripathi was waiting on it, swivels across and pulls it high and over square leg, no need to run for those

S Kaul to Tripathi, SIX, beautifully played, Tripathi is making SRH suffer for dropping him, runs down the track, driven on the up - played with the full face of the bat, a high elbow and deep into the stands at long-on

S Kaul to Tripathi, SIX, for a moment, it looked like it went straight up in the air.. but Tripathi has managed to clear the fielder at deep point. This was full and wide of off, he lost his grip on the hand as he went chasing after it, ended up slicing it high and over cover. The fielder in the deep thought he had a chance, but ended watching it sail over his head. It was the slower ball from Kaul, thought he had done the batsman in by his clever change of pace
Bipul Sharma to Smith, SIX, massive, that ruins the over for Bipul, too full and just outside off, Smith bends down low and slogs it high and over mid-wicket, went sailing into the crowd

Bipul Sharma to Smith, SIX, Smith is ruining Bipul's figures here, slower and just outside off, Smith gets forward and thumps it high and wide of long-on, has the power to sail over the ropes, back-to-back sixes for Smith

Stokes to Williamson, SIX, top-edge and six, no luck for Stokes today. Banged in short and on the stumps, Williamson was late on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sails high and into the stands at long leg

Tahir to Warner, no ball, SIX, that should break the shackles for SRH and Warner, this was a high full-toss from Tahir, Warner was already pre-meditating the reverse sweep, ends up playing the switch hit and sends it high and over deep point for a maximum
Unadkat to Henriques, SIX, SRH need many more of these, length delivery outside off, that's right in his hitting zone, clears his left leg and clouts it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Unadkat to Deepak Hooda, SIX, massive, Unadkat misses his mark, offers a length delivery on the stumps, Hooda gets underneath it and sends it high and over long-on, hits the roof of the second tier and bounces back into the ground

Unadkat to Henriques, SIX, cracking shot, this was the slower short ball from Unadkat, Henriques spotted it early, waited on it and slaps it high and over deep mid-wicket, went a long way into the stands. SRH are finishing well here
McClenaghan to Chris Morris, SIX, much needed. Courtesy Morris. Walks across, stands tall and gives the sitting up short one a real spank in getting it to fly over mid-wicket
Harbhajan to Rabada, SIX, a dance and a dispatch. Right up, close and personal to a friendly tosser up and excutes the lofted drive. Clears the tallest man on operation at long-off

Chris Morris to Buttler, SIX. Bouncer. Top-edge. Six! Are you surprised? Oh! The bats these days. Big chunk of edge as Morris drops his head in disappointment. Went for the pull did Jos Buttler and Morris' pace took care of the rest

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, SIX, for a second the ball seemed to be heading out of Wankhede. But just clears the rope. Slower delivery on middle and leg, Pandya clears his front leg and heaves it to deep mid-wicket. Not off the middle and hence didn't go a long way

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, SIX, smoked! Back of a length delivery, Pandya was almost cramped for space, but got a decent connection on the short-arm pull, the ball travels to second tier at the deep mid-wicket fence. Head right on top of the ball was the key there
Rabada to Buttler, SIX, you don't bowl length to this lad. Not when he's in form. Clears his front leg and smokes it with superb ease over mid-wicket
Axar to Andrew Tye, SIX, they need more of these! Andrew Tye goes across the line, the ball did not turn and came in with the arm, helping Andrew Tye's swing. Goes well over the cow corner

T Natarajan to Finch, SIX, that spoils the over for Natarajan. It was good until then, but ends up conceding 11. Good length ball just outside off, Finch extends those big forearms and smashes it over long-off

Basil Thampi to Maxwell, SIX, Maxwell is much better off playing conventional cricket shots. Short delivery and at Thampi's pace it sat up for the Australian, who dismisses it with a pull over deep mid-wicket

Shubham Agarwal to Maxwell, SIX, mammoth! Agarwal is brave enough to toss it up to Maxwell, who plonks his front foot forward and muscles the loft over the bowler's head. Cleared the sightscreen with ease. All bottom hand!

Shubham Agarwal to Maxwell, SIX, this is buffet for Maxwell. Couple of steps down and takes it on the full, then heaves it a long way over the cow corner fence. Second six of the over and Agarwal is under pressure
Dwayne Smith to Axar, SIX, first ball and it is out of the park. Length delivery right in the slot, Axar crouches a bit and tonks it over deep mid-wicket. Plenty of height and the required distance

Dwayne Smith to Axar, SIX, Doctor Smith changes to round the wicket but there is no respite for him. Proving to be a costly injury that to Nathu Singh. Another length ball and Axar nonchalantly puts it into the crowd at cow corner. 16 off the first three balls

Basil Thampi to Saha, SIX, this time Thampi does not get away with a full toss. There's the big hit Saha was looking for, heaves it towards cow corner and has made a decent connection for the ball to carry over the fence

Andrew Tye to Amla, SIX, as long as they fetch runs - mistimed swing again. Gets over the man at long-on; made a bit of room to this length ball and threw whatever he had. Will be happy with the end result for sure
Shubham Agarwal to Shaun Marsh, SIX, mishit. Again. Won't use that famous thing..everytime. Yeah. Shaun Marsh skips down the track and lofts over the man at long-off. Eventually it has enough on it
Jadeja to Amla, SIX, there's no reason for Jadeja to flight and be full. Because one time he tries this, he gets lofted over deep extra cover.. inside out. Goes all the way
Badree to Narine, SIX, lovely, Narine's toying with Badree, comes down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on, 18 runs already from the over

Tymal Mills to Gambhir, SIX, excellent cricket from Gambhir, banged in short and well outside off, Gambhir got on top of the bounce, used Mills' pace and helps it over the lone slip, went all the way for a maximum
Tahir to Karn Sharma, SIX, and he piles it on with a salt rub. Gets a ball in the slot at a good length and just swings his bat out. Tonking it down the ground

Tahir to Rohit, SIX, well if there is someone catching this it is in the crowds. That's into the railway line. Into one of the Virar locals perhaps. Another variation, in the form of a googly this time and picked out right off the palm as he slogs it while sweeping

SN Thakur to Rohit, SIX, Rohit and his front footed pulls. Ah, sublime. Thakur looks to pepper it with banging it half way down and watches it being deposited with a flat bat into the first floor over deep square leg

Unadkat to Rohit, SIX, it only gets another twist. Spoke too soon. Converts a wide length ball into one in the arc with a run across his stumps. And then it is his swing that takes over. Hacks it across the line and despite the top-edge the big bats ensure it flies into the stands over mid-wicket

Unadkat to Harbhajan, SIX, he finishes it with a swat. In style. But it is Pune who'll be celebrating. They've breached the fortress. A lovely strike on the ball with Harbhajan clearing his front leg and slogs it out of the park. Through his favourite area - mid-wicket

Johnson to Rahane, SIX, what a wonderful shot! Shows the nature of the track. An away-slanter from a good length, Rahane squats, reaches for it and slaps it over cover. Off the middle and the ball has enough wings to go all the way

Karn Sharma to Tripathi, SIX, that's a monster! Dhoni-esque. Flat, quick and overpitched, right in the slot for Tripathi to swing his bat. Clears his front leg and tonks it over long-on for a gigantic six

Karn Sharma to Tripathi, SIX, good effort from the man in the deep, but he couldn't stop it from going into the fence. A 68-metre six. A leg-break, Tripathi gets down and slog sweeps. Doesn't quite get it off the middle of the bat. Nitish Rana at deep mid-wicket waits for it at the edge of the rope. But, the ball had just about enough elevation to go over him
Christian to Uthappa, SIX, some salt into the open wounds being garnished in by Uthappa. The ball was short but Uthappa was tall enough to smack the pull away over cow corner. He wants a quick finish
Tahir to Gambhir, SIX, looked like a mishit but that has gone for a half-a-dozen. The ball was in his zone and the batsman played the cross batted swipe to tonk the ball away over deep mid-wicket
Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, onto one knee! The story after that is scripted. The author - Uthappa just looks into the stands. The ball has disappeared into the stands at the cow corner region

Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, this one is a sequel to the previous six. Meatier and bigger. He knelt down and clobbered the slog sweep deep into the stands. That should be six and a half, Danny would agree for sure
