Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, on one knee and spank! Right towards the pitch of the delivery and he goes kaboom over wide long-off
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, make that two in a row. Over long-on this time. Good hand-eye coordination as he smears the ball with a clean swing of the willow
Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, had a good piece of that did Robin Uthappa. Got underneath and marmalized a floater over long-on for a 83-metre maximum over long-on

Chawla to Dhoni, SIX, you put fielders close to me, I will hit the ball out of the park. Dhoni is taking the aggressive option. This time gets right under the ball after dancing down, smokes it straight back over Chawla for a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, chants of "Dhoni, Dhoni". He's looking in ominous touch here. Not all that short from Kuldeep, Dhoni went deep in the crease and might have top edged the pull, looked mistiemd at first, but the ball kept gathering momentum as it flew over the deep mid-wicket fence

Woakes to Christian, SIX, super shot! Woakes was a bit predictable there. Full and wide outside off, Christian lined up for the loft over extra cover and nailed it to perfection. All the way and a much needed one for RPS

Woakes to Christian, SIX, back-to-back sixes and now we know why GG was relcutant to bowl the spinners at the death. Length delivery right in the swinging arc, Christian is known for his big-hittin and he thumps this over the cow corner fence

U Yadav to Smith, SIX, 16 balls without a boundary or a six, now RPS have three on the trot. This is a top shot. A difficult one to play. Wide yorker outside off, Smith opens the bat face and carves it over point. Nice connection and pinged the ad boardings

Woakes to Rahane, SIX, Rahane breaks the shackles, at first look - he didn't looked to have timed it, but it kept soaring high and into the stands at long-on. Just short of a good length and outside off, Rahane swung through the line and collects his first maximum

Negi to Finch, SIX, that's been launched! Full in the slot for Finch and he isn't standing on ceremony there. He certainly isn't. Lots of flight from Negi, Finch's eyes lit up. Huge six down the ground
Negi to Finch, SIX, that's a smaller six but perhaps a better shot as he had to drag it from outside off. So much power in the bottom hand as he swipes a flat six over wide long-on
Negi to Raina, SIX, races to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over wide long-on. Raina may have the net run-rate at the corner of his eye
Badree to Finch, SIX, why use the feet when you have such beautiful hands. What power, woof! Gets underneath this venom-less slider and smacks it onto the roof at deep mid-wicket
Badree to Finch, SIX. Kaboom. Make that two in a row. Finch wants to take the attack to the opposition. This time he fetches the ball from leg stump and goes spank over wide long-on. Madness...

Chahal to Finch, SIX, down the wicket and bam! Was nowhere near the pitch of the delivery, but fast hands and power of Finch takes care of everything. No half-measures. Swung it as hard as he can and got it over mid-wicket

Aniket Choudhary to Finch, SIX, how does it matter? He is smashing the ball into the crowds. A half-volley on the pads, he whups it for a 97-metre maximum over mid-wicket. Just compare Raina's score with Finchy. Tells you that he's in some mood
Basil Thampi to Kohli, SIX, there goes the riposte from the RCB skipper. He planted his feet leg-sidish and created enough room for a whip of the hands. The ball soared into the stands
Ankit Soni to Negi, SIX, a much needed six. Soni is brave enough to toss it up, Negi kneels down and fetches the slog sweep from outside off, smacks it over long-on and has the crowd going again

Ankit Soni to Negi, SIX, Soni is trying too many things. First ball - leggie. Second - googly. Third - the front of the hand slider, Negi flat-bats it over extra cover. Just about has enough wings to clear the rope

Ankit Soni to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, drops down on one knee and sends the ball skywards. That was a maximum, the moment it left the bat. He pumelled that with all his might and the ball landed well into the crowds in the cow corner region

Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, SIX, well tossed up delivery and the batsman slog sweeps it out of the park. That brings fifty for Samson! This has been a fine knock from the keeper-batsman. This might as well break the shackles
de Grandhomme to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, short delivery, sans any pace and the batsman hammers the pull away over the man at deep mid-wicket for a sixer. Iyer has changed gears as well

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, Bang!! Boom!! Short ball and the batsman transfers his weight ever so slightly to thwack the ball over the on-side towards cow corner region for a huge six. That was almost lost in the clouds

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, cracking shot, fraction too short from Umesh, Samson is quick to swivel across, uses the pace on the ball and helps it on its way, went sailing over the ropes at backward square leg

Mishra to Uthappa, SIX, picks the bones out of this googly from Mishra. It was tossed up generously and as soon as Uthappa picked it, he decided it was going in the stands. Heaves it way over long-on. It was right in the slot too
Chris Morris to Uthappa, SIX, sharp short delivery and Uthappa is up for the challenge. He gets into position quickly and nails the pull behind square, flat and all the way. Good start to the over

Chris Morris to Uthappa, SIX, 16 runs off the first three balls. This is the best of the lot. Good length ball on the pads, Uthappa just picks it up nonchalantly and places it into the stands at deep mid-wicket

Pat Cummins to Uthappa, SIX, he promised some fireworks this year and he's keeping up his words. Anticipated the length to be short, got quickly into position and smashed the pull over the deep mid-wicket fence
Nehra to Guptill, SIX, short ball at 131ks, angled into the body. Bring it on says Guptill as he swivel-pulls a 77 metre maximum over square leg.
Henriques to Eoin Morgan, SIX, fetches the length ball and then thwacks the ball over long-on. Length in the later part of the innings spells doom for the bowlers

S Kaul to Shaun Marsh, SIX, WOOAAAAHHHHHH! That was out of the top draw! A length ball it was and the batsman cracked it over covers for a maximum. That should have been awarded a dozen runs just for the execution of it

Deepak Hooda to Shaun Marsh, SIX, cracking shot, just a little shimmy down the track, Marsh gets close to the pitch of the ball, extends his elbows and lifts it high and over long-off, went a long way into the stands
Axar to Williamson, SIX, touch short and spanked! Williamson is quick on his wheels as he jumps back to thump Axar over mid-wicket. Mighty!
Ishant to Williamson, SIX, half-volley and Williamson dismisses it out of his sight. Loads up and launches it over square on the leg-side

Ishant to Dhawan, SIX, wow!! Dhawan is up and running. Similar line from Ishant. Dhawan won't miss out this time. Swings hard and connects well to deposit it into the fine leg stands. A huge hit from Dhawan
Axar to Warner, SIX, Warner is out of the box quickly and lofts it over mid-on. This white ball surely travels. Goes way into the stands
Axar to Warner, SIX, 50 up already for SRH. In the slot and Warner clears his front foot to nail this straight over the bowler's head. Into the second tier
Cariappa to Warner, SIX, Warner spoils Cariappa's over. Just short of a yorker and Warner clears his front foot to thump it straight over the bowler's head for his third maximum
Maxwell to Warner, SIX, Warner is picking the spinner well today. Comes down the track in a flash and gets to the pitch of the ball to nail this over long-on
Tahir to Kohli, SIX, that's a googly too short and Kohli thrashes it. Shortish delivery and down the leg-side, sits up nicely, Kohli sends that over the mid-wicket boundary. Fifty up
Badree to Smith, SIX, looked a bit fidgety last over, but boy he has nailed this out of the screws. Underneath a flat delivery and he goes spank over mid-wicket
Chahal to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, that's the shot of the game for me. Lovely use of the feet, comes dancing down towards the pitch of the ball and bulldozes it into the mid-wicket stands. Tonk!

Aravind to Dhoni, SIX, the 400th six of the tournament and it has come from MS. No fuss, just a touch outside his crease, picks the bones out of a half-volley and golf-swings it straight down the ground for a 80-plus metre maximum
Aravind to Tripathi, SIX, wow! Welcome to Pune says Tripathi to Aravind. Pitched up delivery on middle and leg, Tripathi sinks down on one knee and slogs it away over long-on

Malinga to Ishan Kishan, SIX, full, on the sticks and Kaboom! That tailed in ever so faintly and Ishan Kishan goes into overdrive mode. That was tonked over deep mid-wicket as the whirlwind of the hands took it high and handsome over the ropes
McClenaghan to Andrew Tye, SIX, short ball, Tye was ready for it. Is quick to stamp his weight onto the back foot and murders the pull over square leg

McClenaghan to Andrew Tye, SIX, slower ball, he has picked it again does Andrew Tye. Not quite off the middle, but he will take it, a 83-metre maximum. Doesn't make any shuffly movements, just keeps his head still and spanks the ball as hard as he can, into the long-off stands

McClenaghan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, OOLLLLLAAAAALLLAA! That was a sizzler. Dropped short and the batsman camps back and pulls the ball away into the deep mid-wicket stands. That was powered, muscled and I can go on...

McClenaghan to Ankit Soni, SIX, perfect finish for the Lions, but Mumbai Indians will be the happier side. Ankit Soni gets underneath this half-volley and blazes it over long-off. Clean ball-striking!
Krunal Pandya to Jadeja, SIX, he has his intentions clear! That has been swiped clean as a whistle. Knelt down and swept it big for a maximum

Irfan Pathan to Krunal Pandya, SIX, that should seal it! Full and in the zone and the batsman whistled the ball away into thin air for a maximum straight down the ground. That was a poor delivery, they should have opted for Jadeja

Irfan Pathan to Parthiv Patel, SIX, even better! Short ball that sits up nicely for Parthiv to play the pull shot. He is a short man, but isn't afraid to play shots like that. Pummels it over deep mid-wicket
Raina to Nitish Rana, SIX, this guy is a positive batsman. What a wonderful way to get off the mark. Sinks low on one knee and smacks the slog sweep over deep backward square leg

Axar to Corey Anderson, SIX, lovely shot, much needed blow for the Daredevils - but they need plenty of thse more. Came down the track, doesn't get too close to the ball, allows him to free his arms - plays with the turn and deposits the ball way into the stands at long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Nair, SIX, cracking shot, banged in short and just outside off, Karun was early into the pull and nailed it high and in front of square on the on-side, went soaring over the ropes for a maximum

Chris Morris to Guptill, SIX, Guptill is in overdrive. Wants to capitalise on the powerplay. Stays a bit leg-sidish, loads up big time and smacks it with lot of power to send it soaring into the long-on stands
Mishra to Guptill, SIX, he is greeted to the crease with a maximum. Slips in a googly, on a shortish length, Guptill picks it up and clubs it way back into the mid-wicket stands
Nadeem to Guptill, SIX, wow. Massive strike from Guptill. Bends low on seeing this tossed up, gets into good position and smokes it over deep mid-wicket. Scores are level now
Henriques to Uthappa, SIX, goodness gracious. Spots the bowler rolling his fingers across and delays his slog over mid-wicket, bruting the ball way over for a maximum

Henriques to Uthappa, SIX, that's a half-baked bouncer. At half the pace it should have been, so the shortish length is all too easy to deal with. Uthappa clubs it over cow corner with utter disdain. Gets to his fifty, another one this season
Siraj to de Grandhomme, SIX, nah. Drops it short, de Grandhomme looked ready and hammers the pull into the stands. Way over the ropes. Lovely, lovely hit

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, if one shot could be included in the wikipedia page of 'power', this is it. 101 metres from Uthappa. Slogs across the line and puts a lot of flesh on it to send it over the deep mid-wicket fence. Was hit with the turn, yes a googly it was

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, this is the second time Uthappa has slogged across the line off Rashid Khan. And like the previous occasion makes good connection again, sending it deep into the stands at deep mid-wicket

U Yadav to Warner, SIX, that's just just missed the sightscreen. This is a good batting surface to hit through the line. You can't bowl full if it's not swinging, Warner bends his knees and gets under it, smashed over mid-off. First maximum of the night
Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, SIX, wowww! This is some hitting. Spare a thought for the bowler. Kuldeep bowled a full delivery looking for some spin, Warner gets down on one knee and slogs it over long-on

Woakes to Warner, SIX, the skipper wants to make it big today. Such a lovely shot this. English length from Woakes. Sits up nicely, on a good length and on the stumps, this is a batting belter, at least with the new ball, so the bowler's got to be clever. Warner gets inside the line and just picks it up to send it over the long leg boundary

Woakes to Dhawan, SIX, now then, now then! That was a shot to make a statement. National selectors, please note. How hard did he hit that? Walked slightly across the line, expectedly got the slower ball and muscled that over the mid-wicket boundary. How poor was Woakes to opt for a slower ball for the fourth successive time?

Y Pathan to Warner, SIX, this has gone all the way over the mid-wicket boundary. The bowler needs to show a bit of courage here and not just bowl short all the time. Got to fancy his chances too. Warner slogs and the connection is very good

Narine to Warner, SIX, it's a 20-ball fifty for Davey Warner, what entertainment from the Aussie. Greets Narine in grand style. This was the normal offie on the stumps, Warner was early into position for the switch-hit and he sent that over the square third man fence. Raise of the bat to acknowledge all the applause. Joint-fastest fifty by a SRH player in IPL

U Yadav to Warner, SIX, wowww! What a shot. No lapse in concentration even after the break. Umesh errs in his length, slightly short in length, Warner muscles the pull hard over mid-wicket and the bat made a sweet sound as it made contact with the ball

Coulter-Nile to Warner, SIX, what a way to bring up the century partnership. NCN went short with this slower delivery, but Warner got the placement right. There was a man at deep mid-wicket and it went at a catchable height, but he hit it to his right

Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, SIX, dropped and it's Woakes again. He misjudged one in the second over off Warner, now he's palmed this over the long-off rope. This was an easy catch. Shake of the head. Has already cost the team around 80 runs at least. Shortish and outside off stump, Warner hit that off the back foot, didn't get the distance, but the fielder misjudges the catch

Aniket Choudhary to Hardik Pandya, SIX, and the last ball has cost 7. Could well cost RCB the match as well. A nothing short ball, around waist high and Hardik Pandya has muscled the pull flat into the deep square stands. Looks like he was waiting for the short one, Aniket Choudhary didn't get any shoulder or height on that, Kohli is not happy at all. Suddenly now the equation looks easy

Aravind to Rohit, SIX, brilliant. Just brilliant. Rohit knows that it will be on a length and slower, knows that it will be majorly outside off as well, so what does he do? Shuffles across and delectably plays a half sweep, yes a sweep, that sails into the unmanned deep square fence. Didn't look like carrying all the way, but it was a flat hit

Chahal to Buttler, SIX, the idea was right from Chahal to flight the ball to the Englishman, but when it's too full, the ball hardly has any distance to spin on the batsman. Buttler moves his left leg out of the way and smashes it high over the mid-wicket boundary

Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, great shot. Walks across his stumps, gets outside off and then sweeps it almost into the first tier. Sailed a long way into the deep backward square stands. Is that the strike that gets him back into his fearsome best? Let's wait and watch

Malinga to Negi, SIX, caught by the ballboy. Outside the boundary of course. RCB needed that. Negi backs away and picks the slower delivery, lofts well and off the middle of the bat. Just crossed the ropes at long-off and well taken low by the man who is the centre of attraction as the cameras pan to him

Malinga to Negi, SIX, second six of the over. Again it is Negi who is doing the damage. Rushed out and clouted the slower delivery high and long. Hardik at long-off tried his best, leaping with one hand to his right, but the ball was always winning that battle. Just over him and six

Bumrah to Negi, SIX, third six for Negi. Bumrah went for the slower delivery after two yorkers. Negi was sitting in his crease and waiting for that. A mighty swing over long-on and that's the biggest of the lot for him. Chahal is seen clapping from the dressing room

Karn Sharma to Kohli, SIX, a step forward and then thump over long-on. All bottom hand in that. Trademark Kohli. Saw the flight on that leggie and then thumped it with lots of wrist and the bottom hand took over. Long-on was just a spectator

Bumrah to Kohli, SIX, what wrists he has. Played a similar kind of shot against Basil Thampi a couple of games ago. That one flew over deep square leg, this over long-on. A little shimmy and picks the slower delivery, then the wrists take over. Like a flick of a switch, he uncorks those wrists and the ball sails a long way over long-on. No-one else in world cricket can play that pickup shot from the pads as well as Kohli does

McClenaghan to de Villiers, SIX, is sweeper in business? No. It has gone all the way. Down the wicket and then cuts it hard and flat over the deep man's head. For a moment Buttler reckoned he was in with a chance, but it flew over his head
Krunal Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, makes room and goes outside leg, sits down and then unleashes the slog-sweep. A flat hit over mid-wicket and all the way

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, SIX, now he's cleared long leg here. Never looked like clearing it, trust me, but this guy packs a punch. Nicely inclined himself outside the line, with no feet, opening the area on the leg-side. Hoicked it up and over, and cleared the man in the deep, who was right at the boundary

Washington Sundar to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's a tripe length. Short and Kishan has pulled him over deep mid-wicket. No fuss. Looked a six the moment he hit it, unlike that hoick over long leg last over
Stokes to Brendon McCullum, SIX, now smacks the bejeezus out of this. Gets his front leg out and hacks this ball over mid-wicket. All the way. Need drones to catch it

Christian to Brendon McCullum, SIX, and look at how McCullum celebrates Stokes no-bullseye last ball. Gets the right length to smack his bat right across to, and does so effectively. Hedgehopped over deep mid-wicket

Tahir to Finch, SIX, what can a bowler do. Bowl, they say. Perfectly good ball from Tahir here. Wrong 'un on off stump but Finch has his front leg out, smacking it over deep mid-wicket with the turn. What have you got, Tahir?
Faulkner to Dhoni, SIX, this shot is all about the sound it made. Goes back and across to this short ball and hammers the pull over the deep mid-wicket fence

Dwayne Smith to Stokes, SIX, that could have taken a couple of them down in the crowd. Stokes swings. Why not. Length ball, sits up there and Stokes just swings across. "The big Ben," the screen displays

Basil Thampi to Stokes, SIX, oh dear, that simplifies things. A 79-meter six. 19 needed off 11 now. A full toss and that has been bruted over long-on. A full-blooded bat swat and boom, it's outta here

Basil Thampi to Stokes, SIX, for a moment, I thought it's headed to long-off. But Finch was there, and the ball would have cleared Finch on Finch's shoulders there. Long, big hit. Made room, as he's been doing, and clouts it over the fielder. Way over him, as I have made amply clear

Faulkner to Christian, SIX, Dhoni and Smith half-hug in the dug out, Pune's crowd cheers its lungs out. Supergiant beat Gujarat for the first time ever in IPL. Christian gets a ball sitting up and scythes the ball over square leg. Way over it. With that, it's goodbye RCB from IPL 2017
Sangwan to Stokes, SIX, short ball and Stokes seems to have got his eye in. Goes back in no time and times the pull well over the deep backward square leg fence. Goes deep into the stands
Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, when 11 deliveries have been dot out of 12, you do such things. Like going across the line and sending it well over cow corner for a maxium
Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, and when the bowler dares to flight, you - on the back of confidence - try it again. This time, Stokes clubs it well over the long-on fence. Too big a hit

Siraj to Samson, SIX, that's a glorious shot! Siraj bangs it short without any venom behind it. Samson stands tall and launches it over long-off. See the ball and hit the ball. He hit that and stood for the photographs
Siraj to Pant, SIX, this guy and his timing. Reads this short ball early and waits on the back foot. Pulls from there into the deep square leg fence

Yuvraj to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, another loose ball around off. Shreyas Iyer swings across the line and for a moment it seems he is in danger of skying this one. But he is not, sends over the long-on fence. Mighty hit
Yuvraj to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, and again! Unlike Corey Anderson, Shreyas Iyer does not miss out on this short ball. Camps back in time and thunders the pull deep into the stands over deep mid-wicket

S Kaul to Corey Anderson, SIX, after a barrage of mistimed swipes and pulls finally Corey Anderson gets one off the middle of the willow. And when he gets those off the meat, no ground is big enough. A length ball served with gentle pace. What else does he need? Swings and swings well to clear the man at long-on

Siraj to Corey Anderson, SIX, bye bye ball. Slips on the legs of Corey Anderson. Was a slower ball and Corey Anderson whipped it from there, skies it high but gets the distance as well. Manages to clear Dhawan at deep square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Corey Anderson, SIX, if not for the stands this would have travelled more. Might have got the metro from Pragati Maidan. Fuller length and Corey Anderson cleared his front leg, cracked it hard and hit flat over the long-on fence

S Kaul to Chris Morris, SIX, at the outset this one did not seem to have come off the middle. But he had timed it well. Has that power to clear the fence. A short ball and Chris Morris pulls well over the deep mid-wicket fielder

S Kaul to Nair, SIX, third man in business? Nope, over him. Cheeky shot from the Karnataka batsman. It was banged in short outside off, Nair waits for it and periscopes it over the non-existent slip. Has enough power to go over third man, who thought he might have a chance there
Henriques to Nair, SIX, Nair is on a roll here! Straight, length ball, Nair moves leg-side and launches it straight over the bowler's head. The ball sails over the sightscreen for a maximum

Rabada to Yuvraj, SIX, not off the middle, but it doesn't have to be when it is Yuvraj Singh. The cross-seamer on off, Yuvraj clears his front leg to heave it into the on-side, off the base of the bat and over the man patrolling the deep mid-wicket fence

Jayant Yadav to Warner, SIX, this is the advantage of having the ability to play the switch-hit. You can't set fields for such shots. A good flighted delivery on the stumps, nothing wrong with the delivery, Warner makes decent connection, although it was a top edge and it cleared the rope over backward point

Chris Morris to Dhawan, SIX, he's so good with that pick up shot. Plays it in his own way. Stylish! Morris once again bowls the perfect length to lift over the top, the full ball was on the leg as well and Dhawan used his lovely wrists to whip it away over the mid-wicket boundary

Jayant Yadav to Williamson, SIX, oh dear! That's released all the pressure. He'd beaten Williamson twice and then follows it up with a filthy delivery in the form of trying a variation. He suggests that he wanted to bowl the carrom ball, but it slipped down the leg-side and Williamson helped himself to a six with a pull over backward square leg

Tahir to de Grandhomme, SIX, "that's Colin de Grandhomme," goes Doully on air. He spots the googly, kneels down and slog sweeps it with the spin over cow corner. He's a big man and that ball sailed a long way into the crowd

Tahir to de Grandhomme, SIX, consecutive sixes for de Grandhomme. Should have been caught. Once more goes with the turn, lofts the leggie towards long-off. Got height more than the distance, Christian moves across to his left and parries it over the fence. He misjudged the rope behind him. There was enough space to go a foot back

Christian to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, is it Suryakumar's night? Has been quiet in the tournament and has been in-and-out of the side as well. Picked the back of a length slower delivery, pivoted on his front leg and pulled it over deep square leg

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, 14 off the first three balls. Unadkat is predictable and Suryakumar is toying with him, plants his front foot across the stumps, laps it over backward square, a better connection meant maximum result

Unadkat to Coulter-Nile, SIX, Collision between Smith and Stokes. The latter straightaway calls for the physio. After crashing into Stokes, Smith goes bang into the ad boardings. Head first and it bounced off. Smith gets up and has a word with the physio. Seems to be fine. That looked brutal. Slower delivery from Unadkat and Coulter-Nile swung across the line towards deep mid-wicket. Stokes ran to his left and Smith ran to his right from long-on. Both were watching the ball and not each other. It was the Englishman who caught the ball, but once he dashed into Smith the flick back didn't go where he intended
Washington Sundar to Gambhir, SIX, wow! This is brutal! Dances down the track and goes big with the swing. Sends well over the long-on fence

Tahir to M Pandey, SIX, he goes against the turn, I assume! And then takes the biggest part of the ground to hit this one. But Pandey has got this one right off the middle of the bat to leave the fielder at the fence as a mere spectator

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, how well has he hit that? Boy! He is having some fun out there. Skates out of his crease, wasn't quite to the pitch, but why bother? He swung it handsomely over mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, another one! Bam bam! He reaches his highest T20 score and does it in some style. Greyhounds down the pitch and takes Kuldeep Yadav for a journey over mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, my word! Don't drop it there to this lad. On seeing the loop, he gets down on his knees and bludgeons it barrel straight over the bowler's head. Runs raining at KKR's E-DEN
Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, on one knee and launched! Tripathi into the 90s. Wanted to have a piece of Kuldeep Yadav once more, got down and thwacked him with a slog-sweep over mid-wicket

de Grandhomme to Christian, SIX. All over! Some glum faces among the crowd. Three back to back wins for RPS. A right-handed version of Ben Stokes, Christian waits for the short ball, once it arrives, he murders the pull flat over mid-wicket

Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, SIX, this must be demoralising for Coulter-Nile. Telegrams his intentions and shimmies out to meet the pitch, converts it into a full ball and blasts it over extra cover. Enough to carry it all the way

U Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, imperious. What a strike from Tripathi. Isn't intimidated by this short ball, takes it from over his head and deposits it over the long-leg fence. He got into the position early and hooked it off the meat off the bat

Woakes to Smith, SIX, wow. Gorgeuous from Smith. Brings up the fastest fifty for RPS in IPL. Stands motionless and lets his hands do the talking. Extends his arms and lifts it handsomely into the long-on stands
Coulter-Nile to Tripathi, SIX, terrific striking from Tripathi. Gets right back to this short ball and muscles it away over the cow corner fence for a maximum

Faulkner to Pant, SIX, he was undone by the lack of pace there. Early into the shot but made sure that he swung hard at this. Bruted it. And as much as it lacked the timing, it made up with its power, this shot. Clouted over deep mid-wicket, despite coming off the bottom half of the bat
Faulkner to Pant, SIX, what do you do to a slow bouncer? You bully it. Despite being in a tangle with your footwork. Had the weight back and could pull the bejeezus out of it. Brilliant shot

Faulkner to Pant, SIX, *jumps into a well* This is turning out to be a ridiculously good innings. Unicorns are real, and so are DD chases. Gets a pitched up delivery and slogs it over long-on. No half measures. None at all. Pick the length and swing. Has been so successful so far
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, umm. This looked effortless and it's gone into the crowd. Just a length ball, turning away and Samson has swatted it over long-on. Clocked 99 meters as if it's body temperature
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, wide and slotted over covers. And it wasn't a bad ball from Jadeja, drifting it wide and making Samson reach out. But erred in the length and paid by six runs. That's it
Jadeja to Pant, SIX, brilliant. A slog sweep that's been nailed into the stands, again. Nothing more I can add. He's just seeing the length so early tonight and readying himself for the hits

Sangwan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh just a touch overpitched. And so overpitched that the change of pace doesn't matter much. And to make things worse, Iyer had read it. So waits a little longer and dumps the ball over long-off. More timing than anything else. Connected the ball at the right time and boom, you can hit it with a spoon too. Well, not really. 20 off 24 needed
Basil Thampi to Corey Anderson, SIX, another six. Length ball, around off and Anderson has swung it over deep square leg. It's that sort of a day. 18 sixes already
Basil Thampi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, here's another. Shuffled across early, and was able to open up the long leg region. Picked the ball up and bottom-handed it over the ropes there. Just 4 needed
Faulkner to Corey Anderson, SIX, Delhi have their highest ever run-chase. Anderson gets a full ball and pumps it over long-on to seal what was an easy win in the end

Sangwan to Samson, SIX, wow. This is from Samson's refrigarator of awesomeness. Pure class. Drops it a tad short, does Sangwan. Samson is ready for it. Handsomely hacks it behind square, such is the power that it carries all the way for a maximum
Basil Thampi to Pant, SIX, quality from Pant. Thampi bowls it short and compliments it with width, Pant reaches out and spanks it over cover
Basil Thampi to Samson, SIX, you cannot afford to spray it on Samson's pads. Thampi just does that and gets punished. He gets inside the line and whips it nonchalantly behind square. Half a dozen!
Sangwan to Pant, SIX, Pant joins into the act. High percentage shot this. Hauls his back leg in the air and elegantly swipes it into the deep square leg stands

Sangwan to Pant, SIX, "Three sixes in a row for Delhi" screams Scott Styris on air. Finesse followed by violence. Loads up big time, gets under this full ball and smashes it over long-on. Soars a long way into the stands
Raina to Samson, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. 500th six of the tournament. Loops it up in the arc for Samson, no turn. Samson lowers his stance and launches it over cow corner

Ankit Soni to Pant, SIX, what a shot. The googly from Soni, but pitches it up fuller outside off. Pant isn't sparing those. Flexes his arms and murders it straight over the bowler's head for a maximum

Raina to Pant, SIX, fifty for Pant. Reaches the landmark in style. A rank long hop from Raina, Pant is onto it in a flash. Skips back and smokes it away into the deep mid-wicket stands. 14 runs off the over
Ankit Soni to Samson, SIX, ugly from Soni. Perhaps, took a cue from his skipper. Half-tracker, sits up nicely for Samson. He gets under it and clubs it over deep mid-wicket

Ankit Soni to Samson, SIX, brilliant. Soni floats it up full, Samson is ready for it. Unleashes his muscles and dumps it over the bowler's head for a maximum. Raina walks up immediately and consoles the bowler

Samuels to Raina, SIX, no sir! Don't bowl there, he'll thrash you even in his sleep. When it's full and that front leg is out of the way, he hardly misses out on the slog. He was down on one knee and smashed this over mid-wicket

Samuels to Raina, SIX, once again Samuels errs on the fuller side and Raina is not afraid to hit the ball in the air. Hits it very straight and ensures that long-off and long-on were not in the picture

Nadeem to Karthik, SIX, every time the spinners have dropped it short, Karthik has done very well to rock back, make excellent use of the crease and pull it handsomely over mid-wicket. This had a lot of hang time on it

Nadeem to Karthik, SIX, wowww! The shot of the day for me! The greatest thing about this shot was Karthik didn't manage to get close to the pitch of the ball after jumping down the pitch, yet went through the lofted inside-out drive and sent it over the cover boundary
Corey Anderson to Karthik, SIX, Karthik is turning the heat on. Not off the middle, but Karthik won't mind as he got enough wood on his hook against this short ball that sails over the long leg fence

Shami to Karthik, SIX, wow! Brilliantly played. It was short and wide outside off, Karthik waits for it and slashes it. Didn't bother to keep it down and up she goes. Over backward point and the ball sails over the boundary rope
Corey Anderson to Jadeja, SIX, that's a monster! Full and right in the slot for Jadeja to swing his bat hard. Jaddu stands tall and biffs it over long-on for a gigantic six

Corey Anderson to Jadeja, SIX, highest ever total for Gujarat Lions! Jadeja finishes the innings in style. That's Dhoni-esque. Slower shortish ball. Jadeja waits and waits for it to come to him and smacks the pull over deep mid-wicket. 17 runs off the final over

Shami to Raina, SIX, why on earth did they remove Rabada after that brilliant over? Raina was never comfortable against him. This Delhi team does strange things! Shami serves up a length ball on the leg stump, Raina is good when he connects those slogs and he has done decently well this time, flew over wide mid-on

Rabada to Raina, SIX, no problems with connecting this one from the middle of the bat. Length ball right in the slot and he's in the mood to swing at everything, lofts down the ground, goes over mid-on and goes all the way. Somehow, Raina has raced to 33 off 17 balls

Mishra to Karthik, SIX, the googly again, but it's way too short. Karthik jumps on the back foot, times the pull well enough to send it high in the air and over the mid-wicket boundary. A poor over that from Mishra, bowled well to Raina, but was very poor with his length to Karthik
Chahal to Axar, SIX, floated up on a fuller length and Axar says thank you very much. A much needed six for KXIP. Axar plonks his front foot forward and hammers the loft with the turn over long-on

Watson to Axar, SIX, massive hit! Makes a dent on the ad hoardings on the roof. Right in the arc - length delivery and outside off, Axar clears his front leg and heaves it all the way over long-on. Needs to play all the six balls

Negi to Vohra, SIX, he's a good striker of the cricket ball and Negi erred in his length. Too full and allowed the batsman to get under the ball, Vohra was down on one knee to smash it over the leaping long-on fielder

T Natarajan to Mandeep, SIX, gosh, no! A short ball down leg and Mandeep had helped the pull over fine leg with utter nonchalance. And given how slow this pitch is, bouncers aren't exactly themselves. They are friends

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, umm, you aren't a cricket binge-watcher if you didn't see this coming. Dropped short, and AB has smacked it into the oblivion. Over deep mid-wicket. You would envy how early AB sees things, cricket lengths here. Got into the position beautifully and swatted it away
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, SIX, clobbered over mid-wicket. Stays put, and waits for the ball to arrive, before laying into a delicate bat-swing over cow corner
Bipul Sharma to Stokes, SIX, Stokes has seen enough. Decides to up the ante and succeeds. Lowers his stance to reach the ball, unleashes his strong muscles and thumps it over deep mid-wicket

Bipul Sharma to Stokes, SIX, two in two! Left-arm spin against Stokes? Not a good idea. He takes a step forward this time, wasn't quite to the pitch but he extends his long levers to butcher it into the deep mid-wicket stands
Bipul Sharma to Stokes, SIX, Stokes is teeing off. Third six off Bipul. Spots the shorter ball early, skips back and flat-bats it over long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni has found his elements. A short ball without any purpose, sits up nicely for Dhoni. He rocks back and muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket. The crowd aren't willing to return the ball. So, the fourth umpire has arrived with a set of replacements

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, SIX, you miss the length, you will get punished. The idea was good from Kumar, but the execution was horrible. Fullish outside off, Dhoni throws his weight across and bullies it over extra cover. A flat six

Henriques to Rahane, SIX, piles on his luck. Unleashes the first boundary of the day clearing his front leg, walking into the line and down in executing the full bat swing as he clinically dispatches it with a tonk over long-on. All timing

Stokes to Yuvraj, SIX, class! Everything right about this shot. Just a pleasing sight to see Yuvraj smack a six straight back over the bowler. Fuller and on the stumps, the full face of the bat comes to the fore and then the extension of the arms to send it sailing over the rope

Christian to Yuvraj, SIX, much needed hit for SRH. Short delivery and not much pace to trouble Yuvraj, was bowled at 120kph and sat up nicely, Yuvraj pulls it off the front foot into the deep square leg stand

Unadkat to Naman Ojha, SIX, Ojha can strike the ball. So, SRH fans, hang in there. Unadkat switches to round the wicket and dishes out a slower delivery on a length, Ojha swings as hard as possible and sends it over long-on. Got plenty of height and for a second might have thought he was in trouble, but Christian was reduced to a spectator
Unadkat to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan is looking in good touch, length delivery outside off, he was quick to shuffle across, gets into a good position and heaves it over the mid-wicket fence

Tahir to Warner, SIX, cracking shot, this was the leg-break, but the line was too full, allowed Warner to get underneath the ball and lift it back over his head, went all the way for the first maximum of the chase, for Warner
Harbhajan to Shami, SIX, that is a good hit! Slogs with the turn and hits it well over the long-on fence. 91 metre hit that

McClenaghan to Nair, SIX, sound! Often that is an indication of the timing. Nair clubs the length ball over mid-wicket. Looked a bit early on the shot but manages to put more than enough behind the shot to power it over the lurking fielder at the boundary
Harbhajan to Pat Cummins, SIX, he goes and goes big. What helps him the sensible approach - that is to go with the turn. Clubs over cow corner for a maximum
Mishra to Pollard, SIX, massive, nicely tossed up on off, Pollard gets his left leg out of the way and swings through the line, plenty of height and way into the stands, long-off was a mere spectator

Mishra to Pollard, SIX, the short straight boundaries has worked against Mishra here. He can't believe it - for a moment, long-off thought it was an easy chance, but he kept watching it soar over his head. Coming to the ball, it was another lovely leg-break, Pollard was completely done in by it, mistimes it badly and still gets a maximum. Who wants to be a bowler in T20s?

Pat Cummins to Simmons, SIX, massive, once again the batsman seemed to be done in by the length, but Simmons has still managed to send this one way into the stands at wide long-on. On a good length and on the stumps, Simmons was backing away on the slog, had to drag it in the end and still gets plenty of bat on it
Corey Anderson to Simmons, SIX, cracking shot, slower short ball from Anderson, Simmons walks across the stumps and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, went a long way into the stands
Mishra to Pollard, SIX, sheer power from Pollard, Mishra helped his cause with a long hop, Pollard rocks back and flat-bats it back over the bowler, deep into the stands at long-off

Mishra to Pollard, SIX, another biggie and Pollard has deposited this one into the top tier of Kotla. Mishra gave this one plenty of air, Pollard gets a big stride forward and dismisses it high and over long-on. He's looking extremely dangerous

Corey Anderson to Hardik Pandya, SIX, the ball hits the ad cushions on the full. Slanted across the right-hander, Pandya stands his ground and smokes it over extra cover. Two men in front of square riding the boundary and he split them to perfection

Pat Cummins to Hardik Pandya, SIX, brings up the 200 and the 50-run stand in style. The cross-seam full delivery, Hardik stays right back in his crease and lifts it over mid-off, the 146kph delivery sailed over the rope

Pat Cummins to Hardik Pandya, SIX, they have recovered from that tidy last over. Back of a length delivery and Hardik short-arm pulls it over deep mid-wicket, the short boundaries taking care of the rest

Rabada to Simmons, SIX, reminds of that night in Mumbai. Flat-batted pull on this back of a length delivery. Does not go high in the air, almost goes flat to the deep mid-wicket fence. So much power behind this one

Zaheer to Simmons, SIX, that is not the longest part at Kotla - the area behind square on the on-side. And to make things easy, it is a short ball down the leg-side. Simmons waits and thunders the pull well over the fence. Simmons is turning it on. Does not take much time to change the entire context

Aniket Choudhary to Chris Lynn, SIX, two fours followed by a six, Lynnsanity is back ladies and gentlemen. Nothing but a back of a length delivery and the golf like swing comes to the fore, slapped over the wide long-on fence
Badree to de Grandhomme, SIX, he's got hold of that. You bet he has. Badree skids it through from a length on middle, de Grandhomme takes a shimmy down and launches it over deep mid-wicket

Head to de Grandhomme, SIX, that's a six and a half! Into the top tier. Head floats it up right into the slot outside off, and that's all the swinging room which de Grandhomme needs as he sinks on his knees and destroys it over wide long-on

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, good use of the feet. Chahal floats it up on leg-stump, Lynn dances down and lofts it straight back over Chahal. The key was to play it with a straight bat and he did it with utter ease. Almost sent it into the press box

Badree to Narine, SIX, Narine had the better off Badree in the reverse fixture and nothing has changed. Tossed up outside off, Narine goes through the line and the loft travels all the way over long-off
Badree to Narine, SIX, same. Badree keeps flighting them up and Narine keeps sending them into the stands. A clean swing of the bat and the ball sails over the long-off fence. Back-to-back sixes

Badree to Narine, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. Badree is being taken to the cleaners by his mate. A repeat of the previous two shots, Badree needs to change things up, he ends up bowling in Narine's half and the big hit clears long-off with ease

Aravind to Narine, SIX, there's the fastest IPL fifty. Sunil Narine is the proud owner of that record. If someone had told me that he would be the holder of that record, I would be laughing my guts out, but here he is proving almost everyone wrong. Short of length and Narine goes on his toes and lofts it over long-on. That is a very difficult shot to play and even the best of batsman find it hard, but Narine does it with ease. The KKR dugout are on their feet and GG is leading the applause. For once he has a smile on his face

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, the explosion does not seem to stop. KKR keep steamrolling. Lynn uses his feet to the flighted delivery and lofts it beautifully over the long-off. Who said he can't play spin?

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, it is now the highest team total in the powerplay. RCB have found new ways to create records. Chahal keeps tossing them up and Lynn sinks to one knee to slog sweep it into the deep mid-wicket fence

Narine to Head, SIX, Head has a reputation of a clean-hitter, but we haven't seen any of that this season. Picks the right ball this time to play the slog sweep, flighted delivery on off and middle, Head went through with the shot and gained maximum result

Rajpoot to Head, SIX, finishes the over with a maximum. Walks down the wicket to get close to the pitch of the ball and then hoicks it over the cow corner fence. Gets the crowd going as well. Good day for Rajpoot in the office, 4-0-25-0

Woakes to Head, SIX, Woakes misses the length and pays the price. Lands it right in the swinging arc and Head ain't missing out, clears his front leg to get and strikes it cleanly over the long-off fence

U Yadav to Head, SIX, caught, in the crowd. 109 meters. That's a monster. The slower delivery on a fuller length, Head shuffled across slightly, bent his front knee and smashed it over long-on. For a second, it seemed to be heading to Cubbon Park, but dropped inside the ground

U Yadav to Head, SIX, consecutive sixes. Umesh is dishing out length and Head is feasting on it. Outside off and Head set himself up nicely for the loft, slots it over the long-off fence. Flat and all the way
Woakes to Mandeep, SIX, lovely shot, on a good length and on the stumps, Mandeep makes room, swings through the line and clears mid-on with ease, has enough power to send it soaring over the ropes

Maxwell to Dwayne Smith, SIX, the captain did not listen to what the keeper had to say a couple of overs ago. Yes, he pitches it up and then sees himself get muscled over the fence, straight down the ground

Mohit Sharma to Raina, SIX, blame the willow, if you are a bowling fan. Or call it a beautiful display of timing, if you support the batters. A gentle chip on this shortish ball where Raina looked deceived for a while. But manages to clear the long-on fence

Aaron to Karthik, SIX, had it gone a few inches higher, it would have gone past the reach of earth's gravity. Short ball and Karthik gets late on the pull, top edges it over the keeper's head. Goes deep into the stands as well
Axar to Dwayne Smith, SIX, fifty for Dwayne Smith. Dwayne Smith gets a fuller ball this time. Something that was missing so far in this over. Clubs it straight over Axar's head. Goes a long way
Axar to Dwayne Smith, SIX, just about clears the man at long-on. An almost tossed up ball. Dwayne Smith goes with the swing and muscles it over the fence
T Natarajan to Dwayne Smith, SIX, anything up and he decimates it. Fuller ball on the middle and leg. Dwayne Smith keeps the willow straight and beats a leaping long-on
Ankit Soni to Amla, SIX, this time he connects well. Flighted delivery outside off stump, not as wide as the previous one. Amla goes straight down the ground and clears the fence

D Kulkarni to Amla, SIX, don't worry about this one though. Amla is nailing it off the middle, backs away a touch and fires a full ball over long-on. Got complete hold of it and his bat swing took care of the rest
Basil Thampi to Amla, SIX, Amla knows what's coming. A slower delivery, he transfers all his weight onto the back foot and bullies the ball over cow-corner. All power!
Sangwan to Maxwell, SIX, short and in the swinging arc, Maxwell loads up and hacks it away over deep mid-wicket

Sangwan to Maxwell, SIX, mishit? Who cares? It has gone for a six. Maxi, you beast! What power! He looked to have mistimed this full delivery, went for the loft, but the only thing that could have taken that over the long-on fence is his power

Basil Thampi to Amla, SIX, second hundred this season, mighty Hash has done it on the big stage! Gets a handshake and a hug from his skipper. Cross-seam full delivery wide of off, Amla goes inside-out over extra cover. Crunnnnched off the meat

Faulkner to Amla, SIX, Amla welcomes Faulkner with a lovely off-driven six. Length delivery just outside off stump, Amla waits and lofts it easily over the top. Faulkner was surprised how Amla managed to time it so well despite there being no wild swing of the bat

Rashid Khan to Rohit, SIX, good shot to end the over which will spoil a good over from Rashid Khan. Slightly overpitched, Rohit crouches low and launches it downtown over the bowler's head for a maximum
Bhuvneshwar to Rohit, SIX, highest score for Rohit Sharma this season. He spots the slower ball that is on a short of length and smacks it away over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Siraj to Parthiv Patel, SIX, that's a cracking cut shot from the little man. Siraj bowls a 135kph short ball, Parthiv is an excellent player of the cut shot, he deliberately cuts hard with an open face and hits over backward point, it's good enough to go all the way
Karn Sharma to Dhawan, SIX, right to the pitch after putting his dancing shoes on, wallops Karn Sharma into the long-on stands. Easy!

Karn Sharma to Dhawan, SIX, isn't to pitch, but boy! Look at that bat swing. The Gabbar seems to be in full flow. Fetches it from outside off and takes Karn Sharma for a journey over long-on. The crowd are excited, why not!

Swapnil Singh to Chris Lynn, SIX, boom, there you go. Slightly short outside off, and even though it's turning away, Lynn has the room to smack it over long-on. And then the gymnasium and those arms take over. Give the ball wings. Sails over
Axar to Chris Lynn, SIX, gosh. Nothing to add. Makes room to a length that has been slightly shortened and Nadals it over long-off. And he says he's not 100 percent..
Mohit Sharma to Woakes, SIX, back of a length delivery, slower again and Woakes is out of his crease, weighed on front foot to whack this out. And he does. Over deep mid-wicket. 22 off 8
Matt Henry to Chris Lynn, SIX, and now a full toss to cap off the misery. Swings across the line and sends it over the deep square leg fence. Went high and handsome
de Grandhomme to Maxwell, SIX, right in the slot. And Maxwell goes into the beast mode. Swings, hard and mighty. Muscles it over long-on
de Grandhomme to Maxwell, SIX, more of the freebies. A sitter up on the hips and Maxwell couldn't be happier in swishing it around the corner. With all the meat in the timing

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, into the clouds. Too good for the multi-pixel cameras to pick this one from the clouds as well. Too short this from Yadav, all the time for Maxwell to rock back, inherit the line and plunder it away. Hacked away to clear the deep mid-wicket fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, even longer. Maxwell turning it on here. A scarred ball this - flat, dragged down and real quick. Just the pace required to go for another muscling swat into the favoured cow corner region

Kuldeep Yadav to Saha, SIX, gets the slog right. Invites him with an airy googly does Kuldeep and Saha throws everything he has into it. Slices it up, slices it high and slices the projectile long enough to take it over long-on

Faulkner to Pat Cummins, SIX, in the air and out she goes! It was an off-pace delivery wide of off at 129kph, Cummins clears his front leg and launches it into the cow corner fence. It came off the sweet spot

Faulkner to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, highest IPL score for Shreyas Iyer! For a moment, it looked like he would hole out to long-off. Length ball, Iyer walks down the track and lifts it over long-off. It came off the bottom part of the bat, but had enough wings to clear the rope by a long way
Basil Thampi to Nair, SIX, all the way. That's a consequence of going through with his shot. Didn't hold back at all. Fullish around off, Nair has the swinging room he desires and launches into it

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's miscued .. and six. He didn't get that like he wanted at all. A big mow from Iyer, the ball grips and catches him on the outside half of the bat and it goes all the way. Ridiculous. Finch, at long on, is left bemused

Shami to Karthik, SIX, fabulous shot! Just the extension of the arms and off she went. Good length ball just outside off, Karthik maintains a good base and lofts it straight back over the bowler's head. All the way

Zaheer to Finch, SIX, just over a leaping Samson. The famous Zaheer knuckle ball on a shortish length, not sure if Finch spotted it early, went for the pull and the short boundaries helped his cause, over deep square leg for a maximum

Brathwaite to Finch, SIX, fifty for Finch. He's blown hot and cold this season. Still getting used to the new batting position. Almost a similar delivery that got DK out, but Finch was able to get under that and tonk it over the long-on fence
Shami to Ishan Kishan, SIX, finally he gets one where he wanted. Down the leg-side and full, Ishan Kishan whips over the fine leg fence. Only just clears the fence
Mishra to Finch, SIX, touch short and Finch sees it early. Camps back and dispatches it to the deep mid-wicket fence. 89 metre hit this

Mishra to Finch, SIX, and now Mishra flights. Overdoes it and gives some room as well. Finch cracks it over the long-off fence. Mishra's wrist looked as if he attempted the googly but it went away from Finch there
Harbhajan to Saha, SIX, 'what a way to bring up the fifty,' shouts D Morrison on air. Saha skips down and lofts Harbhajan with the turn over long-on for a maximum
Harbhajan to Shaun Marsh, SIX, Shaun Marsh skips a bit, dos not need to dance down. Gets a fullish ball and goes with the swing to dispatch it over the long-on fence. Big hit this one
Malinga to Saha, SIX, Saha is justifying the move to send him up the order. How quickly did he read the slower ball from Malinga and lofted it over long-off. Goes the distance

McClenaghan to Shaun Marsh, no ball, SIX, these cute Aussie-Kiwi battles. McClenaghan oversteps and then bowls a slower ball, which gets read by Shaun Marsh. Clears the front leg and sends it soaring over the deep mid-wicket fence
Hardik Pandya to Saha, SIX, full toss. Saha loves that. Clears the front leg and muscles it over the deep square leg fence
Hardik Pandya to Axar, SIX, full toss in Axar's arc and out of the park. Takes his right leg out of the line and sends it over the long-on fence

Malinga to Guptill, no ball, SIX, that's a big bonus for KXIP, it's a maximum and it's a big no-ball as well. On a good length and just outside off, Guptill takes a step forward and carves it high and over cover, went a long way into the stand
Karn Sharma to Maxwell, SIX, lovely shot, tossed up invitingly by Karn, Maxwell gets a big stride forward and lifts it through the line, long-on is just a spectator

Karn Sharma to Maxwell, SIX, Maxwell is in a beastly mood tonight, lovely leg-break from Karn, slower and wider outside off, nearly did Maxwell in with the length. He had to lean forward, goes inside out and carves it over extra-cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Harbhajan to Maxwell, SIX, Harbhajan is greeted with a maximum, dropped it short and on the stumps, Maxwell rocks back and pulls it over square leg, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

Harbhajan to Maxwell, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Maxwell, pushed through flatter and just outside off, Maxwell gets forward and thumps it flat and hard over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum
Harbhajan to Maxwell, SIX, third six of the over, this was tossed up wider of off, Maxwell gets forward and thumps it high and way over long-on for a maximum
Rahul Tewatia to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Pandya doesn't bother wasting any time. Sees a tossed up delivery in his arc, flexes his muscle and tonks it straight over the bowler's head
Rahul Tewatia to Pollard, SIX, Pollard joins into the act. Tewatia drifted it wide of off but Pollard managed to reach with his long levers and launches it straight down the ground

Axar to Hardik Pandya, SIX, spoils the over by conceding a six off the last ball. Lands it full in the arc for Pandya, he clears his front leg and smacks it over long-on. The fielder seemed in business for a while but it sailed over his head for a maximum

Matt Henry to Pollard, SIX, this has gone some 10 rows back. Such is his power. Full and just outside off, Pollard stands motionless and wallops it over long-on. Not off the middle but still soars over the ropes
Matt Henry to Pollard, SIX, two in a row. Henry goes short, Pollard is upto it in a flash. Spindles back and pulls it behind square. Goes all the way for a maximum

Matt Henry to Hardik Pandya, SIX, a behemoth, gosh. Third six off the over. Henry bowls it full and outside off, Pandya bends his knee and lofts it handsomely over extra cover. All grace, elegance and class. Go watch a smooth wave caress the shore, this is that
Matt Henry to Hardik Pandya, SIX, shambles, follows up with a full toss, Pandya ain't sparing those. Gets under it and murders it over long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, SIX, what a shot. If you miss your length, Pollard will make you pay. Full and zooming on the stumps, Pollard gets underneath it and blasts it over long-on

Mohit Sharma to Karn Sharma, SIX, what a clanger. Maxwell, what have you done? Knuckle ball from Mohit, on a fuller length outside off, Karn tonks it straight down the ground, Maxwell prances to his left from long-off, gets both hands but palms it over the ropes. Clumsy!
Mohit Sharma to Pollard, SIX, wow. Pollard is still keeping Mumbai in the hunt. Pivots back and swats this short ball over deep mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Simmons, SIX, another Sharma. Another dispatch. Right in the slot. A shimmy across from Simmons to top it up with a full-blooded tonk. Several rows into the long-on stands
Mohit Sharma to Simmons, SIX, he's toying around here. The mind-reader reads the slower one and the fullish length on the stumps. Deals with a backing away and a sinking lofted power over the covers

Axar to Simmons, SIX, there are some ways to bring up a half-century and there is this way. A gallop down the track, right forward and swings his bat massively to deposit this well into the stands down the ground. His #11 I'm told
Axar to Simmons, SIX, and he celebrates with some more. More of the charges down, more of the swings through the line. The zone of having fun here

SN Thakur to Samuels, SIX, top-edge and six, too predictable from Shardul, banged in short and well outside off, Samuels was swiveling across on the pull - was in no control, the top-edge went high and behind square on the on-side, just has enough to clear Unadkat at deep backward square leg

SN Thakur to Samuels, SIX, cracking shot, much better from Samuels, length delivery from Shardul, Samuels backs away, opens up his arms and lofts it high and into the sight-screen. DD are off and running once again
Stokes to Pat Cummins, SIX, much needed for the Daredevils, length ball on offer from Stokes, Cummins backs away and clubs it over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes at mid-wicket for a maximum

Unadkat to Mishra, SIX, cracking shot, back of a length and just outside off, Mishra was prodding forward, uses the bottom hand and smashes it high and over long-off, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Washington Sundar to Pant, SIX, phew! That's been nailed for six. Short delivery from round the wicket. Pant rocks on the back foot quicker and dispatches it with a pull over deep square leg fence. Pure power that from Pant
Zampa to Pant, SIX, wrong 'un from Zampa and how well did Pant read that. Goes on his knee and slog sweeps it to send it deep into the mid-wicket stands. That's a huge hit

Samuels to Stokes, SIX, he's starting to turn it on now. That's not in the slot, let me tell you. And he hasn't used his feet either. Just plants the front foot down with authority and swings through the line over long-on. Brutal batting
Shami to Stokes, SIX, he has flogged it off his pads for a six over mid-wicket. All muscle from Stokes. I don't think he's got that in the middle at all, but it still clears the boundary comfortably

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, they needed that. They definitely needed that. A nothing ball from Cummins, gaining no height on the short of length delivery. It sits up for Tiwary and he pulls it away into the stands backward of square

Pat Cummins to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, oh boy, do we have something special on tonight?! Back to back sixes. This one is a sizzler over extra-cover. Another poor delivery from Cummins, bowling it full in the slot around off. Tiwary clears his front leg and smokes a stunning drive inside out
Nadeem to Smith, SIX, tossed up ball and Smith makes full use of that. Skips down and goes with the loft. Never intended to hit that hard, clears the long-off fence with ease
Mishra to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, against the turn and run of play. Leg-spinner and Manoj Tiwary steps down, keeps himself away from the pitch of the ball, swings hard and sends it over cow corner

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, SIX, picks the slower delivery and deposits the pull over the deep backward square leg fielder. Not that short, but with a half-swivel Ishan Kishan pulled that meatily and got himself a biggie

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, SIX, "he is a puller" says the great Sanjay M on air. I have to agree with that. Anything near his range and he instinctively goes for the pull, a top edge on this but it went all the way and even if there was a fielder, it was going over his head. On the swivel and then got it away

Nabi to Dwayne Smith, SIX, slightly slower and on the stumps, Dwayne Smith plays his favorite slog to leg, connects cleanly and it goes all the way over mid-wicket. Can't give him the room to swing his arms

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, SIX, given as six. Just landed on the ad-cushions. A top edge on the short-arm jab and Dhawan was running towards it with his left-hand stretched, attempting to catch it. But it went away from him and landed flush on the cushion

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, maiden fifty for Ishan Kishan. Raina stands and applauds. Picks the wrong-un and pulls, it was catchable for Nabi at the deep mid-wicket fence, but he was mindful of the ropes behind him, goes reverse-cup and can't catch it. Can't push it back either. Rashid Khan doesn't like that effort from his countryman
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, SIX, that is the flattest hit for six. Rocks back and muscles the pull, over mid-wicket, picked the shortish delivery and was onto it in a flash. Sailed into the crowd

Siraj to Ishan Kishan, SIX, picks the slower delivery and deposits the pull over the deep backward square leg fielder. Not that short, but with a half-swivel Ishan Kishan pulled that meatily and got himself a biggie

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, SIX, "he is a puller" says the great Sanjay M on air. I have to agree with that. Anything near his range and he instinctively goes for the pull, a top edge on this but it went all the way and even if there was a fielder, it was going over his head. On the swivel and then got it away

Nabi to Dwayne Smith, SIX, slightly slower and on the stumps, Dwayne Smith plays his favorite slog to leg, connects cleanly and it goes all the way over mid-wicket. Can't give him the room to swing his arms

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, SIX, given as six. Just landed on the ad-cushions. A top edge on the short-arm jab and Dhawan was running towards it with his left-hand stretched, attempting to catch it. But it went away from him and landed flush on the cushion

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, maiden fifty for Ishan Kishan. Raina stands and applauds. Picks the wrong-un and pulls, it was catchable for Nabi at the deep mid-wicket fence, but he was mindful of the ropes behind him, goes reverse-cup and can't catch it. Can't push it back either. Rashid Khan doesn't like that effort from his countryman
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Smith, SIX, that is the flattest hit for six. Rocks back and muscles the pull, over mid-wicket, picked the shortish delivery and was onto it in a flash. Sailed into the crowd

Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, SIX, pulls and pulls well. With a swivel, picks the slowish short ball and hammers it hard and high into the deep backward square stands. Sheldon Jackson in the dugout loved that
Southee to Chris Lynn, SIX, Lynnsanity has started! Stand and deliver from the Queenslander. Right in the swinging arc for him and he lofts cleanly, high and over long-on

Southee to Chris Lynn, SIX, No.2 for Chris Lynn. Picks the slower delivery and out comes the big blade, not a big six, but this will do. No-one at cow corner and he finds the fence. Suddenly Southee is under pressure

Johnson to Gambhir, SIX, Gambhir's balance was shot when he lofted that. His head was falling away to the off-side, but the followthrough of the bat and the timing on that was special. Went all the way over long-on. Just cleared the fence. Gambhir picked the off-pace delivery well

Vinay Kumar to Y Pathan, SIX, almost two in two for Vinay Kumar. First ball for Yusuf and he slogs, without even looking. A big top edge and Mitch Johnson running around at third man tried his best - went with both hands on the leap, but the ball had enough to evade him. Vinay Kumar can't believe that

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, SIX, look at Pathan chew on his gum. Would've made Sir Viv proud. It was a tossed up leggie on the stumps, Pathan used his long levers to heave that to the deep mid-wicket fence. Then came the swagger with a chat to his partner to accompany it

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, SIX, he has decided to play his shots. No matter what. This is bowled wide of off, but Pathan uses his reach and smashes it flat back over the bowler's head. Consecutive sixes and Karn Sharma is left feeling a bit sorry
U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, the sound. The crunch. Could only mean one thing. Too shrot, angling in and pulls it off one leg. Into the fence over square leg she flies

Boult to Rayudu, SIX, some way to get to a half-ton. A pitched up freebie on the pads and Rayudu waits on it to swish across the line. Doesn't even bother keeping it down. Flies into long leg. All very nonchalantly

Boult to Pollard, SIX, a mistime. That's what it was. And it is a crowd catch. The brute that this man is. Gets a pounder on a back of a length climbing up much more than Pollard would have liked but he doesn't bother adjusting. Mows across the line, gets it high on the bat and it the cow corner fence takes the brunt

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, another charge, another bat swing, another boundary. Gets really close this time and has it in him to go straight down again. All in the air this time. All the way this time too
U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, that envious swing of blade from Rohit. Once he picks the length, no ground is big enough. Saw the length ball and clubbed it over the long-on fence

Unadkat to Saha, SIX, cracking shot, length ball on Saha's pads, he picked up the length and swung through the line, got plenty of height and for a moment - Tripathi at deep square leg was an interested party. But the wind comes into Saha's aid and the ball kept going - clears him by a distance
Zampa to Axar, SIX, poor ball from Zampa, drops one short and on the stumps, Axar rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket, has just enough to clear the ropes on the full
Maxwell to Rahane, SIX, Rahane skips down and chips over the wide long-on fence. It is all over! Pune are through, winning by 9 wickets. Rahane gets some runs, finally

Rahul Tewatia to Tripathi, SIX, bye, bye ball. Margin of error against this man is so less. Rahul Tewatia dares to flight a bit and gets slogged over the deep mid-wicket fence. Well into the crowd with the wind
Head to Pat Cummins, SIX, floated slightly and Pat Cummins slogs across the line. Connects well and sends over the deep mid-wicket fence

Harshal Patel to Pant, SIX, he is running out of partners but that does not bother him. Finally a delivery that is 141kph and on a length. Pant gets across slightly to cover the angle as it was bowled round the wicket. Whips the pull over the square leg fence
Negi to Mishra, SIX, he won Delhi the last game by cracking back to back fours. Steps down this time and lofts with a straight bat to clear the long-on fence

Avesh Khan to Shami, SIX, Shami has not given up, not just yet. A pitched up ball around off, clears the front leg and and cracks hard. Kohli at long-on gets fingertips to that. Not good enough to parry it back. Avesh Khan is down again. But wants to continue after having a word with the skipper
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, Chahal gives it little more air this time. Shreyas Iyer jumps out of his crease quickly and thumbs it over long-on for a maximum. First one of the innings
Head to Pant, SIX, Pant gets into the act now. Goes inside out over cover. Gets a good connection and the ball has enough legs to sail over the leaping long-off fielder for a maximum

Shami to Gayle, SIX, Gayle will play freely tonight, this was full and wide of off, Gayle threw the kitchen sink at that, gets a thick outside edge that went high and over third man, first six of the night

Mishra to Gayle, SIX, a Gayle special. Mishra darts the quicker front of the hand stuff. And he darts it half way down the pitch as well. All the time for Gayle to rock back and swat him away. High and mighty

Mishra to Kohli, SIX, more of the juicy Mishraji half-trackers. More of the dispatches. This time it is off Kohli. Stays behind with the weight going backwards and a short arm jab in the air. Into his favoured cow corner region
Zaheer to Kohli, SIX, a clear case of a missed yorker. Ends up becoming a juicy full toss and Kohli stands and swishes across the line. Several rows into his favoured mid-wicket stands
Zaheer to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, Jadhav joins the act. Gets one right in the slot and he isn't in a mood to spare these. Swings his bat down and plunders it down the ground. A crowd catch

Shami to Gayle, SIX, massive, too short from Shami and Gayle often doesn't let them go unpunished. This was the slower short ball from Shami, Gayle spotted it early, stayed back and pulled it over mid-wicket, went a long way into the stands

Corey Anderson to Kohli, SIX, lovely shot, a simple extension of his arms and Kohli has sent it sailing over extra-cover. One of the shots of the tourney, on a good length and just outside off, Kohli leans forward, plays a check-push and sends the ball soaring over the infield

Washington Sundar to Parthiv Patel, SIX, there's a man at deep square, but he is just left ball-watching. Floated up into the pads, PP uses those lovely wrists to send the flick aerial over square leg. Sheer timing. Nothing else
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, SIX, PP starting from where he left off. Short ball, angled into the body, his head stays still as he pulls this handsomely into the crowd. Sight to watch

SN Thakur to Malinga, SIX, Dhoni carves a final spot for Pune in IPL 2017. What a 'Sundar' performance. It means beautiful in Hindi.. Anyway, assuming you have let that pass, let's get back to cricket: Malinga finishes by swatting a six over deep mid-wicket, where the fielder almost has it but then dives over the ropes. Nothing matters. Cricket doesn't allow 27 runs to be scored off one ball. Sane cricket, so to say

Lockie Ferguson to Parthiv Patel, SIX, the pocket rocket of Mumbai Indians is trying to squeeze maximum off the powerplay. No hanging back. Swivels into a perfect position as he pulls a leg-side filth flat into the stands
Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's the way he plays. Swagger. Saw the revs and lined himself up for the biggie, clean connection and bam it goes over long-off

Karn Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, Mahendra Singh Dhoni is underway. Probably the slider down leg, Dhoni waltzes down, gets to the pitch and wallops it wide and over the long-on rope for a maximum. Tremendous bottom hand power

McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, Tiwary takes full toll of the free hit. Length ball right in the slot for Tiwary to clear his front leg and tonk it over long-on. If Pollard can't do anything about it, there's nothing anyone else could have done. Good start to the over for RPS
McClenaghan to Dhoni, SIX, brings up the 50-run stand in style. Helped by a mediocre delivery of course. You don't bowl length to this guy. Dhoni waits on the back foot and biffs it high and over

McClenaghan to Dhoni, SIX, it's high and it is handsome as well. Not quite off the middle but Dhoni will collect another six. 26 runs off the over. Third time this season, McClenaghan has given more than 20 runs. Fullish ball outside off, Dhoni goes hard on his lofted off-drive. Rohit tried his best at long-off, but can't do much. He falls outside the boundary rope
Bumrah to Dhoni, SIX, that's a special shot! Back of a length delivery, Dhoni opened up the off-side by backing away. He generates massive power and biffs it over cover for a maximum

Bumrah to Dhoni, SIX, wow! Just wow! You can't do much when Dhoni is in such mood. Seam-up delivery from a goodish length, Dhoni decides to go downtown. Moves slightly off-side and bludgeons it over long-off for a gigantic hit

Karn Sharma to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, comes down the track and lofts the ball over long-on. That is a much needed tonic to this innings which was starting to go nowhere. A slight movement down the ground and then the smacking hit
Hardik Pandya to Rahane, SIX, Rahane comes down on it like a house on fire and dismantles the ball over long-off for a maximum
Narine to Warner, SIX, that's a massive shot! No doubt, it's Warner. Slightly short, Warner sees it and is quick to jump back in his crease. Pummels the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

Chawla to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this guy can hit it a long way. Yep, Vijay Shankar is turning it on here at the Chinnaswamy. Once again, too full from Piyush Chawla, Shankar clears his left leg and deposits it over long-on with a mighty lofted on-drive

Boult to Naman Ojha, SIX, he was clueless against Narine. This is a confidence booster for Ojha. Slower ball right in the slot for Ojha to swing his bat hard. Moves slightly off-side and lifts it handsomely over long-on
Chawla to Warner, SIX, Warner has mixed all his frustration and power on that shot. Attempted googly, lands too short for Warner's liking, he rocks back and fires it into the stands over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, SIX, sure that time-out has helped KW. Settling into his groove now. Gets into position early and dispatches a short ball flat into the backward square stands
Narine to Warner, SIX, that's a massive shot! No doubt, it's Warner. Slightly short, Warner sees it and is quick to jump back in his crease. Pummels the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

Chawla to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this guy can hit it a long way. Yep, Vijay Shankar is turning it on here at the Chinnaswamy. Once again, too full from Piyush Chawla, Shankar clears his left leg and deposits it over long-on with a mighty lofted on-drive

Boult to Naman Ojha, SIX, he was clueless against Narine. This is a confidence booster for Ojha. Slower ball right in the slot for Ojha to swing his bat hard. Moves slightly off-side and lifts it handsomely over long-on
Chawla to Warner, SIX, Warner has mixed all his frustration and power on that shot. Attempted googly, lands too short for Warner's liking, he rocks back and fires it into the stands over mid-wicket
Coulter-Nile to Williamson, SIX, sure that time-out has helped KW. Settling into his groove now. Gets into position early and dispatches a short ball flat into the backward square stands

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, here's the start. On the pedal. A wrong radar stuff this..down leg. Compounds the misery further with he front leg planted inside the line and then it is business as usual. The flattest of airy-sweeps you'd ever come across

Johnson to Coulter-Nile, SIX, here's the first of his dispatches. Where were you hiding Coulter-Nile? Gets a friendly length ball - yes. But times the leather off it with a swivelling hack. Right off the screws and right into the crowd over mid-wicket
Malinga to Narine, SIX, there you go. Picks it off his pads and just hoicks it away with disdain. Waits in the crease and swings his bat at the right time, poppin' the ball over deep square leg

Krunal Pandya to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, here's the start. On the pedal. A wrong radar stuff this..down leg. Compounds the misery further with he front leg planted inside the line and then it is business as usual. The flattest of airy-sweeps you'd ever come across

Johnson to Coulter-Nile, SIX, here's the first of his dispatches. Where were you hiding Coulter-Nile? Gets a friendly length ball - yes. But times the leather off it with a swivelling hack. Right off the screws and right into the crowd over mid-wicket
Malinga to Narine, SIX, there you go. Picks it off his pads and just hoicks it away with disdain. Waits in the crease and swings his bat at the right time, poppin' the ball over deep square leg

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, wowww! What a start. This is the very venue where Pollard grabbed eyeballs during a champions league T20 game against New South Wales back in 2009. Looks like he's going to counterattack. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Pollard muscles it high over long-off

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, what a hit from the younger Pandya. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Hardik doesn't try to over-hit the ball, just lofts inside out over long-off and timed it sweetly enough to clear the rope

Christian to Johnson, SIX, that has been flat-batted with a lot of sinewy power! The short ball angled across and Johnson thwarted it down the ground despite not connecting it with the meat of the bat

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, SIX, the slower ball disappears now! He held his stroke back a bit, the ball chalked the toe-end of the bat and landed well over the cow-corner for a towering, welcoming six for MI

Christian to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya is tonking them big now. That was a length ball, full and wide, Krunal Pandya smacks it down the ground with one knee on the ground. That sailed over long-on pretty easily

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, wowww! What a start. This is the very venue where Pollard grabbed eyeballs during a champions league T20 game against New South Wales back in 2009. Looks like he's going to counterattack. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Pollard muscles it high over long-off

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, what a hit from the younger Pandya. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Hardik doesn't try to over-hit the ball, just lofts inside out over long-off and timed it sweetly enough to clear the rope

Christian to Johnson, SIX, that has been flat-batted with a lot of sinewy power! The short ball angled across and Johnson thwarted it down the ground despite not connecting it with the meat of the bat

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, SIX, the slower ball disappears now! He held his stroke back a bit, the ball chalked the toe-end of the bat and landed well over the cow-corner for a towering, welcoming six for MI
