Christian to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya is tonking them big now. That was a length ball, full and wide, Krunal Pandya smacks it down the ground with one knee on the ground. That sailed over long-on pretty easily
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, has he got enough on it? Jusssst. Shimmied down and swung hard, got it close to the bottom of the bat but the muscle behind it was good enough

Markande to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, good start this from Bravo. He picked the previous two deliveries and now he gets his dancing shoes on to get to the pitch of the ball. It's followed by his trademark flourish to launch it over long-on

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, stunning shot over extra-cover from Bravo. For once, Bumrah offers a length which the batsman can get under, and Bravo - leaning back - smokes it inside-out. How did he manage to generate that power! Hits flush on the cushions
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, full ball on middle, Bravo gets his front leg out of the way and belts it over long-off. Not a clean contact, but this isn't the biggest ground
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, back-to-back sixes! Sublime wrists from Bravo as he whips it off the pads and sends it sailing into the deep mid-wicket stands

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, this is awesome. This is so awesome. Bumrah - one of best T20 bowlers going around - has been effortlessly creamed into the long-off stands. Fifty off just 25 balls for Bravo. Now this should set the cat among the pigeons

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, Hardik Pandya slaps the seat in frustration as he sits in the dugout. Another six. This game has come alive out of nowhere. Bumrah goes round the wicket, bowls a full toss on the pads and is whipped over mid-wicket
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, Wankhede is coming unglued here. The stadium is rocking for Bravo. Low full toss, he's heaved it over deep mid-wicket, just over the fielder

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, he's scooped this for six, he's scooped this for six. Kedar Jadhav.... Oh my. Imran Tahir drops his bat and runs across to hug Jadhav. There's another run to go, but he doesn't care. Good length cutter angled across off, Jadhav bends over - bad hamstring and all - and finds the leverage to lift it over short fine leg. Chennai players are clapping violently

Hardik Pandya to Watson, SIX, glorious shot! And that's gone all the way. Wow. Fuller ball and Pandya got it swing away in the air. Doesn't bother Watson, who walked forward, crouched low and elevated it over extra cover. Off the meat of the bat
Tahir to Ishan Kishan, SIX, clears his front leg and whacks Tahir over long-on. The fielder there seemed interested for a fleeting moment, but Ishan Kishan got a decent piece of it
Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya second guessed Mark Wood there. Waits for the slower short ball and marmalizes it into the mid-wicket stands with zero tolerance...

Mark Wood to Krunal Pandya, SIX, a poor outing for Mark Wood on his IPL debut. Was too predictable on most occasions. Krunal Pandya prepares himself for a short delivery and swings the pull with full flow into the square leg stands

Watson to Rohit, SIX, lovely, this should give plenty of confidence for Rohit, on a good length and well wide of off, Rohit reaches out, plays with an open face and slices it high and over cover, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, beautifully played, too full and too straight from Watson, ends up drifting onto Suryakumar's pads, he prods across, picks up the length and flicks it stylishly over mid-wicket, has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Andrew Tye to Pant, SIX, oh ho ho! Middles this like a dream! That sound off the blade, wow! Back of a length, sits up nicely for Pant who smokes it deep into the stands at mid-wicket. It was just a bit of a short arm jab, such power from the young man

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, H-U-G-E! When this man connects well, the ball is going to fly deep into the stands. Slower ball on a good length, Morris preempted the charge down the track and had a clean golf-like swing. Way into the crowd at long-on. Much-needed one for DD

Andrew Tye to Christian, SIX, smacked away! Takes full toll of the extra delivery, does Christian. Full and in the slot for him, he just hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. DD needed that badly, they certainly did

Axar to Gambhir, SIX, wow. Just wow. This is sheer timing. Also shows you how good the pitch is. Makes some early room down leg and just chips it. Carries well over the long-off boundary. See it to believe it
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a shot with wings. Lands deep into the crowd. Time for Shreyas Iyer to use his feet. Ingests the flight and burps out an 85-meter six over Axar's head

Andrew Tye to Pant, SIX, oh ho ho! Middles this like a dream! That sound off the blade, wow! Back of a length, sits up nicely for Pant who smokes it deep into the stands at mid-wicket. It was just a bit of a short arm jab, such power from the young man

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, H-U-G-E! When this man connects well, the ball is going to fly deep into the stands. Slower ball on a good length, Morris preempted the charge down the track and had a clean golf-like swing. Way into the crowd at long-on. Much-needed one for DD

Andrew Tye to Christian, SIX, smacked away! Takes full toll of the extra delivery, does Christian. Full and in the slot for him, he just hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. DD needed that badly, they certainly did

Axar to Gambhir, SIX, wow. Just wow. This is sheer timing. Also shows you how good the pitch is. Makes some early room down leg and just chips it. Carries well over the long-off boundary. See it to believe it
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a shot with wings. Lands deep into the crowd. Time for Shreyas Iyer to use his feet. Ingests the flight and burps out an 85-meter six over Axar's head

Chahal to Narine, SIX, a maximum! Even better than the first one. Loopy delivery around off, Narine goes down and slogs it over mid-wicket. Half a dozen more as it just clears the fence. Was a flat one!
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Nitish Rana, gee he is some talent! Shimmies down, gets to the pitch of the ball and sends the cherry soaring straight over the sightscreen. Thwackkk
U Yadav to A Russell, SIX, conceded 12 runs in his first 3 overs and now 15. T20 things! A candyfloss on middle and leg-stump, Russell muscles it many-a-mile over wide long-on for a maximum

Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, excellent shot to end the over. He can do this, doesn't matter if Lynn is back to the pavilion. Gets sight of the loopy delivery, sets under it and smokes it right over the bowler's head. In fact a tad to his left, but it's a clean strike. Long-on is a mere spectator

Woakes to Narine, SIX, raining sixes already, we are already in the fourth over. This is the third six of the innings. It's a slower delivery by Woakes, Narine waits for it calmly and bludgeons it right over long-on. Off to a flier is Sunil

Woakes to Narine, SIX, 20 runs off the over! This is boom boom Sunil Narine. Gets hold of the slower delivery yet again, it's slower in pace too. Plenty of time for the entertainer to camp back and clobber it over mid-wicket. The crowd has gone berserk

Washington Sundar to Narine, SIX, toying with the bowler, toying with his lines, toying with his lengths. This is a full toss and Narine simply dances down the wicket and wallops it over long-off. Six more! Can't hear anything, the crowd is loving it and so is Narine

Washington Sundar to Narine, SIX, that's caught, but the fielder has touched the fence in the momentum. Narine whipped this gift to mid-wicket where Mandeep caught it but at the same time was in contact with the cushions. Needs only one more to complete a fifty

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, SIX, crack made the sound, there! Shortish in length, Rana has had enough of those. Rocks back and pulls this nicely into the night sky, high and handsome, over mid-wicket for a biggie

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, SIX, top edgeeee, but fine leg is inside the ring. Wouldn't have mattered though because it cleared the rope. Shortish from Vinay Kumar, McCullum goes for the pull and gets a thick edge, the bat swing is hard enough for the ball to have enough legs

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, SIX, dances down the pitch and threatens the cameraman on one of those tiers. Flighted delivery on the stumps, de Villiers got to the pitch of the ball and launches that over long-on. AB de Villiers has nicely warmed up

Narine to de Villiers, SIX, this is what he does so well. Those small movements in the crease before the bowler delivers and that puts many bowlers off. This time he backed away and Narine followed him, de Villiers swept that high in the air and all the way over deep backward square leg
Johnson to de Villiers, SIX, launcheddddd! AB in this form... wow. Fullish off-cutter outside off, de Villiers sizes it up and biffs it over mid-off. Sails into the stands

Chawla to Kohli, SIX, those wrists have carried this all the way for six. Magnificent timing. He wasn't to the pitch of it even after stepping out, but still went through with the flick over mid-wicket. Plenty of height on it, and enough distance too
Nitish Rana to de Villiers, SIX, oh don't do that. Never do that. A half-tracker to de Villiers who chews it up and spits it over mid-wicket
Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, SIX, full in the slot, Mandeep gets in position by clearing his front leg and then wallops it over wide long-on with a clean swing. Ordinary delivery from Vinay

Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, SIX, six more. 16 off the first 3 balls. Mandeep is taking serious toll of what is some very ordinary death bowling. Short of length delivery, neither here nor there. Mandeep camps back and bludgeons the pull away
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, advances and lofts the ball, the timing is good enough and the ball clears the long-on fence quite comfortably. It was the googly from Chawla but McCullum read it

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, SIX, that's not a bad ball at all from Kuldeep Yadav. Not easy to time the away spinning ball. So Kuldeep Yadav bowls one full googly outside off stump, de Villiers goes for the loft over cover, slices it but the timing it good enough to clear the fence

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan has not been at his best so far today, but this is a shot of highest class. Kulkarni pounds it short for the nth time - well outside off. Dhawan hops across and upper-cuts. Gets enough bat to send it sailing over the third man fielder
Unadkat to Williamson, SIX, wow. Dispatched with authority. Supreme pull shot from the Kiwi skipper. Spots the short ball early, camps back and pulls it witheringly into the deep square leg stands
Vinay Kumar to Watson, SIX, this is a fine shot! In the slot on middle and leg, a length delivery and Watson stays put and towers it over long-on for half a dozen, first biggie of the innings
Chawla to Watson, SIX, Watto is in the house fellas! Gets down on his knee and clubs the floater over mid-wicket, clean as a whistle and it's a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, SIX, that's what he was trying at the start of the over. Raina remains the key to this chase. Floated up outside off, Raina with a stride forward lofts it handsomely inside out over extra cover, just about manages to clear the rope

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, outta here! This is what the Chepauk crowd have been waiting for more than two years - Dhoni at his best. Tossed up on leg-stump, Dhoni cleared his front leg to give himself a free swing of the arms, sends the ball sailing over the deep mid-wicket fence

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, fabulous shot! To get such power behind that shot is incredible. Curran missed his yorker length by an inch or so, Billings stayed on leg-stump and went through with the inside out loft, cleared the fence quite comfortably. Nice hands!

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, and he ends it with a maximum. Another big over for CSK, 17 off it. Curran fires in a full toss around the hip, Billings was moving around in the crease, stands still at the point of contact and heaves it flat over deep backward square

A Russell to Billings, SIX, geez! Some skill that. He waited and waited, moved right across his stumps when Russell was about to deliver, crouched low and scooped the low full toss all the way over fine leg. The crowd find their voice again

A Russell to Billings, SIX, this is spectacular. It was the off-cutter on back of a length, Billings had moved away to the leg-side and was almost cramped for room, extended his arms and lofted it over long-on. It was more of a punch from the Englishman. Reminded me of the Kohli shot against Chris Woakes

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, Billings is playing a gem here. He is getting the big hit at the right moment. The slower delivery and Billings was waiting for it with a crouched stance, gets underneath it and nails the pull over deep square leg

Vinay Kumar to Dwayne Bravo, no ball, SIX, terrible terrible start from Vinay Kumar. KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan affords a smile. A high full toss well above the waist, Bravo somehow managed to swing it away off the top-edge and over fine leg. What a start to the over!

Vinay Kumar to Jadeja, SIX, the roof has come down at Chepauk. Jadeja seals the win with a mighty six. Did I say he's not connecting 'em well? He's just nailed this one. The slower delivery, off-cutter from Vinay, right in the arc for Jadeja, who waits before teeing off, full swing of the arms and the ball sails over the long-on fence

Chawla to Rayudu, SIX, excellent use of the feet by Rayudu. Tossed up delivery on middle and Rayudu shimmies down the wicket to pump it over the bowler's head for a biggie, that came right off the meat and met the sightscreen on the full

Chawla to Rayudu, SIX, carnage continues! The crowd is loving this. Flighted delivery around off, Rayudu stands tall and chips it with ease right over covers, half a dozen more. These two are looking unstoppable
Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, this is entertainment. Full length delivery around off, Watson keeps his head still and powers it over long-off for six more, the bowler is under pressure, straightaway

Chahar to Narine, SIX, Narine is off the mark with a six. I'm not surprised. Swings his bat hard and takes on the man at long-on. The fielder is made to look like a spectator. It was a length ball, Narine stood tall and thumped it well over the fielder. Hello Chennai

Chahar to Narine, SIX, wow! Six more and that's 18 off the opening over. Slightly fuller and got it to swing in a tad did Chahar. But, that doesn't bother Narine. He slightly backs away and clobbers it over cow corner

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, clubbed, length ball from Bravo and Russell sends it into the long-on stands. Gets a big stride forward, didn't get hold of the shot, but his power takes the ball miles over the man at long-on

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, that's a bad mishit and it has still gone deep into the stands at long-off. On a good length and well outside off, this was the kuckle ball from Thakur, Russell was looking to smash it over long-on, ended up slicing it high and way over long-off for a maximum

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes, Russell is on a roll now, low full-toss from Thakur, he missed out on the yorker, but Russell didn't, clears his left leg and clouts it high and over long-on

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, massive and that has gone out of Chepauk. This ball will not come back, Bravo missed his yorker by an inch, turned out to be a perfect length ball, Russell cleared his left leg and swings it high and over long-on. 105m is the distance

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, this is turning out to be a serious hammering from Russell, this was a slower full-toss, Russell bends down low and then heaves it high and over wide long-on for another maximum

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, SIX, cracking shot, huge over for KKR, this was another slower ball and DK picked the bones off it. Gets well forward, uses his wrists to good effect and whips it high and wide of long-on. More problems for MS and CSK

Watson to A Russell, SIX, just over Rayudu at deep cover and that's fifty for Russell, could Rayudu been further back, would have had a better chance at catching it. This was full and well outside off, Russell got down on one knee and sliced it powerfully over cover. Rayudu ran across from the deep, puts in the leap and only palmed it over the ropes

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, the sixes keep flowing from the bat of Russell, length ball on his pads, he was backing away and flicks it nonchalantly over mid-wicket, sails over the head of the man in the deep

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes, Bravo is getting a real pasting in Chepauk. This was the slower ball and Russell spotted it early, gets down low and smashes it high and way over long-on, gets to his highest score in IPL
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, a hat-trick of sixes for Russell, length ball on the stumps, Russell backs away, clears his front leg and heaves it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, Russell is having a party at the Chepauk, on a good length and well wide of off, he bends down low and drills it high and over cover for another maximum, his 10th six of the innings

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, smacked, 11th six for Russell and KKR finish with 202 on the board. A slower length ball outside off, Russell bends down low and smashes it high and over long-off for a maximum

Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, that's a wonderful shot! Was darted in by Tahir, Uthappa spotted it quickly. Got down on a knee and slogged it over deep mid-wicket with a sweep shot. Off she goes into the stands and thereby silencing the crowd
Jadeja to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is in good touch! Not much flight on this ball, Uthappa spots it, gets underneath it and lofts it over wide long-on. Right off the meet of the bat

Jadeja to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is turning it on here. This was bowled slightly outside off, doesn't matter to Uthappa. He crouches slightly low and clouts it over long-on. He's timing it brilliantly. Time to target him with pace?

Unadkat to Maxwell, SIX, finally, oh, finally, the wait is over. Here is the BIG SHOW!! The ball was in the zone and the batsman stayed his crease to use the long handle. The batsman again dragged the ball away and this time well over long-on

Laughlin to Chris Morris, SIX, A six to finish. Does not matter. 9th successive win for RR in Jaipur and 7th successive win against DD. The rains might have done them a favour. That was full and the batsman clobbered it down the ground by holding his shape nicely to send it over long-on. RR win this 10 runs

Chris Morris to Tripathi, SIX, length ball angling into middle, Tripathi lays into that slog-sweep on the up and sends that into the deep mid-wicket orbit for six! Boult takes a phenomenal catch there -- leaping and reverse-cupped -- but the momentum has him going over the ropes

Chris Morris to Buttler, SIX, length delivery outside off, Buttler puts his body-weight behind it and lofts that into the night sky, Maxwell at long-on tries to take that. Jumps sideways -- in an awkward enough shape already -- and ends up dropping it into the boundary. Think that was a six even if he had taken it; Maxwell was air-borne and well beyond the ropes. Unfortunate, because that was a good effort, but that's another six

Shami to Buttler, SIX, fuller one on off, Buttler gets low, makes room and throws his hands at that to loft that over long-off for six. Massive hit. Great start to the over for Buttler. A bit of a slice, but with these kalyug bats, the meat is much bigger

Chris Morris to Stokes, SIX, kaboooooom! He's got this off the meat, that's for sure. Fractionally short from Morris and Stokes doesn't even bother to go on the back foot. Was on the initial forward trigger and picks up the pull with ease. Into the shorter boundary at deep square leg for a biggie

Boult to Samson, SIX, cracking shot! Samson isn't wasting any time to get going and is happy to target the red-hot Boult who is breathing fire. Short ball that's not high enough, sits up nicely for Samson who dismisses it over mid-wicket with a forehand smash sort of pull. Beautifully done
Nadeem to Samson, SIX, half-tracker and goodbye! Cannot bowl such stuff on this pitch, easy for Samson who rocks back in a flash and deposits it into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Huge hit!

Stanlake to Rohit, SIX, lovely shot, Rohit was in complete control over this pull, banged in short and well outside off, Rohit swivelled across and pulled it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes

Shakib to Pollard, SIX, into the second tier. Mumbai need to step on the pedal. Bit of air as Shakib tossed it wide of off, Pollard charged down and had the room to free his arms, smashed it over extra cover for a biggie

Stanlake to Pollard, SIX, wow! That was just an extension of the arms and the ball flies over the fence. For a change Stanlake goes full, right in Pollard's arc, he stays rooted to the crease and presents the full bat face to loft it straight back over the bowler. Held his pose for the shutterbugs

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, he remains the key for Mumbai. Flighted on off, Yadav backs away by moving to leg, give himself the opportunity to free his arms and lofted it inside out handsomely over extra cover. Cleared the rope comfortably

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, SIX, Lewis gets going in some style, his first runs of IPL and it's a huge six, length ball on his pads, he swivelled across and helped it on its way, deep into the second tier at long leg

Stanlake to Lewis, SIX, magnificent shot, pacy length ball on the stumps, Lewis makes room by backing away, swings hard and sends it sailing over extra-cover for a maximum, flat and hard - that's what made MI shell big bucks to buy him in the auctions

Cutting to Deepak Hooda, SIX, he has clubbed this for six! What a start to the over. Low full toss wide of off from round the wicket, Hooda shuffles across a bit, bends his back knee and frees his arms. Muscles it over long-off

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, excellent shot to get off the mark. He's in sublime touch, has carried his form into this match too. On a length outside off, stands tall and pumps that over covers for half a dozen. Flat and over the fence

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, beautiful flick that. Very less margin for error on this wicket. Full on middle and leg, Rahul keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket with nonchalance. Made that shot look effortless

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, SIX, pushed through just outside off, Stoinis comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, went through with the swing and sends it sailing over long-off for a maximum

Chahal to Ashwin, SIX, cracking shot - made it even more special as he was done in completely by the flight. Chahal saw his coming, slowed down the pace, dragged it wide of off, Ashwin reached out and slaps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for a maximum

Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, SIX, Rahul continues to march on. Wickets falling at one end won't make him a difference. This one is a short delivery on leg, Rahul keeps his calm and pulls it over fine leg, off his hips and over the fence

Chahal to Rahul, SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, Rahul waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by Rahul

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, excellent shot to get off the mark. He's in sublime touch, has carried his form into this match too. On a length outside off, stands tall and pumps that over covers for half a dozen. Flat and over the fence

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, beautiful flick that. Very less margin for error on this wicket. Full on middle and leg, Rahul keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket with nonchalance. Made that shot look effortless

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, SIX, pushed through just outside off, Stoinis comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, went through with the swing and sends it sailing over long-off for a maximum

Chahal to Ashwin, SIX, cracking shot - made it even more special as he was done in completely by the flight. Chahal saw his coming, slowed down the pace, dragged it wide of off, Ashwin reached out and slaps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for a maximum

Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, SIX, Rahul continues to march on. Wickets falling at one end won't make him a difference. This one is a short delivery on leg, Rahul keeps his calm and pulls it over fine leg, off his hips and over the fence

Chahal to Rahul, SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, Rahul waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by Rahul

Dananjaya to Roy, SIX, that's huge! Akila concedes his first six of IPL and that's only his second delivery. Nothing much he could have done about it. Flighted one around middle and leg, Roy shimmies down the wicket and smokes it for a 95 metre six over mid-wicket. Welcome to the IPL, chirps Nasser Hussain on air

Markande to Maxwell, SIX, another tossed up one and Maxi slog-sweeps it all the way over backward square leg. It's on the stumps and Maxi won't miss those. Markande's having an of day. Tip for you Markande: If you are bowling to Maxwell, bowl the away-spinning ones wide outside off stump, hope for Maxwell to slog and slice one up in the air
Dananjaya to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh what a shot! The quicker delivery from Dananjaya, Iyer slogs really well and the timing is exceptional, sails into the second tier over the mid-wicket boundary

Krunal Pandya to Roy, SIX, this game is so unkind to the bowlers. Krunal Pandya has actually deceived the batsman in flight and with length, Roy, who was jumping out of the crease was nowhere close to the pitch of the ball, but he's gifted with timing and has a great willow in his hands and that combo is good enough for him to back himself and go through with the lofted hit over the bowler's head

Mustafizur to Roy, SIX, uppish and all the way. Scores level! What a hit under pressure. With a boundary through the off-side previous ball and a field set for the leg-side, Roy knows that the bowler isn't going to bowl outside off stump, so he moves across and flicks this short of length delivery with a strong bottom hand grip to send it clear of the man at fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, in the arc out of the park. Full length delivery, a knuckle ball and Roy with a lot of authority picks it up over wide long-on, would have been a six on any ground

Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, ahh, that was even better than the previous six. Short delivery again, Roy transfers his weight on to the back foot and murders it over square leg with a pull, 96 metre biggie that one, this is why he's in the team

Markande to Roy, SIX, so much power on that. Was a tossed up delivery around off, Roy went down on his knee and smoked it flat over long-off, even a leaping Pollard near the fence couldn't take the catch
Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, Pant pumps it! Shimmies down the wicket and towers the flighted delivery right over the bowler's head for six more, straight as an arrow that was

Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, the partnership between Pant and Roy is more than 50! Tossed up delivery around off, Pant puts on his dancing shoes and slaugters it over long-on to bring up Delhi's 100 in style

Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh my, he's brought out the reverse-sweep and it's gone for six. Completely switched his legs around, got blessed with a full toss and walloped it over backward point

Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, SIX, six more to finish the over, ruins the figures of Tewatia. Puts his dancing shoes on, and despite not getting to the pitch of it, he's able to drag it away over the wide long-on boundary. The key was that he went through with it
Boult to Lewis, SIX, early signs: good pitch against the new ball. Length ball right in Lewis's arc and he goes for it. Will go, 10 out of 10 times. Swings it over long-on

Nadeem to Lewis, SIX, that's been hit to the ESA kids in the stands. Brings up Mumbai's fastest fifty in IPL. Dragged down from round the wicket, left-handed Lewis goes back and clouts it over deep mid-wicket. It was a pull but more casually ruthless
Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Shami does this. Drops it harmlessly on a back of a length on leg-stump, and Suryakumar Yadav's been served a pie. Helps it over fine leg with a good arm swing

Christian to Lewis, SIX, this is unreal unravelling of Christian, and Delhi Daredevils. Slower on a length say, Lewis clears his front leg and sends it romping over long-off. More timing than anything else
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, SIX, it's a slower googly from Rahul Tewatia, which allows Lewis to come down the track and lever it over straightish long-on

Stanlake to A Russell, SIX, Hooda's flown in the air, caught it reverse-cupped and strewn that back in the playing field. Or has he? Nah, the left foot just hits the deep point ropes. Russell throws his arms at the width, with weight still on the front foot. Just throwing his arms..
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, SIX, what a price to pay. Slower ball again, Karthik picks it up and mauls the free-hit ball over long-off
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's massive. Such sweetly it was timed. Picks the googly early, gets down on his knee and slog sweeps it over mid-wicket, high and handsome that was

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's high, miles up in the air... Was the knuckle ball and Lynn went hard at it, towers it up towards long-off where Rashid settles underneath but goes for it only with his left hand, gets a bit on that and eventually parries it over the fence. Was a very tough chance that, difficult to spot those in the night sky

A Russell to Shakib, SIX, woah, the ball has gone skimming over the third man boundary. Boy he hit this hard. Short and wide, a ferocious slash from Shakib. Gets all of it. Massive over in the context of the game - 16 off it. SRH back in control

Shivam Mavi to Williamson, SIX, Williamson uses the pace of Mavi, all 140kph of it, and whips the pull away over long leg. What a brilliant shot. He swivelled across, remained on the front foot while pushing his weight back and used his wrists gloriously
A Russell to Y Pathan, SIX, that will be it. The SRH dugout rises as Pathan pulls this short ball into the stands. SRH pull off their first win at the Eden Gardens
Gowtham to Mandeep, SIX, nailed over long-on. Gentle off-break from Gowtham which is right in the slot. Mandeep grounds his back knee and wallops it through the line
Unadkat to Washington Sundar, SIX, punishes the slower ball this time. He set himself up for it and launched it over wide long-on

Laughlin to Washington Sundar, SIX, parried over the ropes for six! Gowtham was standing around 5 yards inside the boundary, stretched his arm out while back-pedaling but never looked like taking it. May have been a different story had he been all the way back. Slower short of length delivery, sits up for Sundar who thwacks it down the ground

Stokes to Washington Sundar, SIX, now carves this slower ball inside-out for six. Wow. Clean strike from Washington Sundar who picked the variation early and smoked it into the crowd. Brings the crowd to life

D Arcy Short to Kohli, SIX, smoked it! Kohli's one hand came off but then too he manages to get a six. One hand or two hands, doesn't matter. Was a floated delivery around off and Kohli towered it over long-on

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, SIX, insult to injury! Missed on a wicket on the last ball and goes for a six on the very next ball. Shortish delivery, a half-tracker and Kohli pummels it over wide long-on for a towering six, that was huge again
Laughlin to de Villiers, SIX, only one hand on that. Full length delivery outside off, de Villiers goes for it with full swing and manages to clear covers

Washington Sundar to Samson, SIX, blimey, what a blow! Some momentum into the RR innings now. This was fired fuller around middle and leg, Samson held his shape and swung through the line. Sent it soaring over long-on for a biggie
Khejroliya to Stokes, SIX, ahhhh, this is vintage Stokes! Back of a length around middle and leg, easy for him as he swivels just a touch before drop kicking this over deep fine leg. Easy pickings
Negi to Samson, SIX, hammered away! Samson is on the rampage now. Of course, half-trackers like these help as well. Was on the back foot in a jiffy and smashed the pull over deep mid-wicket
U Yadav to Samson, SIX, gobbles up the Free Hit! Umesh is having a horror day. This is a full toss on leg, Samson just shuffles a touch and mows it over deep mid-wicket. Deep into the crowd

Woakes to Samson, SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Slower and a fraction short from Woakes, Samson sits on the back foot and went through with the pull shot. Didn't quite middle this as much as he would have wanted, still got it over McCullum who tried with all his might

Woakes to Buttler, SIX, deep into the crowd! Buttler has activated the beast mode, danger signs for RCB if they don't get him quickly. Back of a length around middle and off, Buttler sat on the back foot and smoked it way over deep mid-wicket. Huge biggie

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, what a beautiful shot! Jeepers, this kid is such a delight to watch when on song. Such class! Full and outside off, his bat face did turn in his hands but he got it dead straight even then. Cleared long-off easily

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, Samsonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn! What quality strokeplay! Fullish ball around middle and leg, Samson makes room by backing away lot and just goes through with the extension of the loft down the ground. Such timing and over long-off again it is, deeper this time. 16 off the over!

Woakes to Samson, SIX, hammered into long-on! Samson's merry ways continue. He is batting on another level now. Slower ball on a shortish length, he just waits for it and slaps through the line. No real effort there, at least not visible but gee the timing, ever so perfect! Another biggie

U Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, H-U-G-E! For a change, it's not Samson who hits a biggie. The young Tripathi joins in the fun now and boy, he has clubbed this almost into the top tier of the ground. Slower and fuller, tries to follow the batsman but Tripathi is equal to the task. Makes room and clubs it easily over long-on. The crowd had to take cover there
U Yadav to Samson, SIX, no stopping Samson here! As if he needed a Free Hit to hit them big. Very full from Yadav and Samson gets under it with ease, clubbed comfortably over long-off. Ho ho ho!!

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, this time over deep extra cover! Incredible stuff from Samson, it's been an exhibition from him this afternoon. Full and wide outside off, he just makes room to lift it over the sweeper cover fence for a boundary. Unstoppable!
Washington Sundar to Rahane, SIX, now downtown. Sundar overcorrects going fuller, Rahane steps away, gives his hands room. And they swing, into the sightscreen
Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, spots the length. It's that in-between one, and Samson makes it look worse. Swivels, pulls and heaves without bothering to keep it down. All brute

Barinder to Rayudu, SIX, finally a maximum! The asking rate is up high, the runs weren't flowing and Rayudu gets a much needed six. Read the slower ball very early, moved across the stumps and waited for the short ball to come and smashed the ball into the backward square leg fence

Ashwin to Dhoni, SIX, that's why he eats those dots. He knows he can make up for it big time. Flighted delivery on the leg stump, Dhoni gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it from the middle of the bat over square leg

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, oh that's gone a loooong way into the stands. Stand and deliver stuff! Full and in the slot, Mohit Sharma goes for the yorker, misses the yorker by some mark and Dhoni gets under it to send it over deep mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to Jadeja, SIX, he's smoked that away, Jaddu! This is the second time he's hit a big shot despite being off balance. Slower delivery from Mohit Sharma, Jadeja somehow connects and gets enough power to clear long-on

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, SIX, smashedddd! Why are you not bowling slower balls Andrew Tye? Strange! Length ball, goodbye! You are asking for trouble. Dhoni actially felt some pain after launching this over deep mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, SIX, can you believe it? An injured MS Dhoni has hit a six with one hand. Take a bow sir! Low full toss, no one at deep square, Dhoni backs himself, has an excellent willow in his hand and swings across the line and over the boundary line

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, he's hit this all the way but it won't matter - full ball outside off stump, Dhoni lofts it to over long-off. KXIP have escaped home by 4 runs. Oh these CSK games and run chases. They get so deep. You got to admire this man - MS Dhoni. Injured very early in the innings, takes some treatment, takes it upon himself and almost takes his side home.
Barinder to Vijay, SIX, roll back the clock - it's that Vijay of the old. Sran goes short, eventually sitting up and Vijay smokes, flat-batting it big into cow corner

Watson to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, hit through the line and off she goes into the stands. Seam-up, half-volley on the stumps, Agarwal bends his back knee and smokes it over long-on. Off the meat of the bat

Tahir to Yuvraj, SIX, there's the trademark Yuvraj shot! Flighted wide of off, Yuvi, with a huge back-lift, lofts it handsomely straight down the ground. The long-on fielder moves to his right, can only watch the ball sail over his head

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, RJ runs across and palms it over the boundary rope. Hit his thumb - his bowling hand as well. Hope it's not serious. It was a full toss and Nair hacked it over mid-wicket. Jaddu covered a lot of distance and the momentum was taking him futher across. Stuck his left hand out, couldn't hold on, despite a jump

SN Thakur to Ashwin, SIX, Vijay was waiting for the ball, but it goes over his head. A 62m six! Slightly wayward from Thakur. Short of a good length straying down leg, Ashwin stays deep and moves towards off to help it along its way. A superb pick-up shot over fine leg
Harbhajan to Gayle, SIX, drop-kicked! Gone for a sixer. The batsman goes with the turn and muscles the ball over long-off for a maximum. Gayle is up and away!!

Chahar to Gayle, SIX, that is into a parallel universe from the universe boss. Length ball was like a dead meat and Gayle picks the bones out of it. Over cow corner for a mighty six. That was poor bowling

Chahar to Gayle, SIX, where are the seat belts? The Gayle show is here. Full ball and the batsman hammers the ball over long-off for a huge six. This man has made a statement. A big one. 46 off 19 balls!
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, unfurl the noise now! Slammed down the ground over long-off. Well flighted ball and the batsman spanks it over the fence. He ain't holding back. KXIP are unstoppable
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, comes down the track and lifts the ball away over long-on. The big hitting has spread like an epidemic. The intentions and the application was superb and in sync

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, that's been palmed over the ropes! Mavi, the fielder. Was a slow, flighted delivery. Slightly too full, Maxwell goes hard on the lofted on-drive and doesn't time it too well. Mavi moved to his right and probably didn't time his jump well. Gets a hand, but that's been parried away. SIX
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, back-to-back sixes. Quicker delivery, too straight as well, that's been bludgeoned over deep mid-wicket with a mighty swing of the bat

Chawla to Pant, SIX, lovely, tossed up well outside off, Pant gets a good stride forward, picks the wrong 'un, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and sends it soaring over extra-cover for a maximum
Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX, easy pickings for Maxwell, short and at his body, he gets inside the line, uses the pace on the ball and helps it way over the ropes at long leg
Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX, smashed, the back of the hand slower short ball from Curran, but it sat up to be smacked. Maxwell swivels across and pulls it high and way into the stands at long leg

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, SIX, off the mark with a six. That's what he can do. Can recover momentum and up the rate so quickly. This was a full delivery on the stumps, Chris Lynn connected well and sent the ball over wide long-on, he needed that for his own confidence and for the team's sake

Vijay Shankar to Karthik, SIX, DK knows all about Vijay Shankar. Both play together for Tamil Nadu, a step towards the ball and then swung it from his hips over deep backward square, was a back of a length delivery but such is the form that DK is in, he has hit it for six

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, length delivery outside off and Nitish Rana launches it over long-on. Clean bat-swing and the ball sails over the fielder's head. The wicket of his skipper hasn't put Nitish Rana off at all

Shami to A Russell, SIX, that is a magnificent shot. For a moment he was cramped by the short of length delivery into the body, but he adjusted at the last moment and slashed it into his team's dugout at the third man fence. Needed to get it fine and did so

Shami to A Russell, SIX, holds the pose. Take that Shami seems to say Russell. Overpitched and right in teeing off zone for Russell, who lofts ever so cleanly and sees the ball till the last moment as his eyes and the bat are transfixed at the target. It lands in the long-off stands. Someone take a pic of that, frame it and present it to Russell

Shami to A Russell, SIX, he is unreal. When it comes to hitting a cricket ball. The predictable short delivery arrives, with no pace or height, brutalised over mid-wicket. The Kolkatans have gone mental at the Eden

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, now Nitish Rana gets into the act. Short ball and Nitish Rana pulls handsomely over deep mid. Looked like he was waiting on the back foot for that one and when it came, didn't miss out

Shami to A Russell, SIX, that is the flattest square-driven six you'll ever see. Trust me on that. Unbelievable stuff from Russell. Sees the slower delivery outside off and gets low to carve it over deep point. The ball never took off from a height after it left the bat

Shami to A Russell, SIX, my word. There's so little margin of error against this beast from Jamaica. A man-mountain. Shami errs by slowing the pace down, lands right in the swinging range of Russell who sends it high into the deep mid stands. Such clean striking!

Shami to A Russell, SIX, straight up in the air, can someone get under this one. What! It has landed over long-off's head. What does he have everyday? Just pass that to all those who want to put on weight. This is jaw-dropping stuff from Russell. Looked like he had pulled the short ball straight up in the air, but such is the power he possesses that it has landed beyond the boundary. What more can I say?
Nadeem to Uthappa, SIX, heaved over deep mid. Sliding on, on the middle and leg line, Uthappa sunk under that and clouted it high and over mid-wicket

Nadeem to Uthappa, SIX, sheer power. That's all made in the gym. What a shot this is. Must be contending for one of the shots of the tournament so far. This is a length ball on off, Uthappa went back and used his forearm power to great effect as he flat-batted it dead straight back over the bowler. A flat six. Nadeem shouldn't feel too disheartened with that hit, it wasn't a bad ball by any stretch of the imagination
Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, SIX, slog-swept by Uthappa and six over deep square. Went down quickly and sheer timing on the shot sees the ball sail into the crowd
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, SIX, the slog-sweep from Nitish Rana and he has sent it over Morris' head at deep mid. Right in the range for that shot and Rana sent it into the stands
Nadeem to Nitish Rana, SIX, comes down the track and launches into the lofted hit, gets good height and the desired elevation over deep mid. Clears the fielder

Woakes to Lewis, SIX, dumped over deep backward square leg! Doesn't take long for Lewis to launch. Gets one that's fractionally short and he is on the back foot in a jiffy. Swivels to absolutely clobber the pull. Went deep into the stands

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, he's done waiting for something deft. He's down, running, Chahal's gone slower as well for some reason. Swings, big time, and it's more a miscue .. never mind when you've got hands like these. Way over long-off
Chahal to Lewis, SIX, typically dragged down. Lewis' smart, he sits, gets it in his slot and heave-sweeps. Checks the railway tracks behind square leg..the ball's there

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, SIX, connects. Cleanly at last. And then it's going only one way. Chahal tries a flipper, but Krunal with his shuffle gets under, sits under and dispatches it into long-on. Nothing subtle
U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, raw meat. That length, you are obliged to smack. Rohit smokes, swinging flat-batted, into the first tier over square leg

U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, oh my. As if the half trackers weren't enough, the hospitality has stretched out to dishing out full tosses on the hips. All Rohit has to do is impart direction and that's swiping it into fine leg. A railway tragedy wouldn't be far

Siraj to Rohit, SIX, wow. Okay Google - search for descriptions. Siraj errs for a change, letting the length sit up in Rohit arc .. and that arc's ever-expanding. Flat-bats, high and into long-on. Save your faces
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, SIX, feeds him a revenge gift. Short, on the body, and Pandya swivels, almost base-balling it into the second floor. Where else, but behind square
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, SIX, and now length. The cardinal length. Pandya rubbing it in and how. Holds his pose, lets the ball get close and clears long-off with his lofted shovel

Corey Anderson to Rohit, SIX, makes him bowl a full toss. Misses the yorker, the dew isn't helping him either. And Rohit doesn't need these, really. You don't have to be this kind. Carved away, deep extra cover

Siraj to Lewis, SIX, welcome to the attack Mr.Siraj! Lewis is absolutely nonchalant as he dispatches this rubbish short ball way into the stands at deep backward square leg. At his pace, Siraj needs to be careful about the lengths he bowls, especially in the Powerplay

Washington Sundar to Rohit, SIX, down the pitch and bang! The MI skipper has decided to up the ante a little. Shimmies down the track on seeing the flight and the leg-stump line helped as well, launched into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Super shot

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, that's hugeeeeeeeeeeeee! Lewis continues on his merry ways. Picks the top spinner quickly and brings out the imperious slog sweep. Huge maximum over deep backward square leg. Brings up his 50! He is looking deadly tonight

Markande to Kohli, SIX, that's classic Virat Kohli for you! Flighted delivery just outside off stump, Kohli lofts the inside-out drive from the middle of the bat, hits the rope on the full. Stand and deliver stuff
Mustafizur to Woakes, SIX, that's a lovely hit! Hit on the rise, the bat made a good sound as it made contact with the ball. Slower delivery again and Woakes went straight towards the sightscreen
McClenaghan to Kohli, SIX, take that! Short of a length delivery on the off stump, Kohli shows no respect and pulls the ball handsomely over mid-wicket. Brilliant hit
Mustafizur to Kohli, SIX, cracking sound. Full and in the slot, Kohli muscles that way back over the long-on fence

Mustafizur to Siraj, SIX, oh he's connected this brilliantly! Give him a promotion next match! Slower delivery sat up nicely, Siraj hangs back and pulls powerfully over deep mid-wicket and easily clears the fence. Will this make Kohli smile?
Bumrah to Kohli, SIX, down the one knee and smashed! Back in the crease with a step and then he picked the bones out of this slower delivery and sent it over long-on

Mustafizur to de Kock, SIX, de Kock has found his bearings. Rahman errs, bowls it full on QDK's strong zone. Just bent forward and lifted it through the line. Ah, all timing as it sails over the ropes over mid-on

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, oh what a freebie, and what a time for it. Any pressure that had built on KKR has evaporated. Slower short ball on leg-stump, Karthik whip-pulls it witheringly over the long leg boundary

Unadkat to Nitish Rana, SIX, pretty full from Unadkat, and this is brilliant use of the crease from Rana. He takes a step back which allows him to get under the ball. Mid-off was up in the ring, so the idea was to just loft it over him. And despite the bat turning in his hands, it still clears the ropes
Laughlin to Karthik, SIX, hoisted over long-on to wrap up a clinical win for KKR. Set himself up for this length ball and launched it into the night sky, falls way back into the stands

Laughlin to Narine, SIX, 50-run stand up between Narine and Uthappa! Short of a length around off, Narine clears his front leg and pulls it over mid-wicket to end the powerplay with a maximum. Good recovery by KKR after the loss of Lynn in the first over of the innings
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, short and punished! Gopal drops it short on off, Uthappa camps back and times his pull over mid-wicket, an impressive blow

Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, a biggie to end the over! Excellent timing on that. Full and floated on middle, Uthappa doesn't miss out on the chance to slog it over mid-wicket, a meaty blow that was. That'll spoil the over for the bowler

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, SIX, what a blow that is. This is what D Arcy Short can do. Backs away and Shivam Mavi follows him with a back of a length delivery, but D Arcy Short clobbers the pull miles into the deep square stands. At one point looked like clearing the crowd and going out of the stadium
batsman: Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short

Commentary: Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, SIX, as soon as he saw the tossed up delivery, a chinaman, Stokes goes downtown. Kneels down and then slogs it miles back into the long-on stands. That's what Stokes can do

Narine to Gowtham, SIX, can Gill get there? He can but can only parry it over the ropes. Good effort from him running to his left at long-off. Not easy at all as Gowtham lofted it superbly after using his feet. Had enough to get it over the left-hand of the diving fielder

Shivam Mavi to Rahane, SIX, smashed. That's some way to treat a bloke who's bowling at over 140 clicks. Down the track and flat-batted the short of length delivery straight back over the bowler's head. Had enough on it to go all the way

Shakib to Nair, SIX, "Will he catch it? Yes, he will! No, he won't!", yelps Mbangwa on-air! Good effort by long-off but too difficult in the end. Pandey was the man there, leapt to take it one-handed but the momentum was taking him past the ropes and in the effort to throw it back into play, fails to do so. Floated ball and was lofted down the ground by Karun, gets a maximum

Shakib to Gayle, SIX, he has got under this one, oh yes! Shakib was trying to steer clear of Gayle's arc but misses it for once. Full and on middle and off, the big West Indian just clears his front leg and launches it over long-on for yet another six

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, not off the middle really but who cares? He has enough power! The googly and Gayle decided to go with the turn, sliced it away over long-off and easily cleared the fence! Whoa!

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, this is off the middle alright! Gayle storm alert! The shorter length and Gayle sits on the back foot to flat bat it straight down the ground. As straight as an arrow and well over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, 3 in a row! Has Rashid ever been hammered like this? I cannot remember at all but this is what Gayle does. He can destroy the best of bowlers. Fuller length once more and he just lifts it straight down the ground. Into the sight-screen! He is in the savage mode

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, it keeps coming! It keeps coming! 4 out of 4 for Gayle! Floated up on middle and off, he gets across on one leg and clobbers the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Oh boy, this is some exhibition!

Jordan to Gayle, SIX, Jordan doesn't get the landing rights in Mohali. The slower delivery, bowls it half-way down the pitch. Seemed as though Gayle was waiting for it. Rocks back and bulldozed it into the deep square leg stands. "Catching practise for the crowd," says Pommie Mbangwa on air. 14th maximum for the universe boss
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, Gayle moves to 99. Spoils a good over by Bhuvneshwar. Pitched up just outside off, Gayle spots it early and smokes it disdainfully over long-off. High and handsome
Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX, Rashid has been taken to the dry cleaners today. Proper pasting. Went too full this time does Rashid, Finch was waiting for it. Muscles it straight down the ground

Jordan to Gayle, SIX, crunched! The big man kicks off the six-hitting for the night. Expected the short ball and was ready on the back foot, swatted the pull over mid-wicket. Made a cracking sound off the blade

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, hammered into the stands! That's a bad ball to most players, let alone Gayle. Juicy full toss and he just blasts it away over deep square leg for a mammoth biggie. Clean strike

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, smashed over long-on! Huge test this for Rashid, Gayle is in the mood to destroy him tonight. Loopy leg break and it's too full, launched down the ground for another huge biggie
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, SIX, booooooom! Cannot bowl it in his arc when he is in this mood. Full and in the slot on off, he just lofts it down the ground effortlessly. Crashes into the sightscreen

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, clobbered away! Agarwal is wasting no time in switching to top gear. Floated up around off, he just clears his front leg and deposits this over the long-on fielder for a maximum. Good proactive batting
Ashwin to Williamson, SIX, some turn on this leg break but Williamson stays put and swipes this over deep mid-wicket. Just a little short, which allowed Williamson to go against the spin there

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, SIX, a 37-ball fifty for Pandey. 40 from 10 needed now, which means literally every ball has to be a boundary. A bottom-handed loft from Manish Pandey that, getting under that full ball and launching it over long-on
Ashwin to Shakib, SIX, switches to the off break and Shakib launches him over deep mid-wicket. Just the length you can swing across
Ashwin to Shakib, SIX, another one pretty much there. A bit slower you'd think, and Shakib goes straighter here

Ashwin to Williamson, SIX, Williamson sends it into the crowd. It was an off-spinner from Ashwin, Williamson comes down the track, reaches the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the long-off for a maximum. Clean connection!
Gowtham to Watson, SIX, first maximum of the match! Loopy delivery around off, Watson backs away, makes room and towers it cleanly over long-off for his first big one of the night

Laughlin to Watson, SIX, flat six! That barely left the ground. Banged in and at Laughlin's pace it sat up for Watto, who was quick to rock back and nail the pull in front of square, right between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, Watto is off to a flier. Although he has been dropped twice, he's continuing to take on the bowlers. This was a length delivery around off, Watson stood tall and clobbered it over the extra cover fence for half a dozen more

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, last ball of the over fetches six more. Unadkat wouldn't like this. He's the most expensive buy of this IPL among Indian players. Short of a length around off, Watson camps back and hammers it over mid-wicket for a flat six

Gowtham to Watson, SIX, gets to his fifty in style! It's a short delivery and Watson camps back and slaughters it over Stokes at long-on. Reaches the milestone and raises his bat, acknowledges the crowd
Gowtham to Watson, SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, Watson slogs this over mid-wicket for half a dozen

Chahar to Rahane, SIX, shot! One of best shots played today. The RR skipper gives the charge by coming down the track and then offers a straight bat to thump this length ball over long-on. Off the middle and off she goes into the stands. Poses for the photographs too
Tahir to Stokes, SIX, stretches out to reach this googly and then flat-bats it over long-off. Brute power

Tahir to Buttler, SIX, 14 off the over! Buttler has ensured that Tahir is not settled. For the third time in as many balls, he comes down the track. It was the googly from Tahir, but Buttler made it into a half-volley and bludgeoned it over the bowler's head. A gigantic hit

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, length delivery and Lynn is all over it like a rash. Lynn was waiting on it, plays with the angle and sends it high and deep into the stands at long-on, 103 m hit - the second longest of IPL 2018

Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, SIX, third short ball in a row and Lynn punishes it with ease. No venom on this occasion, Lynn gets under it and hacked it comfortably into the fine leg stands. First maximum of the innings

Barinder to Uthappa, SIX, bosh! Shot. Never bowl short to Uthappa, Sran finds out why. Short ball aimed at the torso, Uthappa was ready for it. Picked the bones out of it and muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands

Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, woah! Has he launched this one into the moon or what? What a shot. 97-metre hit. Length ball in the slot for Lynn, Lynn set himself and whacked it with ferocity, behind square on the leg-side and into the crowd
Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, 23 runs to cap off the over. Back of the hand slower ball goes awry for Sran. Lynn bent low to free his arms and launched this over deep square leg once again

Tom Curran to Gayle, SIX, that's in the airrr, mistimed, the fielder jumps and it just escapes him. So that's the game for KXIP. They top the points table. Fittingly Gayle hits the winning shot. Length ball, Gayle went for the loft straight, long-on ran to his right and jumped but couldn't get a hand on it

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, SIX, that's inexperience for you from the bowler. He was troubling Rahul with the inswingers, this is the final ball of his second over, he may not be given the third, so now he tries something different from what was working and gets smashed. Short and rising, Rahul nonchalantly pulls over square leg. How good a shot was that?
A Russell to Gayle, SIX, nope! Please don't bowl there Russ! You know it's all too easy if you bowl full against a power-hitter. Gayle easily gets under this ball and launches it wide of long-on

A Russell to Gayle, SIX, the upper cut and it's gone all the way. This guy averages around 50 in T20s at this venue I guess! Oh Dre Russ is down on the floor after delivering that ball. Looks like he's done a hammie here. Anyway, this was a short ball that came at pace and Gayle's leg-side movement gave him the space to free the arms and slice the ball over third man. The connection was spot on

Kuldeep Yadav to Gayle, SIX, got to feel for the bowlers who are forced to bowl a defensive line with these big bats and small boundaries. Can cricket be kind on them please? Kuldeep Yadav did the right thing by spinning the ball away from Gayle and bowling wide outside off stump, but he bowled too full and the big man got under it to smash it over long-on

Chawla to Gayle, SIX, that ball stayed up for an eternity. The fielder at long-on thought he was in with a chance, but it is Chris Gayle who is batting and even a miscue from him will clear the rope. Went after the wrong 'un and cue-ended the loft, just about managed to clear the field

Chawla to Gayle, SIX, full toss and smashed. A hat-trick of fifties for Gayle and this is a bloke who went unsold originally and was picked last minute at base price. He hits this straight and does the "baby celebration" of his. Gets a great round of applause from the crowd

Narine to Rahul, SIX, crunched! A 24-ball fifty for KL Rahul. How well has he played thus far in the tournament! Shortish delivery from Narine, Rahul pulls off the back foot, hit flat and hit over the mid-wicket boundary

Siraj to Pant, SIX, good over for DD, 12 runs off it. They need plenty more of it. Slower delivery and Pant picked the bones out of that one, delayed his loft and smashed it straight back over, pinged the ad boardings on the full

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massive! For a second it seemed to be traveling out of Chinnaswamy. Sundar changes his line of attack - comes round the wicket and slants it right in the slot, Iyer clears his front leg and heaves it deep into the mid-wicket stand

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, fifty for Iyer. Gets there in style. First for him in this IPL. Needs to keep going though. Fetched it from well outside off, might have been a wide had he let go, but he doesn't and swipes it across the line flat over cow corner

Chahal to Pant, SIX, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Pant seemed to have picked it from the hand, didn't try to go across the line, went straight and the boy packs a punch, cleared long-off with ease

Chahal to Pant, SIX, back to back sixes and this was superb. The reverse sweep that goes all the way. Chahal pushed it through after being hit over his head, Pant spotted that and used his pace to broom him away over the third man fence

Siraj to Pant, SIX, flat six! That was just a flick of the wrists and Woakes had no chance. Siraj missed the yorker and the low full toss was right in the arc for Pant, who crouched a bit and whipped it over deep square leg

Siraj to Pant, SIX, wow! What power. It was the slower delivery and Pant had to manufacture all the power, he waited and waited before standing tall and smoking it over long-off, cleared the rope comfortably as well

Woakes to Pant, SIX, raining sixes at the moment. Good length ball outside off, Pant had the space to work with and he accepted the width gleefully, smashed the inside out loft over extra cover for a maximum

Corey Anderson to Pant, SIX, smoked! Pant is smashing them to all parts. Small shimmy to convert it into a length delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, went through with the shot and pummeled it over long-on for half a dozen

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that six will spoil Umesh Yadav's figures. He had conceded only 13 runs off his 3 overs, ends with figures of 4-0-27-1. Was a full length ball on leg as Iyer nonchalantly flicked it over the mid-wicket fence, was timed to perfection by the youngster
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, continues his fun tirade. Keeps getting nothings on the pads, sitting up to be smacked. Obliged. Fiercely swatting into deep mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, there's his arc. You genius. Reads the fuller sucker that's to follow, sits, shuffles and it's behind square. In less than a second. Oh the nerve!

Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, SIX, spectator down - into her jaw. Now who's missing Gayle when AB can break jaws as well. Back on a knee, under the swinging tonk, and into the second tier at cow corner

Chris Morris to de Villiers, SIX, the second tier tonks have become boring. So AB goes into the third. Once that front leg goes out of the way, it's always into the orbit. And then the ball's on the meaty length too. Whacked, straight down
Boult to Corey Anderson, SIX, nobody's getting it right. Boult returns with a full toss, nice and high, and Anderson's reversing roles. Smokes it into cow corner

Chris Morris to Mandeep, SIX, these massive bats. So Mandeep's done in with the lack of pace, he swings across the line, gets the back of the bat. And it finds a way to fly high and into the fence behind the keeper

Maxwell to de Kock, SIX, swept all the way over short fine. Shuffled across slightly to get inside the line of this off-break, Maxwell drifted it in on leg to aid the batsman further, and gets swatted into the stands with a powerful sweep shot

Chris Morris to Kohli, SIX, just over the fielder. Length ball around off, Kohli whips it away and he had the whole of Chinnaswamy concerned for a bit. But they shouldn't have been. Not with those wrists

Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, SIX, smashes the roof of Chinnaswamy! Rank long-hop from Tewatia, just the ball which got rid of Kohli and de Villiers in their previous home game. But de Villiers is having none of that today. Rocks back and hoists it away over mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Raina, SIX, lovely shot! Superb use of the feet from the southpaw, sashays down and gets close to the pitch of the delivery, then uses his bottom hand to whip it over the cow corner fence

Rashid Khan to Raina, SIX, just the over Raina needed to get some impetus to his innings. This is a good old fashion slog sweep, Rashid errs by giving it some air and Raina kneels to get underneath it, struck powerfully enough to clear the fielder in the deep

Stanlake to Rayudu, SIX, he is playing a gem here. The slower delivery from Stanlake and he picked the bones out of that, set himself on leg-stump and swung through the line, the fielder at long-on was a mere spectator

Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, hammered! He is toying with the bowling. Shakib is clearly rattled, bowls a juicy full toss as Rayudu dances down the wicket, easy pickings for the batsman as he slots it into the crowd at long-on

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX, Rashid is being taken to the cleaners. Tosses the googly up and Rayudu picked it out of his hand, he went down on his knee and slog swept it with the spin over cow corner. Got plenty of height and the required distance

Stanlake to Dhoni, SIX, easy peasy! Just a short-arm jab and the ball clears the rope. Stanlake rolls his fingers across the ball and bowls it on a length, Dhoni smokes it over deep mid-wicket nonchalantly

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, SIX, cracking shot, rare bad ball from Bhuvneshwar, back of a length and on the stumps, Watson swivels across and pulls it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, massive, length delivery outside off, Rayudu bends down on one-knee, picks up the length and swipes it high and way over wide long-on for a humongous hit

Jadeja to Williamson, SIX, doesn't look comfortable doing this, but he's somehow muscled it over wide long-off. Length ball just outside off, Williamson had set himself up by clearing his front leg. Opens his body up and carves it inside out

Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, this time Williamson goes leg-side, and collects six. He planted his back foot outside off, got a delivery which landed right in the slot, and shovelled it over wide long-on
Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, woah, that's massive. Williamson! He sat on his back knee and whacked this slog-sweep way back into the square leg stands. Do we have a match on here?

Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, lays into it again, and it's six more. This is some lovely batting from the SRH captain. He didn't overhit the ball this time, just an extension of the off-drive, and it sails over long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, SIX, deep into the crease to be able to get under the ball, and get under the ball he does. Pathan has launched this over long-off. Boy have SRH come roaring back
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, SIX, bludgeoned! He gets absolutely stuck into this slower ball and mows it over cow corner. Wow. Bravo goes for 14 in his first over
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, SIX, free-hit or not, Pathan doesn't care. He smokes this full toss over long-on. He is starting to middle these now, nice and clean
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, SIX, oh what a horrible delivery. Delicious full toss on off stump, Pathan gobbles it up as he whiplashes it over the mid-wicket boundary. Keeps SRH afloat

SN Thakur to Rashid Khan, SIX, whacked down the ground for six. First ball Rashid faces, he leans back and pummels the slower ball. Brings the equation down to 19 needed off the final over. The way this game has gone, don't rule it out

Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, SIX, this is a length ball and it has disappeared. Drama. Two sixes in two balls from Rashid. He's striking it at 600. Swivels across and heaves it away over deep backward square

Chahar to Williamson, SIX, is he a playing a skipper's knock? Reminds me of the knock that Kohli played against Mumbai Indians a few days back. This is a short delivery on middle and leg, Williamson is onto it in a flash as he middles his pull to perfection. Right over the square leg fence for a flat six
Watson to Shakib, SIX, pulled away! Was a short delivery on leg and Shakib had plenty of time to heave it over the fine leg fence. The crowd is slowly getting its voice back
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, he's upping the strike-rate as well. Flighted delivery down the leg-side, Ishan gets to the pitch of the ball by advancing and slogs over wide long-on
Unadkat to Pollard, SIX, pure muscle from Pollard. Finally, gets going. Cutter slanted wide of off, Pollard waited and waited before butchering it over long-on. Flat-batted powerfully!

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar is a free-flowing player, tough to keep him calm and Kulkarni, in trying to search for swing, bowls a touch fuller and disappears. The outswinger doesn't swing, Suryakumar gets under it and lofts it easily over long-on, hit on the rise to an extent

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, SIX, has he hit that alright? Oh yes he has! Been trying a few shots, but he's bravely raced down to a bowler who's kept him calm, the best part about it was he picked this slower ball, got into great position and absolutely smashed that over long-on. First six of the night for Ishan

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, unbelievable hit! Suryakumar Yadav is very, very good with that pick up shot of his. He's moved across a touch to this fullish delivery on the stumps and whipped away with his lovely wrists with great timing, all the way over the long-leg boundary

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh shot! Hit on one leg. Stokes tried a similar ball to the previous one, Ishan connects with the pull this time despite being cramped for room and it hits the backward square leg rope on the full

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, whata a way to bring up the fifty - off 29 balls. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Suryakumar leans forward and lofts the drive inside-out handsomely over cover. Gentle raise of the bat to the team and the crowd

McClenaghan to Stokes, SIX, all the innocous-ity. 92kph, dug in half way into the pitch, turning into him down leg too. Stokes waits. And waits. And swivels, rejecting the wide to pull it into fine leg
Mustafizur to Gowtham, SIX, rocks back, deep in the crease, getting that front leg out once again. And targets the smallest part of the ground - cow corner. And swings. Smoking

Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, SIX, it's in the orbit. It's into the car park. And Gowtham turns hero - coming right at the climax, scoring at a strike rate of 300. Gets a juicy back of a length ball, in the slot and flat-bats it across the line. Into the clouds. And then cow corner

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, that's a brilliant hit under pressure. Barinder, why did you run in and bowl a full ball in the slot? He followed Rahul Tewatia who was backing away, but landed perfectly for Tewatia to tee off over long-off
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, smashed, short and outside off stump, Shreyas flat-bats the loft over long-off. Fifty up for Shreyas Iyer, good knock but he needs to connect them well from here on

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, SIX, that's flown away like it belongs to the stands. Full pace at 136ks and steaming into the pads, and Maxwell's just flunked it over backward square leg with a bat swing. Sounds easy, right?
Mishra to Miller, SIX, downtown. Talk about rubbing it in. Two lives, and a celebration with a hoick straight down. All muscle, perbably denting the sightscreen

Avesh Khan to Rahul, SIX, terrific stroke! Rahul is in some serious form and we've seen it already this season. Dug in short and angling into the body, he just shuffles across to get inside the line and uses the pace to control the pull. Easily over fine leg for a biggie
Shakib to Pollard, SIX, full and right in KP's arc, he has no second thoughts. Just dismisses it out of his presence by using those long levers to full effect, sent into the galaxy. Over long-on

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, SIX, a smile from KW after that big hit. On a length and around off, too predictable these cutters from Mustafizur, Pathan stays back and lofts cleanly miles into the stands at long-on

Negi to Watson, SIX, that's Watson at his best. Too full and too straight, Watson sits down and then heaves with all his might, good connection to get it all the way over long-on. Gets the crowd going
Corey Anderson to Dhoni, SIX, right in Dhoni's teeing off zone. Picks the slower delivery and murders it over long-on. As easy as you like
Negi to Dhoni, SIX, helicoptered straight down the ground! Mini-helicopter you can call. Tossed up on middle, Dhoni marmalises it back over the bowler's head. Such power
Negi to Dhoni, SIX, Negi continues to toss it up, too full and right in the hitting zone, Dhoni swings and sends it over long-on. When it is so full, Dhoni will hit everything out of the park

Negi to Rayudu, SIX, 50 for Rayudu. He is getting tired and losing some of his power, but this he sits back and waits for it to be bowled short, then mauls the pull over deep mid. Third six of the over
Siraj to Rayudu, SIX, magnificent shot. Down the track and lifts the back of a length delivery over deep cover. So effortless with so much timing. A crucial blow at the right time

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, SIX, back of a length outside off, Rayudu knows what is coming, a mini shuffle outside off, forehands it over wide long-off. Carries over the rope, not by much but it will do

Corey Anderson to Rayudu, SIX, this is bigger. And longer. Full outside off, Rayudu shuffles across and gives it all, off the middle of the bat and way back into the stands. Nailed that and the ball flies away to the deep mid fence

Corey Anderson to Dhoni, SIX, whyyy! When those back of a length balls were working so well, why do you want to try the yorker. Dhoni smacks it. He did really smack it straight down the ground. Fifty for the CSK captain, he's determined and as always confident

Siraj to Dhoni, SIX, don't tell me he deliberately sliced that all the way for six! Oh he did! Genius! Low full toss outside off stump, not a really bad ball, Dhoni has been looking to target third man this innings and he's somehow got under this properly and sent it for a maximum

Corey Anderson to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, who better than DJ Bravo to hit those inside-out shots over cover. You got to admire him. Distraught RCB fans. Delight in the CSK camp. Back of a length delivery outside off stump, Bravo backs away and gets under the ball to smash it over cover

Corey Anderson to Dhoni, SIX, that's it! How cool is he man! Is he human? CSK have won with two balls to spare! Unbelievable stuff. More than 100 runs were needed in about 7 overs but he never showed any signs of pressure, nor did he play rash shots. Just played his trumpcard of taking the match deep and backing himself to finish and boy, what a finish it was. Just a jump across to the off-side and slogs this full ball with all his might to clear deep mid-wicket. This is RCB's first loss defending in excess of 200 at the Chinnaswamy

Washington Sundar to Rayudu, SIX, the sound of bat hitting ball was like a gunshot. Such a big hit and so well hit too. After not getting to the pitch, Washington Sundar seeing Rayudu come down, dragged it down, but Rayudu is seeing so well at the moment that he goes through with the pull and muscles it over deep mid

Washington Sundar to Rayudu, SIX, good cricket awareness from Rayudu as he knew Washington Sundar will pitch it up, he does and Rayudu swings through the line and cleanly to get another six over long-on

U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, he is in the mood. For sure. A length ball angling in, Rayudu stays back and just whips that off his pads, knew there was no-one back out there, the white ball sails into the crowd at deep backward square

Chahal to Rayudu, SIX, goes over deep cover. Rayudu didn't find it off the middle of the bat, but has got enough bat to send the ball soaring into the crowd over deep cover. Tough tough shot but Rayudu trusted his ability and played it supremely

Negi to Dhoni, SIX, crikey! We have seen everything from MS in this game. Never will play the big shot off just his second ball, but here he has done so and got six. Down the track to the tossed up delivery on leg, heaves into the deep mid fence. Off the mark with a biggie

Tahir to de Villiers, SIX, there comes the sweep. He has got outside the line as he sits and then takes it from around fourth stump line, sweeps and connects beautifully, sends it into the deep backward square leg fence. The ball just flew off the bat

Tahir to de Villiers, SIX, the ball is lost! Find a new one. If someone is outside the stadium near the deep mid stands, they can take that as a souvenir. And frame it and keep it for posterity sake. de Villiers does a Guptill as he sits down and then does not keep his eyes on the shot, the head looks down and the eyes away from the line of where the ball is going, where's the ball? Over the roof at deep mid. One hit in the last game came back in from there, but this is isn't. Monster hit! My colleague Akshay tells me that it is a 111-metre six - the biggest of the tournament so far

Watson to de Kock, SIX, massive blow and de Kock likes that. Has 50 and points at the base of his bat to someone in the dressing room. All done with a smile on his face. Makes room and the length ball is clattered miles into the deep mid-wicket stands. More of a golf-swing that from de Kock

SN Thakur to de Villiers, SIX, now 50 for AB. Just a raise of the bat and a glove-punch with de Kock to celebrate getting there. Picks the slower delivery and heaves it into the deep mid stands. The key was standing still and then going through with the shot
SN Thakur to de Villiers, SIX, another slower delivery and another six. Predictable from Thakur. Again de Villiers stays so still, doesn't move around at all, over long-on now. Clean and beautiful

SN Thakur to de Villiers, SIX, Thakur isn't learning at all. Third slower delivery, this was the knuckle delivery, he is overdoing it, de Villiers may have seen what he is doing, even if he hasn't, can pick it from the hand, the slower delivery lands outside off and with a swing of the bat, the ball is seen flying over wide long-off. What can this man not do on a cricket field? Absolutely nothing

Jadeja to Mandeep, SIX, almost an unbelievable catch. Boult snatched one in the last game. Billings just missing out with an incredible effort. Slogged in the air from outside off and Billings on the run from deep mid, stretched his right-hand out at full tilt but took the ball with him beyond the ropes. Had he caught that, would've been one of the all-time great catches

SN Thakur to Mandeep, SIX, brilliant shot. He is backing away and having to reach out but awesome timing on the lofted square drive. It was full and outside his reach, but somehow Mandeep got it over the deep point fence. All timing and the crowd have found their voice back

SN Thakur to Mandeep, SIX, bit of TR from Bumble. "Mandeep, Mandeep, goes deep." is his comment on air.
