Sheer power from Mandeep, waits for the shortish slower delivery, then flat-bats it with brute force and clears long-off easily. The key was knowing what Thakur will bowl and setting himself up for the shot. Perfectly executed

Dwayne Bravo to Washington Sundar, SIX, just over Tahir at deep mid. Washington Sundar slogging the slower delivery and managing to clear the leggie, when he hit it, looked like he holed out. Enough, just about to get a biggie

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, mauls this slower delivery over long-on. Made slight room to the off-pace delivery and then freed his arms to go big. Connected cleanly and there was never a doubt about the hit

Harbhajan to de Kock, SIX, de Kock has seen enough. Decides to take matters into his own hands. Such a difficult shot to play - against the spin to a turning ball, but de Kock nailed the shot to perfection. Down the track and to the pitch before hoisting it long over long-on. Again timed so well and it went way back into the stands

Harbhajan to de Villiers, SIX, de Villiers wants to make an impact. Takes on long-on and goes over his head. Uses his feet and then a clean swing of the bat. Rest you know. Sails into the stands. So effortless

Harbhajan to de Villiers, SIX, he played an absolute beauty of a shot against Nadeem in the last game. Does the same here. Makes room and goes in-to-out - one of the toughest shots in the business but de Villiers is a genius, makes it look so simple. Over extra-cover and just crosses the ropes for six. The crowd have gone mad at the Chinnaswamy

Jadeja to de Villiers, SIX, wow. So easy this is for de Villiers that it is absolutely ridiculous. Other mortals would have attempted to drive that through cover, but when de Villiers saw that tossed up delivery outside off he went down on his knee and swept it flat over deep square leg. The fielder was behind square and could only watch the ball go into the cushions
Dwayne Bravo to de Kock, SIX, straight back over Dwayne Bravo's head. Over the sightscreen. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery, stays till and smashes the ball for a biggie
Nabi to Gayle, SIX, down the track he comes and clobbers it! Just a casual swing of the arms to send it rocketing back over the bowler's head
Shakib to Finch, SIX, in the slot and goodnight! Fuller in length and Finchy likes it, tonks it many-a-mile over long-on
Nabi to Rahul, SIX, deep into the mid-wicket stands. He pounces on this short ball. Picks length up strikingly early, hops back and nails the pull away
Basil Thampi to Gayle, SIX, you brutal brutal beast. Clears his front leg and destroys this back of length delivery. It's gone soaring over long-on. Phew, enough to knock the wind out of a bowler
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, SIX, he's tonked this over mid-wicket. Finally the acceleration from Pandey. Picks the ball from outside off and slogs cleanly

Ashwin to Y Pathan, SIX, another one goes down, albeit a much difficult one. Mistimed slog from Pathan, Manoj Tiwary skirts along the square leg boundary, and then tips it over the ropes. His mind was occupied by his proximity to the ropes which made him fluff the chance too

Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, SIX, smashed, that's a long hop from Kuldeep, it was the attempted wrong 'un, sat up to be smacked. Munro stayed back and flat-batted the pull, high and over long-on for a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, ahh, the new DD captain doesn't think so. What a way to greet the mystery spinner in his new spell! Floated up around off, Iyer did well to go with the spin and executed the slog sweep beautifully. Easily over deep mid-wicket

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, launched over square leg! Shaw continues in his merry ways. Fractionally short in length and he swivels a touch before propelling this with a strong bottom hand. In the air for quite a while and had enough legs to clear the fence. He is switching gears here, is Shaw and DD do need to up the ante. Looks a good batting surface

Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's H-U-G-E! Into the top tier! Whoa, what a strike! Iyer has decided to join in the fun as well. Tossed up nicely by Chawla and it's blasted high down the ground. One of those sixes that had good height and distance. Lovely

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, absolutely bludgeoned! We have seen quite a bit of these flat-batted strokes tonight and this one from Iyer is another cracker. Shortish and outside off, he makes room a touch on the back foot and smears this over long-off. All the way

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, chance goes down! Uthappa the man at long-on, don't think he would have managed to stay inside the ropes even if he caught this. Fuller ball and it was lofted down the ground by Iyer. Didn't quite get the elevation on it anc went flat. Luckily for him, just about manages to go for a biggie. Brings up the 50 for Iyer! What a way to start his IPL captaincy stint!

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, scorching stroke! Iyer is going bonkers here. Expecting the shorter length and makes room before launching it over wide long-off. There was a fielder there but this was wider and higher as well. Back to back biggies for the skipper. He is having a ball on captaincy debut

Narine to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, dropped again! Rana is the man again and he fails to judge this skier well. Ends up tipping it over the ropes at long-on for a biggie. Floated up around middle, Iyer went for the lofted stroke down the ground and this went high up into the night sky before setting towards a confused Rana who ended up putting it down

Narine to Maxwell, SIX, gets hold of this one! Finally, Maxwell has middled one and sends this way over long-on for a six. Huge strike! Was backing away to make room and Narine shortened the length to help the Australian's cause. Blasted away over the long-on fence

Johnson to Maxwell, SIX, that's a flat hit! Tells you what one confident stroke can do. Maxwell is now striking them well. The short ball and he swivels to get inside the line before pulling over short fine leg. Clears the ropes as well

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, high in the air....well over the fence! Booming stroke! Mavi isn't hitting the right length, fuller ball outside off and Iyer was already making room for the inside out stroke. Sends this into orbit with that bat swing of his

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, makes no difference! It won't as well if he continues with this length, Mavi. Fullish attacking the sticks, Iyer just shuffles across a touch and sends this flying over deep mid-wicket for a biggie. Another six that had plenty of height on it. Two towering strikes! Perfect start to the over for DD

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massacred away! The Shreyas Iyer show continues. Full and in the slot, poor bowling and it's been punished as well. Shoveled away over deep mid-wicket for another huge six

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, ends the innings in style! Take a bow, Shreyas Iyer! Phenomenal stuff! Mavi loses his length (once more) and sprays this outside off on a good length, Iyer sits deep in the crease and flat-bats this merrily over long-off. What a way to finish! DD end on 219/4!

Narine to Munro, SIX, lovely from Munro, he's showing why he's the number one T20I batsman in the world. This was tossed up on the stumps, Munro bent down on his knees and swept it high and over deep mid-wicket, deep into the crowd for a maximum

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, the helicopter is out, MS will be proud of this shot. Length delivery on the stumps, Prithvi waits on it, then brings his wrists into play and flicks it stylishly over mid-wicket, all the way over the ropes
Maxwell to Narine, SIX, that ain't coming back. Woof! What.A.Strike.Sunil.Narine. Doesn't move an inch, keeps himself steady and lifts Maxwell high into the night sky. Way back over the sightscreen
Avesh Khan to A Russell, SIX, thwack, thwack, thwack! That ball had wings. Infact Russell lent wings to it. Short delivery, sat up and the batsman thumped the ball away over mid-wicket for a maximum

Avesh Khan to A Russell, SIX, Russell will go down fighting. Correction - swinging.. That was short, at the body from round the wicket but Russell was ready. Opens his stance, and then muscles the ball over the on-side for a huge six. The second tier stand at deep square leg was peppered

Boult to A Russell, SIX, Ho ho! This man. Brute.. That was in the zone, pitched up and the batsman backed away to murder that over long-on. The Russell show has started. Bring on your crash helmets, folks!!
Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, SIX, inside out and it is a mighty one! Flighted well outside off and the batsman gave it more air-time by plundering the ball over covers. DD will start to sweat
Boult to Narine, SIX, pressure? Narine just doesn't know what that means. Sets himself up for a shorter length delivery, clears his front leg and goes tonkkkkkkk straight of long-off
Boult to Narine, SIX, same result! Boult persists with the shorter length, Narine whistles it into the same area with a mighty bat swing
Plunkett to Karthik, SIX, short and in his arc. DK swivels a touch and plays the pick-up pull over short fine. All the way for a maximum

Vijay Shankar to Shubman Gill, SIX, time for Shubman Gill to show what he's got. Pitched up and right in the swinging zone outside off, Gill marmalizes it over long-off with a clean swing of the willow
McClenaghan to Rayudu, SIX, smashed. Down the track and to the pitch of the length delivery then lifts it straight back over the bowler. No holding back from Rayudu and he gets the crowd going

Markande to Dhoni, SIX, massacred over wide long-on. Again those hands. Down the track and then helicoptered miles into the crowd. The CSK crowd are sent into pangs of uncontrolled emotion. They are going wild

Bumrah to Raina, SIX, my word. What a blow that is. The weight is on the back foot but he has powered this slower delivery over wide long-on. Looked like he had hit it straight up but it went all the way

Hardik Pandya to Raina, SIX, Raina ends in style and takes six. Hardik Pandya and Rohit are disappointed. This is a fabulous shot. Even though Hardik Pandya followed him, Raina after making room outside leg, heaved that over wide long-on flat with power to clear the fence. CSK end on 169

Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, SIX, how has Rayudu got that for six? Unbelievable wrists. Down the track and not to the pitch of this length delivery, but he trusts himself and then whips it in the air, Evin Lewis was the man circling under that at deep mid, but it kept sailing over him and then flies over the fence. Stunning batting by Rayudu

Krunal Pandya to Raina, SIX, second ball and Raina takes Krunal Pandya to the deep mid stands. The trademark Raina slog-sweep, as soon as he saw a bit of flight on that tossed up delivery on off, bent down and clattered it. Nice way to get off the mark
Hardik Pandya to Rayudu, SIX, nothing edgy about this one. Full on off, a clean bat swing from Rayudu and the white ball soars into the long-off stands. Great end to the powerplay for CSK and Rayudu
Cutting to Rayudu, SIX, Cutting ran in hard and then bowled a slower delivery, was right in the lofting zone for Rayudu who got forward and muscled it over long-on. Six more

Markande to Raina, SIX, beautiful shot this. Uses his feet and then goes over long-on after getting to the pitch. Hardik was there at long-on but he was left a spectator by the timing on that blow. The CSK WAGS are up and celebrating

Tahir to Lewis, SIX, carves this googly high and mighty over extra cover. Probably a bit too predictable from the leggie. This is what he was doing against Lewis in the entire last over. This time Lewis anticipates it, sizes it up and smokes it
Tahir to Lewis, SIX, my word, what power down the ground. Short from Tahir, Lewis thwacks it straight back over long-on. It's off the back foot too. Stunning

Watson to Rohit, SIX, lofted for six with one hand. How well has he timed this. It appeared that Rohit might have been beaten for the lack of pace and was into the loft too early, evidenced by his bottom hand coming off. But mid-off was up, so he had the confidence to go through with it. Ends up getting it right off the middle

Watson to Rohit, SIX, wow, what execution! Gets right under this full ball and lap-sweeps it all the way over short fine leg. Just never looks hurried at all. Quickly took a step across, got down low and again, lovely timing

Watson to Hardik Pandya, SIX, misses his length big time and Pandya laaaaaunches into it. It's a monstrous six over long-on. Probably aimed for the yorker there but ended up bowling right in Pandya's slot. Disappears

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, wow! That's delicious. The bottom hand power, my goodness. Was a full ball on the pads, Yadav just walked across and flicked it over deep backward square leg. Top shot
Rashid Khan to Rahane, SIX, and there. Crunch. Targets the smaller leg-side, premeditates a sweep, slogging it uppishly, deep into mid-wicket. That should simplify things

Basil Thampi to Samson, SIX, that's in the stands! Samson is showing no mercy on his State mate. Fractionally short from Thampi and that's all that was needed for the in-form Samson. Swivels to pull this away for a biggie. Didn't get a full chunk of it, didn't have to in the end as it cleared the deep mid-wicket fence with ease

Unadkat to Williamson, SIX, Fab stuff. Goes downtown. Moved across a bit, with a clean swing of the bat lifted it nonchalantly over mid-off. Such is the timing that it went sailing all the way for a maximum
Jofra Archer to Williamson, SIX, decides to launch Archer over mid-off. Waited in his crease, picked this fuller length delivery early and muscled it over mid-off

U Yadav to Narine, SIX, effortless from Narine, back of a length and just outside off, a gentle loosener from Umesh, Narine stands tall and punches it over mid-off, sailed all the way over the ropes for a maximum
Chahal to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa's looking ominous. He sizes up this overpitched delivery, gets his front leg out of the way and swings through the line. Clean six into the sightscreen
U Yadav to Uthappa, SIX, smashes this into the crowd. 143kph, short of length around the waist, Uthappa treats it with disdain. He belts it away from his presence. Gee that flew off the bat
Siraj to Karthik, SIX, puts the seal on it. Crushing blow from Dinesh Karthik. He's offered a good length ball from Siraj, sets himself up and drills it over mid-off. Just over the ropes
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, length ball on the stumps, that was right in the slot for Lynn, he cleared his left leg and hammered it back over the bowler's head, flat and over the ropes

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, just over CDG, this was tossed up on off, Uthappa got a big stride forward and lifted it with the turn, high and towards long-on. CDG looked very interested for the catch, went with his outstretched right hand, but only tipped it over the ropes
Narine to Mandeep, SIX, brilliant slog-sweep. Over deep mid. Too full and tossed up outside off, Mandeep kneels down and finds the biggie that his side needs

Narine to Mandeep, SIX, fine blow. Two big hits from Mandeep in this over and both have come when it has been tossed up and in the teeing off range. This time Mandeep goes straight back over the bowler's head. Good over for RCB - 15 off it

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, Kohli is pointing his finger at someone. After hitting that for six over long-on. Full and in the slot, Kohli unleashes the short-arm jabbed flick that sends the ball over the crowd. We saw MSD do that against Negi in the last game, but this is trademark Kohli. How does he get under the ball with such a low backlift and generate so much power is incredibly unbelievable

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, now he raises the bat to celebrate. Back of the hand slower delivery from Russell, but too full and Kohli gets under this and directs the short-arm jab flat wide of long-on. Brilliant brilliant use of the wrists. That's all one can say

Johnson to de Grandhomme, SIX, missed the yorker and goes for six. Turns out to be a slower delivery, de Grandhomme sits down and slices it over the sweeper, gets enough on it to go all the way. Kohli likes it and roars 'come on'

Johnson to Kohli, SIX, six to end. Shuffles across and inside the line, too predictable, slower delivery again, Kohli swings it to the deep backward square leg fence. No-one there and anyway it has the legs to go over the fence. RCB end with 175

Johnson to de Kock, SIX, Johnson has a wry smile at de Kock. Won't help though. Pace on the ball and off the bat as well. Full on middle, de Kock makes room and goes over cover, hit well and just about clears the ropes

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, SIX, when it is tossed up, Brendon McCullum will look to play over mid-wicket. That's his signature shot. Sit down and then slog-sweep the spinner. Connects beautifully and loops over deep mid

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, muscled. Dragged down by Chawla and Brendon McCullum decides to go over long-on. Pure power from the Kiwi. Biffed that off the back foot and watched the ball go over long-on. 14 to him off Chawla in that over and he gets a move on

Mishra to Dhoni, SIX, thumped away! Floated googly and fuller outside off, Dhoni was on the charge and although this was wider in line, he trusted his strong bottom hand to launch. And launch he did, flat over long-off

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, that's gone all the way! How flat he is sending this into the stands?? Wow! Fractionally short and slower in pace, Dhoni just swivels and absolutely cracks this pull over deep mid-wicket. He is looking ominous straightaway

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, kaboooooom! Another one! Dhoni is on the rampage now. Fuller in length around off, he just stands deep in the crease and belts this over long-on. Comfortably clears the fielder over there. The skipper is infusing momentum back into the innings

Plunkett to Rayudu, SIX, that's glorious from Rayudu! Talk about being in ripe form, this is another example of it. Premeditates the charge down the pitch and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Dead straight and comfortably over the ropes

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, SIX, that's deep into the crowd! After a series of good deliveries, Avesh loses his composure. Tries the yorker to be fair to him but it ends up as a juicy full toss. Clubbed away way over deep square leg. 108 meters it is! Second longest one of the tournament

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, no he cannot! Because he is bowling to someone who is in insane hitting form this season. Misses the yorker and it's a low full toss, Dhoni just uses his quick hands and it's a short arm jab. Comfortably over deep square leg. No effort at all there

Plunkett to Watson, SIX, short ball, journey ball! That has gone into the stands. The batsman does not bother to go on the back foot and pulls it off the front foot. That was a bad bad delivery and the deep square leg region was peppered with the sinews working in tandem

Plunkett to Watson, SIX, pick up off the pads. And the spectators pick it in the stands. Onto the hips as it angled in and the batsman just clipped the ball away with a lot of nonchalance to soar it over deep backward square. Back-to-back sixes for Watto

Plunkett to du Plessis, SIX, Faf now rubs more salt into the bleeding wounds of Plunkett. Shuffles across and shovels the ball away over fine leg for a sixer. Pretty much like the last game here, there is a lot of carry

Avesh Khan to Watson, SIX, top-edge! Six! Gosh! Over long-on. That was unbelieveable. The short ball, the batsman seemed to be slightly late on it and the ball flew away over long-on fence. Incredible
Plunkett to Watson, SIX, full ball, buh-bye ball! That has been spanked down the ground over long-off for a maximum! He can hit that blindfold. Overpitched and the batsman just timed it

Plunkett to Watson, SIX, strays on to the pads and clipped away over fine leg. Fifth six for Watson. This ball is flying off the bat. Bad bowling this from Plunkett, who has gone for tons of runs already

Rahul Tewatia to Watson, SIX, short ball, the batsman drops down on to one knee and pulls the ball away over fine leg for a sixer. Fifty for Watson! That was a terrible delivery but what hitting from the burly all-rounder

Rahul Tewatia to Watson, SIX, whatta catch! But from one of the spectators. That went miles into the stands over cow corner. Slightly fuller length ball and the batsman knelt down to power the sweep away. Seventh six of the innings for Watson
Jadeja to Pant, SIX, Gee! Quick hands from Pant, he picks up the length early, reaches the pitch of the ball and deposits in the stands at deep mid-wicket

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, Pant finally connects one and when he connects it, ball stays hit. A great hit though. Flat-batted slog over the fence. He goes on the knees and strikes it cleanly, ball sails over long-on for a maximum

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, Vijay Shankar just puts enough power in the shot to send it over the ropes. It was in the fuller length zone, perfect length to hit. Vijay Shankar goes back in his crease and tonks it over long-on for a six
KM Asif to Pant, SIX, fast hands from Pant come into play again. You cannot bowl length ball at this stage and KM Asif does that exactly, Pant picks it up over square leg for a maximum

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, mighty swing of the bat, timing very good, but all too late? Slower delivery on the stumps, Shankar gets down on one knee and lofts it over long-on. Looks like Rayudu isn't happy with Dwayne Bravo for bowling a ball in the slot, earlier he was hinting to the bowling to bowl a bouncer

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, short ball and smashed. Back-to-back sixes. Why didn't you do this when Pant was going great guns? Would have been of great help. Anyway, this is a pull shot sweetly timed over mid-wicket. Now Rayudu is livid, he wants Dwayne Bravo to nail the yorker

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, and another one, clean hits, but the intent should have been there earlier for DD to have a real chance. Slower ball again, Shankar muscles this loft over long-on. This knock will do a world of good to Vijay Shankar's confidence. Meanwhile, MS was shaking his head

Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, SIX, now then, now then! He isn't done yet! Raises the fifty and DD can mathematically still do this. 20 needed from 4 balls. Backs away to this shortish ball and pulls over mid-wicket

Watson to Munro, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Watson getting a taste of his own medicine. Wafted it full just outside off, Munro with a solid base on leg-stump, gets under it and with strong wrists, whacks it into the deep mid stands. Into the crowd

KM Asif to Munro, SIX, Asif getting some pasting from Munro here. 14 runs off the last three balls. The intent was fine but the execution went haywire. Banged it short, no purpose on it and allowed Munro to free his arms. Arched his back slightly and ramped it over the cordon. More off the edge but it went flat and hit the ad cushions on the full. They checked with the third umpire and it was confirmed on the replays
Watson to Pant, SIX, woah. Pant wasting no time. Gets into the business straightaway. Full on the stumps, Pant gets under it and whiplashes it over cow corner. Into the stands
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, off the mark for six. Again tossed up on leg, Vohra this time slog-sweeps and hits it way back over the stands at deep backward square. The crowd getting catching practice
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, SIX, no edges this time. Down the track and over deep mid. Didn't get to the pitch but once it is in his range, he decides to deposit the tossed up delivery into the stands

Bumrah to Mandeep, SIX, smashed. Over deep mid. Picks the slower delivery and then smears it powerfully over mid-wicket. With all his body weight going into the shot. Sends the RCB-pro crowd into delights of joy

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, SIX, that's what he can do. Actually is in tremendous form in the international circuit but hasn't replicated that in this IPL. But mauls this cutter high into the stands at deep mid. Stayed back and gave it his all

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, SIX, and he finishes with a six. This is a tremendous over for RCB. Watches the slower delivery and carves it high and wide over long-off. Pure power and CdG ends the innings in style. Boy o boy did RCB need that or what

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, no ball, SIX, wow! What's more it is a no-ball as well. For height. Over the waist. Full-toss gone wrong and he has belted that into the crowd at deep square. That hit brings the ladies on their feet - with one even whistling away to glory
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, too full. So when it is so full, Vohra can get under that. No chance for the ball doing anything off the pitch too. Vohra gets forward and laces the loft over long-off. Easy

Duminy to Vohra, SIX, this is the best of the lot. Similar delivery to the last one and now Vohra goes over deep cover. Again Duminy keeps flighting it and doesn't pull the length back too, hammered in-to-out by Vohra. Shows how much talent he has and why Yuvraj Singh was wowing about him when he was in KXIP
Markande to Vohra, SIX, fine slog-sweep. Nails it from the meat of the bat. Knelt down and timed it well enough to clear Cutting at deep mid. Who watches the ball sail over

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, SIX, the McScoop! Ridiculous batting. Saw him do this to Tait who was bowling at the speed of light in a T20I - if I'm right at Eden Park, New Zealand - when he made a hundred. He just put off Tait that day with some unbelievable shots. This he sets up a good base, takes the full-toss from middle and ramps it over Ishan Kishan's head. All the way too

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, no ball, SIX, my word. What was that from Hardik Pandya? Must have slipped out of the hand. Above waist-height full-toss as Brendon McCullum was advancing, it takes the thickish edge and hits the cushion on the full at third man. Only McCullum can play such a shot to a delivery that was threatening to take his head off
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, off the mark for six. Again tossed up on leg, Vohra this time slog-sweeps and hits it way back over the stands at deep backward square. The crowd getting catching practice
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, SIX, no edges this time. Down the track and over deep mid. Didn't get to the pitch but once it is in his range, he decides to deposit the tossed up delivery into the stands

Bumrah to Mandeep, SIX, smashed. Over deep mid. Picks the slower delivery and then smears it powerfully over mid-wicket. With all his body weight going into the shot. Sends the RCB-pro crowd into delights of joy

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, SIX, that's what he can do. Actually is in tremendous form in the international circuit but hasn't replicated that in this IPL. But mauls this cutter high into the stands at deep mid. Stayed back and gave it his all

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, SIX, and he finishes with a six. This is a tremendous over for RCB. Watches the slower delivery and carves it high and wide over long-off. Pure power and CdG ends the innings in style. Boy o boy did RCB need that or what

McClenaghan to de Grandhomme, no ball, SIX, wow! What's more it is a no-ball as well. For height. Over the waist. Full-toss gone wrong and he has belted that into the crowd at deep square. That hit brings the ladies on their feet - with one even whistling away to glory
Duminy to Vohra, SIX, too full. So when it is so full, Vohra can get under that. No chance for the ball doing anything off the pitch too. Vohra gets forward and laces the loft over long-off. Easy

Duminy to Vohra, SIX, this is the best of the lot. Similar delivery to the last one and now Vohra goes over deep cover. Again Duminy keeps flighting it and doesn't pull the length back too, hammered in-to-out by Vohra. Shows how much talent he has and why Yuvraj Singh was wowing about him when he was in KXIP
Markande to Vohra, SIX, fine slog-sweep. Nails it from the meat of the bat. Knelt down and timed it well enough to clear Cutting at deep mid. Who watches the ball sail over

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, SIX, the McScoop! Ridiculous batting. Saw him do this to Tait who was bowling at the speed of light in a T20I - if I'm right at Eden Park, New Zealand - when he made a hundred. He just put off Tait that day with some unbelievable shots. This he sets up a good base, takes the full-toss from middle and ramps it over Ishan Kishan's head. All the way too

Hardik Pandya to Brendon McCullum, no ball, SIX, my word. What was that from Hardik Pandya? Must have slipped out of the hand. Above waist-height full-toss as Brendon McCullum was advancing, it takes the thickish edge and hits the cushion on the full at third man. Only McCullum can play such a shot to a delivery that was threatening to take his head off

Jofra Archer to Pant, SIX, clubbed away! Such power from Pant, he's made it look so easy but trust me, it wasn't. Fullish ball from Archer and he errs to land it in Pant's arc, merrily swung away over wide long-on with all the nonchalance in the world. Went deep into the crowd

Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's massive! Iyer has absolutely clouted this. Shuffles across the stumps a bit and this is flat from Gowtham, full as well and disappears over deep mid-wicket. Huge hit

D Kulkarni to Pant, SIX, wow, this is unbelievable. It's a top edge but it's gone well over the keeper down the leg-side and into the crowd. Short ball and Pant swivelled to pull it but couldn't quite control it. Eventually, trying to just use the pace helped him and of course, the shorter boundaries here at the Kotla

Stokes to Pant, SIX, launched well over deep cover! It's raining boundaries here, doesn't matter where they are bowling. Pant is on another level at the moment. Fullish ball outside off, he didn't get the whole of this lofted stroke but still sliced it way over deep cover

Unadkat to Pant, SIX, Pant is now the top run scorer in IPL 2018! What a time he is having! This one wasn't middled well but who cares, it's way over deep mid-wicket for a biggie. Fuller ball well wide outside off, Pant still fetches it to clear the ropes
Jofra Archer to Vijay Shankar, SIX, Shankar gets into the act. Short of a length that sits up nicely for him. He backs away a touch and swings over deep mid-wicket

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, pick and drop ala Shaw style. That was a length ball on the pads and the batsman powers the ball off the pads for a six over deep mid-wicket. Just a short arm jab and the ball was wristed away

D Kulkarni to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, drops the ball short and Prithvi Shaw is on to it in a jiffy. This tiny little ticking time bomb just shifts his base on the back foot and pulls the ball away over mid-on. That was smacked

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, wow! Just wow! This man is a powerhouse. That was just punched. Maybe a dropkick of a punch drive and the ball just kept on going and going. It easily sailed over the man at long-off. Slightly pulled back length and the batsman had no hesitation in going through with the shot and hitting it through the line

Shreyas Gopal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, bowled at 116ks that! The quick hands come down on it like a house on fire and explodes the ball over widish long-on. He tried bowling it quick, the batsman got a length to get under it and muscled it away
Shreyas Gopal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, short ball, same result. This time off the back foot. The batsman waited on this and hammered the pull over cow corner for a maximum. That just went over the ropes
Shreyas Gopal to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, chips down the track and bang over covers for a sixer! Got to the pitch of the ball and then bulldozed it with all his sinews working in tandem. This guy! Phew!

Shreyas Gopal to Pant, SIX, full, tossed up wide outside off and drop-kicked with all the non-chalance in the world. The long-on area peppered this time. The length allowed the batsman to get under the ball and send it on a journey
Nadeem to Buttler, SIX, follows it with a maximum. He shuffles across to the off-side and slog-sweeps it over the deep square leg for a six. Clean striking from the England batsmam

Plunkett to Gowtham, SIX, back of a length slower ball, Gowtham picks it off the hand, he waited and waited for the ball to arrive, gets himself in a decent position and tonks it over deep mid-wicket for a six
Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, Buttler has deposited it into the stands. It was a fuller length ball and Buttler lofts it with a straight bat over the bowler's head for a sixer
Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, Buttler shuffles to the off-side slightly and scoops this fuller length ball over short fine leg for a maximum. Second six of the over
Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, Buttler was deep in his crease and he gets himself in a good position and slogs it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum. Buttler is on fire here
Plunkett to Buttler, SIX, it was the slower ball outside off, Buttler picks it off the hand and dispatches it over extra cover for a maximum

Mishra to Buttler, SIX, fifty off just 18 balls -- the fastest ever by a RR batsman in IPL. This has been a ripper of an innings. It was a full toss and Buttler takes out the reverse sweeps and sends it into the crowd - behind square on the off-side. Second IPL fifty for Buttler this, after 77 for MI vs KXIP in Indore in 2017

Avesh Khan to Buttler, SIX, it was raining 30 minutes back at Kotla and it's raining sixes now. Buttler shuffles in the crease a bit to disturb the length of the bowler, his base was stable and more importantly his connection was clean. Ball has gone into the stands over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Plunkett to D Arcy Short, SIX, D Arcy Short finally connects one. This was long due from his bat. It was on a good length and on the pads, D Arcy Short moves slightly to the leg-side and powers it over deep mid-wicket for a six. Rajasthan need more of these from his blade, if they have to travel to Jaipur with 2 points
Maxwell to D Arcy Short, SIX, picks up the short length quickly, gets in a good position and deposits it over deep square leg for a six

Maxwell to D Arcy Short, SIX, this has been a dismal bowling change from Iyer. It was touch fuller, D Arcy Short uses his power and timing after using feet and sends the ball into the crowd again. Over the head of the bowler
Maxwell to D Arcy Short, SIX, quicker delivery outside off, D Arcy Short was deep in the crease, connection was terrific and ball sails into the crowd. Bludgeoned over long-off

Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, SIX, Watson flexes his muscles and tonks one straight over Kuldeep's head for a maximum. Thrown well outside off, Watson fetches it from there after bending low and slammed it beautifully straight down the ground. Ruins a good over from Kuldeep

Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, SIX, too many short deliveries and MS puts one into the stands. Was getting too predictable there. Shortish in length around off, Dhoni picks it up early and deposits a flat six over the mid-wicket fence. Sweet sound on that blow

Johnson to Dhoni, SIX, that's a flat six again. Short of a length on leg, Dhoni swivels quickly and pulls it to perfection over the square leg boundary. That went to the fence at the speed of light, none of the fielders had any time to even react

Johnson to Dhoni, SIX, that's high. That's handsome. On a length on middle and leg, Dhoni stays put and towers this over long-on for six more. Rinku Singh at the fence was just a mere spectator. The crowd is loving this, when MS is in such form everybody does!

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, dropped! How costly will that dropped catch prove to be? Was a shortish delivery around off, Dhoni pulled it hard to deep square leg where Gill lets it through his palms. Tried to reverse cup it and made a mess of it
Johnson to du Plessis, SIX, du Plessis is looking in fine touch. Sees a short ball, backs away and gets under it to smoke it over deep backward square leg stands. Into the crowd

Johnson to Watson, SIX, proper pasting for Johnson in this over. 19 runs off it and just the momentum CSK were looking for. Went short, no real threat behind it. Watson swivels across, taking his eyes off the ball and pulls it over short fine leg. Sweet timing and it flies all the way for a maximum

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, SIX, into the stands and the crowd are on their feet. Picks the length early on this short one and swivels quickly to pull that over square leg. Was on to his pull in a flash on that occasion

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Lynn. This was a full length delivery on middle, Lynn stayed rooted and timed his loft right over the bowler. Straight as an arrow and over the boundary ropes
KM Asif to Narine, SIX, that's the first one by Narine tonight. Was a shortish delivery around off and Narine cleared his front leg to club it nonchalantly over long-on

KM Asif to Shubman Gill, SIX, that's a stunning shot! That's gone a long way back. His highest score in IPL. Picked the length (short) early, got into a good position on the back foot and muscled the pull over deep square leg. Right off the meat of the bat. Picked it up beautifully

KM Asif to Shubman Gill, SIX, excellent effort from Rayudu, gets a hand on it, but can only parry it over the cushions. Short ball on off, quick hands from Gill who upper-cuts it behind square. Rayudu sprints across to his right from third man and flew with his right hand out to pluck, in vain

KM Asif to Karthik, SIX, 21 off the over and the asking rate has come down to 7.4. KKR are surely the favourites now. The inexperienced Asif bangs one short, but slightly errs in line. Leg-stumpish and Karthik takes heavy toll of it. Walks across and helps it along its way with a hook over fine leg
Jadeja to Narine, SIX, Narine won't hang around blocking. Definitely not against a left-arm spinner. Was bulleted on off, Narine stood tall and smoked it over cow corner. Swung hard

McClenaghan to Rahul, SIX, lovely, Rahul has been in sensational form this IPL and this was a gift from McClenaghan, full and wide of off, lets Rahul free his arms and lift it high and over cover, into the first tier of the stands

Bumrah to Rahul, SIX, cracking shot, this is an exhibition from KL, a gentle loosener from Bumrah, full and well outside off, Rahul leans forward, presents the full face of the bat, high elbow and the ball sails into the first tier of the stands at cover

Krunal Pandya to Yuvraj, SIX, vintage Yuvi! Greets Krunal to the crease with a maximum. Floated up in the swinging arc for him, Yuvraj gets under it and smokes it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Too easy

Cutting to Nair, SIX, whack! Too predictable lengths from Cutting. The slower ball, tad shorter. Nair picked it up early, employs his strong bottom-hand into play to muscle it over deep mid-wicket, clears the rope for a maximum
Markande to Axar, SIX, Axar decides to have some fun. Markande overdoes the flight here. Feeds it full and in the slot for Axar, who flexes his arms and tonks it a long way into the long-on stands

McClenaghan to Nair, SIX, wowza! Nair sends one into the first tier. Poor delivery from McClenaghan, short without any purpose. Nair moves across his sticks, gets under it and hammers it behind square on the leg-side. Wonderful!

Cutting to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, in the airrr and just clears a leaping Rohit. A handy six for Agarwal and Punjab. Pitched up just outside off, Agarwal went through with the loft with a clean swing of the bat, enough wings on it to take it over the ropes at long-off

Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, SIX, "That's the 500th six of the tournament," informs Sanjay Manjrekar on air. Hardik offers a full ball in the slot, Stoinis sets up a solid base of off and launches it over long-off

Hardik Pandya to Stoinis, SIX, awful from Hardik. Cannot bowl short with third man inside the ring. Stoinis knew the fielder was in, so went back and ramped it over short third man. Such is the timing that it went all the way for a maximum

McClenaghan to Gayle, SIX, massive, Gayle has sent this ball into the roof of the Holkar Stadium. Banged in short and at the stumps, Gayle backs away, frees his arms and muscles it high and over square leg. This one will not come back, new balls please
Markande to Gayle, SIX, huge and that's into the top tier of the ground, too full and too wide from Markande, Gayle gets underneath the ball and sends it soaring - high and over cover for a maximum

Ashwin to Ishan Kishan, SIX, muscled away! Much-needed release stroke for Kishan. He was crawling along and this should help. Fired flat and on a good length, Kishan was down on one knee in a flash and slog swept hard. Flat over deep square leg for a biggie. Nicely struck

Stoinis to Ishan Kishan, SIX, helps it away for a biggie! Stoinis spoils the over with a short ball around leg stump, doesn't rise enough to threaten Kishan who swivels to just control the pull. The emphasis was to just use the pace and get it over short fine leg. In the end, it went all the way

Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's gone deep into the crowd! Best over of the chase thus far and MI needed this to be fair. Mujeeb is under pressure now. Full and flat just outside off, Kishan fetches it with a slog sweep over deep mid-wicket. Meaty blow!

Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, SIX, dumped into the stands! Hardik Pandya has been promoted to up the ante and he is at it. Makes a hint of room and gets a fuller ball in his arc, smokes it into orbit at long-on. Powerful hit!

Mujeeb to Rohit, SIX, this will help MI! The skipper tees off and clears the fence with ease. Fullish and in the slot, flatter trajectory helped Rohit as he clubbed it dead straight over the bowler's head. Lovely placement too as you cannot have a fielder there. Not that it would have mattered

Mujeeb to Rohit, SIX, what a gigantic strike! Rohit is in the mood tonight, that's for sure. Shuffles a tad across the stumps and gets a fuller ball closer his arc. Goes through with that classy bat swing of his to send this way into the crowd at deep mid-wicket. 14 off the over! MI are hanging on here

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, M-A-S-S-I-V-E! What a blow by Krunal! This over has most certainly sealed the game for Mumbai. Excellent hitting under pressure from these two. Stoinis errs on the fuller side once more and feeds it right where Krunal was wanting it. He backed away, cleared his front leg and deposited it over long-on for a mammoth six

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, SIX, he has absolutely blasted this away! Krunal is hitting them with such ferocity and also clearing the fence by some margin as well. Fuller ball on middle and leg, he was backing away and slogs it merrily over the ropes. Such a huge hit and with such power. Wow!

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, over Mayank's ambitious one-handed leap at deep square leg! Was pulled away by Suryakumar Yadav. Short and at 132ks isn't going to threaten him on this pitch. So he swivels, without bothering to keep the shot down and gets it all the way
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that's been picked up like a bestseller on the shelf. Length on the pads and Suryakumar Yadav's lovely wrists come into play. Whipped all the way over deep square

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, going...going...going..GONE! That was in the nightsky for an eternity and yet had enough distance to go deep into the crowd. Clean hit! Full and in the slot for Suryakumar who just goes through the line with the loft. Didn't seem like he got hold of it initally but boy, didn't he??

Siraj to Shorey, SIX, that ruins the over. Tries to scare the debutant with a short delivery, but Shorey has made a clean connection with the hook shot, got inside the line and used the pace on the ball to place it over fine leg
Murugan Ashwin to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, that should relieve the pressure off Bravo, a rank long hop from Ashwin, Bravo rocks back and nails the pull over wide long-on, went a long way over the ropes

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, massive, that should seal this match. This was the wrong 'un from Chahal, Dhoni spots it early, gets a big stride forward, plays with the turn and smashes it high and over deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, that should be it, this was tossed up well outside off, Dhoni gets forward and thumps it high towards long-on, didn't get hold of the shot, Kohli at long-off was kept interested, but in the end - the ball sailed over his head

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Dhoni, hitting of the highest order from the former India captain. This was tossed up on off, Dhoni gets forward and thumps it high and over long-on for a maximum

U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, that is what pace brings. Rayudu is hardly in control of the pull shot, but the ball has sailed away for a maximum. Rushed the batsman with a short ball and the top-edge flies over the CSK dugout

Southee to Rayudu, SIX, wrong length from Southee. The off-cutter is landed short of length, sat up for Rayudu, who gave it his all to smash the pull over mid-wicket, the in-form batsman has broken the shackles for the home side

Siraj to Raina, SIX, that's the pressure releaser. Needed a boundary or something to get himself going. Backed away to leg and got the length delivery right in his arc, swung it away over long-on. Not quite off the middle but still had enough

SN Thakur to Southee, SIX, mighty blow from Southee. So this is why he is denying the single on offer. Backing himself to club a few and does so this time in style. Slightly short and slow from Shardul, pulled away over deep square leg after a slight shuffle. Handy runs these

Willey to Parthiv Patel, SIX, he's hit this all the way over long-on. Backs away and makes some room whilst doing so, meaning he could pump the ball away even though Willey was bringing it in wide of the crease
Lungi Ngidi to Parthiv Patel, SIX, read the cutter nicely here. Shifted just outside the line of the ball, which is on middle-stump say, and picked it up -- all the way! -- over backward square

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, that's a beautiful shot. On a length outside off, Shaw stands tall, reaches for the widish delivery and towers it over long-on for half a dozen. No one has treated Sandeep in such a way so far in the tournament

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, rubbing salt on the wounds. Flighted ball outside off, Iyer goes inside out and chips it to perfection over wide long-off. The fielder tried hard, but the ball just cleared the fence
Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this should ease Shankar's nerves. Much-needed hit for DD. Bhuvneshwar overdoes it; full and outside off, Shankar lines up and smacks it with ferocity over long-on
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, greets Shakib with a glorious shot. Tossed up delivery outside off, Shaw leans forward and times his chip over covers for six more, that's his second one of the night

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, he's picking those slower deliveries, those knuckle balls to perfection. This was a full one outside off and Shaw simply smoked it over long-off. Third one of the night for him, he's approaching another fifty

Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's into the stands! Iyer joins the party, scores his first maximum of the night. Gets to the pitch of the ball and sends it sailing over the man at long-on for a perfectly timed six

Avesh Khan to Williamson, SIX, superb shot! Bouncer well outside off, a slight move across from Williamson, followed by an upper cut over third man. Both his feet off-ground when he made contact with the ball. Classy shot. Timing and placement was spot on
Boult to Y Pathan, SIX, that's a massive hit! Picked the slower ball, was in his slot, and then butchered it over long-on. Fullish and misses his yorker. 22 off 11 now

Christian to Y Pathan, SIX, oh, Christian, what have you done. A full toss and gets the treatment it deserved. Was slightly outside off, Pathan crouches low, got underneath and bludgeoned it over long-on. Poses for the photographs as well. Stylish..

Avesh Khan to Dhawan, SIX, bang! "Don't ball short to me," seemed like the body language of Dhawan. Knew what was coming, was ready on the back foot as he muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands
Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, no respite for Avesh whatsoever. Tests Alex with a short ball, much like Hales he gets under it and blasts the pull over the mid-wicket fence

Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, this is turning out to be an expensive over for DD. Went full outside off, Hales jumped across and lifted it over mid-off. Not off the sweet spot but enough to take it all the way for a maximum

Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, 27 runs off the over. Avesh has been taken to the cleaners. Drops it short on seeing Hales move to leg. Hales throws it bat and smashes it over the in-field on the off-side. Sails over the ropes by a few inches. Just the momentum SRH needed at the end of Powerplay

Bumrah to Karthik, SIX, what about the height on this full toss? Looked like it was below the waist. This time Karthik makes hay. Slogs it over deep mid-wicket, where Milne is trying to catch that one-handed and leaping. Well over him

McClenaghan to Nitish Rana, SIX, short, wide and six, the plan was to bowl short at Rana, McClenaghan had a backward point and a fielder square at point, but this was too short and too wide. Rana got on top of the bounce, used McClenaghan's pace and lashed it over the head of third man

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, SIX, beautifully played, he pre-empted that Krunal was flighting this one, backed away, gets underneath the length and lifts it back over the bowler, clears the sightscreen and it's Uthappa's first maximum

Markande to Uthappa, SIX, 4000 IPL runs for Uthappa, this is excellent cricket, tossed up nicely outside off, it was the wrong 'un and Uthappa spotted it early, got a big stride forward, hit it with the spin and into the crowd at wide long-on

Markande to Uthappa, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Uthappa, Markande drifts this one wider of off, Uthappa gets forward and thumps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for another maximum, 17 from the over

Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, one-handed six for Pandya. Tossed it up on off, Pandya used his reach to get to the ball and just went through with the loft, the bottom hand comes off and the ball sails over long-off

Narine to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Narine became a bit predictable there. Bowling offies on back of a length, Pandya waited back in the crease and then slotted the heave over wide long-on. Enough legs to carry over the rope

Narine to Duminy, SIX, Duminy needs to kick on here. He knew what Narine was doing - bowling back of a length, so he moved across his sticks and muscled the pull over deep mid-wicket. Had to manufacture all the power and he got enough to clear the man

Johnson to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, in the air and goes all the way! The man in the deep was interested, but the ball goes well over his head. The bouncer from Johnson and Suryakumar Yadav was hurried by the pace. Still goes with the pull shot and gets a fat top-edge. Had enough wood to clear deep backward square leg

Prasidh to Lewis, SIX, nicely done! If Lewis gets going, it'll be tough to stop him. Krishna pounds in a shortish delivery. Lewis is expecting that. Stays back in his crease and pulls it over backward square leg with a swivel. First six for the West Indian

Chawla to Lewis, SIX, my goodness! That was absolutely murdered. A juicy loopy full toss upfront from Chawla. There is no way Lewis was missing that. Moves slightly off-side and clouts it over deep square leg. That's colossal

Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, good use of the feet from Suryakumar Yadav. Puts on the dancing shoes, gets close to the pitch of the ball and swings his bat hard in the direction of the spin. Into the deep mid-wicket stands. Clean strike
Anureet Singh to Nair, SIX, drifts it on leg-stump and that's been handsomely picked up over long leg. Cross-seamed and skidding on, so Nair had the pace to work with

Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, connects well this time! Stoinis was getting foxed a bit and decides to transfer the pressure right back on the bowler. Tossed up once more but this was in his arc, he lofted straight through the line over the bowler's head. Into the sightscreen. Relieves the pressure a touch for KXIP

Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, that's gone all the way! What a shot! That too under pressure! Mind you this shortish length ball clocked 145kph but that's also what aided Rahul here. He stays back and upper cuts it over short third man. Deep into the crowd. Just the over KXIP wanted to ease a few nerves in the dug out. What a way to get to fifty! Top knock but he knows that the job isn't done yet

Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, he is in a hurry to finish this off now, is Rahul. Probably not interested in taking this deep. Gets a freebie, slower short ball around leg, doesn't came easier than these with short fine leg in place. He swivels to get inside the line and helps it away down the leg-side with a well-timed pull

Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, stand and deliver stuff! Poetry in motion, this shot. Length ball alright but look at the way it's been put away by Rahul. Holds his shape and lifts it straight over Archer's head. Straight as an arrow and clears the ropes with ease. Just a hit away now, KXIP

Shreyas Gopal to Nair, SIX, Nair doesn't reach the pitch of the ball but he still goes through with the shot and connects well. It was a flighted delivery at the stumps, Nair comes down the track and lofts it over cover with the turn for a six. He hit it inside-out, one of the hardest shots to execute. Ball hit the ropes on the full and umpires are confirming it
Ashwin to Samson, SIX, Samson likes it there, no spin and slightly short, he sends it into the orbit over wide long-on. So easy. Just makes batting look so simple this lad
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, what a blow! He takes this leg-break on and hacks it across the line over mid-wicket. Brute power from Colin de Grandhomme. Hits the cushions on the flush
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, COLIN DE GRANDHOMME! Back-to-back sixes off Rashid Khan for the New Zealand batsman. Sits on his back knee and wallops the slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket

Shakib to Kohli, SIX, glorious stuff from the RCB captain! He has come out with clear intent and has decided to unsettle Shakib. Expects the floater and is down the pitch in a flash. Lofts it dead straight over the bowler and into the sightscreen

U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, what a waste of an extra ball and Williamson is too good a player to let that full-toss sliding down leg go. Nonchalantly whips and leaves deep backward square a spectator. Sailed over his head and that's a good over for SRH

Chahal to Williamson, SIX, that's a beautiful shot. Class from Williamson. Tossed up leggie outside off, too full and he has knelt down and slog-swept it flat over deep mid. Consecutive maximums for the SRH skipper
Siraj to Saha, SIX, smashed. Saha backs away and clatters the half-volley on the stumps back over the head of Siraj, flat hit and it went all the way. Power from the diminutive Saha
Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, he's ready for the cutter. Stays leg-side of the ball and pumps the free-hit delivery over covers. Highest score for him in IPL
Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, this is a much better shot from Rahul. He backs away, makes room for himself and cuts it over point, connection was so good that it sails over the ropes
Axar to Buttler, SIX, fuller, wider, worse. Buttler doesn't need to make room, there's plenty already. Crouches low and lofts an uppish slap. Over covers, again

Ashwin to Samson, SIX, this was the shot he was looking off the last ball, gets it right on this occasion. Ashwin drops it short just outside off, Samson goes back and flat-bats it with brute power to smash it over long-on

Andrew Tye to Binny, SIX, whoa! Binny gets into the act. Read the knuckle ball from Tye, it was full in the arc for Binny. He just extended his arms and lofted with a clean swing of the bat over long-on
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, SIX, the punch. The pose. Gets the length right in his slot, loads, shows up the full face and tonks it straight down. Talk about the lack of respect

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed! That has gone around 30 rows back. Back of a length and McClenaghan had become predictable there, Lynn lined up for that length and muscled the pull over deep square leg. That came right off the screws

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, SIX, not middled but Uthappa will take it. He loves facing the spinners. Bit of air given by Krunal and that is enough for Uthappa to get underneath it, sliced the on-drive over the wide long-on fence

Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, wow! Uthappa has had his problems against the short ball this season, not this time though. Picked the short of length delivery early, transfers his weight onto the back foot and nails the pull over deep square leg. Went a long way back into the stands

Markande to Nitish Rana, SIX, much needed maximum for KKR. They have lost the momentum completely. Flatter delivery and Rana is quick to kneel down and deposit it over deep mid-wicket. Not off the middle but enough to clear the fielder

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, bad ball and he gets the treatment! Leg-break that pitches outside leg and turns towards the left-hander's pad. Kishan won't miss out. Gets down on a knee and nails the slog-sweep over backward square leg. Came down the track as well
Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, six more! This time goes over deep mid-wicket. This was flighted, Kishan stayed deep in the crease and mowed it powerfully over deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. Kuldeep Yadav was brave to toss the ball again. Danced down and bludgeoned it over long-on. 17-ball fifty for Ishan Kishan! A superb knock from the southpaw

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, make it four in a row! 25 off Kuldeep's over. The previous ball - he came down. Now, he stays deep in the crease. The ball is in his arc and he uses his wrists to whip it over cow corner

Narine to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh my goodness! Even Narine won't be spared. High and handsome. Slightly fuller in length and Kishan sends another one into the deep mid-wicket stands. Down on his knees to clout it over deep mid-wicket

Narine to Rohit, SIX, slogs and connects well. Moved off-side even before the ball was delivered and positioned himself for the big mow. The offie was in his slot and Rohit clouted it over deep mid-wicket
Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, SIX, slower ball at 112.6kph, on a short of length. Pandya waits, clears the front leg and heaves it over deep mid-wicket

Tom Curran to Hardik Pandya, SIX, one-handed six. Full toss wide of off, Pandya throws the kitchen sink and slices it behind square on the off-side. The bottom hand comes off the handle as well. But, he's got enough wood to collect a six there

Prasidh to Cutting, SIX, this is why Cutting is here! It was another slower delivery from Krishna, Cutting walks across and uses the long levers to excellent effect. Powers the pull over deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Cutting, SIX, long-on would have been interested, but he has to watch it sail over his head. Fullish ball on leg, Cutting stands tall and bludgeons it over long-on
Chawla to Cutting, SIX, back to back sixes. Darted at 117kph, on the shorter side as well, that's all too easy for Cutting. Muscled the pull over deep mid-wicket

Prasidh to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, first one of the night. Was bowling so well before this delivery. Should have stuck to his lengths. Offers a juicy half-volley outside off and Suryakumar goes hard at it, swings hard and gets a thick outside edge that flies over third man. Not convincing enough for the batsman but he'll take that

Chawla to Krunal Pandya, SIX, 22 off the final over! Third six of the over. Piyush Chawla fires another one flat, Krunal Pandya expected that. Stayed in his crease, stood tall and hammered it over deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's a big one to get off the mark. Puts on his dancing shoes, gets to the pitch of the ball and deposits it over long-on for a massive six. Was middled and timed to perfection

S Kaul to Harshal Patel, SIX, not quite his day, it seems. Conceded 15 runs in the first over, concedes a big one early in this one. Was a shortish delivery around off, Harshal was quick to camp back and deposit it over mid-wicket for a flat six

Sandeep Sharma to Harshal Patel, SIX, now you know why he has been promoted up the order. Picks the length early on this short one and slaughters it over the long-on for an impressive six. Was middled to perfection as it went deep into the stands. Held the pose for the cameras too
Shakib to Pant, SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, Pant has smacked this one over the mid-wicket fence for half a dozen to reach his fifty.

S Kaul to Pant, SIX, Kaul keeps on getting thrashed, like he has throughout this innings. Dishes in a full length delivery on middle, Pant waits for it and pummels it over for long-on, high and handsome. The crowd absolutely loved it, they are up on their feet
Rashid Khan to Pant, SIX, Rashid Khan taken to cleaners. He has the Orange Cap now. A floated delivery around off, Pant goes after it with all might and clears the long-off fence

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, even he gets punished. Tries to bowl a yorker but ends up bowling a half-volley. Pant doesn't miss out and deposits it over mid-wicket. Way into the stands as Pant moves on to 86*

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, don't think Bhuvi has been treated in such a way this season by anyone. He's under the pump! Bowls a short one around off, Pant transfers his weight on to the back foot and pulls it for a clean six over fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, that's a one-handed six! Short of a length around off, Pant goes hard at it, in the process one hand comes off but he somehow manages to clear the long-on fence
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, 26 runs off the final over as Pant ends on a scintillating 128*! Walks back to a standing ovation as he muscles the full toss over mid-wicket
Mishra to Williamson, SIX, that slow-and-wide plan to KW from Mishra was better. Drifts this in and is slog-swept by KW over mid-wicket

Nadeem to Dhawan, SIX, hundred run stand. You have to ask Dhawan how he got under this full ball. Drifted in by Nadeem, and Dhawan's waited that extra second to nail that loft over long-on. A wristspinner from Nadeem that!

Nadeem to Dhawan, SIX, strewn full and into the pads, and Dhawan's picked his area on this. Dispatches this over mid-wicket with a bat swing that suggests many more similar hits. He's hit the purple patch again, if this innings is any omen. 58 needed off last 7

Plunkett to Williamson, SIX, another tripe ball on leg-stump line, it's half a dozen. Banged in short, on leg-stump. Williamson swivels and helps it over disdainfully to fine leg. The ball lands on the ad cushions, the umpires took the confirmation of the third umpire before signalling it a six

Boult to Dhawan, SIX, gee, this cutter gets a treatment even worse. Drags it from outside off too -- meaning imagine the biceps he's built -- and then carts it over cow corner with a little bit of a crouch. Ungainly looking but effective
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, SIX, and this one's across the line. Shankar's angling it in, and that helps Dhawan's shot there. Swivels with the angle and plonks it all the way over deep square leg
Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, finally! Too many slower deliveries, one had to go big. Dhoni picks it up nicely and deposits it well over the mid-wicket fence. First one of the night for MS

Ish Sodhi to Watson, SIX, there's the release shot. He's been looking for it for quite some time. Fraction short and that is all Watson needed, quickly moves back in the crease and smashes the pull a long way into the deep mid-wicket stand

Ish Sodhi to Raina, SIX, this over compensates for the previous two overs. Raina gets into the act. It was the googly and Raina was hitting it against the turn, but still had enough to clear the wide long-on fence

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, wow! Watson starting to unleash. Unadkat goes round the wicket and bowls the back of a length delivery, right in Watson's arc and he has no half measures as he deposits it into the deep mid-wicket stand
Harbhajan to Buttler, SIX, halfvolley, dispatched! Loads it up full and bowls straight, Buttler uses those long levers to smack the life out of that leather. All the way over long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, SIX, length ball from Bravo, disappears. What a blow from Binny. His base was steady as he launched it brutally over long-on

Willey to Gowtham, SIX, stunning strike from Krishnappa Gowtham, that too off his very first ball. The crowds jump out of their seats as he muscles his flat-batted heave over long-off. It's gone soaring into the stands

Willey to Gowtham, SIX, this is remarkable from Gowtham. He's come out and nailed two balls out of the three he's faced. Willey misses his mark with the yorker, offers it in the slot and Gowtham tonks it over long-off's head

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, SIX, the Rajasthan dugout erupts. Back of length slower ball, not easy to hit, but Buttler hacks it with stunning power over mid-wicket. Wow what a shot. This should be the blow which seals it
Harbhajan to Stokes, SIX, nothing wild about this one, sets himself on one knee and launches Bhajji for a many-a-mile over mid-wicket. Clean as a whistle

Barinder to Narine, SIX, how good is his bat? Or is the ground? Whatever it is, six runs in Narine's account. Was a slower delivery on middle and leg, Narine waited for it and flicked it over mid-wicket. High, handsome and just over the fence

Barinder to Narine, SIX, unstoppable! Shortish delivery around off, Narine camps back and pulls it over the mid-wicket fence. The fielder near the fence watches it sail over him. Has been the story of the match so far...
Mohit Sharma to A Russell, SIX, woah, that's a biggie. And someone's caught it in the top tier. Massive swing of the bat by Russell. Clears the front leg and swipes to glory over cow corner
Axar to A Russell, SIX, that's an okay slog-sweep. Stretches far in front, picking it from an off-stump line and swamping it over backward square leg

Axar to A Russell, SIX, we need a replacement ball. You know why? This one's on the roof. An uncouth slog that pays off this time. Half-crouched, front leg outta way and hocus pocus - that's sailing over deep mid-wicket. 19 runs off the over
Mujeeb to Karthik, SIX, KKR right now are an efficient courier service, sending everything into the crowd. Angled in, Karthik played with it, slogging it over deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Karthik, SIX, gets into the position early. Stays in the crease and dispatches this carom ball through square leg. Wafting it across
Andrew Tye to Karthik, SIX, how nicely has that been played. That's a slower short ball but Karthik steps out and loops the pull over his shoulders. Just helped the ball there to the fine leg fence

Mohit Sharma to Nitish Rana, SIX, cameras pan to Mohit's face and he's clueless at the monstrosity of his home venue. Slow ball angles across, but Nitish Rana's dispatched him over deep mid-wicket first ball. Is there a pitch in the pavilion?
Barinder to Searles, SIX, his first ball in the match has sailed over long-on. wow. Full and swung away. KKR finish with whoppin' 245
Ashwin to Narine, SIX, finally connects. Was trying since quite some time. Receives a short delivery and Narine makes sure to camp back and heave it over the mid-wicket fence. Clean as a whistle!

Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, this is massive, out of the park. Literally. Bowls a slower delivery to start off, Lynn picks it early, gets into position and smokes it over mid-wicket, over the roof and six runs for the big man
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, even the Purple Cap holder hasn't been spared. Stands tall and towers the length ball over long-on to welcome Tye into the attack
Axar to Narine, SIX, excellent shot! Moves inside the line, swings hard and towers it right over the bowler's head for a maximum. He's looking in good touch today
Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, that's the second 50-run stand of this match. KKR showing some intent. This was slogged over the mid-wicket fence by Uthappa to perfection
Narine to Rahul, SIX, that's meditative. Pure timing. Uses his feet and times this carom ball over long-off
Narine to Rahul, SIX, again shimmying down and going inside-out with this loft over cover. Got right to the pitch and under it. KL Rahul's good. Real good

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, SIX, now sends it over Russell. Not connected properly, but the small boundaries aid him in. Shuffled across to the conventional chinaman and heaved it with a bent back knee over long-on, just over

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, half tracker and Finch dismisses it from his presence. Real poor bowling from Kuldeep. Gave Finch all the time to pick his spot and muscle the pull over the cow corner fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, consecutive sixes for Finch. He needs to kick-on, at least to get his form back. Wrong 'un and Finch had to fetch it from outside off, cue-ends the slog sweep just over a leaping Searles at long-on
Searles to Finch, SIX, Finch is not given up yet. Length delivery right in the slot, Finch winds up with the front leg cleared and gives it his all, heaved away into the deep mid-wicket stand

Searles to Andrew Tye, SIX, off the mark in style. Tye does not want to hang around. Back of a length and not much wrong with the delivery, Tye just goes through the line and smashes it over the leaping long-on fielder

Searles to Ashwin, SIX, third six of the over. This time off Ashwin's willow. Searles hurls it full and in the swinging arc, Ashwin presses forward and sends it sailing over long-off. Searles ends with 4-0-52-1 on IPL debut

A Russell to Ashwin, SIX, wow! That is a massive hit from Ash. Picked the back of the hand slower ball, lined himself up for the big heave-ho and gave it the full monty, cleared long-on quite comfortably

A Russell to Ashwin, SIX, Ashwin is helping his team's NRR with these strikes. Back of a length and at the stumps, Ashwin cleared his front leg and hammered it over cow corner. Got the elevation and the distance
Prasidh to Rahul, SIX, 143ks and that's why it's rushed away to the third man fence. Full and wide, Rahul made some room and carved it away with disdain
A Russell to Gayle, SIX, that isn't for aspiring fast bowlers. Look away! Gayle backs way and pummels this pull off the front foot. Over deep mid-wicket without any fuss
Searles to Rahul, SIX, stand and deliver. Pings the sightscreen. Searles errs by going full and it is right in Rahul's arc, he latches onto it and dismisses it straight back over Searles

A Russell to Rahul, SIX, fifty for Rahul. A thumbs up to his partner followed by a bat wave to the crowd. Third on the trot for him. He's to continue if KXIP have to win this. Shuffled a bit in his crease before making room to this short delivery, upper cuts it into the second tier over third man. Also gets the orange cap back

Narine to Rahul, SIX, that's outta here. Third time the ball has been smashed out of the stadium today. Rahul once again picks what Narine is bowling, runs down the wicket and gets close to the ball, lofts it handsomely over long-on and out of the ground

Narine to Rahul, SIX, Narine being taken to the cleaners. That is the fourth six Rahul has struck off Narine. Half tracker on leg-stump, Rahul transfers his weight back and deposits the pull over deep backward square leg
U Yadav to Roy, SIX, this is what Roy can do? Such a brute of a player. It's a sit-up outside off, begging to be smashed; Roy nonchalantly pulls it into the stands over mid-wicket. Simple ain't it?
Moeen Ali to Pant, SIX, into the stands! Premeditated hack and he's got all of it. Nicely floated up by Mo Ali and the next thing he sees is the ball sailing into the mid-wicket stands

Chahal to Pant, SIX, fuller and wider, Pant frees his arms and lays into it, sends Chahal for a 83-metre maximum over long-on. He's striking the ball clean as ever is Rishabh Pant, just one short of his fifty now

Southee to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, oh yes. That's off the middle alright. Southee tries the sucker full ball to follow. And Abhishek tonks it straight down, full flow, full elegance, full pose. And to imagine he's 17
Southee to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, some more. Southee loses his line, ends up too straight and finds it swatted. Hard, flat, cow corner

Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, he's toying here. And from Pant's brutal attack, it's come down to Abhishek's delicacy. Siraj threatens him with a bouncer, it's off target, it's with width and he carves/upper-cuts it over a vacant third man
Siraj to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, he's lighting it up. Gets the front leg out, loads up, from that massive backlift as he hoicks. Meaty. Long-on. Murder
Siraj to Pant, SIX, get outta here, Rishabh Pant's bat screamed with delight. Saw the length (short) early and launched this flat over mid-wicket at the rate of knots. Phewfff!
Siraj to Pant, SIX, he is constantly feeding to Pant's strengths. That ball sat up nicely outside off, Pant uses all his bottom hand power to hammer it straight of long-off. All the way

Lamichhane to de Villiers, SIX, he's hit that in the airrr, not timed that well, there is a man at deep backward square leg, he jumps and it's evaded him. The length was just a bit too full, de Villiers got inside the line of this flighted delivery and slog-swept it over backward square leg

Harshal Patel to Kohli, SIX, finally, a 100-run partnership between Kohli and AB this season. Harshal Patel bowls a good length delivery down the leg-side in trying to follow Kohli, but the Indian captain is so good with his wrists and whips it away over mid-wicket

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, that's masterful! Masterful because he's picked this slower ball, waited and muscled the loft over long-on. Fifty for AB de Villiers as well. RCB fans would be delighted to see both AB and Kohli score fifties in the same innings. Part of the reason why they weren't clicking as a batting unit this season. Kohli is so happy for AB

Junior Dala to Mandeep, SIX, how easy was that? Mandeep has been in good touch, getting starts this season. This was a short delivery down the leg-side, Mandeep easily pulls it over long leg as he got inside the line

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, Boult has actually bowled a full toss way outside off stump, but that big back and across movement of de Villiers helps him easily time this kind of sweep shot over backward square leg. He's just awesome to watch

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, fitting finish from AB de Villiers. RCB are still alive and DD have officially been knocked out. Slower delivery outside off stump, AB waits for the ball and lifts this over long-off
Junior Dala to Kohli, SIX, wo-aw. Picks up the length, with that jabby whip of his. And swishes it to split mid-on's left. It's a return show

Boult to Kohli, SIX, stands, plants his leg out and holds his position to punch it through the line. High, mighty, and Kotla's switched sides .. RCB, RCB. And you thought the earlier one was the shot of the night. Poor you

Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, okay, you have to learn! Got away with one previous ball bowling full, this time the line is outside off and allows de Villiers to swing his arms. Easily lofted over long-off and AB is pretty good with his timing, isn't he?

Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, that's the bowler getting greedy with the turn on offer and offering a freebie. Way too full, the length is still acceptable, but the line is way outside off stump, got to be closer to the sticks. AB just waited for it and smashed that lofted drive over extra-cover
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, SIX, Bhuvneshwar goes short and Watson dispatches it over long-on. Went back and flat-batted it disdainfully. The key was - he picked the length early

S Kaul to Rayudu, SIX, gee there's a lot of audaciousness with the way he bats. He knows Kaul way too well. Two short balls first up in the over, but expects Kaul to try another one, the bowler dished out exactly what the batsman wanted and that back and across movement from Rayudu makes a strong statement that he is bossing the show, out comes the pull shot and clears deep mid-wicket. Brilliant fifty

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX, has he sliced this? Yes he has, but that bat in his hands is very good and it takes the ball all the way. The leggie outside off stump, Rayudu gets down on one knee and goes hard at it, looked like it was going to long-off for a moment, but this isn't Uppal. The boundaries are smaller

Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, this is precisely why SRH need Rayudu ASAP! Just look at him run down at SRH's key bowler. Got beaten previous ball, but no respect whatsoever and he forces Bhuvi to shorten the length, with it swings across the line with a pull and powers it over the mid-wicket boundary. He's just toying with them

Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, oh my god! This guy is playing some outrageous shots. Flighted delivery from Shakib, Rayudu steps out, gets closer to the pitch of the ball and slogs it hard over deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, he's back to taking the aggressive route again. Advances, takes it on the full and muscles it over the man at long-off
S Kaul to Dhoni, SIX, he got away with a couple of full tosses earlier in the over, but Dhoni has had enough. Absolutely tonks it flat over the square leg boundary. Just 8 needed now.
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, Sandeep's slower ball goes awry. It was the knuckle ball and Watson spotted it early. Squated low and helped it over short fine leg. Clears the rope for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, 'don't bowl short to me' - Watson's body language suggested as Sandeep overbakes and goes short. Watson stays in his crease, allows for the ball to come and pulls it with brute force over mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, Rayudu gets into the act. Reaches out for a fuller length delivery outside off and effortlessly lifts it over extra cover

S Kaul to Rayudu, SIX, in the air and clears Hales at long-on. He seemed to have misjudged it there, runs forward and later realises that the ball is sailing over his head. Short again, Rayudu stayed back and smacked it flat and hard - enough wood to take it all the way
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, only a hit away from his fifty now. This was a full delivery outside off and Dhawan smoked it over long-on for half a dozen. Great shot by the southpaw
Watson to Williamson, SIX, impressive! How well was this timed! Length ball on middle and leg, Williamson pulls it over square leg for a well timed six. Came right from the meat of his willow
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, what a shot to reach his fifty! Shortish delivery around off, Dhawan doesn't miss out on the opportunity and swings it over mid-wicket. Flat and over the ropes, she goes!

Harbhajan to Williamson, SIX, if Dhawan from other end is changing gears, Williamson decides to up the ante as well. Skips out, Harbhajan gives more flight. KW isn't to the pitch, but still goes through by getting his weight forward. Sends it soaring over long-off. All the way!
Harbhajan to Dhawan, SIX, bread and butter for Dhawan. It looked as though he was waiting for it. Harbhajan drops a rank long hop, Dhawan sits back and smokes it over cow corner. Into the crowd
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Thakur gets his line closer to off, Hooda stays still and biffs it powerfully over long-off
