Gowtham to Lewis, SIX, full toss. Talk about ruining a quiet over under the radar. Lewis has his muscles blowing them out of here. 88 meters into the stands behind the sightscreen. And it's a fifty

D Kulkarni to Lewis, SIX, welcome back Kulkarni! Off-speed delivery and Lewis picked the bones out of that, spotted it early and powered straight back over the bowler. He then stood and admired that shot

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, into the second tier. Unadkat is predictable with his change of pace and Pandya was waiting for it, cleared his front leg and smashed it straight back over the sightscreen. Mumbai need plenty more of this

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Unadkat is dishing out freebies. Another nice juicy full toss outside off, just the right amount of width for Pandya to tonk the loft over extra cover. He didn't overhit; just a lift and off she went into the crowd. 17 already off the over
Stokes to Cutting, SIX, Cutting making RR pay for the drop catch. Stokes is slower ball is right in the slot, Cutting delayed his shot for a second and hammered it with a clean swing over long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, SIX, the launch. Can't bowl down leg, not a googly either. Knee, slog, sweep, backward square leg. It's flatly powerful enough to damage a billboard
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, SIX, on the move, Gopal corrects on middle, but Lewis' gone over extra cover. Throws every cell in his body into this hoick
Markande to Buttler, SIX, that ones with the crowd now. Big hit over long-on there. Markande bowls it a touch slow, and Buttler makes that last-minute room to chidingly loft it away

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, not quite as pretty as those Dhoni's bottom-handed whips over long-on but this is good enough. Carries all the way. Takes on the seam-up length ball and muscles it across the line
Bumrah to Buttler, SIX, and now one better. Swivels this time, and deposits the short ball over long leg this time. Game slipping, or has it already?

Hardik Pandya to Samson, SIX, that's flown off Samson's bat. He walks stone-faced to the middle of the pitch and punches gloves with Buttler. Slow ball sitting up and Samson mowing it over cow corner has to be a sight to behold

Hardik Pandya to Samson, SIX, this is a glorious glorious pull. Pandya just stares and walks back to the top of his mark. You do that when you've been pulled off the front foot, and the ball flies over deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, Mumbai Buttler'ed at home. Slow ball sitting up and martyed over cow corner

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, just over Hardik. The slog sweep and Buttler almost found the only man in the deep on the leg-side, shuffled across and mistimed the sweep towards deep mid-wicket. Hardik jumped but the ball was well over him

Moeen Ali to Finch, SIX, welcome to the attack Moeen Ali! Dragged back length and Finch makes room to thump the pull over deep mid-wicket. That is a monster hit from the Aussie and he remains the key for KXIP

Southee to Rahul, SIX, hello says the batsman as he was greeted with a short ball. The batsman did not waste time to transfer his weight on the back foot and hammers it over deep backward square leg off the front foot. Terrific hit
U Yadav to Rahul, SIX, short ball, journey ball and goes the distance. The batsman this time stayed firm on the back foot and hammered the pull over deep fine leg for a sixer. Into the second tier

U Yadav to Rahul, SIX, picks the slower short ball like dead meat and picks the bones out of it by smacking it over deep mid-wicket. He waited on it and then smashed it out of his sight. Third six of the evening for Rahul

Siraj to Finch, SIX, this is exactly what RCB don't want. That was full and that disappeared. Booming hit over covers for a sixer. Flat and powerful. This landed in the range of the batsman and Finch drop kicked the ball away. Is there Finch magic on the cards?

Rajpoot to Kohli, SIX, look at the swagger on this shot! With due respect to Rajpoot, the man facing him is just too good. Full and in the slot, it's in the arc for Kohli who nonchalantly clubs this into the stands at cow corner. Cold welcome for the young man

Andrew Tye to Kohli, SIX, that's dumped over long-off. RCB cantering away to victory. Just a few blows away if they go at this rate. Too full from Andrew and it's criminal with mid-off up. Kohli launches it over the infield and it goes away for a flat maximum
Gowtham to Narine, SIX, how that's! Skid it into Narine, who went with it and swung it over deep mid-wicket
Gowtham to Narine, SIX, now puts on the wheels. Comes down the track and mauls it over long-on. Gowtham clasps his hands but that's not in appreciation, as you'd have guessed
Jofra Archer to Karthik, SIX, goes over. And Kolkata keep the 16-pointer dream alive. Shortened length, Karthik deposits it into long-on with an all muscle heave

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, SIX, a 145ks delivery no good for all-hands Lynn. Moves a little leg-side and scythes this short incoming delivery over backward square leg. Didn't even rock back fully. Didn't need to
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, SIX, Gowtham's horror isn't over. Brilliant loft from Nitish Rana, stepping out and timing it over extra cover. Flew into the crowd
Prasidh to R Tripathi, SIX, full and not too wide, on off-stump in fact, Tripathi makes his own width by making room outside off and slices that over the sweeper cover fence for six! Massive hit!

Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, SIX, short ball and six! That was a splendid hit. More of a reactive shot as he looked like he was slightly late on it but that travelled the entire journey. Over the deep square region and Mavi takes some more punishment
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX, fuller length delivery just outside off, Buttler preempts the periscope and laps it over the tiny fine leg boundary for six!
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX, he moves leg, moves to the off-side again, picks up the good length ball on the stumps to ramp it over fine leg for another six. Last 9 balls: 6 fours, 3 sixes.

McClenaghan to Rahul, SIX, long stop! Leave the bat regulations alone, they've gotta have some boundary regulations! A 64-meter six! A shortish ball on the hips, Rahul shuffles across and swat-pulls it half-heartedly, gets a top-edge over the long stop fence for six
Markande to Rahul, SIX, this is the ball he wanted. A bit of flight from Markande, Rahul gallops down to the pitch of it and lofts it cleanly over long-on

Markande to Rahul, SIX, and again. Much cleaner, much bigger. The Kings XI dugout is on its feet as Rahul finishes the over off with back-to-back sixes. Puts his dancing shoes on again and swings through the line of the delivery
McClenaghan to Axar, SIX, it's not over yet. Axar has pumped this full toss over the ropes. McClenaghan misses the blockhole, and disappears over mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, abysmal start for Hardik (sans highlights), a lousy half-tracker, Gayle just swivels into an effortless six in front of deep square leg

Hardik Pandya to Finch, SIX, gigantic, massive, monstrous! Length ball outside off, a huge no-no in T20, Finch gets room to swing his arms, and goes through the line, golf-swings that over wide long-on for six. Monumental hit...

Mohit Sharma to Lewis, SIX, the first six of the evening - on a good length and just outside off, Lewis got forward on the lofted drive, didn't time it all that well - ended up slicing it high and over mid-off - has enough to clear the ropes on the full

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, just over the outstreched hand of Ankit Rajpoot at long leg. Just! Krunal went for the pull, didn't get all of it, dragged it off the bottom half and it eluded the fieldsman near the boundary ropes. Rajpoot kept his head still and flung himself backwards, but it fell tantalizingly past his fingertips
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, nothing half-hearted about this. Picked the length (short) early and deposited this over wide long-on with an air of nonchalance. Typical Krunal

Axar to Pollard, SIX, becoming too predictable is Axar Patel. The last four balls have been over 100ks. This one's no different either; KP did the smart thing, gave himself room outside off by jumping to the leg-side and tonked this into the cow corner stands with a mighty swing of the bat

Rajpoot to Pollard, SIX, KP is upping the ante now. A risky shot, but he generated enough power to clear the ropes. A 76-metre six. Short ball wide of KP's off-stump, he fetches from there and hacks the pull over long-on. Manoj Tiwary was interested for a bit, but that was always travelling

Stoinis to Pollard, SIX, a 22-ball fifty for KP. He pumps his fists and lets out all the excitement. It was full and right in his swinging arc, KP gets underneath that and launches it many-a-mile over long-off

Ashwin to McClenaghan, SIX, McClenaghan's known for this; hitting biggies at will. Stoops to one knee and gives it a full monty on the slogsweep, found the middle and off she goes. Into the mid-wicket stands
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, top-edge and six, Suryakumar was done in by the bouncer, was clearly late on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sailed over the ropes at fine leg

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, lovely shot, back-to-back sixes for Suryakumar and he was in complete control here. This was the slower ball from Rajpoot, Suryakumar gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, SIX, massive, too short and the angle worked against Mohit here, Kishan swivels across, doesn't bother to keep the ball down and sends it soaring into the second tier - way over backward square leg for a maximum

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Kishan, came charging down the track, Mohit went full and wide of off, Kishan was committed to the drive, gets it off the outside half and still has enough to sail over the ropes - at deep backward point

Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, SIX, Moeen Ali is dealing in sixes. Rashid Khan has a wry smile on his face. Down the track and to the pitch before lofting this clean over long-off. The fielder was just a spectator

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, SIX, Moeen Ali is taking all his frustration at not being selected for the Test side against the SRH bowlers. He was a sureshot selection last year at this time, not anymore. This short ball is at Moeen Ali's chest, he plays a smashing pull high into the deep square leg stands. That was meaty

Basil Thampi to de Villiers, SIX, that has gone out of the Chinnaswamy! And might have landed on something or someone outside the ground. What's AB's reaction - stoic! Again his trademark shot, sit down, move across, a juicy full-toss and it has been sent over the deep backward square leg roof. A souvenir for someone to take home. Chants of "AB" echo around the ground as the players wait for a fresh cherry. Meanwhile AB and Moeen Ali have some refreshments

Sandeep Sharma to Moeen Ali, SIX, it has gone for six. A checked loft. Are you serious? Dhawan can only smile wryly, as it loops over his head. Sandeep Sharma deceived Moeen Ali completely, with a slower delivery outside off, Moeen Ali arrested his shot at the last moment, but it just flew and flew
Basil Thampi to de Grandhomme, SIX, right up there and de Grandhomme has teed off. Full on the stumps, de Grandhomme lofts and clears long-off. He can time them really well too
Shakib to de Grandhomme, SIX, does loft over extra-cover really well. Bit of air outside off, de Grandhomme launches Shakib inside out and gets the maximum. Good end to the over

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, SIX, high high and over the backtracking Rashid at deep mid. That was a misjudgement from the Afghan. He was inside the field of play and not at the edge of the boundary. So can't track back in time and it lobs him despite getting his hands across to try and catch. One more biggie to de Grandhomme

Basil Thampi to de Grandhomme, SIX, that is brute power from CdG. Brutal from the Zimbawean-turned-Kiwi. Waited for the slower delivery and then slapped it high and powerfully over extra-cover. Kohli smiles and claps

Basil Thampi to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, last match they had a fielder just behind the keeper, very fine and he was caught. Not this time. Just reverse-laps a full-toss and it goes all the way. The RCB dugout love it. Sarfaraz Khan is known to be innovative and he is showing us why

Basil Thampi to Moeen Ali, SIX, Moeen Ali launches Basil Thampi over long-off. Was right in the slot to play the lofted drive, hit it cleanly and went all the way. Basil Thampi came round the wicket and bowled a loosener, paid the price

Basil Thampi to Moeen Ali, SIX, this is a fine shot. He has a problem with the short ones, much like Raina, but not at that height, at waist-height, he pulls handsomely and sends the white Kookaburra over the deep square leg's head. That shot brings the crowd back to life

Sandeep Sharma to Moeen Ali, SIX, caught by Shikhar Dhawan but goes over the rope. Six more. Moeen Ali powered this flat and over the head of Dhawan at long-on, he caught it well but went one step back and trod on the cushion. Still manages a wry smile and a "ooooohhhhhhh"
Southee to Dhawan, SIX, so easy. Overpitched by Southee and he sees the white ball fly over long-on. Clean bat-flow and sweetly struck. A welcome Southee won't like
Southee to Hales, SIX, it has gone for six despite it coming off the bottom of the bat. Again a bit too full from Southee, in the hitting range and Hales tees of. Over long-on

Siraj to Williamson, SIX, fractionally short outside off, Williamson stays low and shuffles across, gets under it and pulls it flat to deep mid-wicket. Goes just over the rope for six. Magnificent hitting.

de Grandhomme to Williamson, SIX, in the slot, a bit of air too, Williamson gets on his knees, and puts all his might into that slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket for six. Didn't seem to time that perfectly, managed to clear it. How does he look elegant while slogging? 50 partnership is up, and it almost hits a car.

U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, this guy is amazing! Not a T20 player, they said. Short one outside off, drags that with a pull over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. He's carting sixes on his way to a win.

de Grandhomme to Williamson, SIX, low full toss and Williamson goes one step better compared to his mate. That has been drop-kicked over deep square for a maximum. The runs are raining now. RCB ducking for cover but no where to hide

de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, SIX, gargantuan! More height and enough distance. That was on a length and the batsman dismisses it over long-on for a sixer. Only 67 now off 30 balls as 22 is leaked in that over

Siraj to Manish Pandey, SIX, Siraj misses the mark and pays the price. Manish Pandey dances across his sticks, exposes all of it and picks the ball over fine leg for a sixer. That was smart, not from the bowler though
U Yadav to Hales, SIX, that's a top shot. Granted it was overpitched on middle, but what wrist-work from Hales, nonchalantly whipped it flat and cleared deep mid. That is a statement of authority
Siraj to Dhawan, SIX, smashed for six. Was a length ball and he picked his spot, rocked back and sent it into the crowd at deep mid-wicket. Siraj is welcome with a biggie
Siraj to Hales, SIX, the next ball goes for six. Length ball on the stumps, Hales heaves and clears deep mid. Just. But that will do

Moeen Ali to Williamson, SIX, Wow! Tossed up, in the slot, Williamson keeps a still head and golf-swings it through the line to deep mid-wicket for four. The most underrated of the big four, and he is proving his credentials today

Lamichhane to Jadeja, SIX, googly on middle, Jadeja gets down the wicket and tonks it straight down the ground over the sightscreen! Full swing of the blade, >360 degrees, and it sails away for an 89 meter six

Harshal Patel to Jadeja, SIX, first of all, kudos to the cameraman for following that one. Half-volley on middle, in the slot, Jadeja lofts it with every ounce of his power straight down the ground for six. That went through to the stratosphere and back into the sightscreen

Boult to Watson, SIX, cannot bowl there to Watson, he'll feast on it. Banged short by Boult but it's not that high. Sits up nicely for the Australian who powers the pull over deep mid-wicket. One of Watto's favorite hitting zones

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX, clears the fence! Rayudu has looked really fidgety, trying to hit too hard and connects here. On a shortish length and he was across the stumps in a flash. Pumps it over deep square leg with a meaty strike

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX, it's gone all the way! Rayudu is taking a liking to Avesh. Charges down the track and knows that the length will be shortened. Adjusts to pull it over deep mid-wicket. Easily over the ropes

Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX, third maximum of the over! Rayudu has gone bonkers. Walks down the track and makes room as well, Avesh continues to err on the shorter side and this disappears as well. Way into the crowd at cow corner

Mishra to Rayudu, SIX, straight down the ground! The pressure builds, Mishra bowls a full-toss on middle and off, Rayudu nimble down the track and clubs that straight down the ground into the sightscreen

SN Thakur to Vijay Shankar, SIX, that's deep into the crowd! Plenty of power from Vijay Shankar on this stroke. He's smoked it away. Short of a length and he is now expecting this length. Sits deep in the crease to clobber the pull away by standing tall. Meaty blow

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, for a moment Rayudu at fine leg thought he had a chance as he raced to his left but this cleared the square leg fence. Fuller ball on middle and off, Patel just went across to play the pick up shot. Quick hands and supple wrists on the drop kick from Patel as this whistled away

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, hugeeeeeeeeee! Bravo decides not to bowl the slower ball and it disappears. Fullish and in the slot, lots of pace and it's in the arc as well. Patel does the needful by bludgeoning it way over long-on. Handy blows, these, for DD

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, there goes another! Bravo's death bowling issues this season continue. Is being taken to the cleaners tonight as well. Slower but it's on the shorter side, Shankar gets hold of it and pulls it away over deep backward square leg

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, this is fantastic hitting from Harshal Patel. He is being aided by some poor bowling too. Half-volley and it's a pacy ball, Patel drills it dead straight down the ground. Into the sightscreen for another maximum

Chahar to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, Chahar errs and Shaw pounces. Shortens the length and angles one on middle and leg, Shaw gets into a good position with a slight shuffle and shoves it over mid-wicket. Goes all the way

Dwayne Bravo to Harshal Patel, SIX, 26 off the final over! Just the momentum push DD were seeking and they've finished with a flourish here. Bravo loses the plot completely to dish out a juicy full toss, Harshal in this hitting mood isn't going to miss out. Goes straight once again with the loft and once more, crashes into the sightscreen for a maximum

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, that's one helluva shot! From round the wicket, Harbhajan doles out a leg-stump half-volley, Pant goes slightly leg-side and clouts it over deep mid-wicket. Way into the stands. Absolutely pummeled

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, how did that go for a six? Did Ngidi misjudge that? He ran forward from long-off and then had to come back again. Jumps up in the end, but in vain. Coming to the shot, Pant wasn't targeting that region. He got down to slog over cow corner. The ball ballooned up off the top-edge and just cleared the ropes

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, SIX, how good is that? Pacy short delivery and at the body, what does Parthiv Patel do? He just ramps it for six. Using the bat as a help, periscope style. I guess it is Baz who caught that? in the RCB dugout. No my colleague - Nikhil tells me Baz has dropped it and he is right
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, SIX, six again. An action replay of the first six. Just that Baz didn't drop it in the dugout. Using the pace of Jofra Archer to a nicety. Expensive over from the Bajan

de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, SIX, now he'll try to shift gears. Walks down the track and chips the length ball right over the bowler's head. Such sweet timing on this blow. For a moment I thought this was only a boundary, but no. It's a maximum!

Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, SIX, that's a massive blow. Nicely done. Was a tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman came down the wicket and went ahead with his loft, right over the bowler's head and over the ropes. The fielder at long-on was a mere spectator
Siraj to Klaasen, SIX, this is the class of Klaasen. This is what he can do. This was a full length delivery outside off, Klaasen frees his arms and carves it over third man. Beautiful shot!

Southee to Gowtham, SIX, how often has he done that? Makes six hitting so simple, does Gowtham. Wonder why he wasn't sent to open the innings. This was a short delivery and the all-rounder simply pulled it over mid-wicket
Southee to Gowtham, SIX, excellent shot! Full in length around off, Gowtham stands tall and pumps it over long-off. Back-to-back sixes for Gowtham and the crowd is lovin' it

Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, SIX, first maximum! Premeditated, but he made excellent contact. Flat ball wide of off, Tripathi gets down on a knee after moving towards off. Follows with a massive slog sweep over deep backward square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's just a blatant display of biceps. Comes on the front foot and scythes this length ball over cow corner. Trust me when I say this: it was hammered away disdainfully with a torso torque
Shakib to Uthappa, SIX, he's like a scoop of butter today. Reads the length so early that he has the time to get under a Shakib darter. Lifts it over long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, SIX, top-edges are the new first aid in cricket. Didn't KKR need that. A back of a length delivery going down leg-side, DK was late on the slog-sweep and ushered a top-edge over fine leg. It was way into the crowd, trust me
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, only fair that Rashid takes the brunt. It's outside off but it's enough for Uthappa. Enough full, enough close. Slogged over deep mid-wicket

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, SIX, 20 off the over. KKR are making the most of the powerplay. Once again, it's in Narine's swinging territory, he clears his front leg and lifts the ball back over the bowler's head for a stunning maximum

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, ah! That shoulder seems to functioning just fine. It was short and drifting into leg stump channels, Lynn clears the front leg and smokes it for a 69-metre maximum over mid-wicket

Shakib to Narine, SIX, long-on jumped back in desperation, but he never looked like catching that. Clean swing of the willow from Narine, thumps it from middle-stump channel and deposits it way over the fence
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, SIX, length ball in the channel, Lynn feasts on it with a mighty hoick over cow corner. 87-metres to be precise

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, SIX, "That is what form does to you," says Harsha Bhogle on air. Kuldeep gives plenty of air, but it lands as a freebie for Williamson. On the pads and he comfortably dispatches it over cow corner

Searles to Williamson, SIX, this will hurt KKR. Williamson can play this shot in his sleep. Lenght ball down leg, Williamson gets inside the line and hacks it behind square for a maximum. Easy pickings

Searles to Williamson, SIX, make that two sixes in two balls for Williamson. This was the shot he attempted against RCB in the previous game and picked out the fine leg fielder. This time he knew the fielder was inside the ring. Moved across his sticks early, stayed low and helped it supremely over the fielder's head for half-a-dozen

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, SIX, cow corner is Pandey's favourite spot and he dismisses one for a maximum. Krishna misses his yorker, Pandey cleared his front leg and banged it flat, enough timing on it to take it all the way

A Russell to Goswami, SIX, that's adding insult to injury for Russell, on a good length and just outside off, Goswami backs away slightly, plays with an open face and slices it high and over cover, went a long way over the stands

Narine to Dhawan, SIX, lovely, tad too full from Narine, Dhawan gets a good stride forward, drives it through the line and clears the ropes at long-on with ease. The key was he didn't look to muscle the shot, nor did he play across the line

Cutting to Vijay Shankar, SIX, massive, that should break the shackles for DD, too full and in the slot, Vijay Shankar extends his arms and lifts it high and over long-on, Rohit was a mere spectator as the ball sailed over his head

Mustafizur to Pant, SIX, a one-handed six now, how do you bowl to this man? On a good length and well outside off, Pant was looking to swipe it towards the on-side, his bottom hand came off at the point of impact, but it still had enough power to sail into the crowd at wide long-on

Hardik Pandya to Pant, SIX, cheeky and six, how good is this shot? Length delivery on the stumps, Pant was quick to reverse his stance, plays with an open face and ramps it over short third man, Hardik's pace is enough for the ball to sail over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Pant, SIX, another one-handed six, Hardik is getting a serious pasting here. Another length ball on Pant's pads, he was looking to swipe it over square leg, the bottom-hand came off at the point of impact, still it flew high and deep into the stands
Mustafizur to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, lovely, length ball from Mustafizur and it sat up to be smacked, Abhishek waits on it and then pummels it sweetly - high and way over mid-wicket for a massive six

Cutting to Vijay Shankar, SIX, beautifully played, length delivery on the stumps, Vijay Shankar leans forward, presents the full face of the bat, high elbow and the ball sails over the sightscreen for a maximum

Markande to Pant, SIX, full delivery angling towards leg, the googly, but Pant comes down the track and gets to the pitch so fast that he doesn't let it turn. Gets that bat of his down from a high backlift and slogs it into the deep mid-wicket crowd for six

Lamichhane to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, the intentions are clear from Suryakumar. Wasting no time whatsoever in putting these filths to the fence. Another dragged down delivery, on leg. Suryakumar bends low to get in line with the ball and hacks it behind square for a maximum. 10 off first two, pressure on the bowler

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, SIX, but that is not the way Hardik thinks.. Anything with flight and in his arc, Hardik will go for it, through the line and with a clean bat swing sends it soaring over the long-on fence, into the second tier

Boult to Cutting, SIX, that's more like it. Right in the slot and it is a 83 meter six from Cutting. Just a bit of shuffle to off and got nicely underneath the length ball, the big forearms then took over to smash it over long-on

Plunkett to Cutting, SIX, wow! That's gone a long way. This match ain't over. Mumbai's season ain't over. Until Cutting is there. Plunkett is bowling length and Cutting is waiting for it, muscles the loft well over the long-on fence

Harshal Patel to Cutting, SIX, oh my! Cutting has got the best possible start to the over. Patel does not have the pace to bowl short and it sits up nicely for Cutting, who swivels across and sends the pull soaring over the long leg fence

Harshal Patel to Lewis, SIX, Lewis is wading into Patel now. Overbakes and bangs it short, Lewis can deal with short balls with ease. Sits back and muscles it way back into the deep mid-wicket stands. Into the second tier

Maxwell to Lewis, SIX, in the slot and Lewis makes Maxwell pay the penalty. Flighted full outside off, Lewis chips out of his crease, flexes his muscles and smokes it over long-off. Stand and dismiss stuff

Maxwell to Lewis, SIX, a six off the final ball and 16 runs to cap off the over. Lewis is getting a move on here. Motions out of his crease to meet the pitch and allows his bottom hand to take over. Blasted disdainfully over long-off

Mishra to Lewis, SIX, Lewis gets underneath this flighted delivery and sweeps it straight into the ad-cushions behind square on the leg-side. Mishra looped it on leg-stump and Lewis went low in time to connect it beautifully to smash it for a maximum

Ashwin to Chahar, SIX, he has whacked this carrom ball over deep square leg's head. Not long boundaries here, so even a decent contact comfortably takes it over the ropes. Walked across the stumps, sat down low and got a great length for the slog-sweep
Ashwin to Chahar, SIX, now a blistering strike over long-off. Wow. Ashwin had fired this pretty wide of off, so Chahar had to reach out slightly, but the timing is still so sublime
Axar to Chahar, SIX, my word does he have some ability with the bat! This is a stunning shot. Makes some room to a length ball and flat-bats it over long-off. Wow Deepak Chahar

Andrew Tye to Raina, SIX, finally gets hold of one! He waited just a moment longer to account for the knuckle ball, and then heaved it away for a flat six. Even this had come more off the bottom of his bat actually, but again, these are short boundaries

Andrew Tye to Raina, SIX, pops Tye over long-on to raise his fifty! The equation has come down to a run-a-ball. Don't think he got this one off the middle either, but got enough to just clear the leaping fielder

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, finishes it off by pulling this short ball over the long leg boundary, and then calmly tips the bails over. And that's how the IPL 2018 league stages end, with SRH, CSK, KKR and RR going through
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, SIX, finally gets some bat on it! Was trying to do this since ages. Clears his front leg and pumps the length delivery over long-off for a flat six

Jadeja to Nair, SIX, just clears the man in the deep. Flatter around middle and leg, Nair goes down on his knee and slog sweeps it over square leg. Ngidi is the man in the deep who tries hard to grab it in left hand but it's way above him

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, excellent lofted shot. Full in length around off, Nair moves away, makes room for himself and times his loft over long-off. Right from the meat and comfortably over the ropes
Jadeja to Axar, SIX, lovely shot! Picks the length early on the short one, backs away and nonchalantly lofts it over long-off. Has enough on it to evade the man in the deep
SN Thakur to Nair, SIX, shot! This is what KXIP exactly want. Short again on middle and leg, Nair stays in his crease and swings it over square leg. Way into the stands, such sweet was the timing
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, he's getting better as this innings is progressing. Gets down on his knee and picks the length delivery over fine leg. Good enough to reach the distance
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, fifty for Karun Nair! Preity Zinta in the stands loves it. Was a short delivery around off, Nair comes down the wicket and slaps the slower one over long-on

Chahar to Miller, SIX, for a moment, I thought that he had mishit that. How wrong was I? Pitched up delivery outside off, Miller reaches out, bends the back knee and lofts it over long-off. High and handsome. A six off the free-hit

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, Jadeja can only get a hand on it and he parries it over the ropes. Would be very harsh to call it a drop. Tiwary danced down the track and slug in the direction of the turn. Just over RJ at long-on, who timed his jump to perfection and went for a one-handed catch

Shakib to du Plessis, SIX, straight down the ground from Faf, clean strike. He's got to pick his bowlers now, and he's got 10 off two balls from Shakib. Swings through the line of the full ball and sends it soaring over long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, SIX, and Chahar goes bang. Well, not quite a BANG, but bang enough. Off-pace back of length delivery, he swipes cross-batted and clears the mid-wicket boundary. It came off the toe-end, but these are short boundary

Brathwaite to du Plessis, SIX, oh what a shot. He's picked the bones out of it. An 87-metre six pumps up the CSK dugout while raising the fifty for the South African player. Brathwaite offers it in the slot again, and gets smoked away

Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, SIX, Faf du Plessis, you champion! He takes just one ball to do it. Slower ball on a length, whacks it back down the ground to smash those LED boards before raising his arms and letting out a huge roar

Brathwaite to du Plessis, SIX, risky but much needed for du Plessis, banged in short and just outside off, du Plessis was on the back-foot, didn't get hold of the cross-batted slap, just about has enough to clear the man at long leg

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, first six of the innings, taken SRH 17 overs to smack one out of the park. Brathwaite gets the perfect length delivery, right in his arc to swing it over the deep mid-wicket fence. Went a long way back

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, back to back sixes. Thakur overcorrects by dragging the length back, but Brathwaite was up for it. In fact, he might have been waiting for it, stands tall and murders the pull over deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, small margins for errors. Thakur missed his yorker and bowled a friendly full toss, Brathwaite was waiting for it with a cleared front leg, nice clean swing of the bat and off she goes sailing over the long-on fence

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, Brathwaite is walking off thinking it is the end of the over. But someone tells him there's a ball to go. He was off there thinking the job is done. Short and outside off, Brathwaite stands tall and flat-bats it straight over Thakur

Shreyas Gopal to Shubman Gill, SIX, Gill is getting a move on. Knew what was coming from Gopal, it was the juicy leg-break. Gill charges out and tonks it through the line over long-off. Archer can only watch it sail over his head for a maximum

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, SIX, this maximum brings the 50-stand up for the duo. Another drag down delivery from Gopal, comes off the final ball of his spell. Karthik sees it early, pivots back and smacks it over cow corner. Feel for Gopal, he's bowled so well, just that lost his line and lengths in his last over

Jofra Archer to A Russell, SIX, wades into Archer. Just cannot bowl there for Russell. Goes full and at the stumps, Russell takes his front leg out of the way and dismisses it over long-on. Sheer disdain

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, top-edge but it's that sort of an edge that batsman loves. Unorthodoxy by Karthik, moves across to hoick it across the line with a horizontal bat. A fat top-edge is found and it's going only one way. Over the keeper's head and off she goes for half-a-dozen. Fifty up for the skipper, much vital this for the team. Raises his bat and the dug-out in all applauses

Unadkat to A Russell, SIX, Unadkat's nightmarish day continues. Cutter to Russell? Too full and Russell feasts on it. Sets up a low stance and hacks it violently through mid-wicket. Flat and the deep mid-wicket fielder was lining up, but it cleared Samson in the end. Hits his fingertips and parries over. Brutal

Laughlin to A Russell, SIX, incredible! How do you bowl to this guy? Laughlin digs in the slower short ball, Russell stayed back but had to generate some power to clear the deep mid-wicket fielder. Gets more than enough to power it into the crowd

Laughlin to A Russell, SIX, woah. Change up from Laughlin, ushers in the pacy bouncer at Russell's torso. Took the gamble but didn't come off well. Russell pulls it over his head and dismisses it over fine leg. All the way!

Jofra Archer to A Russell, SIX, phew! That bat-speed and the muscle power from Russell. Didn't get it off the middle but it hardly matters to him. The back of the hand slower ball, rising up and Russell forehand swats it over long-off. Sends it a long way over long-off. Came off the bottom, still dispatched it for a maximum. How?
A Russell to Rahane, SIX, ah Jinks. Gets a wide-short combo, Rahane rocks back, sways, but the hands are quick to pounce on. Cuts, airy and that Centurion-2003 moment as it flies into deep point

Narine to Samson, SIX, that is a jail-break from Samson! Retaliation from the batter as he camped back to smoke a sixer over deep mid. That was gargantuan from the young man and 61 is needed now. RR, more importantly Samson, needed that
Narine to R Tripathi, SIX, there's long-on. But why bother when you can time it like this. Narine tosses his carrom ball full, Tripathi's down on a knee already. And smoking it .. 20 rows back
Narine to R Tripathi, SIX, it can get longer. Tripathi makes his 'V' bigger, clears his leg, sits as usual. And it's for cow corner's crowds to try and grab that lakh
Searles to Samson, SIX, 122.9kph of a filthy nothing. Samson stays up tall, swinging horizontally. Picks up the empty mid-wicket and a 68-meter hit will do
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chawla, SIX, clears the front leg to this length ball and muscles it over mid-wicket. Length ball from Khaleel, right into Chawla's arc. 14 off the over to revive KKR's chase

S Kaul to Shubman Gill, SIX, and clears long-off! Gill has ensured that there will still be some pressure on the weaker bowling option - whoever that is, when the final over starts. Full ball outside off, Gill is deep in the crease to smash it back down the ground. Powers it into the crowd
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn, SIX, slower one at 127km/h, length ball outside off, child's play for Lynn, who smokes this flat over deep extra cover for six
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Chris Lynn

Commentary: Bhuvneshwar to Narine, SIX, length ball outside off, Narine effortlessly tonks it over long-off for six! Just over the rope...

K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, SIX, fractionally short, skidding outside off, Nitish Rana could've done that without an ounce of muscle in his forearms, cheekily steers that upper cut over the jumping giant (Brathwaite) at third man for six
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana

Commentary: K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana, SIX, into the stratosphere and back! Oh these massive top-edges! Bat regulations who? Shortish and angling into the body, Nitish Rana turns on his heels into a Ganguly-pull towards fine leg as the spectators' have a deja-vu. High into the sky and lands just over fine leg
batsman: K Khaleel Ahmed to Nitish Rana

Commentary: S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, length ball outside off, Chris Lynn gets out of the way, gives himself room, and launches this over long-off for an 85-meter six

Kuldeep Yadav to Deepak Hooda, SIX, Hooda is not bothered with a wicket or the break. First ball after the break and he sends it soaring over the fence for a maximum. Tossed up delivery on a fullish length, Hooda just went through the line and lofted it handsomely over long-on

Prasidh to Brathwaite, SIX, that is the problem with yorkers, you can't miss it by much. Nice juicy full toss and Brathwaite said thank you very much by depositing it into the cow corner fence for half a dozen

Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, SIX, Chawla in action again and this time he parries it over. Misjudged it completely. Rashid charged down and threw everything at the back of a length delivery, sliced it towards sweeper cover and Chawla ran forward to take the catch, got fingertips to it and parried it over. Had he stood his ground, it was coming straight to him

Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, SIX, Rashid is playing a blinder here. And he still has one over to go. Can he get SRH to 165-170? Full and outside off, Rashid reaches out for it, down on knee and smashing it a long way back into the deep extra cover stand. A top order batsman would have been proud of that shot

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, SIX, oh geez! "This is the shot of the innings," calls Sanjay M on air and couldn't agree more. Full on off, Rashid went deep in the crease and whipped it with all his bottom hand over deep backward square. It was just a flick of the wrists and the pace of Prasidh took care of the rest

Prasidh to Dhawan, SIX, cracking shot, that should get Dhawan and SRH off and running, a friendly length ball on Dhawan's pads, he picked it up, used Prasidh's pace and clipped it high and behind square on the on-side, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, SIX, Rashid, you beauty! He has given SRH the total they were looking for. 24 runs off the final over. Just what the doctor order for SRH. It was the slow off-cutter and Rashid picked the bones out of that, waited for it and thumped it over the long-on fence for a maximum. Tom Moody, the SRH coach, now affords a smile and has a word with Williamson
Shakib to Watson, SIX, over the wicket, odd angle for Shaks, Watson gets low and plays a hybrid sweepull over backward square leg for six. Fifty up for Watto! Big match, and the big man stands up!
Shakib to Raina, SIX, tossed up on an enticing length outside off, Raina reaches out and gets to the pitch, check-lofts it over long-on for six! Raina turning it on in a big match!

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, oh my word! How on earth has he managed to hit that so well and so cleanly? This is actually a slower ball very well disguised by Sandeep Sharma, Watson was beaten for pace, almost was early into the shot, but managed somehow to reach out and muscle the ball over long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, and he's not done yet! Don't bowl full tosses sir! At least not when he's in this mood. Watson waits for the ball and smashes it over the mid-wicket boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, hat-trick of sixes. He's carrying a niggle, but he's hitting them cleanly. Gee, what a turnaround this has been been. Took 11 balls to get off the mark and now he's 82 off 44. Length ball and Watson blasts that over long-on
Brathwaite to Watson, SIX, he wants to finish this early. He is just a hit away from a hundred now. Back of a length delivery on the stumps, Watson pulls and clears deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, two dot balls and Rayudu has had enough. Runs at the bowler and nonchalantly lofts it over wide long-off, easily clears the rope

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, biffed away! That goes the journey as it was dragged slightly short. The seam up delivery came on to the bat nicely and was in the arc for the batsman to put it away over deep square leg. CSK breaking the shackles?

S Kaul to Watson, SIX, oh a horror of a delivery by Kaul! A length ball angling into the pads, Watson just has to flick it away over deep backward square leg for six! Watto has started to find the meat. A neat and violent pick-up shot...
S Kaul to Watson, SIX, looked like another slower one, Watson doesn't try anything straight batted this time (wary of the knuckle ball) and cross-bats that over long-on for six. Muscled.
Jadeja to Shakib, SIX, umm. Sitting up in the slot, and Shakib's sitting too. Full-swing, slogging it into cow corner

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, SIX, airy, long and 82 meters. Karn tries teasing out another floater well outside off, Yusuf doesn't bother getting out, sits and slices it up and several rows into extra cover
Lungi Ngidi to Y Pathan, SIX, you beaut Yusuf. He's rocked forward, makes the decent back of a length ball into one in his slot and spanks it flat. My, o my, the power his bottom hand hides
Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, SIX, length. Juicy, sitting up length. Brathwaite plants his leg, hammering it 85-meters into long-off. So damn one-sided

Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, SIX, talk about ruining something. Yes, this is just that. For some wierd reason, Ngidi goes for the yorker, Carlos shows us how the world remembered his name in the first place. By depositing it into long-on

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, long-on's there. He's waiting. He reaches out .. and watches it fly fast. That's the hit. Thakur tries another one of his shorter balls, but Brathwaite's not missing this. He's mowing them over

Chahar to Williamson, SIX, top-edge and six! First of the innings and this might get Williamson going. Chahar shortens his length and Williamson is through the shot and hence the top-edge, went high and cleared the long leg fence with ease. Small boundaries at Wankhede

SN Thakur to Dhawan, SIX, Gabbar unleashes! It is high time they start taking a risk or two. Length delivery right in the slot, Dhawan clears his front leg out of the way and launches it over the long-on fence. The swing has disappeared and the bowlers need to be clever now

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, SIX, excellent finish to the over. Three dots and still it is a 11-run over. Bravo goes searching for the yorker and bowls a juicy full toss, Williamson moves across and helps it over short fine with a lap. A ball-boy takes a well judged catch outside the rope
Harbhajan to Moeen Ali, SIX, first maximum of the 2019 IPL! It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Moeen Ali goes down on his knees and nails the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket for a six
Harbhajan to Moeen Ali, SIX, first maximum of the 2019 IPL! It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Moeen Ali goes down on his knees and nails the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket for a six
Shakib to Chris Lynn, SIX, lovely, a little shimmy down the track, Lynn gets close to the ball and then lifts it nonchalantly over long-on - a towering hit and he's off and running
Shakib to Uthappa, SIX, flat drag down -- just what Uthappa needs to break his shackles. Camps behind, swings, flat and deposits it deep into square leg

Shakib to Nitish Rana, SIX, oh there's a plan. There's surely a plan, and Shakib is the villan in that plan. Rana's quick to sink down, pick the sitting-up length, get under it and smoke it into cow corner
Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, SIX, juicy. A full toss around the waist, full-paced as well and Rana stays in the arc, in the V and slices it high, 79-meters into long-off

S Kaul to A Russell, SIX, ah, the dreadful length. Kaul asking for trouble here, and Russell - the compulsive punisher that he is - obliger. Clears out that front leg of his, gets it in his swinging zone and smacks it way over deep mid-wicket
S Kaul to A Russell, SIX, misses the yorker now. Russell gets lesses than half his bat on this, but his biceps will do .. makes room, tonks it straight back, and it's good enough for 77 meters

Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, SIX, oh he's nearly troubling the electricity board himself, sending this soaring so high and long that to try and clean up the light tower they just repaired. Okay so it's full on leg, and Russell continues clearing his front leg and sending it into the skies over cow corner

Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, SIX, he's fooled here, but such has been the audacity of this hitting that Russell sends this into the stands as well. Nearly falls over as he tries clubbing one from outside off, but it's his day, and it's well over long-off
Shakib to Shubman Gill, SIX, well he's been waiting, and he reminds us that he can tonk them around too for fun. Dances, swings, deep, long, game, set, match

Shakib to Shubman Gill, SIX, ho, ho. Another dance down, cleaner to the pitch of it and smokes it into the sightscreen that's taken many a blow tonight. It's a steal, an under-broken-lights robbery. Hyderabad, call the cops!

Sandeep Sharma to Nitish Rana, SIX, beautifully played, tad too full from Sandeep, Rana leans forward, drives it on the up and clears mid-on with ease - the timing is so sweet that the ball lands on the ropes and it's a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Warner, SIX, Warner is in top gear! Tad short around off, the southpaw reaches out for it and thumps it right over long-on. Six more and Sunrisers have moved on to 92 after the first 10 overs, Warner has scored 62 of them
Narine to Shankar, SIX, massive, I reckon SRH got the better trade - after they let Dhawan go, picked the wrong 'un, went down low and swipes it it high and over square leg for a maximum

A Russell to Warner, SIX, clubbed, that's sheer power from Warner, back of a length and at the stumps, was the slower ball from Russell - Warner waits on it and then punches it back over the bowler's head - the timing is sweet and the ball sails over the ropes for a maximum
Prasidh to Shankar, SIX, cracking shot, the slower ball from Prasidh, but the ball simply sat up to be smacked, Shankar made room and clears long-on by a distance - simply stunning from Shankar
Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, thumped down the ground! Bairstow shimmies down the wicket, converts it into a half volley and lofts it right over the bowler's head. Couldn't have hit a better shot

A Russell to Warner, SIX, fifty on comeback for Warner! His 37th fifty in the history of IPL. Gets there in grand style with a six. Latches on to the short ball and slices it over third man. The fielder was sprinting across but he could do nothing more than watching this sail over him
Cutting to Pant, SIX, he is upping the ante now. It was a nothing delivery, banged in around hip-height. Pant gets in a good position and powers the pull shot over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Hardik Pandya to Pant, SIX, this wild heave from Pant is becoming a trademark shot for him. It was short and wide of off, Pant clears his front leg and hoicks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Hardik Pandya to Pant, SIX, this is Pant at his very best. He has taken Hardik Pandya apart. Stays put in the crease and slams the pull shot over deep mid-wicket. Lot of wrist work in that shot

Bumrah to Pant, SIX, wow! Pant is on a roll here. Not many batsmen in the world can dispatch Bumrah for a six when he nails the yorker but Pant can! It was very full and was on the stumps, Pant goes deep in the crease and unleashes the half-helicoper shot over deep square leg for a maximum. Shot of the evening!

Rasikh Salam to Pant, SIX, clears the fence with ease. How easy he makes it look. It was a length delivery on the stumps, Pant clears his front leg and dispatches it over deep square leg for another six

Rasikh Salam to Pant, SIX, going, going and gone! That's hugeeeeeeee! And tell you what, he has only used one hand. This is unbelievable power-hitting from Pant. It was a slower delivery wide of off, Pant takes it from wide of off, brings his bat down at an incredible speed and launches it over long-on for a six

Bumrah to Pant, SIX, Pant has gone nuts at the Wankhede. Bumrah is been taken to the cleaners here from the southpaw. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Pant goes back and pumps it over deep square leg for another maximum
Bumrah to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, oh dear! Rahul Tewatia is at it too. They are all at it. Tewatia goes down on his knees and slog sweeps India's fastest bowler for a maximum over deep mid-wicket

McClenaghan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, how well has he hit this! Full and in the slot, he just extends the forward defence into a chip shot and such is the connection that it not only clears mid-off but also the ropes on the full

Hardik Pandya to Ingram, SIX, smokedddddddd! Can't bowl short to Ingram, he'll have you for breakfast and dinner all day long. Clears his front leg and clobbers the pull over deep mid-wicket. Made a cracking sound off the blade

McClenaghan to Dhawan, SIX, the release over that Dhawan was searching for! Short and wide, Dhawan loves the ramp and the geographical details of the Wankhede allow him to as well. The ball really travels here and the ball clears the third man fence quite easily
Ishant to Krunal Pandya, SIX, outrageous hit from Krunal! Pacy short of a length ball and he was hanging back, smokes the flat-batted hit high and handsome over the long-on fence. Shot!

Axar to Yuvraj, SIX, Yuvraj's got hold of this one! Flatter and outside off, he had to fetch this and did so. Chose the safest spot on the ground - straight back down the ground, crashing into the sight screen. Can the old warhorse create a fist of this chase?
Axar to Yuvraj, SIX, smashed away! Half tracker and Yuvraj is sitting back for precisely this length. Pulls it merrily into the crowd at deep mid-wicket
Boult to de Kock, SIX, de Kock has arrived and how! Latches on to this length delivery, holds his shape and whacks it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Rahul Tewatia to Pollard, SIX, clean as a whistle! Can Pollard do a Russell? Keeps his eyes on the ball and smokes the tossed up delivery right over the bowler's head. High, handsome and it's six runs for Mumbai Indians. Yuvi needs to hit a few of these if the hosts want to make a match out of it
Axar to Yuvraj, SIX, shot! This is what the crowd has come for! Tad short outside off and Yuvraj lofts it over covers for an excellent six. All about timing was that shot
Gowtham to Agarwal, SIX, a hint of flight on offer outside off, Agarwal reaches out and swings his bat through the line, runs his hands through it in lofting it over long-off for six!

Unadkat to Gayle, SIX, some more. And more = clean. It's pitched up, but still enough in the slot for Gayle to go further inside to and tonk it neatly into the sightscreen. Also, a personal 50 -- and nothing WWE-like in the celebrations .. aah, someone's grown up
Jofra Archer to Gayle, SIX, whoa. Absolute carnage. Once that knee bends, things don't stay in this circumference. Archer dishes out full pace but Gayle's swing is mightier. Smashes the sightscreen
Stokes to Gayle, SIX, 134.2kph. Plus a pitch up in the arc. So Gayle swings with a straight bat, with a lot of toe-end, but those muscles will do an 87-meters themselves

Stokes to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, going, going and gone! What a finish to the innings. It was full and in the slot, Sarfaraz clears his front leg and whacks it across the line. Enough power and it sails over cow corner
Unadkat to Agarwal, SIX, 133.3km/h, normal pace, on a back of a length, Agarwal backs away and transfers his weight onto that through-the-line loft over deep extra cover for six! Fantastic hit!
Gowtham to Gayle, SIX, okay, his eye is in officially. Also Gowtham's tossing this in the slot, when Gayle's already waiting on a knee. And bang. Over cow corner. Maybe it's still travelling ..

Sam Curran to Smith, SIX, that's Steven Smith at his very best! Ah, those whippy wrists - International cricket missed you! Shuffles a tad, like he always does, and absolutely smokes it into the second tier

Shami to Samson, SIX, that's the best he's hit thus far! Stands still inside the crease, watches the full ball dip outside off and creams the loft with high hands, flat for a 82-metre maximum over wide long-off
Mujeeb to Stokes, SIX, Ben Stokes is a no non-sense cricketer! Sits on one knee and smokes this floater flat over mid-wicket. Huge hit
Mujeeb to Buttler, SIX, high and handsome over long-off. Flighted just outside off, Buttler loads up and smashes it for a maximum
Sam Curran to Buttler, SIX, that would have been applauded at the Flushing Meadows! That was a superb forehand down the ground. Powered over long-on. Flat and muscular

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, wowza! For a moment, it looked like Pant had mistimed this but nope, got enough timing on it to clear Shardul at long-off. Harbhajan has his hands on his head. Slowish and serves it outside off, Pant throws his bat and didn't connect it off the middle. Came off the toe-end but such is his power that it sails a leaping Shardul for a maximum
Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, hint of flight and Iyer's eyes light up. Loads up big time and clears his front leg to deposit into the empty stands over long-off. First six of the innings!

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, wowza! For a moment, it looked like Pant had mistimed this but nope, got enough timing on it to clear Shardul at long-off. Harbhajan has his hands on his head. Slowish and serves it outside off, Pant throws his bat and didn't connect it off the middle. Came off the toe-end but such is his power that it sails a leaping Shardul for a maximum
Tahir to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, hint of flight and Iyer's eyes light up. Loads up big time and clears his front leg to deposit into the empty stands over long-off. First six of the innings!
Chakravarthy to Narine, SIX, Narine gets off the mark with a maximum. A looped up ball, full and in Narine's arc. The southpaw stands tall and thumps it over long-off
Chakravarthy to Narine, SIX, shot! Narine gets down on a knee and slogs this length ball over the deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, full toss and Rana has launched it into the crowd over mid-wicket. That's a gimme and Nitish Rana took full toll of it

Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, another one from Nitish Rana! For a fleeting moment he seemed to have mistimed it, but the breeze takes it over the boundary ropes. Fired wide of off, Rana reaches out and toe-ends the lofty hit over wide long-off
Mandeep to Nitish Rana, SIX, another one in the zone and this time it's Nitish Rana! Clears his front leg and clouts the length ball over cow corner
Mandeep to Nitish Rana, SIX, flat and over the leaping fielder at sweeper cover! Two sixes in a row. Was smidgen short and Rana freed his arms to slap it over Shami in the deep
Viljoen to Nitish Rana, SIX, hits back of a length and Rana clubs it over long-on with ease! Set himself on the back foot and mauled it with full might

Tye to A Russell, SIX, are ya kiddin' me? A slower one aimed at the body, into the ribcage, Russell just twists into a pull, gets a massive top-edge that sails over fine leg for six - speaking of laws of the game, what happened to the bat-laws?
Tye to A Russell, SIX, length ball, a sin at this point, right in the arc, and Russell opens up to cart that over long-on for six
Shami to A Russell, SIX, 143.1km/h, an inch too short for the yorker length = half-volley, Russell opens up his stance, clears the front-leg, and absolutely clouts that over long-off for six

Shami to A Russell, SIX, attempts another yorker, errs on the fuller side this time, a full-toss in the slot, Russell swings across the line, clubs a gigantic six over cow corner - spectators of Bengal, watch out!

Shami to A Russell, SIX, another full-toss, 142.9km/h, from round the wicket, misses the yorker by a long way, clearly holding the ball too tight, Russell follows that algorithm of opening up that stance for a trigger and carts it over deep mid-wicket for six

Chakravarthy to Narine, SIX, 25 off the over! Not the start the debutant would have hoped for. The pressure got to him and he darted a full ball on the pads. Easy pickings for Narine, who flicked it over backward square leg

Viljoen to Uthappa, SIX, shot! Viljoen provided a bit of width outside off on this short of length delivery and Uthappa used his quick hands to great effect. Carved it over backward point and the ball has enough wings to go the distance

Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa goes after Ashwin with deep mid-wicket and long-on in place. It was floated up outside off, Uthappa got down, fetched it from there and slogged it over cow corner. Good contact
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, Ashwin gives a lot of air on this off-break, but the length is slightly too full. Nitish Rana gets down on a knee and bludgeons it over long-on for half a dozen
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, touch short and Rana pounces on it. Keeps his head still and smacks it from outside off for a 80-metre flat maximum over long-on

Prasidh to Gayle, SIX, 145.1km/h, too short and too wide, Gayle has no interest in it until the ball is almost parallel to him, no unnecessary movement, just gets under it and upper-cuts it over third man for six!
Kuldeep Yadav to Miller, SIX, and the sweep gets him out of jail. Emphatically. Knelt down and smacked it. The bat made a massive noise as it met the ball. The ball whistled over deep mid
Narine to Miller, SIX, too full, the leverage was there and he has muscled it over the bowler's head for a towering sixer. Massive hit from Killer Miller

Chawla to Agarwal, SIX, oh these bats, modern day cricket, power, so cruel for the bowler. Quickish delivery on the leg stump, Agarwal was caught between a sweep shot and a pull shot, but he's somehow sweetly muscled this to clear backward square leg

Ferguson to Mandeep, SIX, this is a lovely lofted off-drive, nothing better than this sort of a shot to get going. Length ball, nice pitch to bat on, so Mandeep hit through the line and collected a maximum

Ferguson to Miller, SIX, now then, KXIP need seven more of these. But hey, this bloke has backed away to this full ball and somehow sliced this ball over backward point, normally you see the ball travel over cover, incredible hit

Ferguson to Gayle, SIX, 142.9km/h, doesn't take the pace off this time, short one on the stumps, but Gayle's trigger is to back away into the on-side - he's absolutely clubbed that, cross-batted, over the long-on fence for six. A fantastic first four balls, spoiled by the last two balls...

Moeen Ali to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar Yadav has had enough of the miscues. Backs his power and goes for the biggie. It was a flat length ball, the right-hander stood tall and bludgeoned it over long-on. Didn't worry about his shape, there did Suryakumar
Chahal to Yuvraj, SIX, a freebie from Chahal and Yuvraj doesn't need second invitations. A half-tracker from the leggie, Yuvraj rocks back and muscles the pull over deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Yuvraj, SIX, kaboom! Vintage Yuvi. Yuzvendra Chahal over-corrects and doles out a half-volley. Right in the southpaw's slot and Yuvraj has bludgeoned it straight down the ground
Chahal to Yuvraj, SIX, hat-trick of sixes! Chahal bowls this wider outside off, Yuvraj goes deep in the crease and also moved towards off to hoist it over long-on. He lofted it off the back foot

Navdeep Saini to Hardik Pandya, SIX, 137.4kph, shortish ball that sits up nicely. Having already shuffled across, Hardik waited for the ball to come to him. A pivot across, followed by a fierce pull over deep mid-wicket. That's mighty

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, SIX, huuuuge! Mohammed Siraj bowls a fullish ball, Hardik stays deep in the crease and it ends up right in his slot. Gets underneath it and massacres it straight down the ground

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, SIX, over deep mid. This is the biggest! It's gone outta here. Once again, Siraj misses his yorker by a couple of inches, Hardik Pandya stays deep in the crease and uses his wrists to send it out of the ground. For those stuck in the traffic jam, watch out!

Navdeep Saini to Rohit, SIX, never bowl short to Rohit, Saini learns why. Bends his back and goes short, Rohit quickly shifts his weight back and pulls, not too convincing but enough timing on it to send it into the deep mid-wicket stands. Imperious from MI captain

Siraj to de Kock, SIX, woah! This is a shot of authority from de Kock. Effortless and dominant stuff from the South African. Siraj served it up in the slot, de Kock takes his front foot forward and freed his arms, making proper connection to launch over long-on. He's the batsman in form!
Markande to de Villiers, SIX, in the arc and that's gone! Lovely floater outside off, AB gets underneath it and smites it over wide long-off with the cleanest of bat swings you'll ever see
Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, slower, loopy, leg-stump. Okay, does it matter to a batsman like AB? He just stands his ground and whiplashes it into the crowd over backward square. Gee, the ease...
Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, length ball outside off, AB clubs it clean over extra cover. That's gone straight into the second tier

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, too predictable from Malinga. Another slower ball and the length is way too short, AB had all the time in the world to pick his spot and he marmalizes it into the mid-wicket orbit without breaking sweat

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, for a fleeting moment AB seemed to have mistimed it. Wasn't to be. AB was moving to the leg-side but Hardik kept it wide of off, bowled it on a length and made AB fetch; carved off the bottom half but no problems, it keeps traveling and sails over the leaping sweeper cover fielder
Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, full toss on the pads, see you tomorrow! Can't bowl there to AB and that's disappeared at the rate of knots. Straight into the third tier over square leg

Malinga to Shivam Dube, SIX, this is why he's been picked in the IPL. Shows no sign of nerves and pumps the full ball over long-off, Malinga didn't have the pace to trouble the batsman and it was righ in the slot for a left-hander

McClenaghan to Moeen Ali, SIX, oh what a shot! McClenaghan will be kicking himself for bowling a freebie full ball on the leg stump, Mo flicks with a strong bottom hand grip and it sails over backward square leg
Krunal Pandya to Parthiv Patel, SIX, this is a brave ball, but Parthiv is a good player of spin and he loves the slog-sweep. Landed full and Parthiv went aerial over mid-wicket

Shankar to Rahane, SIX, hit-me delivery and Rahane obliges. A gift on the pads and Rahane picks it up nonchalantly over backward square, struck it flat and got it over the rope. Bhuvi also might have misjudged as he came in before running back, too late by then

Nadeem to Rahane, SIX, woah! What timing. Rashid thought he was in with a chance near the rope but the ball kept sailing over him. Nadeem in an attempt to dart it in offers an half volley, Rahane backs away and chips the loft inside out, yes just a chip and off went the ball clearing the rope comfortably

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, SIX, fabulous shot! This for me is the shot of the innings. The leg-cutter on a length outside off, Samson plonks his front foot forward and lofts it over extra cover. The power he generated on the slower ball was ashtonishing

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, SIX, into the 90s now.. Sandeep offers a friendly full toss just below the waist, Samson deep in the crease is set up for a heave into the leg-side, the ball was right in his arc and he swings it away 20 rows back near deep square leg
Nadeem to Samson, SIX, bang in the slot. And here's Samson's lazy elegance. On a knee, swinging, sorry slogging, and depositing it deep into cow corner

S Kaul to Samson, SIX, another knuckle pace-off. But Samson picks it perfectly, staying on the front foot and pulling it high. Shankar's waiting for this at deep mid-wicket, he leaps one-handed as well, but despite the 73-meter boundary, the timing takes it just over
Nadeem to Rahane, SIX, runs down, gets close to the pitch of it and smacks it straight down. He's been looking for this for quite some time now, and he really needs this

D Kulkarni to Warner, SIX, geez that's massive! Banged in on a back of a length @143.5km/h, Warner gets his weight on his backfoot and carts that into the second tier over the cow corner fence. Brutal with a dash of panache...
D Kulkarni to Shankar, SIX, he's powered this all the way over long-on. Backs away, gets a nice short ball, and Shankar flat-batted that hard over the boundary

D Kulkarni to Shankar, SIX, gee he's hit this really, really hard! Slower delivery, but Shankar went back in his crease and positioned himself nicely for the pull shot over mid-wicket, the man in the deep was interested for a bit but it cleared him comfortably
Unadkat to Shankar, SIX, it's a slower ball alright, but this bloke is picking them from the hand, so he's being disguised, nicely gets under the ball and smashes it over mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, SIX, gee! The bloke is bowling over 140kph, but Yusuf didn't bother going back to pull this hard, hit it flat and all the way over deep square leg

Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, SIX, oh wow! What a hit and what a shot to finish. Just a whip of the wrists, Jofra Archer's pace helped here, but he middled that so well. Leg-side line again from Archer with the yorker, just a flick with those rubber wrists. SRH win with an over to spare
Gowtham to Warner, SIX, right in the swinging arc for Warner, wide and full outside off, Warner steps forward and lofts it flat over long-off for a six

Shreyas Gopal to Bairstow, SIX, what a way to bring up the hundred partnership! Dropped short, a rank half-tracker, Bairstow uses the depth of the crease, rocks back, and throws his entire weight behind that pull over cow corner for six

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, SIX, that's quality hitting from Agarwal. He didn't try to hit it hard, comes close to the ball, keeps his shape and larrups it down the ground. The timing was good enough to clear the long-on fence which is not a short boundary at all

Krunal Pandya to Agarwal, SIX, he is playing the innings of his life in the IPL. Gets a six off the first ball of the over- doing it the Kohli way. Holds his shape, clears his leg and smashes it down the ground for a six

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, this is more like Rahul. This is the Rahul we know. It was a back of a length delivery wide of off, there was enough room available for Rahul. He backs away, brings his willow down at a tremendous speed and cuts it over deep backward point for a six

McClenaghan to Gayle, SIX, massive, you can't bowl short to this man - this simply sat up to be smacked, Gayle stands tall and pummels it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum, 101m hit, a colossal one
McClenaghan to Gayle, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Gayle, his 300th six in IPL, length ball at the stumps, he leans forward and thumps it high and over mid-on, went a long way over the ropes

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, clears the mid-wicket fence, but only just. It's a baby six by Gayle's gigantic standards. It was a slower one on the stumps, Gayle backs away, clears his front leg and powers it over deep mid-wicket.

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, you can't miss your length by an inch when Universe Boss is in this mood. Attempted yorker goes wrong, Gayle goes deep in his crease, makes it into an overpitched delivery and larrups it straight down the ground for a massive six
Shami to de Kock, SIX, sensational pick up shot from de Kock! Treats Shami as a spinner here by walking across and just drop kicks it over deep square leg. Beautiful connection

Shami to Hardik Pandya, SIX, and this is why - another full-toss and it has been sent into the mid-wicket stands, presses across and then whips it with the bottom-hand, high and long into the crowd - Shami can't bowl such stuff at this stage of the innings

Shami to de Kock, SIX, dumped into the crowd! Fractionally short from Shami and it's not that high to threaten de Kock either. The South African swivels across to shovel the pull high and handsome over deep backward square leg. Huge hit!

Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, proper drag down - as bad as it can get. And it's the googly as well in it, giving Iyer all the more time to read it better - not that he needed it - but then he waits slogging it several rows into deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, now the advance, stepping away from the line to free up his hands. And his hands take it inside-out over long-on

Chawla to Dhawan, SIX, now follows it up with a maximum. This is Dhawan at his best. Googly around leg-stump, that is easy pickings for the left hander, kneels down and sweeps it with a clean bat swing over long leg

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, cracking shot! Shaw picked the length so quickly there, it was fraction short and he was onto it in a flash, gets into a good position and nails the pull flat into the crowd at deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, in the air and over the rope. Seemed like a mishit by Shaw but it carried a good fair distance. Flighted outside off and Shaw lofts it down the ground, clearing long-off. 13 off the over and it was much needed for Delhi
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, conventional, leg-lined, but Iyer's smarter. Clears his forward leg, steps away too and then swings. Into long-on's first floor
Mishra to A Russell, SIX, 100 runs for Russell in the league after this six! Was a tossed up delivery around off and the Dre Russ muscles it over long-off for a flat six
Lamichhane to A Russell, SIX, Muscle-Russell in the house! Reads the googly and pumps it over deep mid-wicket with all his might. There was a fielder in the deep but he was a mere spectator

Lamichhane to A Russell, SIX, is this going to be another one of those nights? If Dre Russ stays out there, it probably might. Down on his knee as he clubs the juicy legbreak right over the bowler's head. That was absolutely launched by the beast

Chris Morris to A Russell, SIX, straight over the sightscreen. Morris goes off-pace but the length is right in the slot, Russell spotted it out of the hand, waited for the ball to arrive and smacked it with all that Caribbean power back over Morris

Harshal Patel to A Russell, SIX, massive! This one hits the roof of the top tier and falls back into the ground. Length and that is one thing you can't bowl to Russell, he just uses that raw muscle power to club it over long-on

Harshal Patel to A Russell, SIX, oh geez! Absolute carnage at Kotla. How things turnaround in T20 cricket. Just a while back KKR looked down but now they are bossing this game through Russell and Karthik. Another length ball and Russell says thank you very much and puts it into the crowd near the cow corner region
Mishra to Chawla, SIX, that is dismissive from Chawla. Off the mark with a maximum. Wrong 'un and Chawla picked it, went down on his knee and slog swept it with a clean bat swing over long leg

Mishra to Karthik, SIX, fifty for Karthik. Cometh the hour, cometh the captain. This is what responsibility has done to DK. He is a completely different batsman and this knock should rate among his best. Shuffles across, bends down and sweeps it high and into the stands at fine leg

Harshal Patel to Karthik, SIX, 50 up for KKR with a maximum! Too hot, too cool. A short delivery down the leg side and Karthik picks it up over deep backward square leg for a flat six. Right over the opposition's dug-out she goes
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, SIX, knuckle ball from Kaul, Grandhomme picks it early and waits back to heave it over deep square leg. Didn't come off the middle but enough to clear the fielder's head

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, rare loose delivery from Rashid and Grandhomme comfortably smokes it over the fence at deep mid-wicket. Dragged it short, sits up superbly for Grandhomme and he takes toll..
Sandeep Sharma to U Yadav, SIX, you can't keep bowling knuckle balls every now and then. This was right in the arc for Umesh, who swings his bat and muscles it into the second tier at long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, SIX, clubbed, Hetmyer comes with a reputation and he gets his first six of the IPL - back of a length and just outside off, he clears his left leg and hammers it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

U Yadav to Warner, SIX, this is batting of the highest quality from Warner. It was an overpitched delivery on the stumps, Warner is not shy to hit the first ball of Yadav's spell. He clears his front leg and larrups it straight down the ground for a sensational six

Moeen Ali to Warner, SIX, has he got enough bat on it? Yes, he has. Nothing is going right for RCB. It was a full-toss on the stumps, Warner stays put in the crease and clobbers it over long-on for a flat six. It was inches over Hetmyer at long-on who leaps in the air but fails to reach it
U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, wow! Just wow! Outstanding hitting this is from Bairstow. He backs away, clears his frong leg and disaptches it over long-on for another six
Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, oh no Jonny show some mercy on the 16-year-old. He dashes down the ground, takes it on the full and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket with utmost ease for a maximum

Chahal to Warner, SIX, lovely, it's raining fours and sixes at the moment, fraction short and at the stumps, Warner rocks back and pulls it flat and hard - went sailing over wide long-on for a maximum
Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, massive, a little shimmy, Bairstow gets close to the ball and lifts it nonchalantly - wide of long-on for a maximum

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, smashed, what more can RCB do? Even muscled mishits are sailing into the stands, a back of a length delivery outside off, Bairstow stood firm and then clubbed it over long-on - makes the boundaries look so short. Bairstow on fire, RCB look down and out at the moment
Chahal to Shankar, SIX, .. and Shankar needs just one ball to continue RCB's torment, flighted delivery at the stumps, he leans forward and smashes it high and over long-on for a maximum

Siraj to Warner, SIX, that's straight into the RCB dug-out, the yorker strategy lasted one ball, Siraj drops this one an inch short, allows Warner to get under it and thump it over Hetmyer's head at long-off
U Yadav to Warner, SIX, this is a poor ball from Umesh, slower ball, but the length was short and just sat-up to be smacked - pulled with disdain and pulled over long leg for a maximum

Prayas Barman to Bairstow, SIX, that is a comprehensive hit from Bairstow. And he has deposited it a long way back. It was fuller and was wide of off, Bairstow larrups it over deep cover for a maximum

de Grandhomme to Bairstow, SIX, that was a miserable delivery and Bairstow has given it the treamtment it deserved. It was a slower one on a short of length, Bairstow goes on the back foot and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for a massive six

de Grandhomme to Bairstow, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Bairstow. It's raining sixes here in Hyderabad. It was a good length delivery on the stumps, Bairstow clears his front leg, keeps his shape and tonks it deep into the mid-wicket stands for a six
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, SIX, flush in the slot, and Raina's V is always smoke-worthy. He gets his front leg out of the way, makes room and slogs it high and long into cow corner
D Kulkarni to Dhoni, SIX, and, the skipper takes full toll of the freebie. A low full toss outside off at 132.9kph, Dhoni bends his back leg, gets under it and then lofts it over deep extra cover

D Kulkarni to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, that's the trademark Dwayne Bravo shot! Kulkarni doles out a half-volley, right in the DJ's arc. The right-hander moves leg-side, arches his back and lofts it handsomely over deep extra cover. The maximum also brings up the fifty run stand!

Unadkat to Jadeja, SIX, terrific shot! It was a slower delivery, Jadeja deals with him like he'd treat a club bowler. Waltzes down the ground, gets to the pitch of the ball and bludgeons it over long-on for a flat six

Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, slower ball bouncer, sits up nicely for the right-hander and Dhoni deposits it into the stands. The ball doesn't rise as much as Unadkat would have liked it to. Dhoni stands tall and pulls it fiercely over deep square leg. CSK have crossed 160
Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, this is exactly what the Chennai crowd wanted. A fuller than a good length ball outside off, Dhoni hoists it over long-off. Set his base and then bludgeoned

Unadkat to Dhoni, SIX, 28 off the over! It was another off-pace ball from a short of length, Dhoni waits and flat-bats it over long-on. The fielder in the deep - Tripathi - jumps in an attempt to catch it. It beats him comfortably

Stokes to Watson, SIX, gets hold. And gets it into the empty deep square leg, and then into the empty stands behind that. Stokes bangs it in short, Watson - now with more of a measure of this pitch - rocks behind and pulls it yummily, uppishly. Also, there's nobody in those stands to give the ball back as well. So, get the fourth ump working ..
Jadeja to Stokes, SIX, fired in flat from over the wicket, angled in, Stokes gets on his knee and throws the kitchen sink at it - flat-bats that over deep mid-wicket for six
Tahir to Gowtham, SIX, absolutely smoked! A googly on leg and middle, Gowtham comes down the track and swings it against the turn over cow corner for six

SN Thakur to Jofra Archer, SIX, swings through the line of that half-volley and connects!
