Angles it in towards the leg and middle-stumps, right in the slot, Jofra Archer clears the front-leg a little and brings those massive forearms into play - goes right through the line, beautiful head position, and deposits that over the long-on fence for six
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, SIX, is there a twist? 104.9km/h, a slow length ball outside off, Stokes waits for it and clubs that flat over deep extra cover for six!
Dwayne Bravo to Jofra Archer, SIX, oh that's a poor ball. A absolute no-no at this stage, Dwayne Bravo takes the pace off, and Jofra Archer swings through the line, clubs it over long-on for six
SN Thakur to Stokes, SIX, he's nailed it! Angles it in from round the wicket, Stokes gets under it, gets the bottom-hand off, and gets topspin on that flat hook over backward square leg for six!

Santner to R Tripathi, SIX, Tripathi goes downtown and the sightscreen has to take the brunt. A fullish ball at 90.6kph, Tripathi gets low and underneath it to hoist it over the bowler's end. 15 runs off 3 legal balls in this over

Chris Morris to Rahul, SIX, a fantastic hook! @136.2km/h, not the quickest or steepest of bumpers, Rahul gets back and across, into the front-on position early, gets under the short one and swivels into a fantastic hook over fine leg for six!

Lamichhane to Miller, SIX, smoked! That's twice in a row that Delhi have conceded a boundary/six off the last ball. It was turning out to be an excellent over until Miller decided to use his feet, gets to the pitch of the ball and launches it over wide long-on

Rabada to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep finishes with a maximum. Rabada misses his length and bowls it right in the arc, Mandeep clears his front leg and smashes it straight back over. The boundaries straight are not big and it clears 'em with ease

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, SIX, slows the pace down, tossed up above the eye-line, the googly, Sam Curran spots it, hurries down the track to the pitch of it, and lofts it straight down the ground for a colossal six!

Harshal Patel to Miller, SIX, oh he's made up for those dot balls! A fuller length delivery with a bit of width, right in the slot, Miller swings through the line and runs those massive arms through it - lofts it high and mighty into the crowd in the deep extra cover region for six! Strike-rate back at 100!

Chris Morris to Rahul, SIX, a fantastic hook! @136.2km/h, not the quickest or steepest of bumpers, Rahul gets back and across, into the front-on position early, gets under the short one and swivels into a fantastic hook over fine leg for six!

Lamichhane to Miller, SIX, smoked! That's twice in a row that Delhi have conceded a boundary/six off the last ball. It was turning out to be an excellent over until Miller decided to use his feet, gets to the pitch of the ball and launches it over wide long-on

Rabada to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep finishes with a maximum. Rabada misses his length and bowls it right in the arc, Mandeep clears his front leg and smashes it straight back over. The boundaries straight are not big and it clears 'em with ease

Lamichhane to Sam Curran, SIX, slows the pace down, tossed up above the eye-line, the googly, Sam Curran spots it, hurries down the track to the pitch of it, and lofts it straight down the ground for a colossal six!

Harshal Patel to Miller, SIX, oh he's made up for those dot balls! A fuller length delivery with a bit of width, right in the slot, Miller swings through the line and runs those massive arms through it - lofts it high and mighty into the crowd in the deep extra cover region for six! Strike-rate back at 100!

Stokes to Parthiv Patel, SIX, just over.. Stokes knows how close it was. Short of length and there was no pace on the ball, Parthiv goes for the pull and the top-edge clears a leaping Tripathi near deep backward square

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, SIX, exactly what Stoinis needed to get himself going. He takes full toll of the free-hit. Archer went off-pace but the length allowed Stoinis to flexes those muscles, he powers it over wide long-on. Lot of height and the much needed distance as well

Jofra Archer to Moeen Ali, SIX, another six that is just over.. Archer bowls the slower delivery on short of length, Mo picked the bones out of that, he was expecting this and it was right in his arc, hammers it over a leaping deep mid-wicket fielder
Moeen Ali to Buttler, SIX, Moeen Ali as expected shortens his length, but in the process has over-corrected. A half-tracker, Buttler is quick to jump back and pummel the pull over deep mid-wicket

Siraj to Smith, SIX, heaved away for a maximum. Too predictable. Yet another slower delivery from Siraj, it was in the arc outside off. Smith picked it early, moved across towards off and swung his bat hard to smash it over cow corner

U Yadav to R Tripathi, SIX, Tripathi caps off the match in style. A short ball at 139.1kph, Tripathi picked the length early, got into a good position and pulled it fiercely over deep mid-wicket. Rajasthan Royals win by 7 wickets
Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, smoked! Probably has come a bit too late in the game I reckon. Bravo picked the slower ball this time and swung this merrily into the third tier at long-on. Mammoth blow

Hardik Pandya to SN Thakur, SIX, in the air for an eternity and it's also cleared the ropes! Not a bad hit from a lower order batsman. Fuller length from Hardik and Thakur lifts it high down the ground. Plenty of elevation and just about has the distance to clear long-off

Behrendorff to Raina, SIX, typical inside-out shot from Raina. Triggers his back leg, creates some room to this full ball and lifts it beautifully over cover. The timing was supreme and it clears the ropes for a maximum

Malinga to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, flicked away for a six. Horror delivery from Malinga, very identical to the previous ball. Slanting it on the legs, Jadhav ain't missing out on these freebies. Walks across and helps it away expertly over short fine leg. Almost smashed it towards the Harrier car

Tahir to Krunal Pandya, SIX, that's an old-fashioned heave. And it will clear long-on with ease. It was a leggie on the stumps, Krunal Pandya clears his leg, keeps his shape and dispatches it into the stands

Mohit Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that's Surya-special for you! He shuffles towards the off-side, picks up the slower one, goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket. Into the stands!. Fifty for Surya with this big-hit!

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's an air-strike from Hardik Pandya. You cannot bowl length to Hardik at this stage, he gets behind it, keeps his shape and absolutely smashes it over deep mid-wicket. It went a long way back into the stands

SN Thakur to Pollard, SIX, Pollard power for you! It was on a length and was wide of off, Pollard stays in the crease and smashes it over long-on with utter disdain for a maximum. Hardik Pandya at the non striker's end loved it too!

Dwayne Bravo to Pollard, no ball, SIX, just praised his skill of bowling yorkers and guess what, he delivers a full-toss above the waist height. Pollard larrups it over deep mid-wicket for a gigantic six. Free-hit coming up! It wasn't above the waist height so that was a harsh call from the umpire

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow! Just wow! You will very rarely see a better power hit than this. It was a yorker on ths stumps, Hardik Pandya was deep in the crease and uses his wrists to dispatch it over deep mid-wicket for a massive maximum. Wrist of steel from the younger Pandya!

Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, SIX, 29 off the last over! And Mumbai ends the innings in a sensational fashion. It was a fuller length delivery wide of off, Hardik Pandya uses his wrists brilliantly again to lift it over deep backward point for another maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, clobbered! Got hold of this alright, big Morris! Slower ball on a shortish length, the South African picked it early and swatted it high over deep square leg. Much-needed one for DC

S Kaul to Axar, SIX, that's some power from Axar! Didn't seem initially like he hit this that well but it went soaring over wide long-on. Slower ball on a good length, it's leg stumpish and the southpaw whips it merrily

S Kaul to Axar, SIX, cracking blow from Axar! Perfect finish for DC. Picked the slower ball early this time, was actually getting predictable from Kaul and it's deposited straight down the ground. Clean hit and it goes crashing into the sightscreen

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, excellent shot, because he played that almost with a straight bat, full and down the leg-side, the front foot opened up meant he had that area open for a free swing of the bat, timed it sweetly to clear wide long-on

Rabada to Nabi, SIX, oh and he isn't wasting around. Rabada tries delaying things with a real fierce bumper, you know, quick, climbing up outside off. But Nabi backs away bigger, swishes outside off and upper-slices .. and Kotla is tiny, really tiny to stop Hyderabad from topping the table
Lamichhane to Bairstow, SIX, G-I-G-A-N-T-I-C! Made a cracking sound off the blade and Bairstow has sent this into the top tier at long-on. There was plenty of flight and he absolutely clouted this

Stoinis to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's in the crowd! Typical powerhit from Rana. He will go after it from the word go. This was the bouncer, leg stumpish and he got inside the line to help it over fine leg. Into the second tier

Negi to Nitish Rana, SIX, clubbed over long-on! The home crowd were extremely hopeful that it would carry to the fielder but it's cleared him comfortably. Rare bad ball from Negi who gives one in the slot for Rana who doesn't try to overhit it. Just a clean bat swing to send it over the fence

Navdeep Saini to Karthik, SIX, just clears deep mid-wicket! Typical DK stroke. Half volley on leg stump, he holds his shape and doesn't go hard at it. Rather swings with the flow and it has enough to clear Chahal in the deep. The skipper is keeping KKR afloat

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, six more! Russell has woken up! Slower and wider outside off, Russell sits back and flat-bats it down the ground. Clears the ropes with ease, as is the case when he connects well

Siraj to A Russell, no ball, SIX, Siraj is out of the attack! Another high full toss, Russell stays put and smokes this over deep mid-wicket. Clean hit and it goes all the way. Timely one for KKR but they need plenty more. Second beamer by Siraj and the umpires rightfully inform VK that the pacer can't bowl anymore

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, smokeyyyyyyyyyyy! Another one! In the slot from Stoinis, tried to keep it wide of the big man's reach but Russell gets there and swings clean through the line. Booming hit into the crowd at long-off. The chase is alive and in fact, RCB are now in danger
Southee to A Russell, SIX, swings it into the stands! The carnage continues. In the slot for Russell who shovels it over deep mid-wicket. Clobbered deep into the crowd. Pressure on RCB

Southee to A Russell, SIX, just over the third man fence! Raining sixes now. Short and wide this, third man is up and Russell goes for the upper cut. Got more height on it actually and Chahal from deep backward point fancied a running catch. Not to be

Southee to A Russell, SIX, he's gone nuts, he's gone absolutely nuts here Dre Russ! Southee misses the yorker from round the wicket, it's a low full toss and it's dumped over wide long-on. Flat maximum. It's a storm out here

Southee to A Russell, SIX, 29 off the over! Russell has killed the game. RCB are dead and buried with this onslaught. In the slot from Southee, doesn't miss the yorker by much but that's enough for Russell who blasts it over long-off for another six. Scores level!

Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, Lynn gets into the act. Oh boy! He's launched this out of the ground. Nicely tossed up, Lynn quickly used his feet and outsmarted the bowler, flaunts his muscle power and dismisses it over long-on. New balls please!

Siraj to Chris Lynn, no ball, SIX, this is dreadful stuff from Siraj. What was he trying to bowl there? Steams in and hurls in a full toss that is just over the waist, Lynn takes full toll. Dispatches it into the deep square leg stands. It's called a no-ball for height

A Russell to de Villiers, SIX, it's THE battle of ego .. and AB's setting it up for Russell to match. Gets a sitter on the body - yes - but picks it perfectly with his pull as he deposits it into the second tier behind square. 88 meters
A Russell to de Villiers, SIX, 134.4kph. And all of it is bang in the slot. Russell bowls length for some reason, ask him, and AB sinks, gets under and smokes it over long-off .. 16 off the over
Nitish Rana to Kohli, SIX, 105.1kph. Length now, Kohli's into death mode already, committing big-time into a tonk downtown, smashing the free-ticketers at long-on
Nitish Rana to de Villiers, SIX, another cardinally ball-gone-wrong length. Oh at leasy give AB a challenge - for now he continues rocking behind and muscling them high over long-on
Ferguson to Kohli, SIX, rank length. Kohli lays in, pulling it away, hard, long, cow corner. Such is this pitch, such is this ground, such is I0$ guy, such is I0$ carnage

Ferguson to de Villiers, SIX, make it 19. Poor Ferguson's tried out everything - full tosses, bouncers, length - andhence decides to try out the one thing that remained, a back of a length sitter on the tummy. AB obliges, with a swivel, and a proper hack behind square
Prasidh to Stoinis, SIX, slower cutter, and the levers have been cut loose. Stoinis rocks behind and swings. No, murders. Many, many rows into mid-wicket

Ashwin to du Plessis, SIX, lovely shot! Should be the shot of the match. Carrom ball from Ash, Faf picked it out of the hand, charged out and lofted it with a straight bat right back over the bowler. All the way!

Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, SIX, fifty for Faf. Picked for the first time and he's grabbed the opportunity. Why were they hiding him? Flighted delivery around off, Faf kneels and smokes the slog sweep into the advertising hoardings near deep mid-wicket

Sam Curran to Dhoni, SIX, you can't be slotting in those balls. That was up there, missed the length by a little margin and it was smacked over deep square leg for a sixer. You miss, Dhoni hits it out of the park
Shami to Rayudu, SIX, length ball? That was a poor one from Shami and has disappeared over long-on. Rayudu expanded his long handle into the shot and smoked it over long-on
Shami to du Plessis, SIX, 138kph. Now the adventure. He's done coming down the pitch, so shuffles, sits and waits under the good length to scoop it really fine .. 16 off the over
Tye to Watson, SIX, the cross-seaming sit up. Tye stays in the slot, and Watson stays tonking. Holds his pose, doesn't over-hit, and still manages to loft it all the way over long-off

Tye to du Plessis, SIX, rank overcook, and Faf doesn't even have to advance out to this one - managing to stay his ground, clear out his front leg and go through the line, swinging, smoking into cow corner
Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, length delivery and has been driven on the up! What a shot! Has lifted the ball away over long-off for a sixer. This might be the game changing over
Chahar to Rahul, SIX, you can't bowl short at this pace. And Rahul is a good puller of the cricket ball. Quickly spotted the length, went back and hammered it powerfully over cow corner

Kuggeleijn to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, welcome to the IPL, says Sarfaraz. No respect whatsoever. It was dished out right in the arc just outside off, Sarfaraz freed his arms and opened his bat face at the right moment to clear the in-field. Lost a bit of shape but managed to chip it over point. Superb timing and it just clears the fence for a maximum
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, SIX, that's huge! Outta here! On the pads, Rohit lifts the ball away and it soars away over deep square leg for a massive sixer

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, SIX, boom! Finally, Pandya swings his bat and connects, connects big. Sees a flighted delivery, just outside off and takes it head-on. Strong muscles and biffs it a long way over the stands at long-on. Wears a cheeky smile on his face

S Kaul to Pollard, SIX, oh jeez! What power from Pollard. For a second, thought he mistimed it as his bottom hand came off the handle but such is the power from the big man that he still manages to deposit this 10 rows back over long-off. It was another canny slower ball from Kaul, Pollard didn't pick it and threw everything at it and gets the desired result

S Kaul to Pollard, SIX, low full toss and Pollard clouts it over cow corner. If you miss your length against Pollard, he will make you pay. Kaul misses his yorker by an inch or so, Pollard connects and launches it into the stands

S Kaul to Pollard, SIX, takes full toll. Kaul again misses the yorker, offers a juicy full toss outside off and Pollard takes it on the full to smoke it over cow corner. 83-metre six, Pollard is on song here

Bhuvneshwar to Pollard, SIX, dropped. Nabi palms it over for a maximum at deep square leg. Very sloppy, should've taken by his standards. Whipped across the line and went towards deep square leg, Nabi sprawls across and gets both hands on it, only to tip it over the ropes

Bhuvneshwar to de Kock, SIX, easy pickings. Picked off the pads and heaved away behind square for a sixer. Not the biggest ground and the ball went over the ropes. Little charge down the track and then the club

Bumrah to Nabi, SIX, 120kph. In the back of a length zone just outside off, but Nabi's happy to open up his cards early - which are the same cards he's been trying to deal with all over - backing away and then generating enough power in this lofted tonk of sorts. It looked like he only had the height on first impression, but no, the legs are there, over long-off
Negi to Ingram, SIX, oh so very defensive. Negi continues firing them wide outside off to cut off Ingram's leg-side play - square of the wicket he goes slicing, flat over extra cover

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, well looped up delivery and has been smacked down the ground. Only a shot away now are the Capitals from investing in a win. Poor delivery again from Chahal and Shreyas Iyer was in no mood to let that go away

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, big jump down the pitch, and a bigger bat swing. It really looked a miscued slice at first, but there's enough bottom handed power, and Chinnaswamy isn't the biggest to get it to sail over the sightscreen

Axar to Moeen Ali, SIX, it was a matter of time before Mo took on one of these two. He brings out the dancing shoes, gets close to the flighted delivery and smokes it with the spin over the cow corner fence

Ishant to Moeen Ali, SIX, second time RCB have hit a maximum right after the time out. Back of a length delivery and on a slow surface it was a hit-me ball, Mo swivels back and nails the pull flat over deep mid-wicket

Lamichhane to Moeen Ali, SIX, change of ends for Lamichhane and he's greeted in the same way as he was in his first over. Mo jumps out of the crease, gets close to the googly and smacks it flat over long-off
Lamichhane to Kohli, SIX, finally! Finally, a sweetly timed shot by VK! Down on his knee in a jiffy as he pumps the floated delivery over deep mid-wicket for a flat six

Lamichhane to Kohli, SIX, it's Kohli time at the Chinnaswamy. The decibels have got a notch higher. Treks back and pulls the short ball over deep mid-wicket. Two in two for the skipper as the ball just clears the fence

Chris Morris to de Villiers, SIX, cracking shot, that might get AB going, banged in short and just outside off, in the zone for AB as he pulls it over mid-wicket, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum

Lamichhane to Stoinis, SIX, welcome, Mr. Lamichhane. First ball and Stoinis puts it into the last tier. Flighted on middle, Stoinis clears his front leg and swings it cleanly to send it sailing over long-on. Kohli enjoyed it at the other end

Gowtham to Narine, SIX, a flashback of Gowtham against Narine. Remember that night in 2018? A tossed up delivery, touch short in length and it's been clubbed over deep mid-wicket by the opener, six runs
Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, SIX, and that has crashed into the demonstration car! Went down on to his knees and slammed the slog sweep flat out of the ground. Cliched but was Lynntastic
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, dropped too short - it's the scarred scared bowling - and Uthappa piles on with a rock behind, a front-leg clear and a heave into cow corner

Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, bang in the arc. Uthappa won't let the rhyme go wrong, he'll tonk it out of the park. Short, full, short .. and yes, too full - which Uthappa gets slightly inside the line to and lofts it behind the sightscreen

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's nailed over long-on, 50-run stand up. Also the fastest team fifty in IPL 2019. Lynn puts on his dancing shoes and thumps the short ball over the fence, just clears it

S Midhun to Narine, SIX, Narine moves into the 40s in style. Goes down on his knee and lifts the tossed up delivery over deep square leg. Clears the fence comfortably for his second maximum of the night. Time for a new ball as it's disappeared in the crowd
S Midhun to Narine, SIX, deposited over deep mid-wicket! Latches on to the floated delivery and slogs it over the fence for six more. The required run rate is just over 4.5 at the moment
Shreyas Gopal to Chris Lynn, SIX, it's raining sixes in Jaipur. Lynn gets hold of it and slogsweeps it over deep square leg for another massive six

Gurney to Buttler, SIX, will this get Buttler going? RR will hope it does. Gurney drops the slower delivery short and gives time for Buttler to pick his spot, pulled over deep square leg and that is the first maximum of the day
Narine to Smith, SIX, and boom! That has gone into the orbit. Charged out and muscled it over deep mid for a sixer. Huge hit

S Kaul to Rahul, SIX, that is the delivery service from Rahul we all know of. Picks a length ball and delivers it over long-off for a sixer. The bowler went a bit towards the body of the batter but Rahul timed it well enough to get it over the fence

S Kaul to Agarwal, SIX, KXIP have gone after Siddarth Kaul from his first over and they aren't holding back now either. Was on a length and Mayank had ample room to free his arms outside off, transfers his weight onto the back foot and pumps it high and over the long-off fence
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, 138.1kph. It's the good length with Gayle in the slog mode. He steps away, frees up his hands and lofts the flat-batted tonk over long-on

Nabi to Agarwal, SIX, rank sitter. Agarwal holds his pose, holds his shape and decides to time it out of here - rocking behind and playing it with the straightest of bats as he punches it straight down, flush

Nabi to Agarwal, SIX, quickly down a knee and there's no missing about. Slogs. Holding his pose as he goes through with the swing in depositing it long and deep into cow corner. Shankar, fielding at the fence does try but ends up parrying it over

Mujeeb to Warner, SIX, first six of the innings! It comes in the 16th over. Better late, than never. Warner makes room and thumps the fullish delivery right over the bowler's head. Straight into the sightscreen and that's a maximum

Shami to Hooda, SIX, 1 off the first 3 balls and 14 off the next 3. T20 cricket for you. Low full toss and Hooda climbed into it. Smoked it over long-off for a sixer. Much needed finish as they scale 150
Chawla to Watson, SIX, dragged down short. Watson is quick to pile in, rocking behind, making it look all the more worse and pulling it away, high, long, into cow corner
Narine to Raina, SIX, bang in the arc, Raina obliges it out of the park. Does well to stay inside the line and free up his hands to tonk it into his own dug-out at long-off
Harbhajan to A Russell, SIX, muscled over cow corner. Russell has seen enough, clears his front leg and whacks it with ferocity across the line. It goes sailing over the ropes at deep mid-wicket
Tahir to Chawla, SIX, clubbed over deep mid-wicket. Chawla takes on Tahir, gets underneath it and slams it powerfully over cow corner

Chahar to A Russell, SIX, yup, a smoke. Chahar continues keeping it on a good length, and this time Russell connects, slogging, getting a slight top-edge, but those biceps have been good enough to clear most ropes, so what is Jadeja's diving there now at long-on? ..
Kuggeleijn to A Russell, SIX, never mind those wrists, Russell will forget them for a second. He continues his love affair with cow corner, swatting it hard, flat and several rows back
Rahul Chahar to Gayle, SIX, lots of flight on this delivery, Gayle clears his frong leg and pumps it straight down the ground for a maximum

Krunal Pandya to Gayle, SIX, that's been hit off the back foot, straight back down the ground for six. Some shot. And that's his fifty too. Krunal must have thought he'd done enough by sliding it across on back of a length to prevent damage. But Gayle just leans across and thumps it

Rahul Chahar to Gayle, SIX, that's a googly delivered outside off, not a bad idea. But it's too full, right in the slot, which counters Chahar's thinking. Gayle reaches out and clobbers it over long-on
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, good length ball outside off, Rahul slaps it over extra cover for six
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, the result of that deliberation is a short ball at the body. It's brisk from Pandya, but Rahul's sharper. He's onto the back foot quicker, swinging the pull over fine leg

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, SIX, and six more. He's tearing into Hardik Pandya here. 22 off the over already, with two balls left. And Pandya doesn't know how to react. Poor bowling to be honest. Offers length outside off and is slapped back over long-off
Bumrah to Rahul, SIX, here's six of them. He's deep in the crease to Bumrah, he's cleared his front leg and he's swung this into the stands behind deep midwicket. Bumrah missing his length there

Alzarri Joseph to Rahul, SIX, that is a high-quality shot. Oh hold on, bat turned in his hand at the point of contact. But the velocity of his bat swing helps him in clearing the fence. It was a pacy delivery on the pads and Rahul takes out this closed-faced whip shot and clears the fence
Behrendorff to Gayle, SIX, seven balls faced and he has got his eye in now. It was on a fuller length and was on the stumps, Gayle clears his front leg and clobbers it over long-on for a maximum

Behrendorff to Gayle, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Gayle. Are we in for a Gayle-storm at the Wankhede! There was hardly any effort behind it. He just waits for the delivery to arrive, it was in his arc around his off-stump and he lifts it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum

Behrendorff to Gayle, SIX, 23 off the over! Wow! Universe boss is on fire! Behrendorff delivers another slower one, he is not learning from his mistake. It was on the stumps, Gayle waits for it and unleashes it straight down the ground for another six

Alzarri Joseph to Rahul, SIX, he is looking in his elements today. Form is back, it is certainly back! He identifies the length in a canter(sign of a batsman in form), gets a terrific position and pummels it over deep mid-wicket for another maximum

Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, that is hugeeeeeeeee! Into the second tier! It was a bumper on the face, Gayle stays put and smokes it over deep backward square leg. Good bye ball! Sit back and enjoy that! We are in for a Gayle-storm today

Rajpoot to Lad, SIX, ho ho ho! He might have waited 5 years for an IPL debut with MI but has taken one ball to make an impact. Short, down leg and has been lifted over fine leg for a sixer. Whatta start for Lad!

Ashwin to Pollard, SIX, just over a leaping Miller! If there was one KXIP fielder who could have gotten to this, it was him but not to be. Drag down from Ashwin and Pollard launches it off the back foot down the ground. Raw power and just about manages to get it over long-on. Miller leapt high as much as he could but it kept going over

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, launched over deep square leg! Short balls might trouble Pollard but not this harmless drag down at generous pace. Climbs onto the pull and smashes it into the crowd. Curran better be on his toes because Pollard seems to be lining him up

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, another flat maximum! Pollard has started to find his range and MI are clawing their way back into the game through him. In the slot again from Curran and it's been powered down the ground with loads of power. Long-on tried to get across but it was comfortably over the fielder's head

Ashwin to Pollard, SIX, muscled away by Pollard! Once again, not off the middle but who cares when he can clear the ropes? Makes room and swings through the line over long-on. More off the toe-end but it goes deep into the stands

Ashwin to Pollard, SIX, bang into the comm box! There was a cracking sound and it's back into the ground. Pollard has gone bonkers here. In the slot this one and he just extends the chip shot down the ground. Beautifully done and comfortably goes over the fence. Wow!

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, that's a six to begin with! Can't bowl in the slot to a rampaging Pollard, you just can't. Just lifts it down the ground, this is another mishit that clears long-off comfortably. How does he hit these mistimed shots for six? Insane!

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, freebie and away she goes into the crowd! 50 on captaincy debut in the IPL for Pollard. Promoted himself at a crucial part of the run chase and now seems in command. Has to finish it though. Poor ball from Curran who gives a full toss and it's swung over deep square leg Way into the crowd

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, dumped over long-off! This is incredible from Pollard. We've seen this so many times over the years but still, it looks better every time he repeats it. Another horror ball from Curran, widish length ball and it's dumped with that clean bat swing

Sam Curran to Pollard, SIX, that's into the second tier! H-U-G-E! Curran is extremely young and he's paying the price for inexperience. Still doesn't justify the lengths he's bowling. Middle and leg, in the slot once more and Pollard bulldozes it over long-on. Mammoth hit. Wow!

Rajpoot to Pollard, no ball, SIX, one-handed shovel over deep mid-wicket! The Wankhede is roaring in delight. Whoa! Fantastic scenes at the moment. Rajpoot loses his composure, gives a full toss and he's overstepped too, so many blunders and it's picked over deep mid-wicket. Just another mishit you know, but that's the big man for you

Riyan Parag to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni powers this slog-sweep to the left of deep midwicket, sending it crashing into the ad cushions. That's hit them on the full. Dhoni has come out firing from the onset in contrast to his usual formula

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, SIX, fetches this leg-break from well outside off and muscles it over long-on. Gopal turns back as if to say he didn't do much wrong there, and he maybe right. But Dhoni looks on tonight

Stokes to Rayudu, SIX, advances to a slower ball and slaps it over mid-off, and over the boundary too. He had stepped towards the leg-side, and found himself reaching for the ball that was outside off. But that didn't seem to hamper the timing
Unadkat to Rayudu, SIX, Rayudu is getting there. He's getting back to being the player he is. Steps out and swats this length ball over long-on

Stokes to Jadeja, SIX, this is an unbelievable shot from Ravindra Jadeja, even going past the one that Russell hit against SRH. Russell was only about to fall down while reaching for a wide one outside off, but Jadeja has proper fallen down but has still managed to club it down the ground for six. This is ridiculous

Stokes to Santner, SIX, he's hit this miles! slower ball around off, right in the slot for Santner who smokes it down the ground. This has cleared the boundary, and then some, as he clinches it for CSK. What an insane, insane finish to wrap up the drama of a final over which will be talked about for a while

D Kulkarni to Rayudu, SIX, this is typical Rayudu, he charges down the ground to gather momentum, transforms the good length delivery into a fuller one. And lofts it straight down the ground, the timing was pretty good and it sails over the fence for a maximum

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, SIX, this is an air-strike from MS. Even IAF would have been proud of it. He dashes down the ground in a canter, gets to the pitch of the ball and clobbers it into the night-sky. It sails into the crowd!

Chahar to Buttler, SIX, incredible shot! Wasn't a bad ball by any means. A short of length delivery from Chahar, Buttler stayed in his crease and went downtown. Thumps it over the bowler's head for half a dozen. It was on the stumps and Buttler generated all the power from the crease

SN Thakur to Shreyas Gopal, SIX, lovely, Shreyas is making the CSK captain think - length ball outside off and he lifted it nonchalantly over the head of the fielder at mid-off - the timing is sweet and the ball sailed over the ropes for a maximum

Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, an absolute treat to watch him bat. Especially when he gets his timing right. Goes down on his knee early and carves the length delivery over deep point, that's a flat six for Shaw

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, SIX, one-handed slap! Wow! Over long-off for a sixer. Tossed up ball and Pant danced out to canon the ball over the deep long-off fielder's head for a big six. The ball has been kissed by the curse of oblivion as well

A Russell to Pant, SIX, the partnership between Pant and Dhawan is now 100. Kneels down on one knee and smacks it over long-on for a sixer. Slower delivery and Pant picked the bones out of that dead meat of a delivery

Chawla to Ingram, SIX, and another DC batsman has been denied a century here. This time by his partner but the team wins. Was a floaty delivery and was heaved over long-on for a sixer. KKR were favorites and have been humbled here by a professional DC team, who move to number 4 in the points table

Ferguson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, two sixes in the over, just the kind of momentum Delhi were looking for. Shaw was expecting a short ball and Ferguson gives him what he desired for. The ball skids on, Shaw takes his eyes off the ball and swivels. Gets a fat top-edge that flies over the keeper's head. 14 runs in the over!

Prasidh to Dhawan, SIX, Delhi openers dealing in sixes! Another short ball outside off, Dhawan slashes hard at it and gets an outside edge. This one flies over the cordon and that's six more for the Capitals

Prasidh to Dhawan, SIX, KKR bowlers have been too short so far! Prasidh bowls another short ball outside off, Dhawan hops a touch and slices it over deep backward point for six more. It's raining sixes at the Eden Gardens, Delhi Capitals off to a flier

Axar to Shubman Gill, SIX, superb shot! Much-needed for KKR. Probably the first one that Axar floated ever so slightly and Gill was down the pitch in a flash. Lofted through the line and send it soaring down the ground. Clears the ropes with ease

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, just clears Dhawan! For a moment, he was certainly excited but it just about cleared him. The miscued pick up shot from Rana and he got plenty of height on it. As it panned out, the distance too by a whisker

Axar to Shubman Gill, SIX, smoked over wide long-on! Gill has to up the ante now, being the set batsman and seems like he has made up his mind. In the slot, slightly oustide off and he fetches it with a clean bat swing. Slog swept merrily over the ropes

Rabada to A Russell, SIX, length ball, boom! Slower ball from Rabada but misses his length, right down Russell's street and he clears his front leg to dump this over wide long-on. First maximum for the big man

Chris Morris to A Russell, SIX, high full toss and Russell clobbers this over deep square leg. Meaty hit and it's goes deep into the crowd. Not given a no ball and Russell is livid! Maybe DK should walk out into the field? No such drama this time but to be honest, this is another of the countless umpiring howlers we've had this IPL

Rabada to A Russell, SIX, top-edge but it's six! And he's not even looking at the ball while connecting here, yet gets a maximum. How Dre Russ? How? Was rushed by the pacy bumper which was well-directed, wanted to duck but couldn't and the fat top edge sails over fine leg. Whoa!

Rabada to A Russell, SIX, he's got a big piece of this one alright! Short ball again, right approach but Russell backs away and blasts the pull over deep square leg. Again not off the middle of the bat but these trivial things don't matter for Russell
K Paul to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa breaks the shackles, back of a length and well outside off, sat up to be smacked and Uthappa pulled it high and over long-on for a maximum

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar Yadav goes downtown and he's made good contact. Gopal slightly overpitches and the right-hander takes heavy toll of it. Stays leg-side of the ball, stands tall and bludgeons it over long-off for a maximum
D Kulkarni to Hardik Pandya, SIX, this is a Hardik special! Picked the slower ball early and shuffled across to slug this over deep mid-wicket. Clean bat swing and struck it ever so cleanly

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, SIX, lovely mini-helicopter from Hardik! It's a shot that he's developed in recent times and not only is it great to watch but also is extremely effective. Archer didn't really miss his yorker by much here, was quite full in length but HP is sitting very deep, waiting for any slipup in length. Then just propels it with that flourish of his to send it deep into the stands

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, smoked away! Slower ball but it's in the slot and Hardik has picked it as well. Sits deep to clobber this over long-on. For a moment, Buttler thought he had another catch but in the end, it's well over his head. Brilliant cameo from Hardik
Gowtham to de Kock, SIX, massive, tossed up on off, de Kock gets close to the ball and lifts it with the angle, sent it high and deep into the stands at long-on

Jofra Archer to de Kock, SIX, massive, de Kock is in the mood today, short of a length and at the stumps, de Kock swivelled across on the pull and sent it miles in the air - high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Livingstone to de Kock, SIX, the attempted off-break from Livingstone, turns out to be a juicy full-toss, de Kock leans forward and deposits it high and over long-on for a maximum
Livingstone to de Kock, SIX, lovely, too full from Livingstone, de Kock gets under it and clobbers it high and over wide long-on for a mamximum
Gowtham to Rohit, SIX, a biggie! Krishnappa Gowtham fires a ball right in Rohit's slot. The skipper, with a big back-lift, swings his bat hard to deposit it over cow corner
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, this was coming with Bumrah's quiet over. Buttler shimmies down the wicket, gets close to the flighted delivery and smokes it into the second tier near cow corner
Rahul Chahar to Samson, SIX, they have made up for Bumrah's over. Samson comes down the track, takes it on the full and the rest was easy, he uses a clean bat swing to clear long-off
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, SIX, steps leg-side, gets a full toss and biffs it straight back down the ground. Another six, his sixth of the evening
Alzarri Joseph to Buttler, SIX, in the slot for Buttler who swipes it into the stands over wide long-on. 28 off the over. He's killed this game off just like that

Behrendorff to Buttler, SIX, chipped all the way! Superb stroke from Buttler. Sat deep in the crease and didn't try to overhit this one. Just hit through the line and stressed on timing more than power. Served him well as it's cleared the ropes at long-off
Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, SIX, up and all the way! He has been good with this shot today - the heave over mid-wicket. Shuffles across and down, gets the right length to send it sailing over the fence
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, Chahar errs by landing one in Buttler's arc, it was the googly which was right in the slot, Buttler goes with the spin and smashes the loft over the long-on fence

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, Buttler has taken over the baton after Rahane's dismissal. Runs down the wicket, gets close to the delivery and then uses his power to muscle the ball over the cow corner fence

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, he just stands there and admires the shot. Darted into the slot, Buttler with a cleared front leg helps himself to another maximum, smacks with minimum backlift over long-on

Siraj to Sarfaraz Khan, SIX, it is not Gayle but Sarfaraz who will have a piece of Siraj. The cheeky right hander, goes down to play that over-the-head-scoop, makes decent connect and the ball sails into the stands

Siraj to Gayle, SIX, he's sent this to the moon! Oh, my! What a hit! Short of a length, sits up nicely for Gayle who clears his front leg and goes booooom! Soaring into the skies at the deep mid-wicket region
U Yadav to Gayle, SIX, smashed into the stands! Another full toss and this time, Gayle makes no mistake. Wades into the slog and sends it comfortably over the ropes at deep mid-wicket
U Yadav to Gayle, SIX, lovely, length ball outside off, Gayle clears his left leg and heaves it back over the bowler's head, went high and sailed over long-on for a maximum

Siraj to Gayle, SIX, you simply can't bowl short to this man - not at Siraj's pace, back of a length and from round the wicket, Gayle made room and swung - didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to sail over long-on for a maximum
Siraj to Gayle, SIX, hammered, tad too short from Siraj, Gayle swivels across and muscles the pull - high and over square leg for a maximum, turning out to be a big over
Chahal to Rahul, SIX, lovely, nicely tossed up at the stumps, Rahul leans forward and lifts it nonchalantly over long-on for a maximum. Pressure straightaway on Chahal

Chahal to Agarwal, SIX, fabulous shot! Chahal gets wicket with this delivery but not that of Agarwal. Floated it outside off and tempted the batsman, Agarwal keeps a low base, gets low and underneath that to loft it handsomely over extra cover. Goes all the way
Tye to de Villiers, SIX, short of length delivery wide of off, punished by de Villiers who slaps it over extra cover. Turning out to be a great over for RCB

Shami to de Villiers, SIX, and this should seal it from de Villiers. He gets low, bends across, moves late to the off-side and sweeps this low full toss into the crowd backward of square. Classic de Villiers

Kuldeep Yadav to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, oh, he's miscued this but guess what? It's sailed all the way for a maximum. Plenty of flight from Kuldeep, Jadhav sits low and goes across the line with the spin on the swipe. Gets enough bat on it to send it into the stands

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, and now he middles it.. into the crowd. Advances down, it's a googly again and this time Dhoni picks the bones out of it. Crucially, he went with a straight bat and not across the line. Deposits it over long-on
Chawla to Raina, SIX, steps out close to the pitch and launches it down the ground. May have come close to the bottom of his bat, but there's still enough for a 74-metre six
Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, cracking shot, too short from Chahar, Lynn swivels across and then helps it on its way, high and over long leg for a maximum
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, a flat six from Lynn, backed away to a short ball and clattered it over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Lynn, tad too short from RJ, allows Lynn to rock back and pull it hard and over mid-wicket for another maximum

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, SIX, hat-trick of sixes, RJ is under the pump here at the Eden - tossed up on off, Lynn came down the track, gets close to the ball and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum

Tahir to A Russell, SIX, thumped, the leg-break and it has been dropped into the second tier - Too full from Tahir, Russell bent down low and heaved it with sheer power - didn't middle it but the ball went a long way into the stands
Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's nailed over deep mid-wicket. Shimmies down the wicket and pulls the short ball over the fence for half a dozen, way back into the stands

Santner to Chris Lynn, SIX, going, going and gone! One of the cleanest strikes of the afternoon. Lynn puts on his dancing shoes and lofts it over long-on for a towering six. Could have been a maximum on any ground, anywhere in the world
Bhuvneshwar to K Paul, SIX, Paul has picked the bones out of this! A slower length delivery around off, Keemo lines up for it and swings it over the cow corner for a gigantic six
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, what a shot! He's very good with that pick up shot, fullish and on the off stump, Munro gets his front across the line and sends it all the way over backward square leg
Khaleel Ahmed to Munro, SIX, slower ball and smashed, Munro danced down the pitch and slogged at this, didn't catch the middle of the bat but caught enough to clear the fence
Abhishek Sharma to Munro, SIX, lovely hit, down the pitch, lofted with the spin and way back over long-on, the leggie again, picked that from the hand and smashed it, highest IPL score for Munro
Chris Morris to Bairstow, SIX, stand and deliver! Length delivery around off and Bairstow stays put and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow and that shall be a maximum
Axar to Warner, SIX, bashes this into the crowd. The way he took stance, it was clear he fancied a bite of Axar. Sensing this, Axar blinked. He dropped it short and was muscled over midwicket

Navdeep Saini to Rohit, SIX, did he hit it that well? Got hold of the short ball and just rolled his wrists over that. The ball seemed to have flown away over fine leg for a sixer. Might have been a bit of a top-edge
Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's another monstrous hit from Ishan Kishan! Shimmies out of his crease and smokes this well flighted delivery into the cow corner orbit with a dash of swagger

Negi to Hardik Pandya, SIX, now then, now then, it's not a well timed hit but it timed well enough to just clear long-on. Shortish delivery spinning away, Pandya goes back and powers the ball in the air and gets a vital maximum
Negi to Hardik Pandya, SIX, take a bow Hardik. This time Negi actually gave it some air, Pandya got under the ball and muscled it hard over wide long-on

U Yadav to de Kock, SIX, that was a golf hit! That has gone into orbit. Outtaaaaaaa here! Short ball and de Kock has picked the skeletons out of that. Muscled over deep square leg for a sixer. Hardly transferred his weight on to the back foot to slam it away
Siraj to Rohit, SIX, this is silly from Siraj. You can't be bowling short and wide to Rohit. Rohit stays back and square cuts the ball over deep point fence for a sixer. Easy peasy!
Navdeep Saini to de Kock, SIX, 143ks dug in short at the batsman, de Kock picks the length slightly late but he has such wonderful hands and he clouts it for a 77-metre maximum over mid-wicket
Negi to Ishan Kishan, SIX, charges out of his crease, gets closer to the pitch of the delivery and clubs it many-a-mile over long-on
Negi to Ishan Kishan, SIX, make that two in a row! Closer to the pitch of the delivery again and Ishan Kishan has nailed that over cow corner for a flat maximum
Moeen Ali to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, tossed full outside off and SKY pumps it for a 73-metre maximum over extra cover, well timed!

Hardik Pandya to de Villiers, SIX, top-edge and over the keeper. Oh, in fact, it's gone all the way. Fortune favouring de Villiers at the moment. Pandya bends his back and digs it into the pitch, de Villiers went for the pull and gets a fat top-edge to his benefit

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, shouts of "ABD, ABD" were ringing across Wankhede and de Villiers treats them by dismissing this into the deep mid-wicket stands. What a strike! Gee. Picked the short delivery early, it sat up well for him too. Easy-peasy as he nails it off the meat and smokes it over the fence

Rahul Chahar to Moeen Ali, SIX, Ali tees off and oh, that's a poor effort from the fielder at long-off. Surely should have done better as he parries it away for a six. Looped up just outside off, Ali got underneath it and blasted it - didn't get it off the middle but fortunately gets away. Seemed like SKY was the fielder, who made a meal of it

Krunal Pandya to Moeen Ali, SIX, and he spoils the over with a maximum. Pandya gives a bit of flight, Ali extends his arms and clubs it over long-on. He had to fetch it from well outside off but Ali's got some long levers. Clean strike from the southpaw

Behrendorff to Moeen Ali, SIX, he's started to tee off here. Behrendorff misses his mark, bowls a slower ball on a length. Ali was just waiting for this, backs his muscle power and smokes it over cow corner

Behrendorff to Moeen Ali, SIX, wow! This is a big over for RCB. Second six and 17 has come off it. Behrendorff fails to nail the yorker, misses it by an inch and Ali makes him pay. Gets under it and dumps it over cover

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, ABD kneels and he will eventually bring you down on to your haunches. Stays low, and scoops the ball over fine leg for a huge six. Full marks to the anticipation and execution

Malinga to de Villiers, SIX, misses the yorker again, this time Malinga, and de Villiers has hammered it over deep square leg for a big six. Sized up for a length ball and got a full toss to scream it away

Behrendorff to Parthiv Patel, SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Kishan was the fielder there and he leapt as much as he could but it went well over him. A taller fielder, Pollard perhaps, could have had a better chance. Take nothing away from Parthiv though, this is a cracking stroke. Picked the slower ball early and though he had to fetch it from outside off, did so with a cross-batted slap

Rahul Chahar to Moeen Ali, SIX, effortless flick from Ali and it sails over the deep mid-wicket fielder's head for a maximum. It was floated on the pads, Ali's propensity on leg-stump balls is well documented. Just stays inside the line and latches onto the freebie

Unadkat to Gayle, SIX, this was in the air for a long time, for a second the fielder at deep square leg looked in business but the breeze here in Mohali takes it away over the ropes. Probably, Archer - the fielder - was standing a few yards inside the rope, had he been near the boundary, he would've had a better chance of catching it. Big misjudgement from him there as Gayle gets away. It was banged in short, Gayle after a few sighters takes it on and pulls. Didn't time it as he would've liked but luckily, the ball sails over the ropes for a maximum

Unadkat to Gayle, SIX, after a few sighters, Gayle gets into action. Unadkat lands a length ball, sits up nicely for Gayle to free his arms. Whacked elegantly over long-on. Back-to-back sixes for the Universe Boss. He's starting to tee off. Ominous signs for RR

Ish Sodhi to Rahul, SIX, that's huge! Short length by Sodhi, Rahul waits for it and smokes it over deep square leg for a massive six. Just the kind of delivery he was looking for in order to break the shackles. Sodhi has just given him that
Ish Sodhi to Miller, SIX, thumped down the ground! A googly by Sodhi, Miller reads to perfection, treks back and bludgeons it over long-off for the second maximum of the over. Pressure on Sodhi!

Unadkat to Miller, SIX, Bowled a rather decent spell in the last game against MI but he's back to leaking runs. Bowls a gift of a full toss on the pads and Miller with utter ease flicks it over deep mid-wicket. The timing was bang on!

Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, Unadkat has run out of ideas! Rahul moves miles away from the leg stump and the bowler tries to follow him. Goes full though and the batsman goes inside out to clear covers with this exceptional shot. Wow!

D Kulkarni to Ashwin, SIX, crunched! Solid hit from the KXIP skipper. Picked the slower ball and the shorter length helped, he sat deep on the back foot and clouted it merrily across the line. Superb batting!

D Kulkarni to Ashwin, SIX, terrific cameo from Ashwin to finish! Premeditates the yorker and walks across the stumps early, thereby putting Kulkarni off. The result is a full toss that's paddle scooped beautifully. All the way over fine leg

D Kulkarni to Gayle, SIX, woah. This is very uncharacteristic from Gayle. Let's the world know about his cheekiness too. Spotted the short ball early, arched his back and ramped it beautifully over the keeper. Normally, it's all about power but not on this occasion

Ish Sodhi to Agarwal, SIX, Agarwal at his very best. He's very good against spin and shows no respect whatsoever to Sodhi. Flighted with more air, Agarwal lowers his stance and lifts it straight down the ground. The timing is really good and it goes all the way for a six

Shreyas Gopal to Agarwal, SIX, launched over long-off! Agarwal is looking in superb touch today. Tosses it enticingly just outside off, Agarwal props forward and clobbers it disdainfully for a maximum

Mujeeb to Buttler, SIX, dispatched over long-on! Clear intent from Buttler, doesn't want to settle Mujeeb settle. There is a long-off in place, so he charges down the pitch and goes in the other direction. Over long-on and it was struck so well that it soared into the second tier

Shami to Binny, SIX, there's nothing brute about this shot. Just a serene pick up off his hip, just watched the ball spear into the leg-side and did well to get inside the line and help the cherry on its way for a 75-metre maximum over fine leg
Arshdeep Singh to Binny, SIX, length ball in the slot for Binny, he stands rooted to the crease and powers it into the cow corner orbit with tremendous timing
Arshdeep Singh to Binny, SIX, no missing this time around. Watches the ball like a hawk, sets himself deep inside the crease and smokes the full ball straight back over the bowler's head

Arshdeep Singh to Buttler, SIX, scorching hit from Buttler! Prowled down the track in a jiffy and although this wasn't that short, he picked it up beautifully. Propelled it over deep mid-wicket with a shovel-flick. Such power! He's looking ominous tonight again

Khaleel Ahmed to du Plessis, SIX, crack made the sound! Such a sweetly timed shot that was. du Plessis waits back in his crease, reads the slower short ball and thumps it over the cow-corner for six runs

Nadeem to du Plessis, SIX, that shot was all about timing! Minimum effort and maximum result. du Plessis shimmies down the wicket and lofts the flighted delivery against the spin. The timing was such that it just about manages to clear Warner at long-off, beautiful

Nadeem to du Plessis, SIX, skips out of his crease, isn't close to the pitch of the delivery but Faf doesn't back out; just goes through with the loft and pings it right over the leaping fielder at wide long-on
Karn Sharma to Bairstow, SIX, swivels on the back foot and pulls it handsomely over deep mid for a sixer. Superb hit as he was quick to pick the length on it
Karn Sharma to Bairstow, SIX, and Bairstow is in some hurry now! Kneels down and slog sweeps it over the widish long-on region for a sixer. They are racing towards the target

Karn Sharma to Bairstow, SIX, oh well Bairstow will do THE Dhoni. It was full, allowing him to come forward and then free up his hands to whip the tonk long, deep, over cow corner. 6 wickets | 19 balls remain ..

Bumrah to Chris Morris, SIX, dishes out full pace and goes 73 meters. It's right in the slot too as Morris lines up and tonks it straight back. Two balls, two hits and Delhi's asking rate falls down by an entire run ..

Malinga to Axar, SIX, 111.4kph. Picks the slower one, picks his slot and picks the maximum. His hands were always swinging, with the legs going away and making the space to -- in lofting it way over long-on
Hardik Pandya to Rabada, SIX, oh there's the crunch. Another swing, and this one's surely into cow corner. Latches onto the slower one, getting under it and pumping it deep, very deep
Jayant Yadav to Dhawan, SIX, out of the crease in a flash and so was the ball. Tossed up delivery and Dhawan charged out to heave it over long-on. Big six. Dhawan has put on a show so far

K Paul to Hardik Pandya, SIX, slower delivery and Hardik Pandya has smacked it over long-off. The whirlwind of the arms into the shot and it took the ball sailing into the stands. Length balls are supposed to go the journey. Hardik is just being the postman..the most powerful one I suppose

Chris Morris to Hardik Pandya, SIX, patent those quick strong tentacles! Low full toss, missed the mark by an inch and has to pay for it. Whips it over deep backward square for a sixer. Cruel stuff from the batter. Four inch perfect deliveries and you miss one ball and are made to pay for it

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow wow wow! The helicopter has crash landed into the hearts of DC fans. That was a superb blow. Stays deep in his crease, and those steely wrists take the ball over the fence

Chris Morris to de Kock, SIX, connects and connects well. This time gets on top of the bounce of this length delivery, takes on the short ball and hacks it with ferocity into the deep square leg stands. This should get him going

K Paul to de Kock, SIX, short and butchered into the crowd at deep square leg. Nothing delivery from Paul, went short but it lacked pace. de Kock was taking a stride down the pitch and it sits up pretty well for him. Launches it powerfully for a maximum

K Paul to Rohit, no ball, SIX, what was that? Seemed like it slipped out of Paul's hands. Delivers a waist-high full toss, Rohit gets into a great position and slams the pull towards deep square leg. Morris, the fielder was setting himself near the fence but it soars over his head for a six. It's called a no-ball and it also brings up the 50-run stand between Rohit and de Kock - their third consecutive half-century partnership

Chahal to A Russell, SIX, first six of the innings! Any guesses, who has hit it? It's Dre Russ and that's his 31st six of the tournament. A floated delivery outside off, the batsman goes down on his knee and pumps it over wide long-off for a flat six
Chahal to A Russell, SIX, just look at the power of this man! This wasn't middled, whatsoever. Was a loopy delivery around middle and leg, Russell goes down on his knee and pumps it over long-on
Chahal to A Russell, SIX, successive sixes for the big man! The crowd is loving this. Russell takes on the leggie and smokes it over his head for a massive six, couldn't have hit it any straighter

Chahal to A Russell, SIX, hat-trick of sixes for Dre Russ! His arrival at the crease has infused some life in this chase. Should have come much earlier. Another juicy legbreak by Chahal and the power-hitter sends it sailing over the long-on fence for six more. This was the cleanest of the lot. 20 runs of that over
Navdeep Saini to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana brings up his fifty in style! Latches on to the short ball and smokes it over long-on for a massive six. His 8th IPL fifty, this is insane!

Navdeep Saini to Nitish Rana, SIX, in the previous over Russell was striking 'em big, it's Rana in this one. A juicy full toss around off and Rana has hacked it over deep mid-wicket for another towering six. He's asking for a waist-high no ball but replays confirm it wasn't one

Siraj to A Russell, SIX, 150 up for Kolkata Knight Riders! Pitched up around off, Russell reaches out for it and tonks it over long-off - possibly for the longest six of the night. Chants of Kay, Kay, Aar all round the stadium!
Steyn to Nitish Rana, SIX, Steyn goes the distance! Pitches this one on a full length around off and Rana goes down on his knee to pound it over long-off, over the fence comfortably
Steyn to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's a home-run! Goes for the slower one and concedes six more. Rana goes deep in his crease and towers it right over the bowler's head. It's raining sixes, literally

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, finally gets one right! Short in length and Russell makes sure to send it over the deep mid-wicket fence. Slapped for a flat six by the big man. So much power behind that shot

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, anothe fifty for the incredible Hulk! This is the second fastest fifty in IPL 2019. Right into the slot this length ball and it's been smoked over the bowler's head for another magnificent blow

Stoinis to A Russell, SIX, what a match this is proving to be! One of the best of the season. Right into the slot yet again and Russell who's watching the ball like a hawk powers it down the ground. The power behind that blow would be enough to clear the fence. 24 runs needed of the final over

Moeen Ali to A Russell, SIX, four sixes were needed off the final 4 balls and here's the first one of the lot. A floated delivery around off, Russell holds his shape and tonks it over long-on, just clears the fence

Moeen Ali to Nitish Rana, SIX, RCB beat KKR by 10 runs! Let me take a breather! An offbreak by Moeen and Rana ends the match with a maximum by smoking it down the ground. Not enough though as the Royal Challengers clinch their second win of the season

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, imperious from Kohli. Russell peppers it short, Kohli climbs into a great position and seizes on it. Muscling it some ten rows back over deep square leg. Dismissive from the Indian captain
Chawla to Moeen Ali, SIX, Chawla offers a little bit of flight and Ali goes big. Down on his knees, gets maximum connection and pummels it over long-on.
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, smoked over deep mid-wicket. Kuldeep flights it teasingly outside off, Ali sinks low and gets under it to smack it all the way for a maximum

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, Ali is teeing off now. Reaches his fifty in style. His 3rd IPL half-century. Slower and Kuldeep went wider of off, Ali goes low and hacks it powerfully over cow corner

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, it's raining fours and sixes here at the Eden Gardens. Kuldeep is being taken to the cleaners. Looped up just outside off, Ali shuffles across and blasts it over long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, wow! This is brutal hitting from Ali. Third six off the over. Again Kuldeep hurls it quick and in the arc for Moeen, who waits deep in his crease and tonks it over long-off. "Merciless" is the word which pops up on the giant screen

Gurney to Kohli, SIX, thumps it straight down the ground. Nothing delivery from Gurney, pitches it up and in the zone for Kohli, who extends his arms and goes with a clean bat swing to send it all the way for a six
Narine to Kohli, SIX, tripe. Drags it short and Kohli is so quick to latch onto that. Rocks back and dismisses it way back into the deep mid-wicket stands
Prasidh to Kohli, SIX, he's getting close to the hundred now. Krishna sends down a length delivery, easy-peasy for Kohli. Just stands tall and dispatches it over long-on
Gurney to Stoinis, SIX, swatted down the ground for a maximum. Full and in the swinging zone, Stoinis gets forward and murders it straight down the ground for a maximum
Prasidh to Akshdeep Nath, SIX, sits up short. And Nath isn't hanging around waiting, takes it off the front foot and muscles it uppishly over deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Moeen Ali, SIX, good feet use in coming down the pitch and then he milks his form. Swings, lofting a hoick over long-on, and just over the fielder's jump

Unadkat to de Kock, SIX, smashed! Right in the slot for de Kock - full and angled into the pads, he had made room and then his arms came down at a great speed to send the ball sailing over deep mid-wicket

Unadkat to Pollard, SIX, insult to injury! Short of a length around middle and leg, Pollard stays put and hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a 98m six. There wasn't much power behind the shot, it was the timing that was sublime
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, stand and deliver! On a length around off, Pandya lines up for it and clubs it right over the bowler's head. Just manages to clear the fence

Jofra Archer to Cutting, SIX, Mumbai Indians post a competitve score of 161/5 as Cutting finishes it off in style. Gets in a good position and tonks the length delivery across the line. A home-run over deep mid-wicket and Mumbai will be pretty satisfied with the end score
D Kulkarni to de Kock, SIX, beautifully played, poor ball from Dhawal, short and at the stumps, de Kock swivels across and then pulls it high and over backward square leg for a maximum
Riyan Parag to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, much needed for Suryakumar and Mumbai. Picked the carrom ball on the sticks, cleared the front leg and smoked it through the line straight back over the bowler

Rahul Chahar to Riyan Parag, SIX, ah, the pump. Chahar drags his length back, and Parag makes it worse with his own rock inside. And then adjusts to the scoot in this as well as he crouches, heaves, a long way over cow corner

Markande to Smith, SIX, this is glorious from Smith. He wasn't to the pitch of this leg-break, but the timing is still so beautiful that it's gone all the way over wide long-on. The form seems to have come back along with the captaincy

Markande to Samson, SIX, incredible batting from the Royals. They're bossing this so far. Lavish off-drive from Samson, and his flourish has taken it all the way over wide long-off. Markande disappears for 15 in his first over

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a clean strike by Iyer. Skipper versus skipper and the younger one wins the contest. Takes on Ash and thumps the floated delivery right over the bowler's head, straight as an arrow and over the ropes

Shami to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, desperate ducking-hook. Damn fiery bouncer into the head, which Shaw in his attempt to get away from swings his bat mid-way, and surprise, surprise, connects really cleanly, flat and deep over fine leg
Harpreet Brar to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan attacks the debutant off his very first ball. Dances down and launches him back over the long-off boundary
Lamichhane to Rahul, SIX, massive, that's one way to greet the leg-spinner, Rahul backed away, lost his bottom hand but still has enough power to send the swipe high and over long-off for a maximum

Lamichhane to Gayle, SIX, going, going and gone. No respite for Lamichhane today. Flighted just outside off, Gayle bends his back knee and slog sweeps it high into the night sky. These Kotla boundaries are not big enough for the Jamaican, for that matter which ground is

Ishant to Gayle, SIX, massive, that's the Gayle we know in the IPL - that's out of the ground, the knuckle ball from Ishant, on a length and just outside off, Gayle cleared his right leg and heaved it high and over long-on, 101m on that shot

Rabada to Harpreet Brar, SIX, top stuff. And to imagine this guy hasn't played a FC match yet .. he anticipates the quick bouncer, is quicker to pull it off his shoulder, smoking it so damn cleanly over deep square leg. Punjab > 160

Mishra to Gayle, SIX, a rank long-hop and Gayle has sent it soaring over long-on. Mishra tries something funky, bowls a flat off-break on off, Gayle rocks back and pummels it high and over long-on for a maximum
Mishra to Gayle, SIX, two gifts from Mishra and both have disappeared. Full toss just below the waist, Gayle says thank you very much and launches it into the stands near deep mid-wicket

Mishra to Gayle, SIX, another rubbish delivery from Mishra. Googly that is pitched halfway down, Gayle had ample time to pick his spot and it is cow corner, rocked back and pulled it all the way for a maximum

Axar to Mandeep, SIX, wow! That is a top shot from Mandeep. Flighted outside off, Mandeep bends low and gets under the ball, chips it with the spin over extra cover and the timing is such that it clears the rope
Nadeem to Narine, SIX, another gift from Nadeem. Long hop and Narine had all the time to pick his spot, he rocks back and muscles the pull over deep square leg, just managed to clear the rope

Sandeep Sharma to Rinku Singh, SIX, dropped and parried over the fence! Nadeem even before taking the catch was looking whether he was about to the touch the boundary. Lucky escape for the left hander batsman. A short ball that was pulled away to deep mid-wicket by him and as a result of Rinku's mess, he not only gets a life but also a six

Sandeep Sharma to Rinku Singh, SIX, Rinku Singh brings up the 50-run stand with a maximum. Gets a low full and the southpaw makes sure to thump it over the long-on fence for a powerful six. The ball's lost in the crowd as the fourth umpire runs in with a box of used Kookaburras
Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, SIX, misses the yorker and bowls a juicy low full toss on the pads, Russell whips it over the square leg fence with an air of nonchalance. Creamedddddd
Bhuvneshwar to A Russell, SIX, slower ball bumper but Russell picked the bones out of it. Sets himself deep inside the crease and powers the pull way over the leaping fielder at deep square
Rashid Khan to Cariappa, SIX, stands solid inside the crease and pumps this quicker delivery into the long-on stands. Timed!!

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, SIX, "catch, catch" shouted Bairstow but it is just over a leaping Shankar. Nadeem gives it air and Lynn is not holding back, lofts through the line and it was a mishit, stayed up for a long time before evading long-on. 28 off 2 overs and KKR are off to a flier
Khaleel Ahmed to Narine, SIX, this is rubbish bowling. Short and outside off, Narine stands upright and slaps it flat over extra cover, got enough power behind that to clear the boundary rope

Yarra Prithviraj to Warner, SIX, 135ks doesn't matter this time! Yarra Prithviraj missed his length and bowled it slightly short outside off, Warner pounces on it as he sends it soaring into the long-on stands with a well-timed loft
Narine to Warner, SIX, goes big again! That's outta here as well. Flighted ball, Warner decided to free his arms and pump it over long-on for a sixer. SRH want an early finish
Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, he doesn't want to hang around for too long..loopy ball, Bairstow sits down and slog sweeps it over deep square leg for a sixer. Only a shot away

Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, keep calm KKR and accept the Murphy's law! They have been annihilated here. Loopy ball and has been banged over deep mid with the help of a slog sweep. Bairstow, like he did against CSK, finishes off with a sixer

Chawla to Bairstow, SIX, and the new bat brings the result straightaway. Picks out the googly, sits on one knee and smokes it into the second tier over the long-on fence. Can't be that full to Bairstow
Narine to Warner, SIX, bashes this short ball into the crowd. Picked the length up so quickly. Leapt back in the crease and pummelled it
Cariappa to Warner, SIX, disappears into the crowd. Slanted in on leg from round the wicket, Warner lowers himself to get under the ball and swings it backward of square

Cariappa to Warner, SIX, tearing into Cariappa here. 20 off the over already and there's still a ball left. He had gone full at the stumps with this delivery, right in the slot for Warner loft it down the ground for six

Cariappa to Bairstow, SIX, smoked into the second tier. No respite for Cariappa. After an expensive first over, here he is hoping to quietly start a new spell. But Bairstow catches him at the door. Swipes him away over midwicket

Stoinis to Dhoni, SIX, Dhoni has arrived! Remember his knock here last year? Jumps out of his crease, shows no signs of nerves and launches Stoinis over deep extra cover with a power-packed smack on the shuffle
U Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, short of length delivery just outside off, this time Rayudu stayed put in his crease and heaved the pull wide of long-on. Just clears the boundary

Chahal to Dhoni, SIX, sees some loop on the delivery, and puts his dancing shoes on in a flash. That's superb batting. He got right to the pitch before launching it straight back for six. 13 off Chahal's final over. It's set up superbly for the final four

Steyn to Dhoni, SIX, back of a length delivery just outside off, Dhoni simply clears the front leg and belts it over wide long-on to bring up his half-century. He just knows how to turn on in these run-chases

Navdeep Saini to Dhoni, no ball, SIX, oh this is just awful from Saini, not only with the delivery he's bowled, but also that he's overstepped. With third man inside the ring, he bangs it in short outside off. Dhoni happily throws his hands at it and whirls it into the crowd
U Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, oh my! This is gigantic. It's gone on the roof. Short of length, another really nothing ball that Dhoni absolutely destroys. It's a 111-metre six
U Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, six more. Umesh Yadav crumbling. Tries a yorker but misses it at least by a couple of feet and Dhoni lofts it with enough power - if not timing - to clear long-off

U Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, stunning scenes! A full toss is fiercely swiped over the deep midwicket boundary. An absolute skimmer from MS Dhoni who is on the verge of doing the unthinkable at the Chinnaswamy again. RCB in shock

Jadeja to Akshdeep Nath, SIX, that's a great shot by Akshdeep Nath. Walks down the wicket and flicks the shortish delivery against the turn, the pitch makes it easier for the ball to go the distance, clears deep mid-wicket comfortably
Tahir to Parthiv Patel, SIX, pumped over deep mid-wicket! Patel reads the googly to perfection and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half a dozen. Couldn't have played it any better

Tahir to Stoinis, SIX, that's a huge six! Slightly short ball and Stoinis treks back to smoke it over deep mid-wicket. Could have been a six on any ground. Just the kind of shot Stoinis was looking for to cut loose

SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, SIX, good end to the over. Parthiv hits the first six of the game. He waits for that short of length delivery and picks it off with a well timed pull shot, sails into the crowd near backward square leg

Chahar to de Villiers, SIX, this time it comes off. Chahar was a bit straight in his line and that allowed de Villiers to make contact, sets up a firm base and heaves it over deep square leg. That should make him feel good
SN Thakur to Parthiv Patel, SIX, Parthiv is peppering that backward square crowd. Another good length ball right in his arc, he maintains a low base and heaves it with a clean bat swing over the rope

Jadeja to Parthiv Patel, SIX, plenty of hang time but Parthiv gets the desired distance as well. He goes down on his knee and slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket, managed to clear the rope comfortably in the end
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, SIX, that's the kind of form he is in! Can't bowl it there. On the pads and Dhawan flicks it over deep square leg with utter ease. Sweet!
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, SIX, clears the front leg to a googly that was right in his slot and lofts it through the line over long-on. Clean strike from Pant

Unadkat to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, high and handsome! This should get Prithvi Shaw going. Unadkat was bowling brilliant slower ones but for some reasons he went for a yorker, misses it and ends up serving it right into the slot for Prithvi Shaw. He clears his front leg and hoicks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Jofra Archer to Pant, SIX, fifty in a canter for Pant. Wow! This guy is a gem of a player. Archer misses his yorker, it was in the slot for Pant. He clears his front leg, gets in a good position and lifts it over deep square leg for a maximum

D Kulkarni to Rutherford, SIX, first six for Rutherford in his IPL career. I am sure it's not the last. You cannot bowl length at this stage and D Kulkarni did exactly that. It was wide of off, Rutherford reaches for it and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket. It comes off the bottom half of the willow but the power that he posseses takes it over the fence

Jofra Archer to Pant, SIX, Pant has dispatched it over for a maximum .Whatta hit from Pant! This has surely sealed the match for DC. It was on a fuller length and was wide of off, Pant comes under it and pumps it over long-on for a maximum

Unadkat to Pant, SIX, Pant has finished off the things in style. DC win by 6-wickets and go top of the table. Incredible hitting from the southpaw. Hold On! Umpires are still checking whether that ball hit the rope on the full. It's a six and Delhi has sealed the victory!
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, SIX, what a superb shot by Shikhar! Trying to outplay the shots played by Rahane. Goes down on his knee and picks this one up with nonchalance to clear the fine leg fence
Chris Morris to Rahane, SIX, this is innovation at its very best! Moved across his off-stump and uses Morris' pace to lap the full ball high and over the fine leg fence

Axar to Rahane, SIX, superb hit! Adding insult to injury, is Rahane. Charges down on seeing the flight and hoists it merrily straight down the ground. Plenty of elevation and also has the distance as this crashes into the sightscreen

Rabada to Rahane, SIX, excellent hit from Rahane! Refreshing intent from the RR former captain and he is wading into the bowling. Short of a length from Rabada and Jinks just backs away to flat-bat this down the ground. Such fine connection that it goes all the way. Superb stuff!
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, brings up his fifty in thunderous style! Watson roars back to form for CSK. Short ball, 116kph, and it goes soaring into the second tier

Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX, Watson is putting on a show alright! This is what confidence can do. He's a different player now and in some mood. Gets a flattish low full toss that's sent over cow corner with a slog sweep. Such a clean hit and he stares at Rashid

Rashid Khan to Watson, SIX, smokedddddddddddd! Nothing much you can do when Watson is hitting them like this. Not even Rashid has any answers. Tossed it up, inviting the big hit and that it was for sure. Blasted away by Watson over long-on for a mammoth blow
Khaleel Ahmed to Watson, SIX, this is some hitting from Watson! Slower and short, climbs onto the short ball and muscles it over deep mid-wicket. Another huge hit!

Sandeep Sharma to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, that's the game! Slower ball and Jadhav charged down for the swipe over mid-wicket. Was a skimmer and Pandey in the deep showed good awareness as he caught this mid-air in an attempt to palm it back. Managed to parry it as well but the foot touched the ground outside the ropes Just 2 needed now!

Khaleel Ahmed to Watson, SIX, short of length on middle, this off-cutter from Khaleel sits up nicely to be whacked. And Watson isn't one to refuse such opportunities. Belts it over the square leg boundary
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, SIX, massive over for CSK, 22 off it. Short of length on leg stump, pulls it away ferociously and hits the cushions on the full

Shakib to Watson, SIX, this time he does get under the short ball, and absolutely pummels it over backward square. It's his favourite pull shot, and Shakib's lack of bounce isn't going to dissuade him once the length's there
Tahir to Shankar, SIX, effortless stroke from Vijay Shankar! Lets the googly dip and marmalizes it for a 84-metre maximum over long-on
Tahir to Manish Pandey, SIX, dispatched! Short in length around off and Manish Pandey pumps it over the cow corner for half a dozen! Sweetly timed blow

Harbhajan to Warner, SIX, Warner attacks Harbhajan straightaway and gets a maximum. This is going to be an interesting battle. It was a flighted one and was on the stumps, Warner takes a good stride forward and lofts it straight down the ground for a maximum

Harbhajan to Manish Pandey, SIX, Pandey Ji means business today! He has promoted to number three and he looks in no mood to waste this opportunity. It was an offie on the stumps and Manish Pandey larrups it over long-off for a maximum
Jadeja to Warner, SIX, launched!! Slightly fuller and in the arc for Warner, he stays low and smokes it into the stands over cow corner
