Tahir to Manish Pandey, SIX, that's the biggest of the lot! Pandey on fire...picks up the flight, gets underneath it and hammers it high and soaring into the second tier over long-on

Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, he has got his eye in and he has smashed this one for a gigantic six. It was a fuller length delivery on the stumps, Pooran backs away, clears his leg, gets under it and tonks it over long-off for a maximum
Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, another six. Pooran gave himself room again, Washington Sundar follows him but Pooran still had enough room to clear his arm and dispatch it over long-off again
Washington Sundar to Pooran, SIX, third six off the over! In the same area again. It was very full and on the leg-stump, Pooran gets under it and launches it over long-off again. Into the stands

Moeen Ali to Pooran, SIX, Mr Pooran why were you hiding in the dressing room in the previous matches. It was a flighted one on a good length, Pooran backs away, makes room and dispatches it over long-off
Moeen Ali to Pooran, SIX, fifth six for Pooran. He is putting on a show here. Pooran clears his leg, keeps his shape and tonks it over long-on for another six. He is dealing in sixes at the moment!
U Yadav to Ashwin, SIX, wow! Ashwin has dispatched it for a six. Can he replicate MSD? Yadav misses the yorker, Ashwin comes under it and pumps it over long-on
U Yadav to Gayle, SIX, this is bad bowling! A full toss and Gayle doesn't need second invitation to put it away. Hoisted over long-on for half-a-dozen
Chahal to Rahul, SIX, this one drifts in on leg, sliding on with the arm, and Rahul just lifts it through the line over long-on. A shot requiring great ability, especially as he's not to the pitch

Chahal to Agarwal, SIX, skims over long-off's reach! Picked the googly there, which was overpitched anyway, and hammered it down the ground. Would've been worried for a brief moment, as he hadn't found the elevation, but it's high enough to escape Saini's one-handed leap

Murugan Ashwin to Stoinis, SIX, much needed six for Stoinis and RCB. Also gets the crowd out of their slumber. Tosses up the leg-break and offers space for Stoinis to free his arms, he muscles it over long-off

Rajpoot to de Villiers, SIX, and again.. Rajpoot persists with the short of length delivery, this time de Villiers decides to put him in the crowd, quick swivel on the back foot and the pull is sent over deep mid-wicket

Murugan Ashwin to de Villiers, SIX, a hit-me delivery and de Villiers bludgeons it. Half tracker and de Villiers picked his spot - deep mid-wicket and sends the ball sailing into the crowd with a pull shot

Viljoen to de Villiers, SIX, watch out, those in the press box! Off-pace ball from Viljoen, but he's doled out a half-volley. AB de Villiers gets underneath it and bludgeons it downtown for a massive six
Shami to de Villiers, SIX, slower ball at 124.2kph, it was wider outside off and de Villiers had to reach out for it. Slightly bends his back leg and lofts it over long-off

Shami to de Villiers, SIX, back-to-back sixes! Almost an action replay off the previous ball. de Villiers was clearing his front leg, Shami bowls another slower delivery and AB smokes it over long-off

Shami to de Villiers, SIX, make that three in a row! This one's landed on the roof! An above-waist full toss - not called a no-ball though. de Villiers, surprised by the height of the ball, takes his eyes off the ball, but managed to heave it over long leg. Incredible! Gayle, meanwhile, suggests that it was a fair delivery. Another non-no-ball controversy at the Chinnaswamy?
Viljoen to de Villiers, SIX, de Villiers moves into the 80s. Viljoen bowls length - a crime at this stage and AB slogs it over cow corner for another sixer
Viljoen to Stoinis, SIX, 17 off the over with two balls to go! In the slot and Stoinis has smoked it over long-on
Viljoen to Stoinis, SIX, 27 runs off the final over! Poor bowling from Viljoen. Another length delivery, sits up nicely for Stoinis, who swings his bat hard and deposits it over long-on
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, SIX, slower ball in the slot for Parthiv Patel. Doesn't move an inch, just pumps it for a clean maximum straight down the ground
Shami to Parthiv Patel, SIX, too easy for Parthiv Patel! Angling in and perfect length to hoick, he creams it over mid-wicket for scintillating maximum

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, SIX, much needed shackle-breaker for Karthik and KKR. Gopal drags back the length and Karthik is all over it, quickly pouncing back in his crease and nailing the pull over deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, SIX, Narine joins the act. Big over for KKR, 25 off it and brings the innings back on track. Googly in the slot, Narine bends a bit and muscles the slog sweep into the crowd near deep mid-wicket

Jofra Archer to Karthik, SIX, Archer looks around in disbelief. He's not sure how that cleared the rope. Short of length around the hips, Karthik is on the hop as he plays the flick and the ball keeps sailing over backward square leg

Aaron to Karthik, SIX, sails into the crowd. Not the delivery to bowl on this surface - short and outside off, Karthik at no point in time tried to keep the cut down, used the pace on the track and slashed it over backward point

Unadkat to A Russell, SIX, he's already starting to hurt them. Slower delivery on the stumps, Russell goes deep in the crease with a cleared front leg and then uses that raw power of his to deposit it into the deep mid-wicket stand

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, shot! The only thing wrong with the delivery was it was too straight, on middle and leg, Karthik stays deep in the crease and picks it up nonchalantly over long leg. He just manages to clear the rope

Thomas to Karthik, SIX, just over. That last delivery somewhat ruins Thomas's figures - 4-0-32-1. He was unleashed on a surface that aided him and the tall pacer has repaid the decision. This was a back of a length delivery and Karthik was waiting for it, goes deep in the crease and pumps it over long-on. Not much Stokes could do there

Jofra Archer to Karthik, SIX, wow! How did he generate the power? Back of the hand slower delivery, sits up outside off and Karthik still had a lot to do, he forehands the slap over extra cover and it travels the distance
Jofra Archer to Karthik, SIX, consecutive sixes to end Archer's spell. This short ball was around leg-stump, Karthik gets inside the line and plays the pick up pull to send it sailing into the crowd

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, this time it goes the distance. Karthik also gets to his highest IPL score. Can he get a hundred? Unadkat is bowling it in the slot and Karthik muscles it with all his might over long-on. Smith has a worried look

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, Unadkat is not learning. He keeps bowling those slower balls right in the batsman's arc, Karthik sets up with a good base deep in the crease and then swings through the line, straight back over the bowler
Prasidh to Samson, SIX, gee! How on earth that cleared the ropes. Samson heaved at this good length delivery, it came off the toe end of the blade and went straight down the ground for a maximum
Chawla to Binny, SIX, nails the slog-sweep over cow corner! Got into position quickly and unleashed his arms across the line of this delivery
Narine to Jofra Archer, SIX, takes Narine on and whacks this length ball straight back down. Flat-batted slap that skims over the boundary ropes in front of the sightscreen

Prasidh to Riyan Parag, SIX, dug in short at pace, good height too, but it's flown into the crowd. Parag has swivelled across quickly and helped the pull over backward square. This is sensational batting

A Russell to Riyan Parag, SIX, just clears Carlos Brathwaite at long-on! Slower short ball outside off, seemed like a mishit initially as Parag swung the forehand into the sky, but it kept going and going

Prasidh to Jofra Archer, SIX, it takes two balls for Archer to wrap it up! This one's right in the slot from Prasidh to which Archer clears the front leg and wallops it over long-off. Sensational win for the Rajasthan Royals

A Russell to Samson, SIX, that's a high quality shot from a high-quality batsman. It was in the slot for Samson on a fuller length, he keeps his shape brilliantly and larrups it straight down the ground for a maximum. He held his pose for a wee bit too! Gee! He enjoyed it and so did we

Yarra Prithviraj to Rahane, SIX, Rahane sends it into the crowd. It was a short of length delivery, Rahane backs away, makes room, makes excellent use of good bounce and powers it over deep backward point for a maximum
Malinga to Santner, SIX, much-needed six for the hosts. Yet another off-pace ball. Santner saw that coming. Waits for this short ball to come to him and biffs the pull over deep mid-wicket

Malinga to Santner, SIX, too predictable! Santner knows that Malinga will bowl a slower ball. The length was on the shorter side and it sat up nicely for the southpaw. Santner cleared his front leg and thumped it over long-on

Hardik Pandya to Vijay, SIX, another effortless shot! Stands tall and lofts the length delivery right over the bowler's head for a half a dozen. Took one hand off the handle but the timing was just so fantastic

Tahir to Rohit, SIX, ends Tahir's spell with a maximum. Fraction short and Rohit was quick to pick the length, he crouched a bit to get underneath the pull shot and sent it over a jumping Shorey at deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, SIX, 150 up for Mumbai and that too in style. Pandya latches on to the slower delivery, right into the slot and it's been muscled over the long-on fence, huge six

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, de kock continues his terrific form in this IPL. It was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, not that short from Chahar. But de Kock identifies the length early, gets in a terrific position and powers the pull shot over deep square leg for a maximum

Harbhajan to Rohit, SIX, has he cleared the fence, yes he has! Only just though! It was a flighted delivery, Rohit dashes down to come close to the ball, Harbhajan drags his length back. And Rohit was not even close to the pitch he still goes through with the shot. And his audacity prevails as it clears deep mid-wicket

Harbhajan to Rohit, SIX, cleared the boundary with utmost ease this time. He looks in his elements today. Again, charges down the ground, wasn't to the pitch but he swings his willow hard and gets enough bat on it to pump it over long-on

Tahir to Lewis, SIX, smashed! Tahir errs by landing it in the arc and Lewis sends it straight back over him. Overpitched and the extension of the arms is enough to take it all the way over the boundary rope
S Kaul to Samson, SIX, magical timing from Samson! A length ball outside off, and this is barely an extension of an off-drive but he's struck it so sweetly. It's gone all the way. Class!
Rashid Khan to Rahane, SIX, too full on off-stump, Rahane picks the flight and sits on one knee to dispatch it for a 75-metre maximum over mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Livingstone, SIX, Livingstone joins the party now! Sees Rashid flight the googly, gets as low as he can and smokes it into the cow corner stands for a crisp maximum
S Kaul to Livingstone, SIX, another knuckle ball, and this one's been picked alright! Livingstone smokes it over deep midwicket. Fifty up for the Royals in just the sixth over
S Kaul to Livingstone, SIX, Livingstone can't help but burst out laughing. Outrageous shot. Short ball around shoulder height, and he's forehanded this swat right back over the bowler's head for six

Aaron to Rashid Khan, SIX, another slower ball and Rashid Khan has nailed this for a maximum. Moved back and across, waited for it arrive and smashed it flat and straight over mid-off, it crashed straight into the boundary hoardings

Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, top-shot! Dashes down, wasn't entirely to the pitch of it but decides to go with a big hit and gets enough bat behind it to deposit it into the stands. He played it against the spin, mind you! It needs some skill
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, reaches his fifty in style! Comes down the track again and launches it over deep mid-wicket for a mighty six. It has been a terrific innings from the skipper!

Navdeep Saini to Ingram, SIX, woah! This is even better. Saini went for the change of pace and Ingram spotted it, he made room and waited to play the inside out loft, sent it just over the deep extra cover fence

Stoinis to Rutherford, SIX, smashed! Rutherford keeps the boundaries coming for Delhi. He picked the back of a length delivery quickly, got into position and swatted the pull over deep mid-wicket. Clean strike

U Yadav to Rutherford, SIX, he only deals in sixes by the looks of it. Length delivery right in the slot for Rutherford, he clears his front leg and smokes it into the Delhi dugout near cow corner. Iyer liked it in the dressing room

Chahal to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan greets the new bowler with a maximum! A floaty delivery from Chahal, Dhawan waltzes down the pitch, gets close to the ball and pumps it downtown. The sightscreen has to bear the brunt

Navdeep Saini to Rutherford, SIX, Kohli walks away in frustration. 20 runs off the final over and make it 36 off the last two. Another full toss outside off, Rutherford slices it over point and the short square boundaries help get maximum result

Navdeep Saini to Dhawan, SIX, a hit-me delivery first up from Saini. A leg-stump half-volley at 141.2kph. Easy pickings for the southpaw. The Indian opener flicks it nonchalantly over long leg for half a dozen
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, a biggie! Not a good ball, drifts one on the pads does Chahal. Shreyas Iyer gets forward to take his front leg out of the equation and hoists it over cow corner

Axar to Parthiv Patel, SIX, deposited into the crowd. Parthiv moves across a bit, gets inside the line and swings it with the spin over backward square leg. Made decent connection as the ball sailed 20 rows back

Lamichhane to Shivam Dube, SIX, cracking shot, that spoils the over for Lamichhane, fraction too short and Dube is quick to latch onto it - rocks back and pulls it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Lamichhane to Stoinis, SIX, just look at the power of this man. A flighted delivery around off, Stoinis gets hold of it and tonks it right over the bowler's head for a towering six. Massive, believe you me

Ishant to Gurkeerat Singh, SIX, that's hit the boundary cushions on the full. Was a back of a length delivery and Gurkeerat Singh heaved it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six. Where was this man all these games? Playing his first game of the season and making an impact right away
Rabada to Stoinis, SIX, dispatched with disdain! It's too late though. Stoinis latches on to the short ball and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six
Ishant to Kohli, SIX, lovely, this is adding insult to injury - length ball outside off, Kohli leans forward and lifts it high and over long-on - went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, that should get AB going, a rank long hop, short and down the leg-side, AB swivels across and pulls it high and deep into the stands at backward square leg
Axar to Shivam Dube, SIX, smashed, tossed up well wide of off, Dube leans across and drags the slog-sweep, didn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to clear the fielder at long-on

Barinder to Shubman Gill, SIX, dispatched for a six! Stellar stuff from Shubman Gill. It was touch short and was on the body, Shubman Gill identifies the length in a canter, gets in a brilliant position and powers it over deep square leg for a maximum. KKR are off to a flier!

Rahul Chahar to Shubman Gill, SIX, beautiful, just a lovely extension of his arms, Shubman came down the track, got close to the ball and then let his hands take over - sent it sailing over long-on for a maximum
Rahul Chahar to Shubman Gill, SIX, clubbed, the leg-break and Shubman spotted it, gets a good stride forward and heaves it wide of long-on
Rahul Chahar to A Russell, SIX, too full from Chahar, Russell gets under it and smashes it high and over mid-wicket - his first of the night

Rahul Chahar to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Russell - after a slow start, he's got the move alright. Tad too full from Chahar, right in Russell's hitting arc, he gets down low and pummels it high and over mid-wicket

Bumrah to Karthik, SIX, even better! A normal-paced ball at 141kph from a short of length, Karthik picks the length early, stays in the crease and hammers it over deep mid-wicket with a powerful pull shot

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, SIX, another slower ball - 117.2kph, shorter in length and sits up nicely for the big West Indian to swing his bat. Russell clears his front leg and heaves it over deep mid-wicket. A biggie
Hardik Pandya to A Russell, SIX, six more! A high full toss, Russell moves leg-side and clubs it over cow corner. Missed the yorker by a long way. Brute power!

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, SIX, that's an incredible hit! Hardik Pandya shortens his length and there wasn't too much width either. Russell made room and slapped it over square third man. He managed to slice it all the way for a six

Bumrah to A Russell, SIX, wow! This is tremendous. It was a slower delivery outside off and Russell had to reach out a long way as he was initaially backing away. He lost his balance, but that didn't stop him from smashing a flat six over sweeper cover
Malinga to A Russell, SIX, six to start the over! Malinga bowls one right in the slot - pace on offer as well, Russell stays deep in the crease, crouches low and flogs it over deep mid-wicket

Malinga to A Russell, SIX, Russell finishes it off with a six! Not a single off-paced delivery in this over. Overpitched delivery and the West Indian doesn't need second invitations to put it away. Stays deep in the crease, bends his back leg and clubs it over wide long-off. KKR finish on 232 - highest score of the season

Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, deposited this into the stands. Lynn means business today. It was a wrong 'un, Chris Lynn reads it late but gets himself in terrific position and launches it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, SIX, into the stands! Lynnsanity at the Eden today! It was fuller and on the stumps, Chris Lynn gets under it and larrups it over deep mid-wicket for a mighty six

Rahul Chahar to Shubman Gill, SIX, beautifully played, the leg-break from Chahar, Shubman gets a good stride forward, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and lifts it majestically over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum - KKR making a statement with the bat and the ball has been lost in the crowd
Narine to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Pandya slowly giving Mumbai the push. He picks the off-break, shuffles across and heaves it with the spin over deep mid-wicket. Struck it flat and got the distance
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, round the wicket angle is not working, for now. Fraction short and Pandya is quick to pounce on it, he stays deep in the crease and smashes it a good 20 rows back
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Pandya is going down with a fight. Short and down leg, Pandya waits before swiveling across and pulling it over long leg. Another huge one from the allrounder

Gurney to Hardik Pandya, SIX, the helicopter has arrived in Kolkata. Goes deep in his crease and flicks it with a lot of power. He's started playing this shot even better than the man who invented it. Towering six over the deep mid-wicket fence

Narine to Hardik Pandya, SIX, fastest fifty of IPL 2019. This is insane hitting by the six hitting machine. He's turning it on here! Heaves the flatter delivery over the deep mid-wicket fence for a massive six, gets to his half century in style. What a knock!
Chawla to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal Pandya joins the party now. Why should Hardik have all the fun, says the elder brother. Goes down on his knee and smokes it over long-on for half a dozen
Narine to Hardik Pandya, SIX, bring out the helmet folks! Hardik gets underneath this full delivery and tonks it over the deep mid-wicket fence for another massive six. It's raining sixes!

Gurney to Hardik Pandya, SIX, magnificent shot by Hardik! Russell hit 8 sixes in his innings but Hardik has just hit his 9th maximum of the night. Gets inside the line and picks up the length delivery over deep square leg for half a dozen
Chawla to Krunal Pandya, SIX, Krunal is not done here yet! Down on his knee and slogs it over wide long-on for half a dozen
Warrier to Lewis, SIX, 138.5kph, short and wide outside off which allows Lewis to free his arms. The southpaw throws his bat at it and flays it over deep point for a maximum

Warrier to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that is his area. Anything on off and middle, Suryakumar picks it away nonchalantly over mid-wicket. The ball lands right on the ad cushions - second six of the innings

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, much needed six for Mumbai and Suryakumar. They need to put their foot on the accelerator. Shuffles across, crouches a bit and flicks it over deep square leg. Just managed to clear the rope
Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Chawla is welcomed with a straight six by Pandya. Flighted delivery and Pandya just swings through the line, clean connection and the ball travels the distance

Chawla to Hardik Pandya, SIX, second six of the over. Fired in but the length allowed Pandya to get under it, he just elevated himself and launched it into the crowd near cow corner. DK walks up to have a word with Chawla

Khaleel Ahmed to Pooran, SIX, Bhuvi has taken it. But he has jumped over the ropes. Khaleel Ahmed would be gutted! Bhuvi throws the ball in disgust. It was a short of length delivery on the body, Pooran mistimes the pull to fine leg but he gets just enough bat on it to fetch a maximum

Nabi to Rahul, SIX, Rahul has no other option but to go for it. Even though he is losing partners in a heap at the other end. Quicker and outside off, Rahul lofts it handsomely over extra cover and clears the rope comfortably. The most difficult shot to play against an offie and he's made it look ridiculously easy

Nabi to Rahul, SIX, now is helped by Nabi. A full toss just below the waist, Rahul waits and swings it over long leg. Back to back sixes and with that it also brings up the fifty for Rahul. The chase depends on him
Bhuvneshwar to Rahul, SIX, clobbered! Bhuvi starts with a length delivery right in the slot, Rahul with a cleared front leg swings through the line and gets plenty of distance over long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, SIX, a one-handed six from Rahul. A full toss, Rahul went deep in the crease and smashes it straight back over Sandeep, with the bottom hand coming off the bat handle
Bhuvneshwar to Simran Singh, SIX, wow! Seemed to be a mishit but Warner watches it sail over him. Full, slow and outside off, Simran lofts it off the base of the bat and it soars just over long-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Rahul, SIX, that's the kind of form, KL Rahul has been in. Stands tall and flicks the length delivery over deep mid-wicket for a towering six, his first one of the night

Rashid Khan to Agarwal, SIX, that's been belted by Agarwal. He sure has some muscle power and he has flaunted it there! He plunges forward, clears his front leg, keeps his shape and absolutely smashes it over long-off for a gigantic six

Nabi to Pooran, SIX, that's more like it, Kings need more of these hits. It was on a fuller length, Pooran gets under it, clears his leg, opens up his shoulders and dispatches it over long-on. High and handsome!

Mujeeb to Warner, SIX, beautifully struck! Turn on this off break but there is width on offer and Warner does the smart thing, goes with the turn as he chips it over wide long-off. More of an extended defensive push and it goes all the way. Shot of a man in supreme form

Murugan Ashwin to Manish Pandey, SIX, 50-stand comes up between the duo with this maximum. Such a clean strike from Pandey. Tossed up at th stumps, Pandey loads up big time and hammers it over the bowler's head. Held his shape and connected it beautifully
Mujeeb to Williamson, SIX, that's more like it! Goes down on his knee and hacks the floated delivery over deep backward square leg for half a dozen does the SRH skipper
Mujeeb to Nabi, SIX, time for Nabi to join in the party! Takes on his Afghan team mate and thumps the floated delivery right over the bowler's head for a clean six, couldn't have played it any better

Mujeeb to Nabi, SIX, Mujeeb has conceded 65 runs already! Nabi gets underneath the full ball and smokes it right into the sightscreen. He's turning it on here, brilliant striking and the decibels have gone a notch higher in Hyderabad. Crowd is loving it

Shami to Saha, SIX, my word, hasn't he clobbered this or what! Saha is going bonkers here! Gets one slightly too short from Shami and belts the pull over deep backward square leg. Absolutely waded into the pull and sent it deep into the crowd

Ashwin to Warner, SIX, the KXIP skipper is welcomed with some rough treatment! Warner shuffles around in the crease and slog sweeps this over fine leg for a maximum. No respite whatsoever from the Orange Army thus far
Aaron to Kohli, SIX, Kohli wasting no time whatsoever. Aaron pitches it right in the slot outside off, Kohli doesn't want any sighters and leans across to dump it into the long-off stands

Aaron to Kohli, SIX, six more! Not so convincing this but Kohli won't mind. This was a short of length delivery from Aaron, corrected his length and slightly cramped the batsman for room. Kohli throws his bat hard and skews it off the outer half. Such is the power that it sails over the third man fence for a maximum

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, SIX, this is some statement from Kohli. RCB fans are going berserk in the stands. Flighted delivery from Gopal, Kohli stays low and pummels it over long-on. Welcome to the attack, Gopal..

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, Samson is underway with a six. Stunning hit! Short of length around off, Samson picked the length early. Stayed in his crease, waited for the ball to come to him and deposited it over deep mid-wicket with a pick-up shot

Navdeep Saini to Livingstone, SIX, Saini bangs it in short, Livingstone once again cleared his front leg to pummel the pull. Didn't quite middle it, got it off the top part of the bat. But, he swung his bat so ferociously that it went all the way over long-on for a maximum

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, two men in the deep (long-on and deep mid-wicket), but all they can do is watch the ball sail over the ropes. A harmless short of length delivery, Samson swings his bat hard and dispatches it over cow corner
Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, much-needed six for RR. Touch fuller from Khejroliya, Samson crouched a bit low, sets the base and smokes it over long-on for half a dozen

Rutherford to du Plessis, SIX, first of the game and Chennai need plenty more of this going into the final phase of the innings. Slower cutter on a length outside off, du Plessis delays his loft and crunches it over extra cover. That came right off the screws and went a long way

Axar to du Plessis, SIX, biggie straight down the ground and almost went into the press box. du Plessis puts on the dancing shoes, comes down the track and strikes it sweetly with the full bat face right back over Axar

J Suchith to Raina, SIX, Boult tries to take a one-handed stunner but fails to hang on. Raina has decided it is time to go, puts the skates on and heaves it towards wide long-on, Boult runs to his left and dives full length, goes with his left hand and the ball doesn't stick. He was looking to flick it to the fielder coming across from deep mid-wicket

Axar to Jadeja, SIX, parried over. Jadeja has been sent above to do this. Goes for the slog sweep and hits it to deep backward square, Rutherford is running back to take the catch but he could only palm it over. The momentum did not help him there

Boult to Jadeja, SIX, this is the best we have seen Jadeja bat in this season. And it is a positive not only for CSK but also for India with WC coming up. Boult misses the yorker, it ends up being in the slot. Jadeja clears his front leg, keeps his shape and larrups it over long-on for a maximum

Chris Morris to Dhoni, no ball, SIX, that's a nasty nasty delivery from Chris Morris. He came to Dhoni to apologize immediately. It was a full-toss above the waist height, Dhoni gets his bat down in a good position and smashes it over short fine for a maximum

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, smashed over deep mid-wicket. You cannot bowl length to Dhoni at this stage. It was a slower one on a good length, Dhoni waits for it to arrive and tonks it high and handsome over deep mid-wicket. It sails into the crowd!

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, he has finished again with a maximum. Dhoni and last ball sixes is a story for the ages! It was angled away from Dhoni, was on a length again. Dhoni slogs, gets Dhoni power behind it. And gets just about enough bat to clear deep square leg who jumped but it was out of his grasp

Harbhajan to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan has belted this one. Geee! He is in amazing touch. It was a nicely flighted delivery wide of off, Dhawan dashes down and larrups it against the turn over long-on for a maximum. The connection was sensational and it sailed over!

Chahar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, pitched up outside off, seemed like a knuckle ball, but Iyer had no problems picking it. He holds his shape and lofts it cleanly over wide mid-off. Brilliantly timed, goes all the way

Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, SIX, this will do! Get-out-of-jail shot from de Kock. Ahmed steams in and pounds it in the swinging arc, de Kock sets up deep in his crease and clobbers it over deep square leg for half-a-dozen

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, SIX, wow! Hardik's intentions are clear here. What a shot this is, nonchalantly picks it off his pads to dump it into the cow corner stands. It was full and in the slot, such fast hands from HP as he takes full toll of the delivery

Basil Thampi to de Kock, SIX, another full-toss just about waist high from round the wicket, de Kock gets his front leg out of the way and slams it into the deep mid-wicket crowd for a massive six! Looks confident, doesn't he?
Rashid Khan to Pollard, SIX, skids through once again, but Pollard is waiting on the backfoot - very decisive, and he thumps it away over long-on for a six
Khaleel Ahmed to Krunal Pandya, SIX, short one angled into the body, gets behind the line and transfers his weight onto the backfoot to deposit it over deep mid-wicket for six

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar Yadav has looked ultra-positive from the start and this is an effortless hit. He's predominantly a leg-side player and very good with the pick-up shots. Nabi tosses it on the pads and Suryakumar makes him pay. Gets under it and whiplashes it away into the cow corner stands

Malinga to Nabi, SIX, Nabi ruins a fine over from Malinga. Plenty of width outside off, all Nabi had to do was watch it close and get it over point (no fielders in the deep). He does exactly that by timing his upper cut and slicing the ball over the boundary ropes for a crisp maximum

Hardik Pandya to Nabi, SIX, Pollard is flirting with the boundary hoardings today, another crash avoided. A full toss from Hardik Pandya and Nabi got all of it; he seemed to have mistimed it for a fleeting moment but got enough height on it to get it well and over the leaping fielder at long-on. Pollard tried his best and nearly crashed into the hoardings

Hardik Pandya to Manish Pandey, SIX, it's a tie and we have a Super Over!! Whew! What.A.Game. After all that long, never-ending confab Hardik Pandya delivers a juicy length delivery on the stumps, Pandey keeps his calm and marmalizes it into the mid-wicket orbit for a scintillating maximum. Pandey knew it was six the moment it left the bat and he pumps his fists before soaking in joy. Rohit doesn't seem too pleased and he is busy picking balls for the Super Over
Barinder to Guptill, SIX, round the wicket, a length ball angling in, no insecurities there, as Guptill uses his long levers to loft it through the line and over long-off for six

Malinga to Manish Pandey, SIX, geez! He's looks so good while playing positively. Banged in halfway down, Pandey waits for the ball to climb on him and ramps it over third man, Bumrah could only collect it from the dugout

Arshdeep Singh to Chris Lynn, SIX, Chris Lynn has belted this into the stands for a 94-meter six! It was on a back of a length, Chris Lynn charges down and backs away, keeps his shape and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. This should get him going!
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, SIX, Gill keeps producing some fabulous shots even though he is playing anchor. Picked the carrom ball, used his feet and lofted it through the line, all the way over long-on
Ashwin to Shubman Gill, SIX, tries a little too much with his action, fires it into middle and leg, Shubman Gill gets on his knee and sweeps it high and mighty over deep backward square leg for six
Tye to A Russell, SIX, errs big time with a full-toss, Russell opens up his stance and swings those brawny levers over cow corner for six. Tough man man to bowl to, this guy...

Tye to A Russell, SIX, ALMOST nails the yorker, on off-stump, Russell backs off and clubs it flat, straight to Agarwal at long-off, who fluffs the catch! He was too far inside, and to add insult to injury, parries it onto the rope to concede six! A crucial drop from Agarwal this. Won't do his confidence much good. And he'd better not look at his captain - the murderous stare of the basilisk will be waiting for him...
Sam Curran to Karthik, SIX, short one angling into the gut, Karthik backs away and nails the pull, transfers his weight onto the backfoot, and deposits it over deep square leg for six!

Ashwin to Chris Lynn, SIX, that is not the length to bowl to Lynn. Back of a length, is this carrom ball and Lynn sets himself up for a big shot down the ground, his bat speed ensured that the ball cleared the long-off fence with ease

Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, might just be Lynn's night. Even mishits are fetching him runs. This was a short of length delivery at the body, Lynn swivels to play the pull and the top-edge sails over long leg, for a maximum
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, one boundary and Uthappa has found his touch. Flighted delivery and it is in the slot, Uthappa extends his arms and lofts it straight back over Ashwin, all the way
Nitish Rana to Agarwal, SIX, that's right in the swinging arc for Mayank Agarwal! Loopy on off-stump, he gets underneath the flight and pumps it for a mighty maximum straight down the ground

Chawla to Mandeep, SIX, that's an extension of punch! Just a mere extension. Mandeep expected the googly and hung back to target the shorter boundaries (straight down the ground), timed the stroke to perfection while on the move and cleared the ropes with ease

Narine to Sam Curran, SIX, that is a shot and a half. We have seen him dispatch spinners in Test cricket and he is replicating that in this six-hitting format too. He dashes down with a lot of intent, swings hard at it, gets enough bat on it. The timing was incredible, it hit the sweet spot and it sailed into the night sky over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Gurney to Sam Curran, SIX, wow! Just wow! He punches his bat in delight. It was a slower one on a fuller length, Sam Curran picks it up, delays his bat swing and smokes it high into the sky and over long-on for a maximum
Gurney to Pooran, SIX, 104.5kph from the back of the hand. And Pooran's picking the screws off it, flat-batting, uppishly, way, way over cow corner. Gee, the audacity

A Russell to Pooran, SIX, 129kph. There's really nothing wrong with this - it's a tight back of a length in fact, but Pooran clears his front leg, takes it off the front foot and goes baseballing it into an empty long-off

Chawla to Pooran, SIX, ooh. It's the googly, and Pooran couldn't care less. He stands his ground, clears his front leg and swings big, lofting it so damn cleanly, with lots and lots of altitude over long-off
Chawla to Pooran, SIX, Pooran is in sublime touch tonight! Wasn't all that short, but Pooran jumps deep inside the crease and converts it into a half-tracker before muscling the pull over deep square

Aaron to Pant, SIX, full pace at a back of a length - never mind how slow Kotla is when Aaron's dishing out juicy freebies. Pant lays into in style, walking across his stumps, making it into a leg-line and then swivelling as well to ensure he makes full use of fine leg being inside the ring with the airy mow

Shreyas Gopal to Rutherford, SIX, the mother of long hops. And Rutherford nails his pull, flat and with seemingly enough distance over deep square leg. But Parag's there, and he leaps up, doesn't get to the ball but ends up falling flat over on top of the ice-bucket kept in front of his team's dug-out
Shreyas Gopal to Pant, SIX, yea, he's in a hurry. One knee, angry hands and a fierce swing as he swipes it across the line, hammering it flat over long-on. And Kotla's boundaries are no enemy ..

Ish Sodhi to Pant, SIX .. aaand Delhi make it to the top two, for today at least. Rajasthan get knocked out, officially. Everything courtesy yet-another Pant slog, the usual, sitting on a knee and smoking it into the first floor at cow corner. Oh also, he has his personal fifty

Ish Sodhi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, Shreyas Iyer is one of the best players of spin in the country and here's the testament. Sodhi gives more air, overpitches in the process and Iyer frees his arms to thawart it straight down the ground for a maximum

Ish Sodhi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, consecutive sixes for Iyer. He doesn't want Sodhi to dictate terms. Sees another flighted delivery just outside off, extends his long levers and lofts it over long-off. Clean as a whistle!
Riyan Parag to Pant, SIX, so, it was just a sighter from Pant. Spots one in the zone, gets low and imbues his forearm strength to clout this into the deep mid-wicket stands

Riyan Parag to Pant, SIX, gee! How on earth did he get this away for a six? Parag has a wry smile on his face. This was a mis-hit from Pant, lost his balance as he threw everything at it. Skews it off the cue-end and got plenty of height. He placed it in the gap over mid-wicket and in the end, it soared over the ropes for a six
Ishant to Livingstone, SIX, massive, Livingstone has had enough of prodding and poking, waltzes down the track, gets close to the ball and bludgeons it over mid-wicket for a huge maximum

Boult to Riyan Parag, SIX, just enough willow behind it to clear the fence. It was full and was wide of off, Riyan Parag clears his leg, keeps his shape and hoicks it over long-off for a maximum. Much-needed for RR!

Boult to Riyan Parag, SIX, gets his maiden IPL fifty in style with a maximum. He becomes the youngest cricketer in the IPL to score a fifty! Gee! This young man has some power. And he has flaunted that on this delivery. It was in the slot on a fuller length, he swings his willow, gets it off the sweet spot and it went a long way back into the stands. And boy, isn't he pumped!

Khaleel Ahmed to Kohli, SIX, what a shot. Kohli special. The lofted on-drive - his signature stroke. Ahmed once again hurls it up, tempting Kohli and he nonchalantly picks it with all the dexterity of the wrists over long-on
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, goes for a big one and dispatches it over deep mid-wicket. He is taking a liking to Rashid Khan! He goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it for a maximum

Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, wow! That has been smoked from Hetmyer. Maiden IPL fifty for him. And he is pumped, look at him celebrate. He goes down on his knees and connects it magnificently well and dispatches it over deep square leg for a maximum. Insane hitting!

Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, SIX, smashed! Hetmyer-show continues at the Chinnaswamy! This is high-quality hitting from the West Indian. It was short and was around face height, Hetmyer absolutely nails the pull shot. But he failed to get the elevation and Pandey at deep mid-wicket had a chance. But it was hit at such ferocious pace that it went through the hands of Pandey and went over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Gurkeerat Singh, SIX, Rashid Khan has had a rare off day today. It was a wrong 'un on a short of length, Gurkeerat Singh rocks back and clobbers it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Gee! He is in fine touch!

Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, why were you sitting in the dug-out, Mr. Hetmyer! Red flags flying high and handsome in the crowd. It was touch short, Hetmyer picks up the length early, goes on the back foot and thumps it over long-on
Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX, whacked over cow corner. Hetmyer tees off, gets under a flighted delivery and pumps it just over the ropes for a maximum
Nabi to Hetmyer, SIX, smoked over cow corner. Flighted delivery from Nabi, Hetmyer goes back very quickly on seeing the length and powers it into the stands. Dismissive stuff!

Navdeep Saini to Guptill, SIX, lovely, a little shimmy down the track, Guptill gets close to the ball, plays with a still head and a straight bat - high and over mid-off, sails over the ropes for a maximum

de Grandhomme to Shankar, SIX, comes on. Gets dispatched. A proper sitter, neither-here-nor-there and Shankar's always been stylish, clearing out his front leg and pulling it bang off the middle over long-on
Washington Sundar to Shankar, SIX, 105kph. Dropped short, Shankar still takes it off the front leg, freeing up his hands once again over long-on. Ah, flat
Washington Sundar to Shankar, SIX, off a knee now. Sundar tries going down the brave route - tossing it up - and finds it being slog-swept deeper, longer, cow corner
Khejroliya to Williamson, SIX, a similar length, but Williamson's too smart to be fooled twice in a row. So he walks well across his stumps and pummels it off his legs into deep square leg, 86 meters

Khejroliya to Williamson, SIX, it's an empty cow corner, and KW's exploiting it a little more with his walking-across-carts. Gets behind this back of a length delivery, on top of it as well, in a much smaller smoke
U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, real smart stuff, he's spotted mid-off in the circle and is happy to loft a very, very flat drive over that guy. It's his fifty as well - the first of 2019
U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, shuffle, swing, six. Picks out the off-cutter, gets under the length and heaves it with lots of bottom-hand over mid-wicket
U Yadav to Guptill, SIX, massive, SRH have got going, comes down the track - did Guptill, makes room as he did so and carves a length ball over cover, went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Murugan Ashwin to du Plessis, SIX, it's getting worse for Ashwin. du Plessis skates down the track again, meets the pitch and extends his arms into a lofty hit over long-on

Tye to du Plessis, SIX, Tye is being taken to the cleaners. 14 runs off the first three balls. Pitches up, just where du Plessis was hoping for. Gets under it and thumps it over long-on for a maximum. Just clears M Ashwin, who was patrolling the fence

Sam Curran to du Plessis, SIX, tonked down the ground for a six. It's in that swinging arc, just outside off. du Plessis arrests his back-lift and launches it over the bowler's head. For a moment, looked like he didn't get it off the middle but still he manages to get it over the fence

Sam Curran to du Plessis, SIX, slotted over cow corner. du Plessis inching closer to his ton. Another short ball, du Plessis gets into a brilliant position and sends it a countrymile over deep mid-wicket

Harpreet Brar to Raina, SIX, that is much better. Why nudge and nurdle when you have the shots? Raina shimmies down the wicket and though he wasn't to the pitch, he went through with the loft and it sailed over long-on

Harpreet Brar to Raina, SIX, super shot! He is picking his deliveries and time to attack the left-arm spinner. Raina dances down the wicket and gets close to the ball, swings it with the spin over deep mid-wicket. This came right off the screws and went a long way

Chahar to Rahul, SIX, just the perfect over-ruiner. And Chahar's to blame -- letting out a rank short sitter outside off, slow as well for Rahul to line it up as he swivels and pulls it over cow corner
Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, slowed up just for a change, and Rahul's no slow coach - he makes room and goes inside-out in a lofted extension of his arms over extra cover

Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, now a shuffle, and goes the other way. It's in line with the stumps, which Rahul now has the spin for help as well as he sweeps it without even bothering to keep it down. Way over fine leg
Harbhajan to Pooran, SIX, dropped short, poor bowling, Pooran rocks back, very deep in the crease, and pulls it with an elegant flourish high and mighty into the cow corner crowd
Jadeja to Pooran, SIX, half-tracker from round the wicket, flat one, Pooran whacks it high and mighty over deep mid-wicket for six
Tahir to Pooran, SIX, dropped short, absolutely abominable delivery, Pooran rocks back and deposits it over deep mid-wicket with a pull for six
Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, oh he'll run down now. Closes in on where it pitches and then goes inside-out, long levers, long-off. It's KL, the 2018 version

Harbhajan to Rahul, SIX, 19 balls | 52 runs -- the third fastest of the season. And it's just as stunning a shot to get there, the usual straight high-elbowed lofted punch. It's not everyday that you leave Gayle stranded at 4 off 5 balls while you have your fun
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, brave toss up, but it goes wrong big time. Just too full and outside off as well with Gayle hanging back in his crease to smoke it typically into the sightscreen straight down
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, and now he'll use the turn as well. Tahir goes length and Gayle goes tonking them over long-on, swishing the whack, long, hard

Malinga to Uthappa, SIX, is that the shackle breaker? He doesn't even want to go to Karthik and punch gloves. Tells his skipper to stay put. Malinga dishes out a slower length delivery from round the wicket, Uthappa clears his front leg and smokes it over cow corner

Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, four followed by a six. That should ideal get him going but not sure today. Short ball at the body, Uthappa has no other option but to take it on, the top-edge sails over the deep backward square fielder

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, SIX, second ball and Rana puts it into the stand. Gentle full delivery outside off, Rana just extends his arms and lofts it handsomely over mid-off, the timing was such that it goes the distance

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, SIX, 14 off the 3 balls. This is smart batting by Rana. He backs away and waits for the slower short of length delivery, ramps it over short third and the ball just manages to clear the rope
Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, just over Pollard. Misses the yorker and bowls a juicy full toss, Uthappa goes straight down the ground and gets enough wood on it to clear a leaping Pollard

Malinga to Nitish Rana, SIX, consecutive sixes. The slower delivery from Malinga and not sure Rana was looking to go deep square leg, he intended to hit it over mid-wicket but ended up dragging it over deep square. He won't mind the final result though
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, SIX, there's the first maximum for the evening. Lynn cuts loose, gets the required length to swing his arms and clouts it way back into the cow corner stands

Malinga to Chris Lynn, SIX, not going to see it off on this occasion. This bouncer is directed at the torso, it was kicking rapidly at him. But Lynn gets his weight back and helps it over short fine leg for a six
Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, serves it up in the zone and gets punished. Lynn shows no mercy as he clears his front leg and dismisses it straight down the ground for half-a-dozen

Rahul Chahar to Chris Lynn, SIX, dumped disdainfully over long-off. He's continuing from where he left off from the last game. Chahar under the pump now. Flighted it more luringly, Lynn gets under it and butchers it over long-off

Warrier to de Kock, SIX, short one at the body, de Kock shapes up to hook - oops, he's late on it - bit of a top-edge, very high on the bat, goes over the expectant fine leg fielder for six! QdK is surprised it carried!
Narine to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, okay, finally, a hurry. Yadav gets half a press in front and lofts his whip, many rows into cow corner

A Russell to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, and the strategy dished out means it needs only one ball to finish things up. Mumbai top the table, Kolkata get wrapped up. Russell takes all his anger out in this delivery, banging it in short, down leg and Suryakumar hooks it away fine, very fine, very long. Mumbai seem calm, but trust Hyderbad to errupt.
A Russell to de Kock, SIX, ah, the good ol' length-ball swat! On a length, and hence, in the slot - de Kock plays the pick-up swat over deep mid-wicket for six

A Russell to de Kock, SIX, consecutive sixes! Another short one @144km/h, de Kock swivels on his toe and gets it off the sticker of the bat over the fine leg fence for six. Very fine, and that's landed just in front of the more vocal comm. box!
Jayant Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, cracking shot, excellent use of the feet from MS, comes down the track, gets close to the ball, plays with the turn and lifts it high and over long-on for a maximum
Jayant Yadav to Rayudu, SIX, massive, the pep talk has worked, Rayudu dances down the track, gets close to the ball, lets the ball turn and then clouts it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Malinga to Dhoni, SIX, monster blow from Dhoni. He'll make a mockery of you if you miss your length. And this is the shot he will play even in his sleep. Malinga misses the yorker, sends it into the swinging zone for Dhoni and he makes him pay. Gets under it and tonks it powerfully over long-on. That's going, going and goes a long way into the stands
Malinga to Dhoni, SIX, it's two in two now. Malinga under the pump. Errs again, hurls in a similar delivery. Dhoni was ready for it, waits for it and absolutely clobbers it over long-on again

Harbhajan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, he'll bite the bait. Is happy to go against the turn, milking the last ball of the powerplay that doesn't allow a deep mid-wicket - sitting on a knee and slogging it over. Cleanly
Nabi to Pant, SIX, gets underneath the tossed up delivery and smokes it for a 91-metre maximum over long-on. Gee, that power off the bottom hand...
Basil Thampi to Munro, SIX, that is where he is very strong! On the hips, just a pick up shot and that has gone many a mile over the deep backward square stands. 53 off 37 looks far more gettable
Nabi to Pant, SIX, kneels down and lifts the ball away! That wasn't too far away from Rashid at the boundary line. The ball pops over the fence as well. Much needed sixer for DC
Bhuvneshwar to Rutherford, SIX, length delivery going across and has been lifted away over deep long-off for a sixer. Poor choice of ball and has been deposited over the fence
Basil Thampi to Pant, SIX, another slower delivery and has been thumped over deep mid. Got hold of the ball and muscled it over the boundary. Poor execution
Basil Thampi to Pant, SIX, you beauty! Pant on beast mode. Only 14 needed now. In the right slot, Pant has smacked it over deep mid. 20 off the over already. What have you done Mr. Thampi?
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, in the slot and that disappears! This man is a visual delight. Pitched up and Pant went bonkers to send it over long-off for a sixer
Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, he is toying with the bowlers now. Stands deep in his crease, spots the short ball early and ramps it over a helpless third man fielder
Hooda to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, Prithvi Shaw is flying at the moment. First ball against Hooda and he launches him way over long-on with a clean swing of the bat

Ishant to Guptill, SIX, into the night sky, going..going..gone! Jeez, that was in the air for a long time but guess what, he's got the distance as well! And quite a bit of it too. Length ball, just where Guptill likes it and he swings merrily through the line. Didn't hold back at all and that helped him in the end to take full toll. Into the second tier at long-on

Axar to Shankar, SIX, that is his strength. Anything that is back of a length and Shankar is quick to pounce on it, he uses his reach to good effect to thump it with a straight bat over cow corner. Just managed to clear the rope

Boult to Shankar, SIX, oh no! Iyer did all the hard work and catching the ball, but the toss up to the incoming fielder goes awry. Similar line and length from Boult and a repeat of a shot from Shankar, smashes it to wide long-off and Iyer races across to his left, takes it over his head but with the momentum taking him over, he tries to flick the ball up for Dhawan. No dice as he ends up throwing it over the ad boards

K Paul to Nabi, no ball, SIX, Keemo Paul is struggling. He was on his haunches after the second ball and now he has overstepped. Hobbles to his run-up. Is not fit? Full and in the slot, Nabi nonchalantly picks it over cow corner for half a dozen

Boult to Guptill, SIX, one-handed chip over deep extra cover! Second time that Guptill hasn't quite middled it but has as many sixes to his name. Will this be his night? Was probably undone by the slower ball and got early into the chip shot. One hand came off in the process too but what he did well was to have clarity. Chose to go over the infield and ended up going over the ropes too. Wow!
Boult to Guptill, SIX, muscled away! Guptill is on a roll here! Shortish and a bit of width as well, he feasts on the offering with a ferocious slap cut over sweeper cover. Bludgeoned it!
Axar to Guptill, SIX, hacked away! Guptill is in the mood! Axar fired this in and the Kiwi sat down to half-pull this over deep square leg. Absolutely clobbered it!
K Paul to Watson, SIX, horrible ball, short delivery down the leg-side, Watson pulls and times it sweetly, in fact just helped on the way over long leg
K Paul to Watson, SIX, the slower ball is telegraphed early, got to be well disguised to a top player, Watson picks it, waits and slogs it on one knee to the cow corner fence

K Paul to Watson, SIX, fifty for Watto. From 18 off 20 balls, he's raced to 50 off 31 balls. This is precisely why CSK never mind a slow start from Watson. Slower delivery full and outside off stump, Watson lofts, mistimes to an extent but has enough power to hit it over long-off

Axar to du Plessis, SIX, yet again its that premeditated movement tat enables Faf to smash a big one. Transfers all his weight onto the back foot and clubs this flat over extra cover with a hint of class and elegance

Axar to Watson, SIX, swept away all the way over backward square leg and CSK are running away with the game now. The heads are dropping in the DC camp. Fired down the leg-side, Watson meets the ball nicely and sends it into the stands, they are searching for the ball
Harbhajan to Rutherford, SIX, just look at that shot! Unbelieveable, reckons Sunny G on air. Was a touch short around off, Rutherford treks back and lifts it over covers for a lovely six. Class!

Tahir to Pant, SIX, Deepak Chahar catches it......and steps back to ruin the party for CSK! MSD is not pleased and he immediately brings Chahar into the infield. Tahir almost started celebrating, but had to hold back and so are the CSK fans in the stands. A loopy full delivery outside off, Pant goes for the biggie and slices it high into the air off the cue end, the ball keeps swirling and Chahar at long-on couldn't control his momentum around the boundary ropes. Took the catch cleanly but the momentum way always dragging him back. Big moment in the game?
Jadeja to Boult, SIX, shortens his length and keeps it around off, Boult stays on the back foot and thrashes it way over long-on

Jadeja to Ishant, SIX, walks down the pitch and smashes it for a maximum. Just the kind of finish DC wanted and the whole of Delhi camp are delighted on seeing Ishant Sharma get his highest score in IPL. It was straight and short from Jaddu, Ishant ambled down and clobbered it straight back over the bowler's head. Crashed flat into the boundary hoardings...

Malinga to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, 138.6kph, misses his yorker and worse - he's got reverse swing on it as well - but it's bang in the slot and Bravo also makes it worse by getting deep in the crease as he whips it uppishly, high and over deep mid-wicket. Hardik doesn't help himself either at the boundary, running in at first, and then having to go back .. watches in the nd

Krunal Pandya to Watson, SIX, this was coming, this was exactly what Krunal was gambling again. He flats it wide outside off, there may have been a deep extra cover, but Watson carves it powerfully, well over that guy

Krunal Pandya to Watson, SIX, it had to be short. It HAD to be given the last ball's treatment, but Watson's smarter, rocking behind, going with a straight punch, extending his followthough into the sightscreen down the ground
Krunal Pandya to Watson, SIX, well, well, well, it can get cleaner. Krunal's darted this bang into the arc, Watson's down on a knee too and goes slogging. If only boundaries were in the second tier!
Krunal Pandya to du Plessis, SIX, over mid-on again, a much cleaner strike. Krunal is drawn towards du Plessis down the leg-side, and is bashed through the line

Malinga to Watson, SIX, drifts on leg-stump with this off-cutter and is swept into the stands. Watson, having picked up the line in a flash, got into a brilliant position there before swinging it over backward square

SN Thakur to Rohit, SIX, smashed! A sharp bouncer @139.8km/h, Rohit isn't back and across, but natural talent comes to the fore - the frontfoot across and that pulled high in front of deep square leg for six!

Tahir to Pollard, SIX, low full toss, didn't dip on the batter and has been spanked down the ground over the bowler's head for a sixer. Pollard didn't hold back there. Mistimed hits from him will carry as well
Tahir to Pollard, SIX, you can't drop it that short! Mince meat for Pollard. Picks the short ball and slams it over deep square leg for a sixer. Much needed one for MI
SN Thakur to Pollard, SIX, and Pollard slams the pull away! Adds a lot of red chilly into the wounds of CSK. Powered over deep mid for a sixer. That was hugeeeeee

SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, SIX, fuller ball and has been whipped away over deep mid. This is what a redemption does to a batter. Frees his arms and helicopters it over deep mid for a sixer. Oh Raina!!

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, another lost ball? A length ball, the white marshmallow deceives Chahar, as it doesn't move off the wicket, a tad wide outside off, but de Kock shuffles across and clubs that high and mighty over cow corner for six! Into the stands!

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, an away-swinger, nothing wrong with this one, on a good length and not a lot of width, de Kock just backs away and has a flash at it - and he's sliced it away over deep backward point for six. Just over Bhajji at the fence

Chahar to de Kock, SIX, VVS was spot-on with his pitch report, he's definitely trusting the bounce off a length, it's angling away, de Kock lines himself and just casually lofts it over deep extra cover for six
SN Thakur to de Kock, SIX, short one angling away outside off, de Kock plays a southpaw's forehand and absolutely slaughters that over deep mid-wicket for six. That's an absolutely stunning shot...
Krunal Pandya to Rayudu, SIX, horrible drag down this. Rayudu's charged down, made it into one in his slot and smoking a cross-batted heave over cow corner
Rahul Chahar to Rayudu, SIX, oooo, wow. Just wow. Rayudu continues dancing, going inside-out, and then holding his pose. Yep, extra cover
Krunal Pandya to Sam Curran, SIX, low full toss. Curran stays crouched, gets under, and boom. Swinging slog, into cow corner
Bumrah to Sam Curran, SIX, game over. Bumrah tries the slower one, but Curran - in some mood - picks it early and nails it right off the screws, over deep mid-wicket

Bumrah to Rayudu, SIX, that will hurt. The free-hit has gone the distance as Rayudu lines up against the short ball and clubs it off the back foot over wide long-on. Sweetly timed maximum. Started with four dot balls and ends up conceding 14. Life's harsh sometimes

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's all the amount of respect Pandya had in the tank. He loves spin. As soon as Jadeja bowled a little full, he went down on his knees to power it over deep mid-wicket

Jadeja to Hardik Pandya, SIX, now that is some shot! Don't think many would hit that so far from that length. Not really short and leg stump line, but went back, despite not using the depth of the crease and being cramped, he swivelled and pulled it over the backward square leg boundary and that seems to have cleared the ground. All those gym sessions, that's great flexibility

Chawla to Pollard, SIX, na, na, na, just waited for it to land in his zone. With that sort of a form in CPL, he won't mishit those. Easy to the eye straight loft into the sightscreen. Expect the bowler to push it quick and short?

Jadeja to Saurabh Tiwary, SIX, Jadeja gets it right into the slot for Tiwary who lofts it downwind to clear long-off. The wind was the key here. Don't think he struck it that well but the wind made sure it carried
Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, see-ball, hit-ball. As simple as that. Iyer finds one in his arc, brings those strong muscle power and butchers it over long-off. Second six for DC's skipper..

Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, whoa.. Iyer, you beauty. This lad is a very good player against spin and he's showing his class here. Gowtham doesn't correct his length, floats it up just outside off and Iyer's eyes lit up once more. Gets under it and whacks it a mile over long-on

Jordan to Stoinis, SIX, muscled over cow corner. A 92-metre hit from Stoinis. Got the required length from Jordan, who perhaps missed his yorker and Stoinis punishes it with a massive strike, sending into the empty second tier
Jordan to Stoinis, SIX, wow! Stoinis is on fire here. He's raced to 34 off just 16 balls. Jordan serves it fuller and on middle, Stoinis moves across and wallops it over deep square leg.

Jordan to Stoinis, SIX, 20-ball fifty for Stoinis. Rabada congratulates and his mates in the dressing room are delighted. Stoinis raises his bat and soaks in all the applause. Jordan struggles again, keeps missing his length and gets punished once again. Stoinis takes it on the full and dispatches it into the deep mid-wicket stands

Gowtham to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massive, too full from KG, right under Shreyas's arc and he doesn't let that go unpunished - gets forward and thumps it high and over long-on, went into the top tier for a 99m hit
Mohit Sharma to Rahul, SIX, bread and butter for KL Rahul! On the pads and a real loosener that from Mohit Sharma, lines it up perfectly and swats it into the mid-wicket stands
Stoinis to Agarwal, SIX, gets one out of the screws, finally! Gets into position early against the short ball and hammers the pull flat into the mid-wicket stands
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, SIX, rank length ball, released off the knuckles, a massive no-no at this point, and he's carted that over long-on for six!

Mohit Sharma to Agarwal, SIX, that's a start to the over, and the pressure is right back on the bowler now! Full and wide, and he gets on his knee to slice this over deep backward point for six! Fifty for Agarwal, and this may well be a coming-of-age story in Dubai tonight, as he raises his bat...

Mohit Sharma to Agarwal, SIX, he's picked the bones out of the slower one, and it's clear why - 75.5km/h, off the back of the hand, and it was so slow, he could have swung once and swung it again in time. Decides to wait, and clubs this over long-off for six!
Stoinis to Agarwal, SIX, 13 off 6, and he's slammed the first ball of the final over for six! Far too slow to bother him, and he's nailed this loft over his head for for six!

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, carves it over extra cover. AB waits patiently now, it's another one of Sharma's slower balls that sits up on a length. And boom, and the virus has saved someone in the crowd from a broken nose
Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, width again. Sharma doesn't bother changing his approach, something AB's read well in advance to slap over point this time

Shankar to Finch, no ball, SIX, he's just landed this in the slot for him to power it over mid-wicket. A lot of height on that one and it cleared the fielder in the deep. Oh he's overstepped again! What are you doing Shankar!
Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX, Rashid Khan goes full and Finch slog-sweeps behind square, Rashid Khan was doing alright bowling the hard length, Finch wins the battle

U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, more filth from Umesh. This is an awful start. Short of length at the body, sitting up for Bairstow who helps the pull behind square and helps it over the ropes. Great timing

Washington Sundar to Manish Pandey, SIX, so tempting. So, so tempting and whacked! 85kph, looped up by Sundar. It's brave, but it's also too full so it eliminates the risk for Pandey who wallops it over midwicket. Smashes the roof over the first tier
U Yadav to Bairstow, SIX, the scoop for six! Incredible shot. Good length delivery outside off, he sits on the back knee while leaning into the off-side and helps it on its way

Rahul Tewatia to du Plessis, SIX, SMACK! Parag at the boundary has woefully misjudged it, and not for the first time, the outfielder is pointing at the floodlights! Charges down and carts it, with a bit of a hind-limb pirouette, over long-on for six!
Rahul Tewatia to du Plessis, SIX, backs away into the on-side, Tewatia serves one up in the slot, and clobbers this over long-on for a gigantic six! More of these needed. Many more.
Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX, charges this slower one and lifts this over long-on for six! Absolutely smoked that over one of the longer boundaries here at Sharjah!
Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX, far too slow for even two bat-swings - 105.2km/h - and this ridiculously slow short ball has been clubbed over deep mid-wicket with a late pull for six!

Unadkat to du Plessis, SIX, 14th fifty in IPL for Faf, and it's been brought up by one of the cleanest, straightest swings of the blade down the ground. Another six that seems to have cleared that diminutive Sharjah roof!

Tom Curran to du Plessis, SIX, half-volley outside off, clears his frontfoot, and makes it 4 out of 5 balls dispatched for six! Clobbers this over long-off! That's the fifty-stand - only 7 of which have been scored by Dhoni. Faf is in rhythm...
Jofra Archer to du Plessis, SIX, drops it short and into the body, but Faf picks the slower one - waits for it to arrive and clubs the pull over deep midwicket for six!

Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX, MS Dhoni, far too late in the final over, dispatches this over deep midwicket for six! A Dhoni six, and the world goes crazy! My neighbours have gone crazy! Right in the slot and that's carted into the Sharjah streets...
Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX, what's in that cricket bat? A slower one on a length, and that's a no-no to the world's best finisher - on his knee and he's mowed that over wide long-on for six! 92 meters!

Tom Curran to Dhoni, SIX, THWACK! MS Dhoni in the final over is a sight to behold! Slams this short ball, pulling it over deep square leg for third successive six. That's a joint IPL record - 33 sixes in a game...
Jofra Archer to Watson, SIX, this is just a flick from Watson and it's gone all the way over square leg. Slower ball from Archer that drifted into the pads nicely to be put away

Shreyas Gopal to Watson, SIX, there he goes, and clears the roof! Signature Watson this. So good with the pull shot against spin. Even deliveries that are slightly off in length, he pounces on them. This one, though, is a proper long hop and Watson just nails it over square leg
Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, short of length delivery around the hip, and if there's anyone you don't want to bowl this length at, it's Watson. Whips the pull away into the stands

Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, this is not good bowling. Dare I say Tom Curran doesn't have the pace to trouble Watson with the short ball. It's playing into his strengths. And he's absolutely nailing these pull shots
Rahul Tewatia to Sam Curran, SIX, Curran races down, ensures he gets right to the pitch of this googly and smokes it downtown. Already injecting life into the chase and he's only 3 balls in

Rahul Tewatia to Sam Curran, SIX, there's six more. Tewatia may not be feeding it into the slot for him, but Curran is creating his own length with excellent use of the feet. Gets close enough to this and hammers it back down the ground
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, lovely tossed up on off, Samson gets a big stride forward and then lifts it nonchalantly over long-off, went a long way into the stands

Jadeja to Smith, SIX, chance, dropped and six - it's not happening in the field for CSK - Sam Curran, the culprit, this was tossed up slower and wider of off, Smith had to reach out and didn't get enough on the lofted drive - went flat and and wide of long-off. Curran stretched out with both hands, got to the ball and then let it burst through - was right in front of the ropes and that perhaps put him off
Ngidi to Jofra Archer, SIX, lovely, that's a clean hit from Archer, picked the slower ball early, extended his arms and lifted it high and over long-off for a maximum

Ngidi to Jofra Archer, SIX, back-to-back sixes and the Royals are finishing on a high - Archer expects Ngidi to go short and he's quick to swivel across, gets a lovely connection on the pull and sends the ball soaring over square leg - went out of the ground as well

Ngidi to Jofra Archer, no ball, SIX, a hat-trick of sixes, length ball at the stumps, Archer clears his front leg and thwacks it flat and hard, wide of long-on for a maximum - worse, Ngidi has overstepped by a massive margin and a free-hit is coming up

Ngidi to Smith, SIX, loosener from Ngidi and he has been dispatched into the empty stands. Back of length angling into leg, Smith loves it there, picks it up nonchalantly and sends it sailing over backward square leg
Sam Curran to Samson, SIX, cracking shot! That's more like it. Short of length around the hips, Samson gets into a good position this time and smashes the pull into the deep mid-wicket stands

Chahar to Samson, SIX, wow! That is some shot. He looks so elegant when on song. Picked the short of length delivery early, stayed on the front foot while transferring his weight back, pulls it handsomely over deep square leg and cleared the field comfortably
Jadeja to Samson, SIX, he's dealing in sixes at the moment, third for him. Drifting in from the round the wicket angle, Samson swings through the line and smokes it all the way over wide long-on

Jadeja to Samson, SIX, Jadeja put under pressure straightaway. Samson does not want him to settle. This is touch wide of off-stump and he goes with the spin, nice clean bat swing to take it over long-off. Might have gone out of the ground

Chawla to Samson, SIX, woah! Samson is on fire. First ball from Chawla and he launches him straight down the ground. This was right in the slot though but still had to be put away, Dhoni has a word with Chawla

Chawla to Samson, SIX, this is now officially a carnage. Chawla goes wide of off-stump and Samson was happy with that line, good stride forward and lofts it with the spin over extra cover. Another one out in the car park

Chawla to Samson, SIX, "looks like he is having a net," quips Gavaskar on air. He is treating them that away and has even impressed his skipper at the other end. Flighted and lands full, Samson clears his front leg and goes straight, that high backlift allows him to have a clean swing and it goes over the roof

Chawla to Smith, SIX, Smith has a piece of the leggie. 28 runs off the over. Chawla went fast and short outside off, Smith does not commit to the shot, waits for it and then smacks it over extra cover.

Chawla to Smith, SIX, Chawla continues to travel.. Throws it up wider expecting to get away but Smith has other plans, he makes use of the width and smokes it straight back over, not the power of Samson but has enough to clear the rope

Chawla to Samson, SIX, this is bad bowling now. He is just feeding it in his slot. Flighted and lands it on a fullish length, right where Samson likes it, he lofts through the line and clearing the fence has not been difficult for him, well over long-off

Pattinson to Narine, SIX, you just can't bowl full to Narine. Especially not at his pads, he will make you pay everytime. Pattinson went for the slower ball and Narine accepts the gift, picks it away off his pads effortlessly over deep square leg for the first six of this innings
Pattinson to Morgan, SIX, feeds the slot. And finally, FINALLY, Morgan connects. He stands his ground, staying crouched, clearing his front leg and mowing this over cow corner
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX, 126.4kph, innocuous lazy delivery, off a back of a length sitting up on the pads. And Cummins swipes across the line, getting it over short fine leg
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX, follows him in with the bouncer, but Cummins' undoing some of his rubbish with the ball. And this one's with a super hook, comfortably over fine leg
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX, tonks off the front foot now. Gets under the good length and lofts it over long-on
Bumrah to Cummins, SIX .. make it 27, and remember it's off Bumrah -- 3-0-5-2 and then 1-0-27-0 to ruin. It's a low full toss, and is smoked straight over his head

Rahul Chahar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana stamps his authority against spin. Read this tossed up delivery from Chahar that was planted outside off, made enough room and lifted it over mid-off. Has enough power to clear the ropes on the full

Warrier to Rohit, SIX, as anticipated, the extra ball goes the distance. How often do we see this? Short and wide outside off, plenty of time for Rohit to free his arms. Throws the kitchen sink and plays an upper cut as the ball sails over deep point for the first maximum of the evening. Frustrated is Warrier as he spoils his over

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, SIX, ufff! When he plays the pull there is no ground big enough for him. Kuldeep errs in length, Rohit had ample time to go back, get into position and nail the pull over deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Rohit, SIX, this is Rohit at his best. 200th IPL six. Dances down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the delivery and once he does that the rest is easy, lofts through the line and clears long-on comfortably

Cummins to Saurabh Tiwary, SIX, 10 off the first two. This is a fabulous shot. Length ball around off-stump, Tiwary clears his front leg and then brings his bat down in a straight arc, sending the ball sailing over long-on

Cummins to Hardik Pandya, SIX, ufff! Pandya was lining up for the back of a length/ short of length delivery, he moves across and nails the pull flat over deep mid-wicket, the ball goes on to strike one of the ad boardings in the stand. Another costly over from Cummins, 19 runs off it and he still has an over

Cummins to Rohit, SIX, the Hitman has arrived. Not for the first time has Cummins been at the receiving end of such brilliance by Rohit. Remember that six over extra cover Down Under? Hangs back in his crease, stands tall and thwacks the short ball over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Cummins to Rohit, SIX, did someone say the boundaries are bigger? Not for this guy. Cummins feeds him another back of a length delivery and the Mumbai skipper has smoked it over deep mid-wicket for six more

Russell to Rohit, SIX, into the stands! Clearly the biggest one of the evening. Typical Rohit who nails his pull shot again. Back in his crease as he picks the length early and deposits it over deep square leg for many-a-mile

Kuldeep Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, what a shot! Suryakumar Yadav puts on his dancing shoes, reads the googly, gets to the pitch of the delivery and lofts it over deep extra cover for a perfectly timed six. Run fest at the moment! And that has forced Karthik to have a word with his bowler

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, woah! That's smashed. Steyn became predictable there. Slower ball back of a length and Rahul was waiting for this, gets into position quickly and nails the pull flat over deep mid-wicket

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, AB tries his best to pull off another one of his Superman catches. But is not able to. Slower delivery on the stumps, Rahul picks it away over backward square and he gets the elevation to beat a leaping AB. The South African tried to parry it in but he was not able to

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, oh my! That's disappeared into the top tier. Steyn is just too predictable with his slower deliveries, it is all back of a length stuff, Rahul waits and swings his bat at the right time, pumps it flat and all the way over deep mid-wicket

Steyn to Rahul, SIX, he is putting on a show now. Not leaving any delivery that is in his arc. This was full and outside off, Rahul stays leg-side to give the room to open his arms, opens the bat face and slices it over point. Another biggie..

Shivam Dube to Rahul, SIX, Rahul brings up the 200 in style. Dube misses his yorker by a long distance, this was right in the swinging arc, Rahul clears his front leg and pumps it into the first tier near long-on

Shivam Dube to Rahul, SIX, Rahul finishes it in style. This is the highest ever score by a captain in IPL. He walks off to a standing ovation. We have been witness to a great innings from the Kings XI skipper. Slower delivery that is back of a length, Rahul waits for it and flat-bats it straight down the ground. When he's striking them so well there are no grounds big enough
U Yadav to Rahul, SIX, free-hit, a half-volley, Rahul gets under it, and slices this high and mighty over sweeper cover for six!

Neesham to Shivam Dube, SIX, wow! What a shot! A great chance for Dube to knock a few in the middle and prepare for the remaining games. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Dube pulls over mid-wicket and clears quite comfortably

Ravi Bishnoi to Washington Sundar, SIX, this bloke is a good batsman. Smoked quite a few in the TNPL. Ravi Bishnoi floated the googly, but he's lunged forward to that and powered the ball over long-off

Cottrell to de Villiers, SIX, length delivery, off-pace as well, de Villiers has his weight on the back leg but still manages to slam it over long-off for a sixer. Was sweetly hit. de Villiers has to fire tonight for RCB

Avesh Khan to Watson, SIX, Avesh is the weak link among DD's pacers and Watson knows it. A free-flowing swing of the bat, nailing it off the middle and launches it into the long-on stands. Can't bowl this length Avesh..
Jadeja to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, thumped over long-off. Not quite to the pitch of it, and he's against the spin, but there's enough in those arms to tonk over
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, here's the shackle-breaker. Dhawan finally middles, finally shows intent, sitting under this length and using the in-spin to slog it over deep square leg

Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, SIX, clubbed, Gill charges down the track to a good length delivery, didn't look like he got to the pitch of it, still went through with the bludgeon and gets enough to send it over the ropes at long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Morgan, SIX, fuller delivery angled across, Morgan lofts it huge over deep cover for a sixer! Lovely hit. The freedom was there for the southpaw and he just opened his arms
Abhishek Sharma to Shubman Gill, SIX, chips down the track and lofts it huge down the ground! Superb hit from Shubman Gill as he wants to have an early finish
