T Natarajan to Morgan, SIX, short ball outside off and has been pulled away handsomely over deep mid for a sixer! Got under it and slammed it. Only 2 needed now. Morgan unleashed that big shot as he saw it too short

Chakravarthy to W Saha, SIX, Saha had to up the ante! Shimmies down the track, crouches low and swings his bat hard to flog it over mid-wicket. There was a man in the deep, but the keeper-batsman got enough wood on it to clear the fielder. Nevertheless, an excellent spell from Chakravarthy comes to an end -- 4-0-25-1

Narine to Warner, SIX, up, up and over long-on. Warner has seen enough and it's time to get into business. Slightly bends forward, reaches out with his long levers as he pummels it high and sends it over the ropes. There was a fielder waiting but it cleared him. First shot of real intent and it's a six

Shivam Mavi to Manish Pandey, SIX, that's Manish Pandey for you. Banged in short and Pandey smokes it over cow corner. A 81-metre hit. The ideal length for him and he tees off. He's away with a maximum and Warner liked it too
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, SIX, clean hitting from Pandey. Uses his feet, gets to the pitch and extends his bat swing in tonking it over long-on. Stunning timing on that

Udana to Rohit, SIX, that's one length you don't bowl to Rohit. He thrives with anything short, the round the wicket angle was also taking it down leg, Rohit swivels and helps along the way over fine leg. With the fielder inside the ring it was more comfortable to put it away

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, welcome back to the attack, Saini. Kishan lays into him, showing no respect to this full ball. Right in his arc and that's been slammed straight down the ground for a maximum

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, okay, Kishan has decided to change gears and he's targeting Saini. Again gets the length up, Kishan was waiting for this. Just gets under it and muscles it a mile over deep mid-wicket. Second six of the over, pressure on the bowler

Zampa to Ishan Kishan, SIX, fifty for Ishan Kishan. It's his comeback game, replaced Tiwary and he's making this opportunity count. Zampa gets it too full, Kishan gets underneath it and smokes it a long way over cow corner. Brings up the milestone in some style

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Mumbai need more of this. A dragged-down delivery from Chahal, Kishan has all the time in the world to hang back and swipe it over deep backward square leg. Brute force from Kishan..

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, oh boyyyyy! Has Negi dropped the match here? What a big miss from him at deep extra cover. After taking so many catches, he lets one burst through his hands. Flighted just outside off, Pollard mistimes it as it comes off the toe-end. Skies in the air near the fence, Negi was in good position but it slips through and sails over the rope. You can't give a lifeline to someone like Pollard, he will make you pay..
Zampa to Pollard, SIX, and he does. Rightaway! A rank long hop, Pollard sits back and clobbers it a countrymile over cow corner

Zampa to Pollard, SIX, told ya! Pollard is making that drop count. Yet another maximum.. Tosses up by Zampa, Pollard didn't get it off the middle but still has imparts enough power on it to smash it over long-on

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, naahhh! Pollard ain't showing any mercy. Tonks it over long-off. Served it up slower and wider of off, Pollard's long levers coming to the fore.. sends it into the empty stands

Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Kishan gets into the act now. Not so great bowling from Chahal. Where's the googly mate? Just tosses another leg-break, Kishan pivots back, reads it and slogs it over deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Pollard, SIX, 20-ball fifty for Pollard. What a player. What a knock this has been. MI back in the game. Another big over. Flatter leg-break from Chahal, Pollard skips back, makes room and murders it over long-off

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, my word! How did this fly over the ropes? A proper mis-hit from Kishan, directs it into the night sky and Virat at long-off was setting himself near the boundary, but it gains some distance and loops over his head. Crazy

Udana to Ishan Kishan, SIX, butter fingers everywhere for RCB. Gurkeerat at long-on messes it up. Kishan muscled it flat and straight to him, he got both hands but couldn't lock it in time. Terrible.. and morever, he tips it over the bar for SIX

Udana to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Ishan Kishan, you beauty.. connects and connects this one properly. Moves across his stumps and pummels it over long-on. Too predictable from Udana and Virat throws his head in anger. Rohit jumps from his chair. Oh! What's happening!

Navdeep Saini to Ishan Kishan, SIX, shot! That's a fine hit from Kishan. Short and at the body, Kishan swivels and pulls, he got it right off the meat as the ball sailed over the long leg fence. The ball is lost in the stands and the fourth umpire brings out a box of replacement balls..

Zampa to Hardik Pandya, SIX, that's a horrible delivery. Zampa overcooks the delivery and it ends up as a full toss, Pandya does not need a second invitation, deposits it to the biggest part of the ground - to deep mid-wicket. Even some of his team mates were impressed on the distance he got

Pattinson to Devdutt Padikkal, SIX, now that is some shot! Kohli hit a six over long-off in an international game and this is a little similar to that. Not easy to loft handsomely off the back foot and he did so without balance too. Great shot!

Pattinson to Devdutt Padikkal, SIX, now the full flowing bat down the ground to loft Pattinson into the sightscreen. Devdutt Padikkal, what a talent. Length delivery, in the slot, but Padikkal made it look so easy. Rohit not happy with the length or the idea from the bowler

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, okay! Never bowl within the bodyline to AB when he's looking for quick runs. The slower ball sat into the surfaces, de Villiers hangs back and pulls over mid-wicket. Didn't bother running

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, no Jas B! Unless you get that yorker right, it's difficult to control AB when you bowl into his body! This is another yorker missed, right in the slot and de Villiers, clearing the front leg out of the way, powers it handsomely over the bowler's head for a maximum

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, just 4 runs off the over till this ball, so it should have been a smart delivery, but Boult, having got away with a short slower ball first delivery, tries again, but AB will feed on those anything within his bodyline at the end overs. Pulls, really high and into the stands over long leg

Bumrah to de Villiers, SIX, how high was that hit? What a way to raise a fifty. Such a lovely player to watch at the death. Really interesting ploy from Bumrah to continue to bowl into AB's body than bowl outside off stump and make him to force pace. This is just a length delivery that's been absolutely muscled over deep square leg

Pattinson to Shivam Dube, SIX, wow! Really nice cameo this from Dube. Knew Pattinson is going to bowl full and wide of off stump, read the slower delivery, got down on one knee and powered this over cover

Pattinson to Shivam Dube, SIX, this is so stylish flicked! Stunning hit! Rohit folds hands and looks. Fullish and angled in, Dube just uses his hands on that to wrist it with a strong bottom hand grip, so easily clearing mid-wicket

Boult to Finch, SIX, lovely, superbly played by Finch, length delivery outside off, he reached forward, got close to the ball, a clean extension of his arms and he drop kicks it over the long-off fence

Pattinson to Shivam Dube, SIX, why? Just why? Coaches, experts plead not to bowl length at the death but Pattinson has bowled a slower ball halfway down the pitch. Dube stands tall and flat-bats it really straight. What a finish for RCB - 201

Abhishek Sharma to Pant, SIX, and there's the insult rubbed in .. Pant's not messing around, staying his ground and for a change not over-hitting as he manages a lovely bat flow in slogging it over cow corner
Abhishek Sharma to Pant, SIX, more insult -- off a slice this time, over long-off. Neat bat swing, and a flat tonk

Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, SIX, 137kph, feeds a full toss in the arc at full pace. Well, well, it can't get easier. Hetmyer finds his arc, swinging and heaving over cow corner. This should break shackles
Khaleel Ahmed to Hetmyer, SIX, picks the off-cutter for treatment here -- with Ahmed insisting on feeding it short, wide, and getting sliced uppishly over backward point

Khaleel Ahmed to Rabada, SIX .. and he'll finally get his cover-chip-drive right, getting under this length and tonking it over long-off rather comfortably. Clearly SRH couldn't care less, in fact Warner's even celebrating while the ball's in trajectory

Nortje to Abdul Samad, SIX, he's got hold of this one! Wow! First signs of Samad's abilities. In the slot alright and he's pumped this high over wide long-on. Brute force and to do it against a bowler of Nortje's pace shows that the bloke has the talent for sure

Nortje to Warner, SIX, cracking shot, Warner breaks the shackles at last - change of pace on this cutter from Nortje, but the length was wide of off - Warner bends down on his knees and pumps the drive over cover - went a long way over the ropes for a maximum
Mishra to Bairstow, SIX, clubbed, nicely tossed up outside off, Bairstow gets down on his knees, picks the length early and plays the slog sweep over mid-wicket - hard, flat and over the ropes

Ishant to Warner, SIX, lovely, the slower ball from Ishant, but it's too full and right under Warner's arc - he clears his left leg and drills it back over the umpire's head, has enough power to sail over the ropes for a maximum

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, SIX, has that gone the distance? Yeah, of course, it has! Right into the slot around off, slightly up, Shubman Gill shuffles a touch in the crease, gets underneath the length and clubs it over long-on for the first big one of this evening in Dubai

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, there he goes! First of the night for Dre Russ. Googly and Russell was waiting for it, it landed right in his arc and he went down on his knee to bludgeon it over cow corner

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, number 2! Gopal is erring in line and Russell is not one to miss out. This one drifts in on leg-stump, Russell clears his front leg and muscles it flat over deep mid-wicket. The fielder was left as a spectator
Rajpoot to Russell, SIX, this is a buffet delivery for Russell. He is just waiting for that length - back of a length, he waits for the ball to arrive and pumps it flat over deep mid-wicket. Six #3!

Jofra Archer to Morgan, SIX, oh no! Curran has palmed it over the rope. Short and angled across the left hander, Morgan uses the space on offer to play the upper cut to deep backward point, Curran runs across and he is thinking of parrying the ball in even before catching it, in the end he allows it to slip past his grasp

Tom Curran to Morgan, SIX, and he's got the distance. It was in the air for a long time but he had made enough connection to beat deep mid-wicket. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely, Morgan shuffles across and heaves it with a clean bat swing

Unadkat to Narine, SIX, that shall give him some confidence. Or rather, a lot of it. He's a confidence player. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Riyan Parag to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana welcomes Riyan Parag with a maximum. A loopy delivery around off and the shouthpaw has lofted it over wide long-off with impeccable timing, looked a six the moment he connnected that

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, SIX, has that gone the distance? Yeah, of course, it has! Right into the slot around off, slightly up, Shubman Gill shuffles a touch in the crease, gets underneath the length and clubs it over long-on for the first big one of this evening in Dubai

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, there he goes! First of the night for Dre Russ. Googly and Russell was waiting for it, it landed right in his arc and he went down on his knee to bludgeon it over cow corner

Shreyas Gopal to Russell, SIX, number 2! Gopal is erring in line and Russell is not one to miss out. This one drifts in on leg-stump, Russell clears his front leg and muscles it flat over deep mid-wicket. The fielder was left as a spectator
Rajpoot to Russell, SIX, this is a buffet delivery for Russell. He is just waiting for that length - back of a length, he waits for the ball to arrive and pumps it flat over deep mid-wicket. Six #3!

Jofra Archer to Morgan, SIX, oh no! Curran has palmed it over the rope. Short and angled across the left hander, Morgan uses the space on offer to play the upper cut to deep backward point, Curran runs across and he is thinking of parrying the ball in even before catching it, in the end he allows it to slip past his grasp

Tom Curran to Morgan, SIX, and he's got the distance. It was in the air for a long time but he had made enough connection to beat deep mid-wicket. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely, Morgan shuffles across and heaves it with a clean bat swing

Unadkat to Narine, SIX, that shall give him some confidence. Or rather, a lot of it. He's a confidence player. Picks the bones out of this slower delivery and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen

Riyan Parag to Nitish Rana, SIX, Rana welcomes Riyan Parag with a maximum. A loopy delivery around off and the shouthpaw has lofted it over wide long-off with impeccable timing, looked a six the moment he connnected that
Rahul Chahar to Pooran, SIX, Nic Pooran in the house folks! Back in his crease as he tonks the short ball over long-on for a huge six
Boult to Gowtham, SIX, in the airrr and just over Pollard at long-off. Boult went full and outside off stump, Gowtham toe-ended the loft, Pollard jumped on the boundary but it evaded him
Krunal Pandya to Pooran, SIX, this is why Krunal was afraid to get anything close to him. The slog-sweep has gone miles. Pooran shuffles across, fetches it from a length outside off and finishes it

Ravi Bishnoi to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's into the stands! A loopy delivery around middle, Ishan Kishan shuffles across, goes down on his knee and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. 84 metre maximum that!
Ravi Bishnoi to Pollard, SIX, how easy was that for him? Stands tall and nonchalantly lofts the tossed up googly over long-on for half-a-dozen. Pressure on the young wrist spinner

Ravi Bishnoi to Rohit, SIX, got out to a half-tracker in the previous game, but not this time. Rocks back and manages to beat the fielder at deep mid-wicket by quite some distance. Wasn't in complete control of this pull, but the timing was good enough to go the distance, and it was also the shorter boundary that he targeted

Neesham to Rohit, SIX, yeah, that's what I was talking about! So pleasing to the eyes. Short ball around middle and leg, "Rohit has more than a second to spot the length," as Kohli says. Doesn't even need to transfer his weight as he pulls it over deep square leg. 86 metres!
Neesham to Rohit, SIX, such a talent! Goes inside out, plays with the field and lofts the pitched up delivery over deep extra cover. Raining sixes in Abu Dhabi!

Neesham to Hardik Pandya, SIX, stand and deliver! Short of a length delivery around off, Hardik Pandya reads the length early and lofts it over the leaping Maxwell at long-on. He can attack right from the word 'go', hence he's so crucial towards these later stages

Gowtham to Hardik Pandya, SIX, the last ball he smacked back to the bowler, but this one he has smacked out of the park. Right into the slot around middle as Hardik Pandya smokes it over deep mid-wicket. High and handsome!
Gowtham to Pollard, SIX, the carnage continues! Pitched up by Gowtham, and although it was wide - Pollard manages to reach for it as he tonks it right over the bowler's head, and into the sightscreen
Gowtham to Pollard, SIX, 97 metre six! A floated delivery around middle and leg, Pollard gets under it and clubs it over deep mid-wicket for six more
Gowtham to Pollard, SIX, vintage Pollard finishes off the innings in style. A hat-trick of sixes for the big man as he bludgeons this one over the bowler's head. Mumbai end with 191/4

Abdul Samad to Jadeja, SIX, here we go! Jadeja is down the wicket as he tonks the tossed up delivery over long-on for a 84 metre six. There was a fielder sprinting across in the deep, but this cleared him comfortably..
T Natarajan to Jadeja, SIX, fifty for Jadeja! Please move him up the order. A full toss on leg and the southpaw heaves it over deep square leg as he brings out a rather tired sword celebration

T Natarajan to Sam Curran, SIX, that's the first ball Sam Curran's facing and he has struck the biggest six of the night. A short ball by Natarajan and Sam Curran pulls it over deep square leg as it goes deep into the stands. WoW!
Khaleel Ahmed to Dhoni, SIX, so the break has helped. It has helped him regain his focus. Picks the bones out of this slower short ball and thumps it over deep mid-wicket for a flat six

Abdul Samad to Sam Curran, SIX, the last ball of the match has gone the distance! But, Chennai Super Kings face their third straight loss after winning the tournament opener. Gets to the pitch of the delivery does Sam Curran and thumps it right over the bowler's head for half-a-dozen!
Jadeja to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, lovely, RJ doesn't learn, tosses one just outside off, Abhishek gets across, plays with the angle and swings it high and over mid-wicket for a maximum

Sam Curran to Priyam Garg, SIX, this is batting of the highest quality from young Garg - full and coming back into the right-hander, from that round the wicket angle - he bends low, picks the length early and slaps it over square leg for a maximum

Unadkat to Devdutt Padikkal, SIX, where has this gone? Monster hit from Padikkal. Remember him playing a similar kind of shot in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, he's so good with the flicks and glances. Unadkat bowls the inswinger onto his pads, Padikkal says thanks and decimates it a long way into the grass banks at deep square leg

Riyan Parag to Kohli, SIX, even better! Parag bowls a full one, right in the slot. Kohli makes room by moving leg-side and lofts it handsomely over deep extra cover. Superb inside-out from the skipper. This is the Kohli we know....

Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, SIX, shot! Kohli is definitely finding his touch! Dances down the track to this flighted delivery, gets to the pitch of the ball and tonks it powerfully over long-on. Moves to 49!
Chahal to Lomror, SIX, this one's got the height.. and the distance! Enormous! Lomror gets to the pitch of the ball and smokes it over long-on for a massive six. Was in the air for an eternity

Chahal to Lomror, SIX, this is proving to be an enterprising knock by Lomror! Chahal at its receiving end once again, as the southpaw goes down on his knee and swings it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen
Navdeep Saini to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, that's the confidence he's carrying! On the pads and Rahul Tewatia helps it over the deep square leg fence. How nonchalant did he make that swipe look like?
Udana to Jofra Archer, SIX, that's Archer-ed! A slower delivery by Udana, on the shorter side and Jofra bludgeons his pull over deep mid-wicket for a flat six. All about power!

Navdeep Saini to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, and the free-hit is out of the park! The reply couldn't have been a better one. Length delivery by Navdeep Saini and Rahul Tewatia swings it over deep square leg for a monster hit. Once again, RCB are proving to be expensive in their death overs

Navdeep Saini to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, dealing in sixes is Tewatia. Rahul - it's in the name! A full toss around off, Rahul Tewatia shuffles across and swipes it towards deep square leg as he manages to beat the fielder's leap near the boundary

Udana to Buttler, SIX, that's a Buttler special! Wow! Slower ball, on a shorter length and not many can generate such power by standing in the crease. Waited that bit longer and unleashed his short-arm jab. Minimum fuss, maximum result

Zampa to Lomror, SIX, huge blow! This boy is known to hit the ball long and hard, and this is a sample of that. Slot ball from Zampa, leg break and Lomror gets down on his knee to slog sweep this over deep mid-wicket. Clean strike and a much-needed blow for RR

K Nagarkoti to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, fifty for Shaw. Second of the season for him. He shakes hands with his skipper at the other end and then raises his bat to the dugout. Slower that is dragged back, Shaw backed away and though he had to reach for the flat-batted hit, he manages to clear the long-on boundary

K Nagarkoti to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, second six of the over. He bowled a similar delivery to Iyer early in the over and got away with it but not this time, the flick is uppish and the ball sails over the backward square leg fence

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh my! This would have been a six in any ground. Googly around off-stump, Iyer keeps his head down and then has a clean bat swing to send it soaring into the roads over long-on

K Nagarkoti to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, small margins for error. Nagarkoti fails to nail the yorker, it is a juicy knee high full toss and though Shaw does not middle his pick up shot, half a decent connection on this ground is enough to take it all the way. Mavi could only watch it go over him near deep mid-wicket

Cummins to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, these small boundaries, I tell you. This was a miscue, right off the cue-end but the ball just clears the rope. A low full toss and Iyer didn't get it off the meat, but enough to clear cow corner

Russell to Pant, SIX, that's outta here. Length delivery at this venue goes only one way - onto the roads. This was right in the swinging arc for Pant and he doesn't miss out, deposits it over deep mid-wicket
Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, 12 off 3 balls. This delivery had width on it and Iyer picks his spot - deep extra cover, extends his arms and launches it with a clean bat swing over the rope

Chakravarthy to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, 20 off the over. So the move didn't work. This flighted delivery lands right in the arc, Iyer clears his front leg to get a golf-like swing and he smashes it over deep mid-wicket. Can he get a hundred?

Russell to Hetmyer, SIX, high and long. Right into the KKR dugout. Russell misses the yorker and it is a full delivery, Hetmyer doesn't get hold of the loft but you don't need much to clear the fences here
Cummins to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, now this has been crunched. Short of length into the body, 147kph, Shaw treats it with contempt as he pulls over midwicket. Skimmer!
Narine to Dhawan, SIX, collects a six as he gently sweeps over square leg. Nicely on a length from Narine, Dhawan meets it with good timing
Narine to Dhawan, SIX, six more with the sweep. Went a touch harder there, but once again the length is perfect for the shot. It goes further. Goes over the roof
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, makes room to a length ball and slaps this over extra cover. Oh the wonders of batting in Sharjah, hitting through the line like this
Narine to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, Iyer's been made to fetch this from outside off. He does so and swipes over midwicket. Just clears the boundary with this 75-metre hit
Harshal Patel to Nitish Rana, SIX, more in the slot, more of the obvious slower ones. Rana can line it up, swing, and hoick downtown
Nortje to Morgan, SIX, brutal, murderous. And it's the first ball that he's faced -- swivelling, pulling, tonking flat over deep square leg
Rabada to Morgan, SIX, slogged, and bursting straight through a jumping Rahane at deep mid-wicket -- for Morgan's 301st T20 six. Anyway, it's helped the equation come under three runs per ball
Stoinis to R Tripathi, SIX, 116.1kph, bang in the slot, bang-er in the arc, and BANG. Tripathi's already one-kneed, smoking this over cow corner's roof
Stoinis to R Tripathi, SIX, slow full toss .. Tripathi's once again gone one-kneed and is slogging this flatter, cow corner

Stoinis to R Tripathi, SIX, certified opener to certified finisher -- Rahul Tripathi's making the Cummins promotion look really silly. Another wide full toss and his one'kneed adventures get it sliced over extra cover
Rabada to Morgan, SIX, 139kph, bouncer, nah, never mind. Morgan stands with an opened up stance, whacks a pull, and gets it high, almighty outside the stadium, via fine leg
Rabada to Morgan, SIX, more fun. MORE FUN. A 121kph slower cutter on a length. It's a sin, it's a cardinal sin. Morgan stands like he does, crouched, under it, and slogs over deep square leg

Rabada to Morgan, SIX, Morgan's half a Yuvraj, 3/5th a Tewatia. Another full toss, and Morgan - as if for fun - just swipes and smashes a hoarding on the square leg boundarys roof. Right, just to make sense: with an asking rate of 18-an-over, Morgan's done it n half the time

Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, Nitish Rana greets Ashwin with a maximum! That's gone outta here. Flat, non-turner on a length, Rana gets down on one knee and nails the slog sweep to send it over deep square leg. New ball please!
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, SIX, 15 runs off the over! In-drifter, but the length is tad too full. Ends up bowling it in the slot, Rana gets under it and swings his willow hard to dispatch it over long-on

Nortje to Shubman Gill, SIX, that's a nice shot! Banged in short, head-high bumper at 140.4kph, Gill picks the length early, stands tall and pulls it away with aplomb over deep square leg for a 68m six!

Mishra to Nitish Rana, SIX, and, Nitish Rana takes full toll of the free-hit. Mishra overpitches one, it's right in Rana's arc. The left-hander clears his front leg, bends his back leg and bludgeons it straight down the ground for a 81m six!

Rabada to Russell, SIX, smacked! Rabada misses his yorker by a couple of inches - ends up bowling a half-volley. Russell moves leg-side, clears his left leg and hoists it over the bowler's head. Bent his back leg and muscled it!

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, SIX, there's the first six of the game. Didn't take long. You cannot bowl short to Rohit not on this ground, not on any ground, easy pickings as he nonchalantly pulls it over deep mid-wicket

Williamson to de Kock, SIX, lovely, excellent use of the feet from de Kock, comes down the pitch, gets close to the ball and then launches it back over the bowler's head, brings up his first fifty of the season

Williamson to Ishan Kishan, SIX, one over too many for KW - Warner had to complete the fourth over from his fifth bowler- but this is going the distance. Tad too full and well outside off, Kishan reaches out and slugs it high and wide of long-on for a maximum

S Kaul to de Kock, SIX, nicely played, de Kock is looking in top form now, length ball on off, he gets under this one and clubs the on-drive over mid-wicket - went flat and wide of Manish at long-on, over the ropes for a maximum

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, SIX, Kishan is in some form - he will have to take over the role of the aggressor now, full and just outside off, he bends down low and pumps the slog-sweep over mid-wicket for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Hardik Pandya, SIX, fingertips and Warner has parried one over the ropes. Will it prove costly for SRH? Was a brilliant effort, he was on the move, leapt as high as he could, but managed to only parry it over the ropes - length ball outside off and Hardik pumped it high and over long-on
T Natarajan to Hardik Pandya, SIX, clubbed, fraction too short from Natarajan, angling across the right-hander, Pandya stays back and pummels the pull over mid-wicket for a maximum

Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, SIX, even mishits can fly on this ground - Sandeep misses his yorker, offers a full-toss on the pads, Pollard didn't get hold of the shovel, but the short boundaries takes care as the ball sails over the ropes. 100th six in Sharjah this IPL

Sandeep Sharma to Pollard, SIX, just over Rashid at backward square leg, low full-toss on the pads and Pollard whipped it over backward square leg - Rashid got across and was trying to drag the ball back into play with his right hand, can't do so though

T Natarajan to Pollard, SIX, thumped, low full-toss wide of off, Pollard reached out and got it pretty low off the bat - but the short boundaries meant that the fielder in the deep at long-off could only watch it sail over his head
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, SIX, smashed, change of pace and Krunal spotted it early, threw everything he had on the slog, gets enough to clear the fielder at long-on by a distance

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, SIX, a four-ball unbeaten 20 for Krunal and he has lifted MI to 208, length ball at the stumps - Krunal gets under it and sends it high and over long-on. Warner can only watch it sail into the stands. Krunal is absolutely thrilled as he walks back

Abdul Samad to de Kock, SIX, oh no! Pandey has parried it over the rope. Is this the luck de Kock needed to get going? This was not all that short and hence de Kock could not get the elevation on the pull, hit it flat towards long-on where Pandey moves to his left and allows the ball to burst through his fingers. Tough chance but you expect it to be taken

Abdul Samad to de Kock, SIX, this was right in the slot and de Kock ensures it is dispatched. Flighted outside off, de Kock had the width to free his arms and he smacks it straight down the ground, clearing the sightscreen comfortably

Boult to Bairstow, SIX, what a way to get off the mark! Wide half-volley and at Sharjah of all places, that's gotta go. Bairstow reaches out and lofts it cleanly over long-off. It's gone for a mammoth six

Krunal Pandya to Warner, SIX, round-arm ball from round the wicket, a length ball outside off at 93.5kph, Warner swings his bat hard and deposits it over long-on. Got it off the bottom of bat, but all those won't matter at this ground

Bumrah to Abdul Samad, SIX, this lad is known to hit massive sixes. 143.2kph, Bumrah misses the yorker, Samad stays deep in his crease, gets under it and bludgeons it over the bowler's head. The sightscreen has to bear the brunt..
Bumrah to Abdul Samad, SIX, 128.8kph, slower ball on a shortish length, sits up nicely. Samad walks across, waits for the ball and pummels it over deep backward square leg with a pull shot
Krunal Pandya to Bairstow, SIX, the first bad ball of the over and Bairstow says 'Thank you very much!'! Dropped short by Krunal and it's launched over deep mid-wicket. Easy peasy for JB

Rahul Chahar to Manish Pandey, SIX, didn't I tell ya? Pandey loves to murder spin, especially when it's tossed up fuller and at this ground, hitting that for six is just a formality. Clobbered over cow corner. Easy as you like

Rahul Chahar to Warner, SIX, that's on the roof! Chahar isn't learning, errs on the fuller side again and it's slower too. Warner mows it over long-on for a huge hit. SRH sensing that this is the time to go big
Cottrell to Watson, SIX, Watson's found his range tonight. Clears the front leg to a length ball and clubs it down the ground. Clean hitting
Harpreet Brar to Watson, SIX, Harpreet is almost forced to bowl it closer after the call, gets into Watson's arc and gets nailed over long-on
Shami to du Plessis, SIX, what a ridiculous shot. Slices it one-handed over cover for six. Was a near yorker from Shami and gets creamed by du Plessis
Ravi Bishnoi to Watson, SIX, Watson has destroyed this googly. He has absolutely destroyed it. Slog-swept into the top tier. That's soul-crushing

Chawla to Mandeep, SIX, shot! Mandeep goes down on his knee and smokes the tossed up delivery over deep mid-wicket with a meaty slog. Such. Sweet. Timing! Maxwell does some bhangra in the dug-out to acknowledge the batsman
Chawla to Mandeep, SIX, Mandeep is dealing in sixes! A short ball by Chawla, Mandeep rocks back in the crease and pulls it over deep mid-wicket for six more. Just the momentum they were looking for!
Jadeja to Pooran, SIX, another shuffle, and Jadeja fires it in quicker and into the body. Pooran pulls, no, wait, tonks, over an empty backward square leg

SN Thakur to Rahul, SIX, finally. FINALLY. Rahul goes uppish, shows intent, getting under Thakur's juicy length delivery to smoke it over long-off. Also, a fifty, and no one's keeping count anymore, there's no point
Sam Curran to Pooran, SIX, 134.3kph, absolutely holds onto this heave. He's already standing with an open stance, swinging across the line, and then boom. Onto cow corner's second tier
Dwayne Bravo to Pooran, SIX, high full toss, and whacked with disdain. Pooran doesn't even bother looking up after flat-batting this into cow corner
Moeen Ali to Stoinis, SIX, Stoinis does clear the boundary rope at deep mid-wicket. This a half tracker and those bulging forearms come into play, he muscles it way over the fence

Navdeep Saini to Stoinis, SIX, woah! That's some shot from Stoinis. Back of a length delivery and he was so quick to pick that, transferred his weight back and bullied it for a flat six over cow corner

Navdeep Saini to Pant, SIX, Pant gets into the act now. Saini is being taken to the cleaners. Slower delivery and Pant spotted it early, lined himself for the big hit and smacked it straight back over the bowler, just clearing the rope

Siraj to Pant, no ball, SIX, oh my! Now Siraj does a Saini. High full toss that almost took out Pant's head, the keeper-batsman does well to duck and swing across the line, the top-edge sails over the fine leg fence
Udana to Hetmyer, SIX, Udana misses the yorker but Hetmyer doesn't miss. It was a full toss and Hetmyer uses his power to muscle it over deep mid-wicket, cleared the fence quite comfortably there

Navdeep Saini to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, that's an incredible shot from Prithvi Shaw! Fullish ball outside off at 143.6kph, Shaw bends his back leg and lofts it handsomely over extra cover. Came off the meat of the bat and went all the way. Mind you, it was the longer side too

Chahal to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, now a biggie! Chahal is brave to toss this one up, bowls it full and outside off. Shaw gets down on one leg and bludgeons it over wide long-on for a mighty six. New ball, please!
Harshal Patel to Kohli, SIX, steps down, makes room for himself, gets it perfectly in the slot, and tonks this into long-on's first floor
Ashwin to Shivam Dube, SIX, gets hold of this .. under the length to a fuller-than-usual delivery to smoke it over long-on against the spin

Rahul Tewatia to Krunal Pandya, SIX, pressure releaser for Krunal. He was not getting anything off the middle till now. Tewatia floats one up and Krunal takes it on, slog sweeps straight down the ground and collects half a dozen

Tom Curran to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, superb batting. Suryakumar shuffles across, goes down on his knee and waits for the low full toss, then nonchalantly helps it over backward square. The connection was so good that the ball sailed over

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, wow! That's special. We have seen this before but to do it to Archer after being hit on the head. Hats off! Full delivery just short of yorker length, Suryakumar crouches down and reverse laps it straight over Buttler, the pace of Archer ensures it goes the distance. Even Smith was impressed with that shot

Rajpoot to Hardik Pandya, SIX, once more not off the meat but the power of Hardik ensures it goes sailing over the rope. It was a freebie from Rajpoot, juicy full toss and Hardik goes straight, clearing the boundary quite comfortably

Rajpoot to Rohit, SIX, beautifully played, tad too full and wide from Rajpoot, Rohit leans forward, gets close to the ball, extends his arms and launches it over mid-off went sailing over the ropes for a maximum
Jofra Archer to de Kock, SIX, massive, fraction short and de Kock is quick on the pull - rocks back and pulls it high and over backward square leg, went sailing over the ropes

Kartik Tyagi to Rohit, SIX, a high full-toss and Rohit has sent is sailing into the stands - prods across and then brings his wrists into play, came at an uncomfortable height, but he was equal to the task, pulled over backward square leg for a maximum
Shreyas Gopal to Rohit, SIX, cracking shot, too short from Shreyas, Rohit stays on the front-foot and then pummels the pull over mid-wicket, went a long way over the ropes for a maximum
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, slips out of his hand into the half-tracker mark, Buttler rocks back and launches that over long-on for a gigantic 82-meter six!
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, he's backed away to a flat one that's intended to cramp him, and mowed it over deep mid-wicket for six!
Pollard to Buttler, SIX, for the faintest moment, all was gone for RR. He backed away to the on-side, waited for the pace-off delivery to reach, and bottom-handed the swat late over long-on for six!

Boult to Jofra Archer, SIX, short ball at the off-stump, Jofra Archer has a free swing across the line between mid-wicket and long-on and gets it over the fielder for six! Terrific shot, and they'll need a lot more of those!
Rahul Chahar to Buttler, SIX, half-tracker at the stumps, swatted into the grass banks behind midwicket

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, drops it so short that it was on its way down when reaching Buttler. And he does so well to generate power, which isn't always the easiest thing with such deliveries. Slaps it over the extra cover boundary

Chahar to Tripathi, SIX, this is poor execution from Deepak Chahar! He serves another leg-stump dross and it's been picked up neatly from the in-form Tripathi who smokes it on one knee and sees the ball sailing over the fine leg fence

SN Thakur to Cummins, SIX, another one to feast on for Cummins and he doesn't miss out. Short and angled into the batsman, Cummins loads up on the back foot and smites it many-a-mile flat over the cow corner fence
Chahar to R Tripathi, SIX, the knuckle ball in the slot .. and Tripathi has a full-blow at this, slicing his loft, with more height than distance, but is still over deep extra cover
Karn Sharma to R Tripathi, SIX, slogged. One-kneed, murderous bat-swing, and despite Curran's full-leap at long-on, it just goes over. Alas, not everyone has a Polllard ..
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, SIX, 99.9kph. Wide floaty, loopy off-break. Narine lays in, this is bang in his zone, and slices this typically over deep extra cover

Chahar to Tripathi, SIX, this is poor execution from Deepak Chahar! He serves another leg-stump dross and it's been picked up neatly from the in-form Tripathi who smokes it on one knee and sees the ball sailing over the fine leg fence

SN Thakur to Cummins, SIX, another one to feast on for Cummins and he doesn't miss out. Short and angled into the batsman, Cummins loads up on the back foot and smites it many-a-mile flat over the cow corner fence
Chahar to R Tripathi, SIX, the knuckle ball in the slot .. and Tripathi has a full-blow at this, slicing his loft, with more height than distance, but is still over deep extra cover
Karn Sharma to R Tripathi, SIX, slogged. One-kneed, murderous bat-swing, and despite Curran's full-leap at long-on, it just goes over. Alas, not everyone has a Polllard ..
Dwayne Bravo to Narine, SIX, 99.9kph. Wide floaty, loopy off-break. Narine lays in, this is bang in his zone, and slices this typically over deep extra cover
T Natarajan to Pooran, SIX, lovely shot by Pooran! Length delivery on leg and Pooran has played a superb pick up shot to clear the fence at deep square leg
Abhishek Sharma to Pooran, SIX, stand and deliver! A tossed up delivery on middle and off, Pooran gets it right into the slot and thumps it over long-on for a huge six
Abhishek Sharma to Pooran, SIX, two in two! Overpitched delivery by Abhishek Sharma and it has been pumped over long-on by Pooran once again. The young spinner put under pressure by Nicky P
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, he means business today! Showing no mercy on the young bowlers. Loopy delivery on off, touch fuller and it has been smoked over long-off for half-a-dozen
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, woah! One of biggest of the night. Gets to the pitch of the ball and clubs it over wide long-on for six more. Carnage!
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, fastest fifty of IPL 2020! A loopy delivery around off and the southpaw has tonked it over long-off for his sixth biggie of the night
Abdul Samad to Pooran, SIX, unstoppable! Slightly short ball on middle and leg, Pooran hacks it over deep mid-wicket for six more. Unbelievable hitting this!

Maxwell to Bairstow, SIX, wow! This is carnage of the highest level. Maxwell shouted "catch it" but there's no crowd allowed. This was a fraction short and Bairstow was quick to pick the length, rocked back and hammered the pull into the deep mid-wicket's second tier

Maxwell to Bairstow, SIX, and another.. This just keeps getting bad for Kings XI. Maxwell lands this right in the arc, Bairstow with this kind of hitting form is not going to miss out, he clears his front leg and goes straight, clearing the sightscreen comfortably

Mujeeb to Bairstow, SIX, Bairstow is just toying with the bowling now. Bowlers are not sure where to bowl to him. Mujeeb goes wide outside off, Bairstow uses the long lever to thump it straight down the ground, all the way

Mujeeb to Bairstow, SIX, back to back sixes. The length was pulled back and Bairstow was waiting on the backfoot, pulls it in front of square and wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket. He is closing in on his hundred..

Arshdeep Singh to Abhishek Sharma, SIX, wow! That's some shot. Just a chip from Sharma and the ball has cleared the rope. It was the slower delivery and Sharma was deceived for a moment there, checks his loft and manages to time it beautifully, goes all the way straight down the ground

Shami to Williamson, SIX, woah! A one-handed six. The knuckle ball outside off, Williamson was completely deceived for pace as he looked to loft it straight down, the bottom hand comes off but the ball ends up over the rope

Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, SIX, kaboom! Bairstow finally times his charge down the track well, gets to the pitch of this and lofts dead straight down the ground. Long-on can't do much as it's well wider and flatter

Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, SIX, 18 off the over! Bairstow is shifting gears and has found momentum on his side. Expects the lad to go short and he is sitting deep for that already, clobbers the pull over deep square leg

Mujeeb to Warner, SIX, someone shouted 'catch it!' from the KXIP team, maybe he was referring to whoever was there behind the sightscreen because this was always going to be a six. Mujeeb overcooks and it's slower too, Warner reaches it and goes through the line with a clean loft
Tye to Hetmyer, SIX, hit-myer! Tye goes short, but this one isn't going to trouble the batsman. Hetmyer is quick to rock back as he pulls it over deep backward square leg for six runs

Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX, too predictable. Kartik Tyagi sticks to his length that is on the shorter side. But the line is even worse as Hetmyer picks it up with ease and clears fine leg for half a dozen

Tye to Hetmyer, SIX, this one has gone the distance! Goes full after bowling a short one, and the batsman reads him to perfection. Down on his knee as Hetmyer lofts it over deep extra cover for a maxmium
Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX, exactly! This is what that overthrow has resulted in. A full toss on off and Hetmyer slams it over long-off as he manages to clear the man at long-off
Kartik Tyagi to Hetmyer, SIX, cruel game this! Kartik Tyagi bowls this one right into the slot on off and Hetmyer goes down on his knee and smokes it over deep mid-wicket for six more
Tye to Axar, SIX, all smiles in the Delhi camp as the free-hit goes the distance. Touch full on off and it has been tonked right over the bowler's head by Axar
Aaron to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, stand and deliver stuff! Prithvi Shaw waits for length and smokes it flat and straight back over the bowler's head with an air of arrogance
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, short and sits up at perfect height for Stoinis who powers the pull flat and hard over mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, make that two in a row! Another short one and this one drifts into Stoinis' pads to launch another maximum into the mid-wicket stands
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, Stoinis is making six-hitting look incredibly easy. Loopy delivery and he unleashes those muscular arms to club it flat over the extra cover fence
Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, SIX, that run out doesn't have any impact on Stoinis. Gets a juicy toss up in the zone and he hammers Rahul Tewatia clean and straight down the ground

Stoinis to Jaiswal, SIX, okay, he's catching up. Stoinis' no Nortje, and these 130ks are dibbly-dobblers for Jaiswal, who's clearing out his front leg and heaving it into those conical sheds at cow corner
Stoinis to Tye, SIX, full pace feeding the slot -- and Tye's camping on the back foot for this precisely, with lovely high elbows on the bat swing to smoke it downtown
Nortje to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, just gets hold. Takes the slog off the front foot, with more height than he'd have liked, but then 77 meters is enough over here, at deep mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, just brutally carved through the line. Goes after top-edge width outside off and just like that has managed to get it easily over deep point
Rabada to Smith, SIX, non-chalance in that flick - a microsix, 62 meters, flicked away over a leaping Dhawan at deep backward square leg for six!

Harshal Patel to Jaiswal, SIX, short ball, and Jaiswal was ready for that - just rocks back onto the backfoot and mows that over deep mid-wicket for six! Is this the activation energy this reaction needed?
